description:
If you want authentic Italian food, head over to this wonderful restaurant where you are treated like family.  Our waiter, Viento, welcomed us and provided us with the specials for the evening.  He took our order for beverages and shortly we were given olive oil with warm bread.  He came back with our drinks and explained he would put our appetizer order in first and would wait until he saw we were almost done with it before putting our entree order in.  We watched as he handled other tables with the same ease and charm.

Our antipasto tray arrived and it was delicious.  We were able to enjoy this  without feeling rushed and we could talk without having to raise our voices even though the restaurant was very busy.  When our entrees came, I was positive I had gone to heaven.  The chicken risotto was creamy and hot.  My husband's veal was tender and good.  My husband ate all of his meal, but I was unable and was very happy to take a doggy bag.  Dessert - oh yes we did and we shared although I know I got more than my husband.

We had a wonderful meal and evening.  If you want to get in and out, this is not the place to go.  If you want to experience a true Italian meal and spend a few relaxing hours, walk over to Trattoria Contadina.
author: Nancy S.

description:
This place is so cute! It is pretty small so I would make a resy on their website. I really loved the prosciutto and baratta plate. It had some fig jam on it too and was yummy. The salad was good, normal. A bit on the small side but tasty. 

The entrees were a bit disappointing. I got the spaghetti and meatball, the sauces and noodles were food but the meatball was not good. I mean really not good. 

We also go the chicken risotto on the specials menu, this really tasted like nothing. We added salt and it was still very bland. 

Cheesecake is mediocre. It was lemon with raspberry. 

I had a great time dining here but I just wish the entrees were better. The salad was okay. The dessert mediocre. I really really wanted to like this place, since it is so close to my house but atlas it was only okay.
author: Tina L.

description:
A cosy, Italian restaurant with some classically cooked food. Booked a reservation through Resy, and the table was ready by the time we arrived. Overall, the service was stellar with very friendly and attentive staff who refilled our water cups and took away our plates promptly. Although food was also prepared quickly, the food was overall okay, nothing too memorable, but also nothing to complain about. 

We started off the Prosciutto and Burrata with Fig Jam, Eggplant, and Bruschetta. The Fig Jam balanced out the soft, creamy Burrata so well, especially when paired with the complimentary house bread. Bruschetta was nothing too remarkable - just a crisp garlicky bread topped with pretty flavorful diced tomato mixture. 

For our main course, we all got pasta. The favorite was definitely the Carlesimo. I made that dish vegetarian by taking out the Pancetta and didn't feel like I was missing anything because the mushrooms provided ample flavor to the creamy tomato sauce. The Il Diavolo was another favorite - a Spicy tomato sauce topped with a creamy cheese. I heard the Vongole was too buttery, and needed more lemon to cut through the heaviness. The Short Rib Pasta was decent, but nothing outstanding. 

Since we told them we were celebrating my brother's birthday, they brought out a complimentary slice of tiramisu with a candle and sung him a birthday song. Really love restaurants that do this!
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
I always think it's good to go to a restaurant twice - because itll reassure or reject your initial thoughts on the restaurant. I've been to twice Trattoria Contadina. This is a classic Italian restaurant with an excellent pasta selection. The first time I came I got the vongole. The second time I got the special shrimp penne pasta. 

I'd say ALWAYS order the vongole (my mom had the  vongole and wish I just stuck w that). It is delicious and though you might feel like you just ate an entire stick of butter, just don't think about it and savor every moment of the delicious lemony goodness. The clams are good and the pasta is fresh. 

The shrimp penne had less of a wow factor - it was good but nothing special. 

They try to be speedy with the service, which I appreciate since we came HUNGRY. 

Definitely book in advance, you can try walk ins but probably unlikely on a weekend. Make sure you call if you're trying to walk in! Sometimes they have events and close the walks ins for the night.
author: Ayumi W.

description: One of my favorite restaurants whenever in SanFran!  Amazing pasta, great wines and service
author: Alejandra T.

description:
Wow, just wow! this restaurant was amazing from the atmosphere, the service and especially the food! 

My b-friend and I decided to share two dishes since the portions are healthily sized. We started off with the prosciutto and burrata which was absolutely perfect! the prosciutto didn't have a slime texture and was very lean with a delicious favor! the burrata was perfect, you could tell it was fresh! the arugula and fig jam gave the dish depth with that bitter and sweet adding a much needed complexity! we ate this dish both alone and with bread. 

Next we landed on the cheese ravioli and the pasta and the ricotta was very fresh. i honestly think this was some of the most vibrant pesto i've ever had and the tangy-ness and chew from the sun dried tomatoes was a good contrast to the soft ravioli! 

We ended it all with a small shot of espresso! 

This is a great, intimate old school restaurant that great for a romantic date or catching up with friends! the service here is attentive and warm, Nancy was our server and there was a slight hiccup with our order but we didn't mind since she was so kind to us that we understood that mistakes happen! I wish i got the name of the man who constantly brought us bread and made sure our table was clean!

All in all, i would highly recommend!
author: Danielle D.

description: Charming, cozy, friendly restaurant with heart-warming pastas.  I loved that it wasn't pretentious and was just really good at what it was good at.  The roasted pepper appetizer was rich and delicious, and the seafood longone (?) and veal piccata were balanced and flavorful.
author: Ben K.

description: Went to this restaurant recently for the first time with 2 friends. The appetizers, entrees and wine were perfection. Highly recommend the gnocchi in tomato cream sauce. Service is warm and personable. The place was packed, loud and tables close together- like many north beach establishments. But it wasn't claustrophobic. Happy diners. There are menus and info. posted online that are very outdated and/or inaccurate. So just arrive with an appetite and trust the menu will provide many wonderful options.
author: Srae R.

description: Don't get me wrong, I like the resturant and food. But there are a few easy things they can do better. Why would you take the plates away while one person is still eating?  It embarrasses the person still eating.  The pasta is kinda soft. Don't boil it for so long. The little things would make this place so much better.
author: Leung T.

description: Nice, small, cozy neighborhood place with solid food and very good service.  Traditional Italian restaurant menu - nothing fancy or terribly creative - but all very good.
author: Michael C.

description:
This is the quintessential neighborhood trattoria, looks-wise. Cute as a bug. Excellent service. And the spaghetti with meatballs looked great. 

Unfortunately their signature pasta (which had prosciutto, sun dried tomatoes, peas, garlic, tasteless tomato cream sauce and some tubular pasta) was just awful. The special risotto was also devoid of flavor. It was like the real cooks had the night off and they left all the ingredients out for the bussers to figure out. 

I would like to like this place. But the cooking won't get me back.
author: Lee P.

description: Favorite pasta place in SF. The place reminds me of an authentic Italian restaurant minus the little ole Italian Nonnas. Get the carlisimo!
author: Genica R.

description:
This family owned gem continues to serve up delicious Italian favorites. 

A cozy date night spot, the ambience has the right amount of lively chatter and sensual vibe. 

We enjoyed sharing a plate of  Carpaccio. The beef fillet was traditionally garnished with olive oil, parmesan, arugula, capers, a lemon. Very bite was delicious with a bit of sourdough bread. 

Our entrees equally impressed. 
Valdostana was pounded chicken breast with |smoked mozzarella,prosciutto, sage, madeira, roasted mixed vegetables,  garlic mashed potatoes. 
​
Saltimbocca featured tender veal scallopini,prosciutto, mozzarella, sage, marsala, tomato sauce, sautéed spinach, and mashed potatoes. 
​
Dessert was the classic Tiramisu with cups of strong Italian coffee. 

One of the best meals I've ever had!
author: David N.

description:
Can I say YUMMMM! This Italian restaurant is so cute and homey! The service is so good, they take hospitality to the next level and their food is delicious! 

They start off with some bread. We ordered the carpaccio and it was so good! The portions here are also huge so be sure to share! We also shared the meatballs, the tomato sauce was so flavorful. I kept using the bread to soak up all the sauce.

For the main entree, we had the special- short rib tortellini and carlesimo! It's rigatoncelli cooked al dente with a sun dried tomatoes cream sauce with a little kick to it!
author: Natalie V.

description:
Came here for dinner before heading over to a comedy show at the nearby Cobb's Comedy Club.

It was easy to make reservations online via OpenTable just a couple days beforehand. I made the reservation for 8:30 on Saturday for a group of 3.

My friends and I all arrived a little bit early, and since we were the first of the 8:30 reservations to arrive, they were able to seat us around 8:15.

The restaurant itself is cozy and cute, with strings of light hanging above the small dining area. There is also a small bar area with a couple of seats and what looked like a pretty fully stocked bar.

I wasn't too hungry, so I went with their meatballs starter in pesto sauce ($10.50), while my friends got pasta dishes. The three meatballs were delicious and came smothered in a homemade pesto sauce. I didn't try any of my friend's pastas, but they both seemed to enjoy it.

I'd love to come back again and try one of their pastas next time.
author: Dianna H.

description: So have you ever gone and bought microwaveable Italian food, then dumped that food into a pile of dirt then eaten that food. That what the pasta here tasted like. Worst food I've ever eaten in my life. Never before have I had the urge to leave a review before. The only reason it's getting one star was because they didn't mess up the wine. And the waitress was great. Other than that, grab a meatball sandwich from subway for your Italian kick.
author: Joshua L.

description:
Excellent place for family dinner or a feast with friends!
The staff is really friendly and welcoming. We were able to get a table for six right away, although initially we were told to wait an hour. Our friend celebrated his birthday, and we were surprised to see that they got us a tiramisu cake with a little candle on it!

Their daily special menu is a staple. There are hand-crafted mouth-watering dishes there. My friend got the scallops steak. It was delicious! I indulged in risotto, which was equally tasty. Some of us got also their pasta, which they said was tasty as well.

All in all a great place for a Sunday night dinner, highly recommend booking in advance though.
author: Jakub S.

description:
The food was fantastic here, the service was great and a good vibe. We ordered the Burrata and the Prosciutto to start, and it was melt in your mouth good. My wife had the Carlesimo and I ordered the Pavarotti, both were really flavorful and good portions, just awesome!

These great cooks in the kitchen make all the food magic happen, everything comes off that counter pipping hot and very tasty, thanks Chefs!!!

One of the best Italian restaurants in the city, we're looking forward to our next visit!
author: Rich L.

description:
Great portions, food was tasty, and our server definitely tried their best to accommodate for our requests despite them being ridiculously busy. 

Special shoutout to their burrata w/ aged prosciutto appetizer - it's hard to get right texture-wise, and this was one of the smoothest renditions I've tried so far. 

Cons: really loud ambiance so you can't really hear your dining partners very well. Also, while it's tasty, I think most of their pasta isn't homemade.

I recommend you get a reservation, for peace of mind's sake - this place gets really busy!
author: Anna C.

description: My absolute favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco/ever. The Pasta is so delicious I loved every single bite! The menu is easy to navigate and the service is exceptional. Our server Viento was so knowledgeable, he was able to answer all my questions about wine, pasta, antipasti, secondi, and the dessert menu! This place is perfect for dates and very intimate. Will most definitely always come to this restaurant every time I'm in SF forever and always!!!!
author: Jason L.

description:
WOW, I've been thinking about the "Carlisimo" dish ever since I had it. Definitely a go-to, and I was glad that the server shared some enthusiasm when I said it caught my eye. I could end my review there - get that dish! - but here's a bit more...

The restaurunt is small and cozy. That means you'll probably have to come in early, or plan to get a reservation as it filled up quick. Wherever you're sitting, you'll have a view of the bar and kitchen and the waitstaff will only be a few feet away. This means that service is attentive and friendly. There's a true intimate atmosphere, and that's assisted by some dim lighting and a couple bottles of wine. :)

Our group shared olives and caprese as an appetizer, then two orders of the carlisimo and gnocchi. 

Highly recommend!
author: Jake D.

description:
Came here for an anniversary dinner. Made a reservation via open table was easy. When arrived to the restaurant, we did not wait long for a table. 

My overall experience dining here was okay. The foods were above average but was not amazing. We ordered a few items including the meatballs, bruschetta, polpettine, and Carlesimo. The meatballs were tender and flavorful The bruschetta were full of tomatoes The polpettine was good however, the Carlesimo was too creamy for me. It's an ideal place to have dinner with friends but not so much for date nights IMO.
author: Christina L.

description:
Trattoria Contadina

My best friend told me that her favourite type of food is Italian. Great, I know what kind of food she likes, now I gotta find out which one is worth going to. I chose to go to this specific one than the rest in little Italy due to a couple of findings. It's intimate, cozy, has great ambiance, and good service. I wanted this experience to not be overwhelming so this was perfect. We had 6:30pm reservations on 11/26. 

We first started off with their appetizer; the Bruschetta. I don't even really like tomatoes which is basically what this is on a scrumptious toast. They also already had another bread with what I thought was olive oil while we wait. Our food got to us in no more than 10 minutes I feel like. 

She ordered the most popular dish, the Carlesimo. It was a spicy tomato cream dish with porcini and pancetta. She had told me that it was the best pasta she's had in all other Italian places she's been to. 

I got the, which was Polpettine, the perfect sized (spaghetti and meatballs) I've ever had that left me wanting no more or no less. The sauce was so creamy and saucy, the meatballs were perfectly cooked. I could taste the fire that was put into my food. 

Our night here was spectacular. The restaurant was kind enough to bring out a slice of tiramisu with a candle. Our kind waiter sang happy birthday with me. Our waitress kept an eye on waters too-- thanks for being mindful of our table. Thank you for making our time here enjoyable.  :)
author: Liza H.

description:
Top notch service and top notch food. My husband and I ordered the Carlesimo without realizing it had mushrooms in it (which we both hate). Once we realized and told them, they were so sweet and brought us two new pasta plates, with no mushrooms! 

Can't wait to go back!
author: Faith C.

description: Really cute little gem! The service is perfect and the food really good. All the dishes are made with really good quality products. Highly recommended!
author: Aurore E.

description:
The ambiance here is as good as it gets for sure! Come here with friends or coworkers -- you'll definitely have a great time. Additionally, the surrounding area is lovely.

Stand-out dishes (as good as it looks/sounds):
*Caprese: burrata, kumato tomatoes, basil, balsamic reduction ($13)
Delicious! The burrata amplifies the dish. Great balance of flavors.

*Roasted bell pepper: asiago, mozzarella, bel paese, spicy tomato cream ($14)
Usually not a fan of bell pepper, but the warmness

*Carlesimo: rigatoncelli, pancetta, porcini, peas, sun-dried tomatoes, spicy tomato cream ($21)
There's a kick to it! Absolutely loved the sun-dried tomatoes with the rigatoncelli.

*Gnocchi | ricotta dumplings | asiago | tomato cream ($19)
Probably my favorite pasta on the menu. It's DELICIOUS. Great gnocchi.

Bonus points for amazing waiters/waitresses.
author: Jenny H.

description:
Finding a quality and above average Italian restaurant in San Francisco can be trickier than you might think. In a city that offers an abundance of fine dining locations, I come to the source where Italian food dominates and that is none other than the touristy North Beach neighborhood. Having been born and raised not too far from here, I know this is where you will find family owned restaurants and delis. Which takes me to "Trattoria Contadina".

Located directly on the corner of Mason St. and Union St., this place has been serving up locals and tourists dating back to 1984. Since this is in a very busy, dense part of the city, it is highly encouraged to arrive here via-Uber/Lyft, Muni bus, or taxi. Since my lady and I are out-of-towners (from Sacramento), we luckily found parking just a block away which was a rarity on a Saturday evening. 

We came here for our anniversary which was the perfect end to our evening. Keep in mind, reservations are highly encouraged. Our reservations were made through OpenTable which was set for 7:30pm. The entire process was painless from the time we entered to the time we were seated. The interior of Trattoria Contadina is very small but adds to the quaint homely feel. At times, you may feel a little too close to the neighboring tables which for some can be a drawback. However, the high ceilings give it more of an open airy feel to it. And finally, they do have an upstairs area that can be reserved for a larger party. 

We both decided on ordering a bottle of their "Chardonnay de Tarczal" wine (for about $40). If you do decide on bringing in your own wine, their corkage fee is $25 a bottle. We were given warm a loaf of their sourdough bread complete with balsamic vinaigrette/extra virgin olive oil. Since I am more of a red sauce fan, I decided on their "Polpettine". This consisted of spaghetti pasta complete with Rocky's homemade meatballs and tomato sauce. She went with their "Pavarotti" which was fusilli pasta w/chicken, prosciutto, zucchini, sun-dried tomatoes, & spicy tomato cream.

The restaurant was consistently busy; even at 7:45pm when we ordered our food. By 8:00pm, both our entrees finally arrived. The presentation on both our plates was very well executed. My Polpettine pasta dish was absolutely heavenly as I tasted many amazing spices that balanced out each savory bite. And the homemade meatballs (which they did not skimp on) had wonderful seasonings including garlic, oregano, and Italian spices that made this a truly wonderful dish. I also sampled a few bites of her Pavarotti dish as it was creamy and delicious. 

Overall, "Trattoria Contadina" is an above average Italian restaurant that I highly recommend if you're a local (like myself) or an out of towner that has never had authentic Italian food before. And the location has more of a hidden feel (a few blocks away from Columbus Ave.) where you won't be in the heart of the touristy areas. Do keep in mind that this place is exclusively a dinner restaurant as they're only open from about 4-9:30pm. All in all, with the service, quality, location, price, and experience, I give this place a perfect five-stars.
author: Donovan H.

description:
My wife and I went here on Thrillist recommendation. Overall, it's a good place and they treat you well. It's cozy inside and the feel is Mom&Pop. 
The food was good, not great. (WTF, Thrillist?) Some things were better than others...
We loved the "pickled things" app and our bruscetta was good. I had the Caesar salad with extra anchovies. They use the good anchovies... so the salad was really really good. My favorite part of the meal. Her "Mista" salad was ok.
I had the spaghetti and meatballs, wife had the cheese ravioli. I really have to say that I expected better. Supposedly fresh pasta was not. Gravy was ok... meatballs were rubbery and tough, like they were microwaved.
Wifey's ravioli, she didn't care for...I thought it was ok. Fresh pasta. Good filling, sauce only ok...

Drinks...they have an impressive whiskey list. Aces in my book. They do a good pour, and don't bat an eye on special orders. Nice.

I'd definitely go back, though...and order something else. I just liked the way the people and place feel. You will, too.
author: Rob O.

description:
Cyndy's Bottom Line:  Reliable neighborhood  Italian food.
3.75 food

Stopped in for an early dinner.
Friendly service.
Promptly seated.

This is what we ate:

1.  Appetizer:  Pickles and things.  Grilled
and pickled artichokes.  Assortment of pepperoncino and onions.  Enjoyed the grilled artichokes and picked onions.

2.  Carpaccio - Sliced thinly.  Served with a slice of lemon, capers, arugula and sprinkled with cheese.  Fresh and tasty delicious.

3.  Vongole - clams in garlic butter caper sauce with clams.  Clams are in the shell so you will need to do a little work to get them out.  Nice flavor, especially with the capers.

4.  Meatballs and spaghetti - hearty good sized meatballs.  Very tasty.  Spaghetti perfectly cooked.

5.  Tiramisu - excellent!  Light and airy.  Just the right ratio of lady fingers to liqueur and mascarpone.

6.  Blackberry Cabernet sorbet - wonderfully delicious!  You can taste the richness of the blackberry fruit.
author: Cyndy K.

description: We luckily stumbled across this place and it was outside of the tourist area. Definitely looked like more locals. They had a list of reservations but made room for us which was great. It's very cute and quaint when you walk in and you are able to see the chefs at work with their open kitchen in the center of the seating area. They have an upstairs area as well and I would suggest sitting up there because it is soooo hot downstairs from the stoves and ovens in the open kitchen. Our waiter was Gian and he was really sweet. He was able to take our order right away and get us started with appetizers quickly. The fresh bread was so good and we started with the burrata and prosciutto. This was fantastic!! The arugula complimented this appetizer so well and there was a sweet fig jam that was amazing! My dad ordered a spaghetti with clams and capers which was to die for! The pasta wasn't over cooked and it was packed with flavor with wine wine and lemon. They didn't skimp on the clams. I ordered the gnocchi which was amazing. It had a tomato cream sauce that was seasoned perfectly. So glad we found this place and I would definitely recommend it!!
author: Jessie A.

description:
Every time I ride the cable cars they stop here and let off a group going into this restaurant.  Before I left San Francisco I wanted to check the place out.  It was a real treat.

The restaurant is a good size but looked like it might get crowded, so I took a seat at the bar.  They had a good wine and whiskey selection; I chose a nice red and ordered their spaghetti and meatballs.  Excellent choice, very fresh and stayed hot throughout the meal.  Nice conversation and a short DOWNhill walk back to Columbus Ave.
author: Keith S.

description:
Love this little local trattoria in beautiful North Beach. Real Italian ambiance with cable cars ringing their bells right outside. 

We started with the bruschetta, carpaccio and a Cesare to share. Entrees were three pastas. All different and all delicious. 

Brought our own wine for a small corkage fee. 

Total bill was $140 plus tip for four people. Awesome!!!
author: Kevin C.

description:
What a great find! What a lovely neighborhood Italian. Wish it was in my neighborhood. We were greeted by the owner who could not have been more accommodating. Our waitress was fun and knowledgeable.  Don't expect fancy, but the food makes the place.
My only complaint would be servings are too large. My husband had veal Contadina, and it was beyond awesome. Tender, flavorful. Yummy!!!! I had the most delicious pasta, Carlisimo. Spicy, al dente, perfectly executed.
Bon Appetit.
author: Sue S.

description:
I stumbled across this restaurant while walking around SF with my mother some years ago.

It was a nice quiet environment with exceptional Italian food. I had the Carlesimo, which was a pretty unique pasta dissimilar to any I'd had before. It was so good, i made a special trip back to that area to have it again before leaving SF.

I'll be back in SF again soon, and I'm planning on making my way there to have the dish again. When I do, I'll be sure to update this review with pictures and some additional detail.

I'd definitely recommend it.
author: Mitchell R.

description:
Wow. My friend says this is the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco but he lives half a block away from Trattoria Contadina. After eating there earlier this evening, I am convinced it's one of the best restaurants in SF!

I made a reservation for 7:30 PM on a  Tuesday evening the night before using OpenTable.  I would highly recommend making a reservation otherwise the wait would likely be an hour long. They have a small little bar section though so you can have a few glasses of wine from their extensive wine list.

We were quickly seated and given a loaf of bread and olive oil. Ultimately my date and I decided on an order of the meatballs with the classic tomato sauce and the eggplant toast. The meatballs were delicious however the sauce was slightly salty. The texture of the egg plant toast was phenomenal - perfect crunch on the bottom with the mixture of eggplant, raisin, and garlic on the top.

We ordered 2 pastas - the Carlesimo and Vongole (the clam lemon and white wine, white sauce) pasta. They were both delicious! The waiter recommended the veal, says it's his favorite. It's the last item listed on the menu!
author: Jasper L.

description:
My family loves going to this place for birthdays and other occasions. The menu is pretty great: saltimbocca, pesto, really good bread. The prices are reasonable for the food and the wine. The servings are good, but not huge. The walls are covered with photos of old-time San Francisco places and people. It's a good, old-fashioned Italian place.

The drawbacks: parking can be a beast, the tables are pretty close together, and the upstairs area can get really, really warm, although the last time we went they had the windows open and it was actually pleasant.
author: Matt C.

description:
This is one of those places you have bookmarked to try for years and the moment you have the first bite, you feel like an idiot for not coming right away.  

Cutting to the chase, you must, must, MUST get the Carlesimo.  Hands down one of the best pasta creations I've had this side of Mars.  It's intergalactic good, that level.  Unbelievable flavor, I'm afraid to get anything else but that when I return. My friend got another pasta dish and any other time, it would have been great but it paled in comparison so that I can't remember what it was.  

And don't sleep on the pickled vegetables appetizer, it was something else too!

Service was terrific, family-like warm vibe. Our server had been with them for 20 years.  Not an ounce of pretension in the place, just old school good.
author: Saminda W.

description:
Trattoria Contadina is an adorable, bustling little neighborhood gem that serves up some seriously delicious Italian food.

Though our waiter told us that the pastas came in fairly generous portions, we couldn't help but order two appetizers to start: the meatballs and the eggplant caponata. The meatballs were delicious--we chose the classic tomato sauce, and our server topped it off with a heap of freshly grated cheese. I'd never tried eggplant caponata before, but I loved it! The ingredients worked together so well, and they were neatly piled atop a crispy piece of garlic crostini. The flavors were wonderful, and the contrasting textures were perfect.

For pastas, we went with the ever-popular Vongole and Carlesimo. Both were incredible--very different but each equally delicious in its own right. The Vongole tasted more like many of the pastas I'm familiar with, but it was just executed so well. The combination of lemon, butter, and garlic was just right, and let's be honest, I've never been one to walk away from a seafood pasta. The Carlesimo was unlike anything I'd ever had before, and I loved it. It was creamy, just a little bit spicy, and perfect with the crispy pancetta. In both pastas, the noodles were cooked just the way I like them. I couldn't get enough of either of them, and we spent the entire night swapping our giant pasta bowls across the table.

It was definitely too much food for two people, but it was worth the food coma. I wouldn't change a thing, except that maybe next time I would also add dessert. :)

I would recommend this spot for so many different occasions--I saw couples, co-workers, friends, families, etc. The ambiance works for anything, and the food is just SO delicious. I can't wait to come back!
author: Kelly R.

description: Great spot for awesome pasta! Penne pasta with pancetta and spicy tomato sauce was delicious so was the wine from Tuscany. Good service.
author: Mark J.

description:
Great food.  Cute quaint location nice selection of food and wines.  
All the dishes are traditional and delicious.  And very authentic. Great variety I had a pasta stuffed with prosciutto and porcini so delicious. Lots of locals and families so must be good. 
Parking is not very convenient but it's a few blocks at the most. 
Or waiter was a bit short and unavailable but the other staff and manager were very friendly.
author: David C.

description:
Trattoria Contadina is definitely one of my favorite "normal night" restaurants in SF. This place is always packed and deservedly so. The food, service and atmosphere is all warm and definitely classic. Please, make a reservation and prepare to have a lovely evening.

This review will be for my most recent visit with A though I have been before to celebrate a friend's birthday and had an equally wonderful experience. A came in for an 8pm reservation on a Friday night and were sat promptly though there were people waiting in the (tiny) restaurant for a seat. Every table was taken; they really pack people in here. We decided not to start with any appetizers since we knew we wanted to order dessert. Since it was a Friday, I wanted to celebrate a little and the waiter was able to recommend a glass of wine that paired perfectly with my entree. We had:

-Veal Correnti ($32): This was mine and it was GREAT. I normally don't love cream sauces but I wanted to avoid tomatoes. This cream sauce was super flavorful and the veal was cooked perfectly. The Chianti that as recommended was a great match. A could not stop stealing food from my plate.

-Carlesimo ($19): A got this dish and really enjoyed it. He also doesn't normally order cream sauce but liked this since it had a bite to it. I tried some and really enjoyed it as well, enough to maybe order next time.

We also HAD to have the Spumoni ($8) that we saw on Yelp and we were not disappointed. Seriously, if you come here and don't order the Spumoni, you are wrong. I was ready to order a piece just for myself after we polished off the first piece but A stopped me...something about self restraint and nutrition.

Anyways, why 4 stars instead of a perfect 5? The service is...spotty. We saw our waiter three times: to order, to drop of the wine and to pay. We had to wait a long time for refills on water and didn't get a refill on bread when requested. We also waited a while for a check. I understand they were busy but I think the service aspect could be refined.

Trattoria Contadina is a great meal though and definitely worth the stop. We are looking forward to coming back and working our way through their menu. Hopefully the service will be a bit more attentive next time, however.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Favorite Italian date spot. Romantic and amazing food. Staff gives off the family vibes since they've all been there for a very long time. Not going for trendiness but quality.

My favorite is the pesto gnocchi- it's off the menu but they make it! Also the carlismo is amazing! 

No parking- plan to take a lyft or walk.
author: Tricia K.

description: Great food and kind service. Amazing booze menu and the make a great old fashioned. I had chicken, broccoli I, and mashed potatoes with a caprese salad appetizer. All was super yummy
author: Luke S.

description: This restaurant blew my mind! First of all, my boyfriend and I walked in and they were full but had a reservation that was a no show so they got us a table within 5 minutes. Our waiter was so accommodating and kind. Then there's the food....holy moly! Probably some of the best Italian I've ever had. I had the Lobster and Shrimp ravioli and I highly recommend it!! Thank you for such a wonderful dining experience
author: Sarah H.

description:
Next time I'm in the mood for a great "North Beach Italian" restaurant, I'm coming back to Trattoria Contadina. 

Just near Columbus Ave, we walked up Mason Street to this cozy spot on the corner of Mason and Union. We had a reservation for 8pm on a Tuesday and it was packed, so I'd highly recommend making one before arriving here. The host led us through the restaurant and up to the second level for dinner. We quickly tried their delicious sourdough bread and had to resist gobbling down ten more loaves of it. 

We started with bruschetta and then ordered the mushroom ravioli, veal scallopini, and osso buco. I didn't get a chance to try the osso buco, but the veal was my favorite. The pasta it came with was buttery and cooked to perfection. 

Our waiter was really friendly and attentive, which made our experience even better. We all enjoyed the evening here.
author: Shira W.

description:
Trattoria Contadina is a fun step back in time to those Italian restaurants your family went to after a baptism or a funeral. The comfortable but elegant decor is welcoming and makes you feel right at home.

I've really loved their arribiata and pesto pastas I've had there. They also have a rather extensive and interesting wine list that is decently priced. And save room for tiramisu and coffee - the coffee reminded me of the espressos I had in Rome. Complement this with nice service, and you have a great night out!!
author: Holly L.

description: Randi was our server, and she was exceptional!!!!! One of us had veal saltimbocca and one had the Vongole. We had a bottle of Luli Pinot Noir, and bruschetta, and one of the best meals ever in North Beach!! I've been here many times over the years, and the food and service never disappoints! Fabulous wine list as well!!
author: Kristin F.

description:
When choosing an Italian restaurant in north beach, this is the one to choose. 

You just can't go wrong here. Friendly and fast service, authentic food and a great cocktail and wine program. 

Also, this is a REAL family owned and operated restaurant, a dying breed in SF.
author: Kaveh A.

description: Great little place. The waitress was very friendly and attentive. I ordered a special that night. Ravioli with a great autumn type sauce. I tried a few others plates as well and we all agreed mine was the best out of them all. The others could have used something else to punch up the sauce a bit. It was a great evening though and service was great. Would come back again.
author: Chelsea H.

description: Great food, nice atmosphere. Not sure if A/C was broken but it was extremely hot. Service was great too , pasta was delicious.
author: Yani G.

description:
Decent Italian but nothing terribly creative.  

Pluses:
-Great service--bartender and waiter were outstanding.
-Decent wine selection.
-Accommodating staff--we were late.  Actually, we were a pain and they were nice about it.

Minuses
-Food is pretty good, but nothing original.  No wow factor.
-Can get cramped if you're in a large party.
author: Rob R.

description:
We were craving some authentic italian food, but hoping for a non-touristy spot (ie on columbus). 

We found this cute little spot on Yelp and made reservations for dinner. I am so glad we did because the location was fairly small so almost all tables were full when we arrived at 7pm. 

We had a party of 5 and ordered the following:


- beer carpaccio
- clams and mussels
- eggplant

- pavarotti
- saltimbocca
- vongole 

We ordered a few more dishes but I cant seem to remember their names. I would recommend the pavarotti and the saltimbocca. The pavarotti is rich and creamy. The vongole is pretty heavy but the tender veal tasted great.

Overall, a great spot for authentic italian food that is within North beach but you arent surrounded by tourists.
author: Claire W.

description:
Got a res at Trattoria Contadina for a party of 5 Friday night @5:30pm. I love it when restaurants in the city take reservations! We were seated promptly upstairs by the hostess and were immediately greeted by our waiter. HH was still going on so we opted for some drinks - house wine, old fashions, and a martini. Everyone was pretty happy with their drinks. 

We started off with a few appetizers - Bruschetta, Meatballs and Marinara, and House Salad. This was the biggest bruschetta I've ever had, large slab of bread with a mound of tomatoes on top. The meatballs were highly recommended on yelp and they were delicious, two meatballs was enough for 5 people to sample. 

I ordered the Inverno Verde - Conchigle pasta, fennel sausage, arugula, with pesto cream. I was sold on the fennel sausage and the pesto cream. This dish was great, I love the choice of the conchigle pasta, it holds the sauce very well. I also got a taste of the Fruitti Di Mare - Spaghetti, clams, mussels, snapper, calamari, prawns, scallops, and tomato sauce. Also very delicious and a great sample of seafood. 

Overall we had a wonderful experience, we were able to book a reservation the day of and it was definitely the way to go. The service was great and I loved that the restaurant was hidden off of Columbus Ave... a little more low-key than others in North Beach.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Yes indeed....a wonderful neighborhood gem. 

Four of us went a few nights ago and it was fabulous. From the warm greeting by the host (and owner), to our genuine & attentive waiter, a sweet & efficient water/bus person, and to the most delicious food....really now. 5 stars. Be sure to have dinner in the main area and if possible, a table by the windows to see the world go by....reservations highly recommended.
author: fused g.

description:
We walked in 15 minutes before closing and were immediately seated for a lovely dinner. Our waiter was wonderful, attentive & hilarious (brownie points when you refill our water without us hunting you down). 
I started with the Rose wine which was spectacular!!
Followed by the Gnocchi which felt like ultimate comfort food. The sauce was so good I could have just had a bowl of it with bread and been satisfied! Gnocchi stuffed with ricotta made a nice contrast with the sweetness of the sauce.
My husband had the rotini with pancetta and sun dried tomatoes which he inhaled! 
Overall great experience & delicious food!!!
author: Maria R.

description:
This is exactly what I was wanting. True Italian food surrounded by true Italians. The experience was perfect. The staff was attentive, our glasses never empty and the food was amazing. We started with the caprese salad which honestly was the best I have ever had (and I have had a lot) I didn't get a picture as I ate it too fast. Next he got the II Diavolo and I got the Carlesimo which they are known for. Both were magnificent. I added red pepper to mine as I like my dishes spicy and this was not. Both were the perfect blend- noodles cooked to perfection, his with a slight Smokey and spicy (he didn't add red pepper and he ALWAYS does) mine with salty, earthy, slight sweet and tangy. It was amazing. 
If you want a place that's quiet- this is NOT that place. If you want true Italian food surrounded by amazing people go here. 
The only thing I would change is have the bread given at the beginning warm.
author: Lisa H.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city.  The Italian food is delicious.  The decor reminds me of my Grandmother's house (who was born in Italy), and the sauce and smell of the place is simply amazing.  The blue cheese wedge is exceptional as is the diavolo pasta with pancetta is to die for.  I would highly recommend this place.
author: Jeff R.

description: Went here for a friends birthday! We made reservations through open table, we sat right as we walked in (we came 15minutes early too). The customer service is unparalleled, they have amazing service and make you feel comfortable in their small space. We ordered the caprese, carlesimo, and the shrimp pasta special. The caprese was nice and refreshing with the fresh bread. The carlesimo was a very flavorful pasta, a bit salty, and full bodied. The white wine based shrimp pasta special was a great dish to even out the flavors of the carlesimo pasta. We shared the dishes so we got to mix and match, so we didn't get too overwhelmed over one palate of flavor. For a birthday celebration they kindly brought us a slice of tiramisu with a candle and they do sing happy birthday but my loser friend didn't want them to sing for her. Overall, a great experience and the food was pretty good. I wouldn't say the beat past ever but it's above par, I would come back!
author: Jada C.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant. Quaint mom & pop feel. Service was outstanding and food was very good.
author: Oscar W.

description: Best little Italian place in San Francisco. I can't wait to get back to SF so I can have another romantic meal here! I loved that we could make rezzies on OpenTable to avoid the long wait times. Amazing food, fantastic service, what's not to love?
author: Allie A.

description: I highly highly highly suggest the beef cheese tortellini. The service was so fast and so great. The chopped salad was too good. Please wear yoga pants when you come here.
author: Marci M.

description:
We had a party of 11 for my wife's birthday and really loved it.  The service was exceptional, the food outstanding and the ambiance is the best.  This is a local gem in my mind.

Note they have a upstairs room that is quite nice for a larger party like ours.  We've always been downstairs below and didn't even know that had the room upstairs.

Personally, I like the penne Milanese, but all of the pasta dishes are great.
author: David J.

description:
This was a nice little date night spot, but I was disappointed with the food. Although everything looked very nice, the flavors were not all there. Of the three dishes we ordered, my favorite was the appetizer. We had the prosciutto and burrata. My favorite part was how they had fig jam and arugula, drizzled with some olive oil and salt, and the entire dish just came together beautifully. 

For entrees, we ordered the mushroom ravioli and another pasta dish. The ravioloi was sub-par. The mushroom stuffing was bland, and I found the ravioli shell to be too thick for my liking. The pasta wasn't so great either. It lacked flavor. The only good part about it was that the pasta was cooked perfectly. 

I would highly recommend that you make a reservation. The walk-in line can get very long. Also, finding parking can be tricky here, so give yourself enough time to find parking before your reservation time. 

This restaurant is worth a shot, but I don't think I will be coming back here again for the price that I paid for mediocre food.
author: Lynn T.

description: Gian was a wonderful server - very attentive and kind. Their signature dish is what I ordered; carlesimo - a must order. It was delicious. The bread was amazing and the tiramisu was some of the best I've ever had. Bravo to the cooks for some amazing, true Italian food!
author: Emily F.

description:
I really wanted to love this place. It's such a cute Italian restaurant with a great family owned feel. Service is excellent. We ordered the meatballs with tomato cream as an appetizer and they were absolutely delicious!  Unfortunately, neither of us cared for our entrees. 

The Carlesimo pasta, their "not to be missed" signature dish was something I now wish I had missed. Folks at the table next to ours didn't eat theirs and that should have been a hint not to order it. My dish looked nothing like other photos of it on Yelp. It was as if it had all stewed together far too long and developed an almost pungent, bitter taste. The Valdostana included an overcooked dry breast of chicken and mushy brocolinni. 

I might eat here again just for the meatballs, service, and atmosphere, but the entrees alone would not bring me back.
author: Carla K.

description: Our server, Casey, and our bus boy made us feel like VIPs, which enhanced our experience, while delivering exactly what we wanted-authentic Italian food in a neighborhood setting. We stuck to pastas and salads. Don't miss the caprese. Reservations are suggested.
author: Adrienne A.

description: We had the nicest waitress and the raviolis were incredible. The have a limited menu but it's all you need because it's all so delicious
author: Gianna P.

description:
This place is a MUST TRY. Every dish was absolutely delicious. From the Roasted Pepper to the Gnocchi, I was in heaven. 

How can you go wrong with various combinations of cheese, cream, sauce, and pasta. My tummy is so happy right now.
author: H B.

description: This place was absolutely amazing. We came here for my 40th birthday celebration weekend. The food, the service and the atmosphere were all terrific.  We pretty much ordered everything on the menu and did family style sharing. The winner of the night. The signature pasta, Carilisimo(sp?)  The lemon cheesecake was divine as was the spumoni. Definitely would recommend a visit.
author: Laurie S.

description: We hiked up some steep hills to get here for dinner and were a little worried since we did not have a reservation, but were able to get right in and sat upstairs. The tables are packed tightly together and it gets a little loud, but the staff was very friendly and attentive. They understood we wanted a leisurely dinner and did not rush us at all, but were great about keeping our water glasses full and asking if we needed more wine. The food was terrific and the portions were generous. We had a big salad, chicken with broccolini and garlic mashed potatoes, and saltimbocca with garlic potatoes as well. Truly enjoyable evening!
author: Holly G.

description: I think this is my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco! We got the meatballs, vongole and carlesimo. The meatball was good, but I would be fine without them. However, the pasta was amazing!! You can definitely taste the white wine in the Vongole. If you are looking for something creamy, definitely get the carlesimo. But, if you want something that's going to make you not hate yourself after the meal, get the Vongole. We had the two pastas and meatball for 3 people. I will definitely go back! Restaurant is small though, so you may want to make a reservation! And, service was great! Very attentive and always refilled my water :)
author: Darlene T.

description:
A local recommended this restaurant to us and boy was he right!

The staff was super friendly, professional and responsive.  The bar was loaded with a great selection of spirits, the wine offerings didn't disappoint. 
The menu choices made it difficult to choose what to order but even though we all ordered different items, everyone raved about their choice.  The combination of excellent bar choices, fabulous food and a professional waitstaff made our evening superb.  

I'm out of superlatives but I'm not out of positive feelings about this experience.  The next time I'm in town, I'll surely go back.

Bravo
author: Steve F.

description: Great local Italian - family owned and operated - make reso's or sit with Vince at the bar
author: Lance A.

description: Great experience. Wonderful service, thanks everyone including - Viento and the bartender. Drinks were wonderful. Let's not forget the food. Unique dishes, intense flavor and very creative. This is a must try. Grateful for a beautiful meal! Best and truly most authentic since we've been in Italy. Gracie sweet people.
author: Dr. Skip H.

description: This has become our favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco for my wife and me. We were just there on Friday for my wife's birthday and couldn't have been treated better. The food was wonderful and the staff was great. I can't recommend this place enough.
author: Greg F.

description: Made a reservation for a Sunday night on open table based on reviews after Beach Blanket Babylon. We were early, the bar was packed so we waited outside. We were entertained by the cable cars going by. We were finally seated a few minutes after our reservation time once we asked about our table. We sat upstairs, the tables were very close and I almost elbowed our waitress a few times reaching for my wine glass. We had the valdastano and the ravioli. The chicken was very flavorful and the ravioli, just ok. Bread was good and they have a nice wine list. Service was friendly and attentive.
author: Donna B.

description: It is an awsome place!!! Food is delicious, waitress  are very nice and attentive.  I hope have a restaurant like this in bakersfield. I don t gave 5 stars because tiramisu was terrible, I read reviews about the tiramisu, but it wasn't good the cream tasted sour and they add chocolate syrup. Sorry but I taste better tiramisu.
author: Idalia B.

description:
I went to dinner there for the third time over several years (when I come into town) and it never fails to be delicious. I came with a group of 8, two of whom are local regulars. I had the chicken Valdostana, which was a Chicken breast: smoked mozzarella, prosciutto, sage, oregano, madeira, swiss chard, roasted potatoes.

We also had the meatball appetizers which were jumbo sized, and Roasted bell peppers with asiago, mozzarella, bel paese  in a spicy tomato cream--which I wish came in an entree portion. 

There is always a line, even on weekdays, so make reservations and arrive early, as its street parking.
author: Cathy O.

description: We have had a really nice experience each time we have come here! Exactly what you're looking for when in the mood for a nice, Italian, packed restaurant! The service we receive is always very friendly and genuine, they never make us feel uncomfortable or uppity! So yummy and a nice date night or family treat.
author: Maria M.

description: It was our 35th wedding anniversary. We wanted a quaint little Italian restaurant. What we found was so much more. We were greeted and seated right away. We were brought 2 glasses of champagne. Our waitress Brandi was very attentive and helpful with the menu. Hubby and I shared the chopped salad. It was literally the best salad I have ever eaten. I had the homemade gnocchi in a tomato cream sauce and my husband had the veal scallopini with prawns. Finally we shared the tiramisu that Brandi presented us with for our anniversary with a candle in it. We will definitely be returning and sharing with our friends and family.
author: Terri L.

description: Ok so the negroni is simply one of the best drinks I have ever drank in my life (i ordered 2), the ravioli succulent (you can taste the freshness) the sauce in the ravioli and the grilled pimento was so very tasty, they have happy hour everyday (everything very affordable and delicious in there), excellent friendly attentive service, would go back to try more stuff!!
author: Andres G.

description: Best Italian restaurant I have ever been to!!! I am Italian and it's always so hard to find Italian cooking as good as my families and this place surpasses it! (Don't tell my grandma lol). The wait can get long but just make sure to put in a reservation and you'll be good! I've been to Italy twice and this is still the best Italian food I've ever had. The gnocchi is the absolute best and you will never have better gnocchi in your life. My all time favorite place to eat!
author: Gabby M.

description:
We were celebrating my dad's birthday in the city and I had to find somewhere near Fisherman's Wharf area for dinner. A quick Yelp search led me here and I was able to make reservations at 6pm! We finished a bit early and ended up here around 5:30pm, but that wasn't a problem and were seated upstairs where it was actually a bit cooler because of the nice breeze that came through the windows.

Service: The small seating upstairs ensures great service because the waitress can see everything! She had help from a couple other people who refilled water glasses, cleared plates, refilled bread baskets, etc. Great, friendly, and attentive.

Food: The pasta here is delicious! The meatballs are pretty darn good also. I ordered some burrata for the table since we made it in time for happy hour prices. It came with heirloom tomatoes, which were delicious! I ordered the Polpettine (spaghetti and meatballs), my parents and my bf ordered the Vongole, and my sister ordered the Salvatore. Everything was great! If I were to do it again, I think I would be quite content with an order of burrata, meatballs, and the bread on the table.

Cost: It was definitely on the higher side, especially for being pasta, but the servings were generous and the ingredients were fresh.
author: Leana L.

description: Small, upscale restaurant on the corner of Union and Mason in North Beach.  We had the Caprese Salad made with Burrata Cheese.  It was so flavorful and smooth!  Yum!  We also had the Polpettine which is their spaghetti and meat sauce with meatballs.  We loved that too.
author: Amy C.

description:
Very good a very traditional old style Italian restaurant .
Please don't order their Caesar salad it was not very good this place makes everything from scratch and they used croutons that are packaged terrible terrible terrible. 

I told the waiter if I was dying tomorrow this was my last meal what I order. He suggested veal it was excellent
author: Michael P.

description: Oh wow AMAZING. Delicious and authentic Italian food and a great bottle of wine for dinner. Tiny little restaurant near Beach Blanket Babylon which was why we had planned to try this place before a show. As soon as we walked in we knew it was special. Busy at 5pm and it was clear this was a place the locals knew about. Locals and cops can always find the best restaurants. If you see either, you know it's gonna be a good meal. Loved it. Will return many more times in the future.
author: Tony W.

description: At first I was hesitant due to the lack of space however that changed quickly. The food was delicious and authentic.  Our server was personable and friendly. Rocky the meatball maker has been doing it for 25 years apparently and you can tell! Next time in San Francisco I will come to this establishment again.
author: Trina C.

description: Awesome atmosphere, great food, huge portions, and super attentive servers. Most of the restaurants down by fisherman's wharf and Pier 39 have a lot of useless workers there that make you feel like they don't want to serve you, be there, or even see your face. This restaurant was a breath of fresh air and I will definitely be returning here when I come back to visit San Francisco.
author: Aaron P.

description: When we talk about good service on reviews, it can mean lots of things - promptness, professionalism, knowledge, formality, etc. What good service means at TC is that you feel CARED for. The food is outstanding in its category, which is traditional Northern Italian, strong on veal dishes and pasta with variations on prosciutto and cream sauces. This kind of comfort food completes the overall feeling of warmth, familiarity, and happiness you get from dining here. It was perfect for Mother's Day, as it would be for any special occasions with loved ones.
author: Lisa O.

description:
We went to this place due to prior positive reviews.
Their menu is limited and so not that many choices for entree.
11 bucks for a Caesar salad is out of line.
The entrees were tasty but the service was poor.
Having to sdk 3 times for refills on water is not cool.
Asking 4 times for bread unacceptable.
May have been an off night.
I would give it another try.
author: Paul W.

description: I never leave a bad review but this place was such a disappointment--I expect more from an Italian restaurant in a culinary capitol like San Francisco. This place is cute, but the spaghetti and meatballs were sub-ordinary, the bread was old and cold, the bill was outrageous, AND I was made to feel unwelcome by my condescending, ageist server. What a waste of an evening in the city!
author: Rhonda C.

description: What an amazing place to get some good Italian food! Hands down the best Italian food I've ever had and such a cute little venue! The type of place where once you've discovered it, you will consider it your special little spot and go-to place to take your sweetheart. It's our first time visiting San Francisco and we wanted to find a nice local spot with some good food and we really hit the jackpot! The service was fantastic and the food is to die for! The sauce was so creamy and addictive, the chicken seasoned and cooked to perfection, and the vegetables were steamed to a perfect balance of soft and crunchy. It was delicious! Everything from the the food, location, the wait staff, and fun decor made for the perfect dining experience! You have to check this place out!
author: Scott M.

description: Great staff and ambience.pesto pasta was delicious..nice place for a romantic dinner​..tried tiramisu for dessert.it was too sweet..should have had more coffee flavor to it. The servers were very polite .will definitely recommend this place for pasta.
author: Prerna M.

description: Fantastic small Italian restaurant with a great lively atmosphere and excellent food.  The staff is friendly and really helpful.  They took great care of my 6 year old even though she is super picky.  I will come back again.
author: Tom M.

description: Best meal I've had in a long time. I highly recommend this place! Great service and excellent food. I can't wait to go back the next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Barbara B.

description: This place is a definite go to if you are looking for bomb Italian food! I got the gnocchi (which is made fresh) and it was perfect! The service was also excellent
author: K L.

description: Was referred this place by a friend who lives in the city and this is for sure a hidden gem. Very authentic Italian food. Amazing service and good portion size. Everything was delicious. Had the caprese and bruschetta for an appetizer and was not disappointed. The meatballs were also fantastic. Would highly recommend.
author: Jon R.

description: The bf and I usually share two dishes.  I got the carlesimo and he got...something else.  I don't recall because it wasn't important because a few bites in I asked him if we still had to share.  That carlesimo is pretty darn solid and the pasta is cooked perfectly al dente as well.  We'll likely be back for another date night.
author: starrynight c.

description:
I'm not sure why I ever gave Trattoria Contadina less 5 stars  - this place certainly deserves more than 5. I will go as far as to say this is the best Italian restaurant in SF. 

I've now been probably 7-8 times and haven't had one meal that wasn't outstanding. Typically at Italian restaurants I'll find one dish and order it every time. Here, though, I've been encouraged to try so many different dishes and loved all of them.

My favorite dish of the moment is the Il Diavolo. It's this creamy penne with some spice topped with buratta. I've said this before and I'll say it again: I will without a doubt order anything on a menu with buratta. This dish will never disappoint.

I also recently tried the Inverno Verde. I don't usually order pesto pastas, but this one comes in a close second to Il Diavolo. The creamy pesto is served with conchiglie noodles and sausage. 

Beware: these pasta dishes are huge. You could definitely get away with ordering one pasta dish and an app or salad and still walk away full.
author: Emmy Q.

description: I'm really generous in giving 2 stars here just because the server was real nice at the beginning and views are great, convenient location near north beach, within a stones throw from beach blanket blvd.  Well the best thing about the product was the sparkling water - really.  Caesar salad totally underwhelming, even the anchovies seemed stale, my wife's shrimp was completely overcooked - you can tell with the super white color even before you put it in your mouth, my Il Diavola was a spicy dish, but it honestly tasted like mashed up pizza with very regular pasta from a box.  We ran into another party at BBB later on who also dined here and they also experienced equally disappointing dishes.  I would feel better if the server had offered something after we mentioned about the shrimp, but nothing was given.  I can't say I will be back any time soon.
author: Richard W.

description: If you are looking for good Italian food in North Beach that is a little off the beaten path and away from the tumult of the tourists, this is the place for you. We enjoyed the gnocchi, which were fresh, fluffy pillows of comfort food. We also tried the shrimp and lobster ravioli with a very mellow tomato cream sauce--not too creamy and not too heavy--the perfect consistency with a little bite to it. We had a 7:30pm reservation, arrived a few minutes early and our awesome table in the window was waiting for us. Service was impeccable. Looking forward to going back and so glad we now have a "spot" in North Beach.
author: Abbe D.

description: We just happened to walk past this restaurant and decided to pop in for a drink. We ended up grabbing a bite for dinner and I'm glad we did!
author: Matthew M.

description: My girlffriend and I visited SF this past weekend and loved having dinner at this place. We were a little late for our reservations but were still immediately seated. The food and the service were great. We also loved the feel of the building. It seemed as if we were having dinner in someone's home. Just perfect.
author: Richard M.

description: Love it.  Classic.  Stay classy.  Don't let the hype ruin it.  Yelp thinks that if you write a longer review it's more valuable.  Good communication is succinct , focused, and clear.
author: Sim J.

description:
This place was great! I definitely recommend it to anyone looking for good Italian food in San Francisco.

The experience was positive from when we first entered the restaurant. My group and I had a reservation for 7:30, and although we were a bit early they were able to seat us.

Our waiter was really on top of everything. He had a great personality and knew the menu super well. I didn't order any drinks, but the rest of the table really seemed to like theirs.

For my entree I had the gnocchi and my friends sitting had the melanzane and risotto, which was one of the specials that night. We each loved our meals! The gnocchi was made out of ricotta, so it was a bit lighter than the usual potato version and a nice alternative.

I had a bite of the melanzane and want to order that the next time I come. The eggplant in that dish was cooked really well, and the sauce in that dish was delicious.
author: Ali A.

description: Had a very nice family dinner here last night. Portions were huge- I'd recommend going family style on the pastas. Corkage was $25 which is a little high, but standard for SF. Will definitely be back.
author: Adam G.

description: On a family trip to SF we found this place. Cute neighborhood location. Staff was very friendly and food was fantastic. Had the Carlesimo based on the recommendations and loved it. Pleased the whole family and I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Lisa C.

description:
My boyfriend took me to this cute place for a date night. I have been craving Italian food and he read my mind :)

We came here for dinner and it was pretty packed once we got there around 7, but thank god we made reservations. Service was great, the place is pretty small, so tables are squeezed together, but it's okay we can all get real personal and intimate. 

I had their meatballs and their signature and famous carlesimo. Meatballs were very good, highly recommend. They were juicy and well cooked. The carlesimo was delicious, definitely satisfied by tummy :) It was very creamy.
author: Natalie L.

description: Loved everything about the experience, food, and service. Will happily return next time I'm in SF. We had the roasted pepper, Caesar, Il Diablo pasta, and tiramisu. Yum-my!
author: Michelle S.

description: This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in San Francisco. It has such an intimate setting and the food is so incredible. Our waiter was so amazing, told us all her favorites and she was completely on point. I will definitely be coming back!
author: Cassie P.

description:
Note: The Yelp dinner menu is slightly different than the current dinner menu at the restaurant. Some items that are recommended here by everyone on Yelp aren't on the menu, but can be ordered there.

Anyway, this is the cutest little Italian neighborhood gem! I love that it's slightly tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Columbus Ave, but also only a block away from it if you want to go for a post-dinner stroll. 

This restaurant is perfect for a romantic date night! We went for dinner early at 5:45pm on a Friday night and were able to be seated immediately, luckily! ...because it seemed they were actually fully booked with reservations for the rest of the night. 

We had the meatballs (must, must, must!) and mista salad to start. Both perfect! Then, my boyfriend got the Vincenzo (I snuck a few bites -the sausage is amazing and the sauce has a spicy kick!) and I got the Correnti (super creamy and delicious). For dessert, we shared the Mocha Fango with an espresso each. Absolutely incredible! We kept the wine flowing throughout dinner too, and it was one of the best overall meals we've had :)
author: Ashley S.

description:
We were looking forward to eating here due to all the good Yelp reviews but were left disappointed. We came for dinner an hour earlier than our reservation time but the host graciously gave us a table. This is a small restaurant and the tables are small and cramped next to other tables.

We ordered a bowl of vegetable  soup which was barely edible. It was oily and bland and had bits of hard stuff, not sure what it was. We also ordered the Fruiti di Mare (mixed seafood and spaghetti for $25) and Saltimbocca (veal scaloppini for $29). Both dishes were just okay, no real flavor, thus overpriced.

What made us want to leave without ordering our usual dessert was the fruit flies that circled over us and the lack of service. The server only took our order and brought our food but did not check to see how we liked the food nor give any beverage refills. We love Italian food but we won't be back to this place. North Beach has tons of good Italian restaurants!
author: Zoey W.

description: Loved this place! Service was great, my dish was great and they brought me out a piece of tiramisu for my birthday and that was delicious!
author: Natalie K.

description:
Amazing little trattoria tucked away in North Beach. Came here on Saturday evening reservation and we were seated a couple of minutes early. After deliberation we ordered the Rigantoncelli alla Carlesimo and Vongole (spaghetti with white wine sauce and seafood). The Vongole is a more traditional dish, but it was probably the best white wine sauce and seafood spaghetti dish I've ever had. Other restaurants tend to make it too watery due to the clams, but Trattoria Contadina cooked it perfectly. The Rigatoncelli was very heavy (perfectly al dente and chewy) as the pasta itself was large and the sauce was tomato cream, but still DELICIOUS. I savored every bite of both pastas and would order them again in a heartbeat. 

For drinks, I got the Bee's Knees cocktail and the bf got a Barbera red. Both were delicious! For dessert, we got the Mocha Fango, which is a mocha gelato cake with an oreo type chocolate crust. Very cutely plated, large portioned (good to share) and sooo good.

Already planning the next time I come back :)
author: Claudia C.

description: This place is a must-go. Service is great and food is even better. We ordered the Mista salad, gnocchi, and pavarotti and holy crap, all were AMAZING. The portions were big enough to easily share between 2 people. The salad was so fresh and the vinaigrette was great. The gnocchi was fantastic, the tomato cream sauce was perfect and just the right amount with the size of the portion. The Pavarotti was just as good as well. The restaurant is so homey and quaint. Definitely will be recommending to all friends and family!
author: Lauren B.

description:
Wonderful atmosphere and great service. The antipasto was 4 stars. Food in general was good not great. I judge an Italian restaurant by a very simple rubric; spaghetti and meatballs. The spaghetti and sauce(gravy) were good. The meatballs were not good. They were hard and flavorless. 
Don't get me wrong, I really enjoyed being here, however they do not know how to prepare a decent meatball. This is coming from an east coast Italian.
author: Donato P.

description: Being Italians it's so hard to be wowed. This was our granddaughters Birthday. She ordered gnocchi's. They came so hard and unappealing. She used her fork to show me how hard they were. Very dense with no flavor. My order was not much better. It was the corkscrew noodles with chicken and sun dried tomatoes. Nothing special for $25.00 a dish.  My husband got the spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were so tough he did not enjoy them. When I reheated my dish the next day it was dripping with oil. I mean I poured it out of my bowl 1/4 cup of oil. Yikes! Needless to say we will not be returning.
author: Gioia B.

description: Came here for my and my SO's 2 year anniversary and it. was. AMAZING!!!! The ambiance was perfect, waitress was exceptional, we got complimentary presecco, and the food was incredible. There was absolutely nothing bad to say, and I HIGHLY recommend this place for a great Italian restaurant to check out in the City. If the short rib tortellini or risotto is on the specials menu, both are must orders...LEGENDARY!!!
author: Jackie O.

description:
GOOD FOOD BUT SERVICE DISCRIMINATION: The food was good. I think this is heavily white area. I could sense the difference of service for a brown guy and all white guys. I wanted my drink refill as water. The waiter came three times, addressed the needs of the other 3 tables assigned to him (needless to say white) customers, but didn't even look at my table. Fourth time, I raised both my glasses to make noise. That's when they realized that I need service as well. 

I want to go there for food again but not sure for service. My experience might have been different if I was white.
author: Murali Y.

description: My favorite Italian Restaurant in North Beach.  Ate their last night with a large group. Service was excellent. The appetizers were delicious especially the burrata and prosciutto and the caprese. I usually go for the gnocchi which is fantastic but I had the seafood pasta Vongole which was also top notch. Everyone else in the group was very happy with the meal and experience. I will be back again as soon as I can
author: Mark S.

description:
I was eating alone and fairly new to the area. I walked in and stood at the door and waited and waited while the maitre'd or host or bartender LOOKED at me and paid no attention.
As I was feeling a bit unfamiliar, I stood for a good ten minutes while I was ignored; feeling like a leper.
I left, feeling middle-aged and invisible.
Too bad. Quality starts with the customer.
author: Philip L.

description: Excellent!!! Our go to spot for Eye-talian!!! The small pasta plates are just enough to start or you can order multiple for the table to share great space and wine list.
author: Marcus R.

description: Wonderful all around meal from the prosciutto to the Caesar salad to the Pavarotti pasta . Great service in a small quaint neighborhood restaurant away from the touristy areas . Definitely will be back when I come back to the San Francisco area again .
author: Leonard T.

description: I love coming to this place. The service is always great and the food is amazing. It is some of the best gnocchi I've had.
author: Penny B.

description:
Sometimes, you want something comfortable. Good Italian food stripped of pretentiousness. If you are looking for that, this place fits the bill. Right off the bus line, this place in the North End had really solid Italian food at reasonable city prices.

The homemade ricotta gnocchi was the standout. So rich and delicious even my picky daughter gobbled it up.  I enjoyed a pasta dish that was way too big for even my big eyes.  And we ordered an appetizer of meatballs that were just like Grandma -- or at least the Italian grandmother I dreamed of having -- made.  

Overall, a really enjoyable dinner in a city filled with good restaurants.  Thumbs up.
author: Dan S.

description:
Cute and quaint restaurant atop of a hill near North Beach. The atmosphere screams family.. small kitchen with tight sitting spaces. 
We had our table ready about 30 min before our reservations, which is always nice if you're running early. 
We got fresh sourdough bread as we waited for our food. We got the 
1. Caprese- so delicious!! Fresh, fresh, fresh mozzarella cheese & basil on top of a purple tomato. The light drizzle of balsamic vinegar was perfect! 
2. Frutti de mare- came out piping hot, seafood was fresh. There was a mixture of scallops, shrimp, fish, clams, and mussels. The tomato sauce was light and refreshing. Noodles were perfectly cooked.
3. Carlesimo- this dish was OK, the meat was a little too fatty and had pieces of chewy fat that I'd spit out. Didn't taste much of the peas or sun dried tomatoes. 
4. Osso bucco- lamb was a bit gamey for my liking. The polenta was bland, but the spinach was seasoned nicely. 
Overall, this restaurant is a great place for a romantic dinner.. or just a place to drink and eat with friends! Would def come back and try more of their menu!
author: Maria C.

description:
I can't wait to go back here. I'm a NY transplant and this place reminded me of little Italy in all great ways from the atmosphere, our server to every delicious bite. I've already told 4 friends about it and am plotting my next visit and what to order next.

We had cheese stuffed peppers, salad, the house pasta, a bottle of Sangiovese and all were fantastic.
author: Tanya W.

description:
This is my favorite Italian restaurant in SF, it's so cute, nested in the corner.
Definitely need to try Beef carpaccio!!! It's so fresh and delicious!!
author: Julia L.

description:
Prices have gone up! When I was here a year ago, it was my hidden gem.  I may have let the dog loose by writing a review on yelp, but hot damn the food is so amazing.

Carlesimo used to be $16 when we first went, now it's $19.  Wine used to be a steal for city prices at $7, now average is $10.

Everytime we go, it's the same order:
They changed French bread to sourdough- not a fan. Olive oil is amazing. 

Olives (garlic lovers delight)
Mushrooms (just amazing)
Meatballs (consistency and sauce are better than ever)
Carlesimo
Gnocchi (you can still get with pesto, tomato or blue cheese sauce, just not written on menu)
Italian wine
Stracietella ice cream
Espresso

We never veer away from the order. Although, their seafood pasta is supposed to be really good too! 

This is a the stop we prefer over Nopa! Can you believe that?  (We were prob at Nopa just before or after this stop for drinks!)
author: Candice H.

description: One of my Favorite places in The City. Intimate - excellent food, excellent wine list, excellent service! Right off the Mason St cable car, which I usually catch at union square and ride to the restaurant!  You'll love it!
author: Brian H.

description: Very tasty.  Excellent service. Gnocchi and pasta very fresh.  I will eat there again next time I am in this part of San Francisco.
author: Scott T.

description:
We came here with no reservations at 8p on a Saturday night. Instead of giving us the typical "sorry - no reservation no seat" attitude, the hosts were willing to work with us to find a solution so we could eat!  While we were deciding whether we wanted to wait, the host received a call from someone stating they would be late for their reservation, so lucky us - we got their table!!

That is when the fun began.  Their menu is really varied with something for everyone.  We got the beef tartare and the spicy tomato penne with pancetta. 

First off, the bread is so yummy and fresh and the olive oil is *real* olive oil as in...you can taste the olives. MMMmmmm

Second, their drinks are SO good. I got an old-fashioned and it was perfect - not too sweet, not too strong. Just how an old-fashioned should be. My friend got some sparkling wine thing that was awesome too. 

The beef tartare was a really good amount, but what stole the show was that penne! MMMMmm I would come back just for that. First, presentation was awesome. Second, it was a really good portion for the two of us. Three, the TASTEEEEE. OMG - finally Spicy tomato sauce that is....spicy! (and not burn your tongue off spicy - just right).   We OBVI got the fresh parmesan on top too because...duh.

All in all, I would 100% come back here for good, fresh, how-it-should-be-made pasta.
author: Megha A.

description: Went there for dinner there the other night and loved it. Had Caprese and roasted peppers for appetizers. They were both delicious! Had gnocchi for main course and it was okay. Not the best gnocchi I have had but still not bad at all. We ordered their tiramisu for dessert and that was probably one of the best tiramisu I have ever had!!! I definitely recommend checking out this place for group dinners too.
author: Suprita K.
