description: Decided to come here based on the fabulous Yelp reviews and was not disappointed!  This place is small and busy, we didn't have reservations but only had to wait 15 minutes for a table.  Wait staff was very attentive and our food was outstanding. Menu had a nice balance of options for everyone's different tastes at a reasonable price.  We are a little picky regarding Italian restaurants and were very pleased with our meal and overall experience.
author: Jessica H.

description:
4.5 stars for this gem of a generational Italian restaurant with a very reasonable price point. The service is great here and the small San Francisco neighborhood feel emanates from this charming eatery and albeit small bar. 
The dishes are consistent and most of them meet expectations. The burrata caprese is exceptionally good. Again, this neighborhood and friendly eatery is charming and the service is solid.
It is also located on a cable car line if you feel especially lazy and don't wish to walk. Like with most places in San Francisco, don't even try to drive and park anywhere near here save a few nearby garages..
author: Michael G.

description: Crazy delicious pasta. The Carlesimo was perfectly al dente and served with a spicy tomato cream sauce.
author: Elaine T.

description:
I was there about one month ago with a couple of friends. It's located in north beach area.  I had a good experience, the food was good and some dishes very innovative. 
The beef Ravioli were amazing! 
They like to change the menu many time per year- I like that a lot because they can offer different dishes to satisfy the clients curiosity.  The service was good as well.  
I will be back soon!!
author: Francesco G.

description: North Beach is famous for its Italian food, and this spot is a standout for sure. Took my Fiancé here for a low key bday dinner. We loved the traditional decor, ordered a mid priced bottle of wine and a couple fantastic pasta dishes. Yes you will be taking food home and yes it will be awesome. Service is excellent. My only advice is to make a reservation, these guys were slammed on a weeknight!
author: Russ B.

description: This place was amazing I haven't that good of Italian food in a long time. Those meat balls were devine the flavor was so perfectly balanced. Also their tomato sauce was so fresh tasting. I got the beef ravioli with the tomato sauce the chop prosciutto on top brought it to another level. I will be telling to go here that i know and will be making a spot back there soon.
author: Ant F.

description:
Your typical Italian restaurant, the food was good but didn't stand out to me. The atmosphere is very cozy in this little spot, there's also upstairs seating

They give you complementary bread and olive oil to start off with while you wait for your food. It would've been better if the bread wasn't cold.

- Fruitti di Mare
spaghetti with clams, mussels, snapper, calamari, prawns, scallops in a tomato sauce

- Osso Buco
red wine and tomato braised lamb shank, served with saffron risotto and peas.

Portions are shareable and recommended!
author: Lisa N.

description: Some of the best Italian food I've ever had! Came here on a busy Thursday evening (yes, it was busy even on a Thursday evening) without any reservations and we had to wait 20 minutes or so, but the wait was worth it. We ordered one entree of pasta between 2 of us, so the total didn't turn out to be too large, but the pricing was definitely on the higher end. The bruschetta was $8 but came with only 2 pieces, which was a bit much. Don't get me wrong though, the food was wonderful and worth the money. The waiters were so kind as well and although the tables were placed close to each other, it felt cozy instead of crowded. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant - and order the tiramisu!
author: Sam S.

description: The food was delicious! We were on vacation from the East Coast and decided to check this place out, based on Yelp reviews. One of the best places we at throughout our trip. We ordered the Burrata and Prosciutto as an appetizer and it was really good. We ordered the Carlesimo, Gnocchi, and a couple other dishes, but we ran out of stomach space. The waitress was kind enough to cancel our other dishes. They do offer smaller portions of the pasta dishes, which was great! The Carlesimo was AMAZING! The spice level was just right and the creaminess took a little bit of the heat off.
author: Megan M.

description: Great cozy restaurant.  Portions are very large and rich so it's a great place to spilt dishes.  I went with one of my girlfriends and we spilt an appetizer and pasta dish and both came out super full and happy.
author: Mary S.

description:
We hit up this wonderful little Italian eatery every time we're in the Bay Area. Delicious freshly made Italian food. They change up the menu from time to time but there hasn't been even one dish we've ordered here that we haven't loved.

This is a small restaurant. Limited seating. They get packed so be sure to call ahead to make a reservation.
author: Larry M.

description: Visited for a friend's birthday, great food and service. The waiter was so nice and gave us a yummy tiramisu. A very lovely place.
author: Tina B.

description: Wow, what a perfect meal! It was a friend's birthday and her only request was pasta, so we picked this place at random and made a reservation. From the moment we walked in, the staff were so nice and they even set up for a dessert to be delivered to the birthday girl at the end of the night. I ordered the Inverno Verde dish, which was a seashell pasta with a pesto sauce, fennel sausage and arugula. It was delicious! Such a rich sauce, I could've eaten a second plate. My boyfriend got the risotto special which he loved. We had the slice of chocolate with an Oreo base and a tiramisu for dessert. The restaurant is cozy but the staff are so nice, the food is delicious, and overall we had a great time. I want to go back and try more!
author: Kristen T.

description: Literally the best pasta I've ever had in my entire life. So much flavor, amazing quality and soooooo tasty. Would definitely come back here. I would eat here every night if I could haha
author: Ariana B.

description:
I feel as though I have been blessed with the ability to use language in a fashion that allows me to communicate ideas in a way that people may easily understand. I'm not claiming to be Hemingway or Joyce. I'm just saying. So, it frustrating that I don't seem to be able to organize the appropriate words to describe the Salvatore Chicken Ravioli that I just ravished at Trattoria Contadina. So, here is my straight forward assessment of the meal I just had: this might be the best Ravioli dish I have ever had. 

Imagine a flavor and texture that tastes the way that fine silk might feel when pulled across your exposed skin. That's as close as I can come to describing it. I did not try anything else on the menu because it would have felt like cheating. 

I met Vince, the founder's grandson, and he was great. Professional, friendly and diligent. He clearly has great pride in the restaurant and is a wonderful ambassador. The atmosphere was "neighborly" and appropriately vibrant for this neighborhood spot. 

I loved it and I'll be back.
author: Rock A.

description:
What a fantastic Italian restaurant!  We had a reservation and our table was ready and waiting when we walked in!  Service was prompt and friendly - and the food was fantastic.  The Caprese Salad and the Bolognese pasta were soooo good!  Wife and I shared all dishes, and it sure was plentiful.  We finished the night with a delicious Mocha pie kind of dessert.

Will definitely come back next time I'm in SF!
author: Alfredo V.

description:
I wanted cozy. I wanted Italian food. I wanted convenience to our evening show of "Beach Blanket Babylon." I got all three in Trattoria Contadina. The excellent no-nonsense service and warm atmosphere was a bonus.

After discovering Trattoria Contadina on Yelp, I called twice to get a reservation -- but short notice means no luck. So, we made plans to go somewhere else before our show. The other place didn't take reservations, so when we walked past Trattoria Contadina, I poked my head in just in case. The hostess greeted us warmly and said she'd had a couple no-shows, "So let's do it!" We were seated immediately and quickly had bread and attentive service. I was happy -- even happier moments later with wine poured.

We split the trio of meatballs -- solid 2.5" orbs of meat with choice of sauce (we had the classic tomato). I had a cup of minestrone that was good but not special. My gnocchi were excellent and a large portion. I judge an Italian restaurant by its gnocchi, and these were denser than I prefer but still very tasty in a creamy tomato sauce. A crew of attentive staff ensured we always had water, bread, hand-grated parmesan, fresh pepper and a clean table. We skipped dessert because of the show time, but I am confident that the menu of Italian standards would have delivered just as well as the other courses.

The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with friendly people waiting on you -- and things moved quickly. Two families with small children enjoyed meals nearby, as did other groups, and it was clear this is a place with a loyal base of local customers as well as tourists who stumble on it via guidebooks or Google. I'm definitely keeping this one on my list of places to return for a quality Italian meal.
author: Logan A.

description:
Run if a Moscow mule comes in a glass, Trattoria Contadina serves theirs in a copper mug so we were off to a good start! 

I had their house speciality, the Carlesimo, which was cooked perfectly al dente and hot when it came out. The pasta itself looked like big macaroni with a spicy tomato crime sauce, mushrooms, pancetta, and peas. I was worried about how spicy the sauce is because I'm a wimp, but I wouldn't say it's spicy at all. So if you're really looking for a kick, I would ask the waiter to bump up the hear for ya. But it was utterly delicious, I would order this again for sure. 

Really cozy vibes, a little bit of a blast to the past with the wood paneling, but well decorated and clean! Great service as well.
author: Erica L.

description: I cannot say enough about the customer service. This quaint little place is a hidden gem. The food was freshly prepared and served steaming hot. I love the open kitchen and the atmosphere was not only not only good for families, but there were family celebrations of all sorts going on around me! If you're considering going...go! You will not regret it!
author: Alyson P.

description: This was a unexpected find on our trip. Some of the best Italian food I've ever had. I had the beef ravioli and man was it good. Atmosphere also makes it very relaxing and inviting.
author: Kristal G.

description: The dishes and services are great! They even help me carry baby's stroller to second floor. The prices are reasonable in the same area.
author: Yi L.

description:
I've been searching desperately for a good Italian spot since I moved here from New York earlier this year. I'm so glad I found this place! The food is excellent, probably the best Italian food I've had in SF. Plus it's right down the street from me. My new go-to! 

I always order the burrata because, I mean, how can you not? The Pavarotti pasta is definitely one of my favorite pasta dishes and the eggplant caponata is a great appetizer. I was a little disappointed with the meatballs - they were a little too dense - but everything else has been fantastic.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
Cool little restaurant that has been here forever. Excellent service.
Perfectly executed traditional standards, but a little boring for me.
But IMO they do have some outstanding dishes.

The Good:
Eggplant with olives, mozzarella, basil and a tomato sauce - absolutely delicious

The Average:
Caprese salad - just ok for me - I prefer more balsamic reduction and riper tomatoes

Meatballs - perfectly cooked traditional meatballs, excellent but a little boring for my taste

Risotto with chicken, capers and pesto - good but agai a little on the boring side for me, this one is better suited for a for a more conservative palate
author: David T.

description: Solid neighborhood Italian restaurant with fresh and delicious cuisine! Family owned and operated, tratt is a hidden gem off the beaten path in North Beach.
author: Mitchell M.

description:
Delicious Italian food. More traditional than trendy.

The eggplant appetizer was fabulous. I recommend getting a few pastas to share, but you need to order the Carlesimo because it's wonderful - the sauce, the combination of textures, the perfectly al dente pasta. 

The atmosphere is warm and great for family dinners or a meal with a few friends.
author: Sara M.

description:
My husband and I had such a wonderful dining experience here last night! We've lived down the street from this place for 6 years and have never been in; we always talk about going, but then get distracted by shiny new restaurants. The rainy weather had me craving some warm Italian food, so we decided to head over around 5:30. We got sat in the cozy upstairs section, which was already half-filled with diners. Our server was incredibly bubbly and personable; she  recommended a bunch of her favorite dishes and even let me sample one of the wines that I was interested in. 

We ordered the special burrata dish which featured persimmons and prosciutto. It was honestly one of the best burrata dishes I've ever had, and I will definitely try making this for our next dinner party. My husband ordered the special tortellini dish. The pasta was stuffed with beef and was covered in a pea and prosciutto cream sauce. It was incredibly tasty and I loved the nutmeg flavor. I ordered the the polpettine (spaghetti and meatballs) and was very impressed with the dish. I tend to judge most Italian restaurants by this dish, because it can be very hit or miss. The meatballs were delicious, and the tomato sauce had a lot of flavor. My one complaint was how much garlic was in the meatballs; I felt like the garlic was coming out of my pores three hours later. 

I can't wait to come back here for dinner. It's a great date night spot, as well as a place to bring family and friends. I'm so glad that this gem is in our neighborhood!
author: Regina L.

description: Their signature pasta dish is awesome. Rest everything is alright. Dessert is very cold. Service and the ambience is very warm
author: Ash M.

description: This is the perfect neighborhood Italian place. The ambiance is warm and inviting. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The food is flavorful and comforting. Honestly, what more could you ask for?! 3/4 of us ordered the Il Diavolo because it just sounded too good and we were right. The salty and spicy sauce with the creamy burrata was just the best combo ever. The bruschetta was super garlicky and fresh tasting. Me and my fiancé are already planning on coming back but when we do we will be splitting an entry because they have very generous portions.  Escape the crowds on Columbus and come here instead!
author: Emily S.

description:
My friend and I were craving Italian food really badly. Bella Trattoria was closed, so we ended up driving all the way to North Beach to try out this spot.

We came here on a pretty slow weekday night, so we got seated immediately. I liked that this place was small yet cozy. We really liked how everything was set up in the restaurant.

We had the Eggplant with tomato sauce for the appetizer. The eggplant was cooked well and the sauce complimented it. I just thought this dish was okay.

For entrees, my friend ordered the Carlesimo and I had the Pavarotti. The rigatoncelli in the Carlesimo resembled macaroni but super sized. The sauce was pretty good but it wasn't that special for me. The Pavarotti was a huge disappointment. Instead of a cream sauce, the sauce was super thin and there wasn't much of it. The dish tasted super bland, like they didn't use any salt or flavoring in it.

Overall, I just think this place has bland food. It doesn't have enough flavor for me. I probably wouldn't come back.
author: Derek T.

description:
So was looking to meet friends for a small Sunday dinner gathering and decided upon this place and was able to make reservations the Friday prior to showing up. We were seated quickly upon entering and announcing our reservation right next to the front door. This joint is on the corner of Union and Mason and you will be able to see it right there. The joint itself has a nice décor inside and has a "family feel" to it with lots of people just enjoying company without being obnoxiously loud. This joint has a lot of energy from the servers all the way to the patrons and it was a nice setting. 

The table decided to order a bottle of red which was delicious and then a bruschetta, the special risotto, the polpettine, the carlesimo, and the gnocchi. After ordering, they were prompt in bringing out the bread and the vino and off we were. The bread comes out in ample amounts and provided with olive oil and balsamic of course. The bruschetta was solid, simple, and classic being a nice way to start off the meal. I will make this simple for those in a hurry to just get to the punch line. All of the food here is hearty and just plain delicious. This joint focuses on bringing delicious pasta that is cooked well to the table. The risotto was pretty good and I loved the mix in of the pesto mix to it. It was not overcooked or watery like a lot of places can get wrong so solid. Each of the pastas had its classic feel to it but just simply done well. The polpettine was delicious and classic and easy to finish off. The Carlesimo was made really well and the pasta was cooked perfectly. The pancetta added a nice flavor to the sauce on top and this was delicious as well. The gnocchi was of course to no surprise delicious as well. All of the plates were delicious and the sauces were the perfect compliment to the carb heaven on the table.

All in all, this is a solid and delicious joint in the north beach area. They provide delicious food and a good vibe to all patrons. This is definitely a solid place to check out and definitely delivers on good food without being overpriced. Check this spot out.
author: Dan M.

description:
A very small and unique place with a full bar. A huge range of whiskey selections (not much of Japanese whiskeys though). They need to work on their cocktail menu since there's only about 10 on the list. They have quick service but servers were not too friendly or social. 

We ordered the clams and mussels as appetizers and it was nicely done. Very tasty; there's a garlic taste but not too strong that it takes away the taste from the seafood. We also had the chicken ravioli in a cream sauce. It's a super simple dish, but their special cream sauce made a huge difference. The chicken inside the tiny raviolis are so soft and tender and it goes well with the sauce. Last but not least, we ordered the "carlesimo" which is just simply pasta, peas, and sun dried tomatoes, but they did a good job. It's in a semi spicy tomato sauce. It's not spicy to me so I wish they could've made it more spicy. I'll come back next time and try other items on their menu.
author: Cindy W.

description: This is one of my favorite Italian sports that I've been to. The food is terrific and I've never gotten a bad meal there. The service is a bit casual, but not necessarily in a bad way, as it fits the charm and lax vibe of the place. Great place to take a date too.
author: Graig N.

description: We came to SF for our anniversary and stumbled upon this gem. We ate out a lot this weekend, but this is the only restaurant that I am recommending. The food was fabulous, the portions were generous, and it came out piping hot. From the moment we walked in the service was excellent. The staff actually seemed like they wanted to be there, as opposed to all the other restaurants that we were at this weekend. We will be returning EVERY time we come to town.
author: Tori P.

description:
This place is really a wonderful, quaint little italian spot. 

Great Atmosphere
Friendly Wait Staff 
Delicious Flavors

I did have to knock a star for this last visit for two reasons. One of the dishes had a significantly smaller amount of noodles. (About only 10) which left a lot to be desired when there was amazinly flavored bacon sauce flilling the bottom of the bowl with no noodles left to accompany it. 

The second reason was that one of the four dishes was luke-warm/cold. We all tried each others pastas when they came to the table, and everyone simultaniously noticed that one was quite cold while the others were steaming. We asked for a quick re-heat and we could hear/see the cook slam a pan down and become upset. It just made the experience awkward and we really didnt mean to insult him, just needed the dish a little hotter. 

I'll still go back!
author: Cynthia P.

description:
This place is simply adorable! I enjoyed sitting by window as requested. I reserved a spot
for valentines day!! The food was delicious! from the seating to the last bite was Great!
author: Hannah P.

description: So happy I found this place on Yelp!! Have been trying to avoid tourist restaurants etc since we got here. Booked via open table at about 10am on Saturday and there was a only a table at 4:30pm available - happy hour is 4-6 so ended up working out well, shared some appetizers on happy hour and drank many happy hour cocktails and didn't order our mains until about 6, the staff didn't rush us at all. I had the gnocchi which was delicious. This place is definitely worth going to. Make sure you book - I also noticed they turned away a family with young children so worth calling ahead if you're going with your family to check whether children are allowed here.
author: Georgia D.

description: This place was delicious! If you're looking for good Italian food, this is your spot. It's a quaint little place in a bustling area of north beach. We both ordered pasta dishes and neither dish disappointed. It also has an extensive wine list if you're looking for that. I would definitely return!
author: Ashley R.

description: Trattoria Contadina is one of the best Italian restaurants in SF. We had the Vongole with clams, caesar salad, and the gnocchi, paired with a delicious bottle of Chianti. The service is always wonderful as well. Make reservations because it gets busy!
author: Kim O.

description: This is by far the best pasta I have ever had! I loved this place so much that I wouldn't mind to drive from Long Beach just to go eat here. The atmosphere is nice too, I like how quiet it is and everyone is so friendly there but there food is amazing! I believe I ordered the first pasta in the pasta section and my boyfriend ordered ravioli which was good too! I just loved this place so much and if I could I would give it more than 5 stars.
author: Stephanie G.

description: I have been coming here for a long time. The stuffed bell pepper is my favorite. The service and food are always consistent. Definitely warm comfort food. The way Italian food should be.
author: Rich S.

description:
Mamma mia!!!! I think is the best italian restaurant I've tasted so far in SF, all the dishes we asked were amazing, taste is authentic, the service was flawless, the place is very nice although a little small and a bit noisy, but the overall experience was excellent. We went with 4 small kids, 2,4,6 and 9 years old and they were more than happy.

I just love the place!
author: Jose T.

description:
I can be so pathetically myopic sometimes like presuming the only worthwhile eats in North Beach are on Columbus or Green or maybe Grant if I'm feeling more energetic. Going to any other block requires me to "think outside the box", and I'm the type who worries too much about what I'm missing inside the box. Lemme inside the box... PLEASE!! Thank goodness someone was kind enough to drill a big enough hole in my box to let me out. But enough with the Container Store analogies since four of us came here to dine on traditional Italiano off the tourist track in the residential area at Mason and Union. If you want good eats for hearty appetites, they got 'em right here. Ba da bing, ba da boom.

So I came here with my friends Stephanie, Robbie and his lovely wife Betsy, all fairly recent transplanters to our fair city from points east and south. Yet the irony was that they already knew this place was a find, while I, the supposed expert on local eats, was in the dark probably overly focused on the latest eatery to show up in 7x7. This one's been around since I put mousse in my hair and wanted to be in a Duran Duran cover band. It definitely looks like it was decorated back then but in a very simple, back-to-basics way (photo: http://bit.ly/Nda7iH). No velvet paintings of clowns steering gondolas, no lava lamps. Just classic. I started with one of their $8 signature Negronis because I needed it (photo: http://bit.ly/1eVtgM9).

And it did the trick. You could bend me like a pretzel for the rest of the evening now, especially with a chaser like a glass of the 2011 Brunelli Rosso di Montalcino, a lively sangiovese with a fruity finish (photo: http://bit.ly/1eVtmDf). OK, time to eat. I started with the $9 Insalata Barbabietola, a festive plate of arugula, radicchio, beets, goat cheese and pistachios, all of it doused in a light vinaigrette that didn't need much coaxing to bring out the flavor (photo: http://bit.ly/Od0mlN). It was delicious and devoured in all-too-common haste. My entree was the most extravagant pasta dish on the menu, the $25 Fruiti di Mare, a nicely portioned plate of spaghetti saturated with clams, mussels, calamari, red snapper, scallops, prawns, onions, and peperoncini, all of it lightly tossed in a fresh tomato sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1l0hybn).

Just the type of seafood extravaganza I wanted to enjoy with relish. Not pickle relish, I mean gusto. Good stuff, nothing artful but pretty darn tasty and filling. But who doesn't want to share in a little dolci to cleanse the palate. The four of us shared two of the $7 specialty ice cream pies - a slice of the Mocha Fango, layers of fudge and and mocha almond chip gelato on an Oreo cookie crust blended with chocolate chip and almonds and a slice of the Spumoni, a Neapolitan combination of vanilla, chocolate, pistachio, and strawberry ice cream - both drizzled in a dark chocolate sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1feWwU8). And did I mention the $8 mug of Irish Coffee with Jameson whiskey and a whopping dollop of whipped cream (photo: http://bit.ly/1feWDyW). Delicioso. Heavens to Betsy. Oh wait, she's here...and most heavenly.

FOOD - 4 stars...good, old-fashioned Italian well executed with no frills
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...classically nondescript with nary a red checkerboard tablecloth in sight
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...not too intrusive though a bit on rote
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely for those tired of inhaling the gas fumes at the sidewalk tables on Columbus
author: Ed U.

description:
Ate here for dinner on 10/24.  

We wanted to have one last family dinner before we left California.  I found this place on zagat's 15 Non-Touristy SF Restaurants That Every Tourist should Visit.  

Appetizer:  Meatballs.  The obvious and delicious choice.  

Main: Saltimbocca.  I can't pass up veal with red sauce.  It did not disappoint.   I also sampled the Tortellini alla Panna which was equally as tasty.  

Dessert: Spumoni.  It was just the right amount of sweet and it wasn't too heavy.
author: Scott M.

description: First timers. It was everything I'd read it would be. Great food, great service. Signature pasta dish was excellent. Gnocchi too. But don't let them stick in the upstairs room. Totally different experience. Wait for a table in the main dining room.
author: Norm C.

description:
ummmmm, this place was delicious.. so so good. came here with my parents and a gf so wanted to pick a family friendly spot with yumminess but not something extravagant. my friend has been raving about this spot, and i was thrilled they had a 4 person reservation at 630 on a sunday. RARE. we got there on time and were immediately seated near the back.. service was attentive but not suffocating (though they did ask if we were done with everything 3x before we were actually done - but we're just fatties and eat everything)

we got a bottle of chianti (they have a full bar with cocktails, beers, and lots of wine at  reasonable prices) to share, and it was pretty good with the food. for apps we got - mussels and clams, and set of 3 meatballs.  great flavor on the seafood - i thought the meatballs were a bit disappointing for an sf italian place. for entries - gnocchi, carlesimo, and risotto of the day. oooooooooomgggggggggggggg. CARBS FOR DAZE. possibly the best gnocchi ive ever had. seriousuly and the sauce was perfect.  carlesimo and risotto were also so so yummy - perfect doneness and texture and sauciness.

only complaint would be that bread was cold. but honestly. so good.
author: Christina L.

description:
This is such a nice cute & cozy Italian restaurant in North Beach! As you walk in, you will be promptly seated by the host/hostess. You will notice photo frames of famous celebrities (that I presume have been customers of this place).

The memorable ones of the night include:

Carlesimo: rigatoncelli noodle, mushrooms, peas, sun-dried tomatoes and spicy tomato cream sauce. This was delicious! Absolutely flavorful and definitely a must-have if you come visit! (5/5)

Pavarotti: fusilli noodle, chicken, proscuitto, zucchini, sun-dried tomatoes and cream. This is probably *THE BEST* cream I have ever had in my history of Italian pasta cravings. The cream isn't too heavy and contains the vital elements of flavor and consistency. You must order this if you don't normally eat tomato sauce pastas! (5/5)

Inverno di Mare: Cavatappi noodles, clams, mussels, scallops, roasted peppers. The ingredients are fresh and delicious, however I prefer the previous two pastas more. (4/5)

TIP: The cheapest parking garage near this place is for $10 (a few blocks away). Otherwise, you may need to find street parking, which can be a bit annoying during dinner hours.
author: Eva L.

description: Small place in North Beach near Washington Square.  Unpretentious decor.  Service was so-so during a time when place was not at all busy.  Bartender made an excellent Old Fashioned.  House red wine and Chianti by the glass were both mediocre, but moderately priced.  Happy hour until 6, I think.  Bruschetta were huge but otherwise unremarkable.  Entrees - Carlesimo and Ravioli - were excellent. The Carlesimo was among the best pasta dishes I've ever had anywhere.  Prices were very reasonable.  I would definitely come here again.
author: Rick B.

description:
Great family-owned restaurant. Everything cooked to perfection and so flavorful. Words can't describe the experience. 

I was with a party of 5 and treated very well on Sunday night with a completely packed house. We ate family-style near the window with a view of a the trolley, very picturesque. We allowed for the owner to pick our meal and had a great sampling of the menu. Can't say I had a favorite because it was all very good. Fresh, clean food made with love. 

I will definitely be back.
author: Heather G.

description: Wonderful service, even as an alone diner (yay Chris!) ! Totally willing to accommodate small changes to dishes without frowning. Two things I hate - luke warm food and soggy zucchini. The dish came out so hot I had to wait to eat I (again, yay!!) AND somehow the zucchini still wasn't smooshy. Well worth the departure from Columbus up the hill.
author: Mitzi V.

description: Had a quick Girl's night last night here! The service was awesome--they were attentive without being overbearing and the food was absolutely delicious. We started with the bruschetta and carpaccio which were both great choices! I had the Preggo with nicely cooked pancetta and broccolini. I am excited to go again!
author: Lynne T.

description: Italian fare that's executed well and is just the right portion given the quality and price - for example, my namesake, the Vincenzo, which is a fettucine dish topped with sausage, peppers, onions, olives, and tomato sauce. A simple, satisfying, honest-to-goodness dish. The venue itself is a cozy, intimate neighborhood joint that reminds me a lot of my favorite trattorias from my time living in NYC. Good food, good wine, and good times all around.
author: Vincent L.

description: You must order the pepper roasted bell pepper stuffed with three cheeses in a spicy tomato cream sauce. This was recommended by some locals that were sitting next to us. It may be the best thing I have ever put in my mouth!!
author: Holly R.

description: Great food. Great service in a small quiet setting. We were surprised at how fast the food came out. The homemade tiramisu was the best we've tried in a long time.
author: Dean A.

description:
Love this place!!!

Get in early and find a steal of a happy hour!!!  Amazing location, great quality food and excellent prices.  Staff is super friendly. Come for a romantic dinner or with friends, this is the real deal.
author: Dan K.

description: I am a first generation Italian and this is the best Italian food I have ever been served in a restaurant. The service was excellent and the meal was incredible. We loved so much we came back a second night before we had to leave.
author: MB C.

description: My husband and I got engaged here 25 years ago, and we come back every time we get a chance. The food was fantastic as always. The restaurant is now being run by the third generation of the original owners, and they are a wonderful bunch. Our waitress was excellent, the service terrific, and we'll be back again!!
author: Peggy R.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Every time I go back it gets better. They serve amazing authentic Italian cuisine, while maintaining a homey feeling in the restaurant. It's best to make a reservation unless you're okay with eating at 4pm or 8pm. Free bread and olive oil and vinegar to start. I love to start with the burratta and prosciutto plate ($17), as it is the freshest burratta I've ever had. I had the il diavolo as my entree. It's new to the menu and amazing. Perfect amount of spice.
author: Bella S.

description:
What a wonderful find. Tucked away off the beaten path is this cute little place with the most amazing food. We stopped by without a reservation on a Saturday. We were told that we would not be able to be sat until 9 pm---then someone was late for their reservation and we were in. Thank you!!  We had the Mushroom Ravioli which was to die for. The creamy Marsala was delectable. 2 others opted for the Spaghetti and meatballs which they said were Delish. We topped it off with the Lemon-Champagne-White Chocolate. Cheesecake.  Very delicate in the blend of the flavors. Another hit. 
Can't wait to return next visit :). Thanks for the great night.
author: Charlene G.

description:
A great first impression of Trattoria Contadina. We felt the food and service were excellent. Our waiter, Christobal, did a nice job with his deliveries and discreet observations. Everything was orchestrated well for a very pleasant dining experience. Trattoria Contadina is an amazingly fine and distinguished Italian restaurant. 

We ordered a wide sampling of menu items: 

Appetizer
* Deviled eggs (appetizer, seasoned with prosciutto, sweet red peppers, and smoked salt)

Pasta
* Carlesimo (rigatoncelli, pancetta, porcini, peas, sun-dried tomatoes, spicy tomato cream. 
* Polpetine (spaghetti, superb and tasty Italian meatballs, tomato sauce)
Both pasta dishes were prepared al dente; pasta entrees are offered in small and large sizes)

Main Dishes
* Veal Saltimbocca (prosciutto, mozzarella, sage, marsala wine, tomato sauce, spinach, and roasted potatoes)
* Filet of Eastern Salmon (a special item), 

Beverages
* Glasses of Nebbiolo
* Italian coffee.

Enjoy!
author: Reyn J.

description: We stumbled on this quaint little family owned Italian restaurant on New Years Eve. They were booked, so we ate at the bar. The people there were friendly and loved to talk. The food was exceptional. I had the Gnocchi made with cheese, yum. Donna had the Prego, which comes with a story. Ask about it. Great place.
author: Bill M.

description:
The food is good and tasty! Had the red sauce pasta with shrimp and my sister got the chicken fettuccine, they use such big plate that makes the portion so little. Dessert was good too, we got the canolli. 
Nice small italian restaurant and i like it! I
Lots of people eating and thats a good sign.
author: edel g.

description: Very nice Italian restaurant off the main tourist drag. Food and service were excellent, a tad noisy and crowded but not enough to keep me away. Wine list was very reasonable. Deserts were great. Cabernet Sorbet must try.
author: Dennis C.

description: This restaurant is small but cute. They have upstairs seating as well which isn't evident when you are downstairs. I think the food is fairly average. We had the meatballs and it was fairly average...Italian homemade makes a significantly better meatball. My bf had the mushroom ravioli and it was pretty earthy and the ravioli was well cooked...a little al dente with good bite. I had the lamb shank. It was highly underwhelming. It came with polenta and spinach that was literally swimming in butter. The lamb was not well seasoned and not cooked long enough because it was a little tougher than other lamb shanks I've had at other restaurants. It was also a bit gamey which is also an indication of lack of seasoning. I would not come back to this place because there are significantly better restaurants in north beach.
author: Mai C.

description: Rustic and Authentic Italian food served by very competent staff, Trattoria Contadina is probably the best Italian food we have had the pleasure of eating in the Bay Area. Gina is a very charming host and she and Kevin have made a real jewel in the heart of North Beach. Every bite of every dish we ate was just perfect. Whether you are a first-timer or a regular Italian foodie ... this is one place which you must go. I particularly enjoyed eating the Pesce Picatta ... and I highly recommend this for seafood lovers. Planning to go back soon in my second of many more visits. Hope this place flourishes for generations to come
author: Saurabh M.

description: The antipasto was drenched in sauce as was the veal scallopini. Too heavy. Also, the veal was tough. The veal chop had too much vinegar in the sauce and was sour. Not recommended.
author: Doug T.

description: My boyfriend took me here on our first date and it was amazing! I got the cheese stuffed ravioli and he got the spaghetti w/ meatballs. So delicious! Our server was really sweet and attentive. The decor is so cute and I love how it's a bit away from the Washington Square area. We'll definitely be coming back!
author: Katie P.

description: Had a really good experience at Trattoria Contandina for Valentine's Day.  The restaurant was busy as expected, but the food was delicious and it came out quickly.  Service was friendly and the atmosphere was warm.  The house Pinot was also very good.
author: Joe L.

description: Had some wine and dinner and watched the trolley go by a few times. What a nice place! We had reservations and I think that's a must!
author: Carmelo W.

description: The food was excellent and the service was even better.  Ask for J. He's the best waiter.
author: Pete C.

description: Years back I asked a close friend - he's 100% Italian :) - where to go for some good Italian food on a first date. Without hesitation he recommended Trattoria Contadina. Trattoria is the perfect representation of a high-quality, family owned/operated restaurant. We've come for random date nights, a birthday (8-10 people), when we have family in town, and every anniversary since. The service and food is always perfect. Thank you Correnti family for such great dining experiences with our friends and family!
author: Tyler G.

description: Love love love this place! Sat at the bar and had a lonely conversation with the bartender who is the grandson of the owner. This place has been around for 33 years-same two head chefs and you can tell a lot of love goes into their food and their atmosphere. A true San Francisco authentic Italian restaurant. Love.
author: Jill M.

description: Great food, warm and cozy atmosphere! The pasta with clams and capers was delicious, as was the blackberry sorbet!
author: Sydney M.

description: Fabulous traditional Italian eatery. Great ambience and great food, the pasta dishes are exceptional. Super wine list. Only reason it's not a five is that service was rather relaxed. Not too much of a problem, big wait between individual servings of the appetisers, though the food and ambience made up for it.
author: Simon K.

description: Absolutely love this place! We have to go here every time we make it to San Francisco. The food and service are amazing. Everything from the greeting at the door to the dessert drinks is always a pleasure. The owners are usually there with a warm smile and ready with a wonderful recommendation based on our moods. This place is a delight that many of recommend. Top notch all the way!
author: Jeton P.

description:
I've been to Trattoria Contadina twice now and both times have been phenomenal! It's become an instant classic in my book and our favorite neighborhood Italian joint. 

You really can't go wrong here. As far as antipasti goes, I've tried the warm olives, the meatballs and the roasted bell pepper. The meatballs were the only thing I might pass on again, but the warm olives and roasted bell pepper are fantastic. I've also had the wedge salad with the tarragon caper dressing, which is divine and crave-worthy. 

Among the pastas, collectively my boyfriend and I have tried the gnocchi, the carlesimo, the vongole and a risotto special. All were fantastic, and for me to say that about a pasta dish, it has to really hit the nail on the head. 

We've also had wonderful service both times we've been there. Very friendly, patient staff that makes you feel at home. The servers offer valuable direction on the menu and have provided us with wine tastings if we torn between a few options. They also have these delicious after dinner drinks that are the perfect way to end the meal. Can't wait to try a dish from the secondi portion of the menu next time I come in.
author: Amy H.

description: This place is unreal! Everything we had was amazing (gnocchi, clams and spaghetti with white wine sauce). Pretty quiet on a Monday night but it was the perfect place for a date!
author: Greg F.

description:
Found this place by luck and wanting to try something different- so glad we did! 

Cozy atmosphere where you can see and smell the kitchen.

The waitstaff is awesome. This place has been handed down to Kevin and his brother Kasey helps out as well. Both were super friendly and have recommendations that were awesome.

The carlisimo is to die for. Haven't had anything like it. The homemade pasta is fabulous. And the creamy tomato sauce is great.

The burrata special with persimmons is amazing. They recently updated their burrata special with new cheese and with figs- it's not as good so I hope they switch back!

We also tried the only Cabernet sauv on their menu and it was outstanding.

Great food. Cozy atmosphere. Good management and waitstaff- they even remembered us on our second visit. We'll be back
author: Zoe S.

description:
Trattoria Contadina is a classic neighborhood Italian restaurant. We were seated upstairs where the room temperature was cooler. The service was very pleasant. We had Caponata and roasted bell pepper appetizers. Both were excellent. The caponata is a great mix of flavors. The peppers are like an Italian fondue. Even the olive oil provided with the bread was light and sweet. 

For dinner, we had gnocchi with a meatball, Salvatore (ravioli), Pesce Peperonata, and the Capesante scallops special. All were very good. The swordfish was in a light, tomato sauce with broccolini. The gnocchi was fresh made in a light tomato cream sauce. The ravioli has a rich cream sauce. 

Dessert was chocolate chip cookies and mocha fango.  We plan to be back. The best Italian we have had in SF.
author: Howard S.

description: Wanted to like this place more, but it was just so so for me. Clearly it's popular though, as it was crowded on a Friday night.  As such, it was extremely loud.  We were glad to be seated upstairs. Our server was pretty nonexistent. It took an awkwardly long time to place our order, and then we really didn't see her again. The fresh bread they bring out is awesome, definitely a highlight. Everything else was just fine. The meatballs in the spaghetti dish were so dense, it was off putting. They bordered on the dry side as well, so somewhat tough. The flavor didn't wow me, and the red sauce was very watery. Pasta was probably homemade, but nothing special. The special pasta, with the spicy cream sauce, looked much better. I tried a bite and it wasn't spicy at all. Neither of my dining companions raved about it though. Not my worst meal, but not my best.
author: Jennifer B.

description: We had a large group (11 total), a reservation and a craving for Italian. This place did not let us down! Between us all we had a variety of dishes including the (appetizers) meatballs, carpaccio, caprese, (dinner) snapper, oso buco, carlesimo, saltimboca, il davio and a bunch of other plates I can't spell. We also had an order of tiramisu which is what dream are made of. Bottom line is I would come back in a second! Generous portions, great atmosphere, friendly staff and amazing eats.
author: Alissa A.

description: We were looking for a place to eat on New Year's Day. We had spent most of the day at Fisherman's Wharf to Pier 39. On the way back to our car which was parked at Ghiradelli Square, we were thinking of where to eat at 7pm. We looked at yelp and were craving some really good Italian Food. My brother found Trattoria Condtadina. The reviews were exceptional, the foodie pictures looked phenomenal and so he called in. The guy who made reservations for us was a lifesaver. He managed to squeeze the 3 of us in for dinner. It was the best decision on both parties, because now I know where to go when I visit San Francisco. This place is not located in Little Italy, and it's located in the neighborhood where you would at least expect it. There's no competition for this restaurant and I feel most of the customers are local near by neighbors. Once you get in, there is limited space to wait inside. But it's definitely worth the time waiting, when you get inside the restaurant eat some really good Italian Food. I had orderded the seafood penne. It was supposed to be spaghetti, but I asked for a penne substitute. My mom and brother had the same but stook with the spaghetti. It was a delicious dinner. I wish I could've added more penne. We also started off with an appetizer of Mussels, and clams. It was definitely a great way to start off the dinner. I also had lemonade as a drink, My mom and brother had wine. The environment here is very romantic and Italian-Family feel to it. We ended the night with tiramisu and cappucino. The tiramisu was to die-for. The cappucino was really good too. This is definitely a restaurant to come to. I can't wait to come back to S.F. and get some more of that tiramisu. Thanks Trattoria!!!
author: Arthur W.

description: It is a must eat in San Francisco .  The food is excellent and the wait staff is truly wonderful. Seriously MUST DO!!!
author: Cory C.

description: Fun ambience but very mediocre food. Caprese was good. Spaghetti and meatball and veal was way over salted. Meatball was over salted also. Didn't taste like homemade pasta at all. Not sure why this place is rated so highly
author: Linn L.

description:
Absolutely incredible traditional Italian meal! We had five different pasta dishes, the highlights being the chicken ravioli dish and the gnocchi. Utterly creamy sauces and perfectly al dente pasta. Also tried their special burrata with melon, which was excellent, and was surprised by the roasted stuffed pepper appetizer as well, which was probably one of my favorite dishes ever. Great wine list and servers were very attentive and friendly. 

Decidedly one of the stand-out Italian meals I've had in North Beach -- and that's saying something!

This place is awesome for a hearty meal with close friends + fam! Make a reservation because it fills up quick.
author: Rachael H.

description:
IMA in SF.  

The Carlesimo, which has homemade rigatoncelli along with pancetta, porcini, peas, sun-dried tomatoes, and spicy tomato cream, is one of the ten or so best pasta dishes I have ever had.  That alone makes the visit worth it.  Add to that a cute atmosphere, nice cocktails, and good and reasonably priced italian wines, I highly recommend this spot!
author: Ian A.

description: The food is very heavy - Olive Garden would be a better and less expensive alternative
author: Tom L.

description: The pastas are hit or miss, but the  Carlesimo is always a crowd pleaser. Service is good, seating is cramped. They can accommodate large groups upstairs.
author: Nick R.

description:
I'm afraid to say but this was mediocre for me. After scouring different reviews and menus in the area I made a reservation while in SF on a business trip. I don't consider myself, by any stretch, to be an Italian food expert, but I could tell the food would be "eh" at best when it plopped at my seat literally five minutes after ordering. In some instances you want food delivered quickly but when you go out for a nice dinner it's okay to wait for a few. It was clear in this case they had vats of dishes in the kitchen and just scooped out my plate. It tasted okay, but it also tasted like it had been sitting for a while - lukewarm and a little flavorless. 

Service was great and the food tasted like it could be good had I eaten it after it had been cooked instead of a lengthy time later, but I just wish it wasn't so blatantly prepared in mass quantities.
author: Kristen M.

description:
Had a wonderful dinner here on a Monday night. Stuffed pepper appetizer was great, I got a veal dish that was done quite well.

Service was good. Nothing spectacular, but definitely solid. The beer was flat which was a bummer.
author: Ross H.

description:
Italian food is about either out of the world quality, or mind blowing portions.  Trattoria misses on both.  But let's start from the beginning of this experience.

Came in here because wife wanted a nice sit down place.  Seated suitably fast, although in a corner.  They were nice enough to bring crayons for my daughter, ok, so far so good.

Both of us thought the bread was cold, so that could've been better.  Olive oil was meh... So, not off to a great start, the Mista salad was your standard mixed green salad. Nothing spectacular, for $9.5, 5/10 on the honesty scale, my daughter.

Ordered the spaghetti with meat balls and the Carlesimo.  And when my daughter said: " am I ever going to get my dinner."  I was ready to knock off another star.  Luckily, dinner came here seconds after that.  

The portions were relatively tiny for the pricing they were charging,  Bucca had better size.  So, I was expecting something quite out of this world as far as the pasta is concerned.  The spaghetti with meatball was just plain, so not really special.  The Carlesimo was something other yelpers raved about, but I thought the noodles were a little too tough.  They did get the spices right, so wasn't a complete disappointment, overall, I would hope if the noodles were boiled a little longer, it would be just about right.

My overall opinion of Italian restaurants is that they were either mind blowing in terms of quality or they overwhelmed you with portions.  The best case is that you get both.  Trattoria missed on both opportunities, only the reasonable services redeemed this place.
author: Min C.

description: We had a fantastic time at this restaurant for a birthday dinner. They were thoughtful, the service was good, and the food was excellent (get the gnocchi). Beware of very large portions! We will definitely be back!
author: Ishani S.

description:
Awesome local find in a slightly hilly and pleasant neighborhood. Eat great homemade pasta and watch the trolley roll by. Start with the antipasta meat and olive dish. Don't miss the pesto ravioli, it was perfect, I'm still thinking about that. And end with their homemade tiramisu, gosh that's good. Compliment with a bottle of Chianti (any on the menu will be good) and you are set.
I prefer to eat family style here, so everyone can try all the wonderful dishes. Only rule: everyone must order something different.
author: Brian J.

description:
I give a four start for the food but not so much the service.  I have eaten at Trattoria Contadina a few times with my family and have really enjoyed the food. I picked this restaurant this evening as my three sisters and I were celebrating a birthday.  I brought a bottle of wine and the corkage fee is $25 which is comparable to many restaurants in the city.  My sisters ordered the meatballs and thought they were very tasty (I'm a vegetarian).  Between us, we ordered the primavera pasta, eggplant pasta,  pasta with clams and mussels, and the swordfish.  All dishes were substantial and we left our plates empty.  We were also served bread with olive oil and vinegar.  For dessert, we had cheesecake which we also enjoyed.

A few things to note.  We had a problem with several fruit flies at our table.  I had forgot that we had this problem when I had been there several months ago.  We brought it to the attention of our waiter but there was not much he could do while we were eating.  We ate at a table for 4 at the far end of the restaurant.  I have to say my sisters and I thought the busser was much more attentive and friendlier to us than the server.  Our waiter was busy helping a large party celebrating a 90th birthday but he just didn't seem "in tune" with our table.   Lastly, on the way out of the restaurant, my oldest sister commented to the host about our problem with the flies. He said they were going to spray as this happens when the seasons change.  I don't know what time of year we have eaten here before but they were there then too.

I think they have a great menu and they have quality food but they need to address the fruit fly problem.  It's very annoying to eat while they are flying around the food. In looking at all the reviews, I do not see mention of this so I'm wondering if it's just this table as this is where we have sat in the past.
author: Kathy T.

description: Love this place! So many great choices on the menu. The food there reminds me of all my Italian family's recipes that came over with my great grandparents from the old country.
author: John M.

description:
This has to be my favorite Italian place in the city!!  Everything is top notch!  Service, food, atmosphere, drinks, people.  They seem to happily go off menu as well, and they do it well.

I also love their brunch. It is a place that I make sure to take people that I am close with.
author: Jesse K.

description:
The portion size I got last Sunday afternoon was literally only a quarter of what I see in these photos.....

Carlesimo was disappointing.   The texture was too dry and chewy, I'm not sure if it was fully cooked. I really regret not asking them to recook it.  

Ravioli Beef was good but we finished that dish in seconds.  Only a handful of pieces.

These dishes are really not worth $18 each.  I felt bad taking my friend here.  I could tell he was not happy having to pay so much for this meal. 

This whole restaurant only has ONE restroom.  Must be a nightmare during rush hour meal times.
author: David W.

description: We have eaten here 2 times previously and thought it was delicious. We brought out of town guests last night and I have no idea if they changed chefs but it was awful. We had the burrata appetizer and the was the only noteworthy part of the meal. I had chicken w pancetta and it was very bland and had an offensive smell. My son had a waiter recommended pasta dish where the pasta was so aldente' he could not bite through it. Other family members had an eggplant pasta dish, mushroom ravioli and linguini and clams all that were very, very mediocre. We love to support and recommend small local restaurants but in the case we cannot.
author: Linda C.

description: This place is so cozy and scrumptious. My boyfriend and I didn't have reservations, but luckily we were able to sit at the bar and chat with bartender/manager Casey, whose Italian family owns the restaurant (his Sicilian grandfather opened it years ago). Great conversation, service, and food. I'm obsessed with Italian food and I know when it's not done right. But this place is authentic and definitely does the food right. We started off with the meatballs (with freshly grated Parmesan might I add) which were perfect and served with the best tomato sauce. Secondly, I had the Carlesimo pasta which was my absolute favorite. The sauce nearly melted in my mouth. Lastly we had tiramisu which tasted like it did when I had it in Italy! Overall, such a cute and authentic restaurant. I will definitely go back and get that delicious Carlesimo pasta again.
author: Caroline Y.

description: I was looking for top rated restaurants near the Fairmont hotel where my family and I were staying but most of them were booked or were not family friendly. I found this gem and the reviews were spot on. The food was excellent and the service was even better! The host, a big burly guy with forearm tattoos was super cool and comped our drinks for having to wait a little longer than expected. It was family friendly and a homely ambiance. Dish recommendation: veal scallopini.
author: Rene N.

description: Best service, bar, chefs, keeping it real. Taking care of us and food is always fresh.
author: Robert M.

description: We had a wonderful time at this restaurant. We had the caprese appetizer and I had a dish with pancetta and a spicy tomato sauce. Service was impeccable and it was a romantic, quaint, and inviting atmosphere. I loved this place!!
author: Nicole L.

description: Yum, you guys. This was great. I went with a big group, most of whom were from out of town, and we were all very satisfied. I had the Carbonara, plus I sampled someone's Gnocchi and someone's Seafood Jubilee or whatever, and everything was great. This is a little corner restaurant in the city, maybe not a huge amount of elbow room, but that's part of its charm. I also fondly remember the cheese plate we had as an appetizer, and the very attentive service. Prices are... high for what I'm used to where I'm from in the Twin Cities, but since everything in the Bay Area seems high to me, I'd say these prices are more than fair. We went there on the advice of someone who is very knowledgeable about the San Francisco restaurant scene, and he noted that the small bar tends to be very popular and lively as well.
author: Bob A.

description:
Enjoyed my second amazing meal here the other night- brought my bf here for our 6 month..... The atmosphere is quaint and the wait staff is impeccable - friendly and attentive.

The burrata with fig was a triumph- second only to the meatballs which words simply can't describe. Yum.

For entrees the cheese ravioli was better than the first time I had it nearly 6 months ago--- this speaks to the consistency of food quality here, as I find repeat orders at most restaurant favorites tend not to be as good as I first remembered-- the ravioli was just phenomenal.

We also tried the veal saltimbocca- the spinach and potatoes were a great side, the veal itself was to die for. 

My only piece of constructive criticism would be in regards to the osso bucco... It was the only item that I may not try again-- the lamb was a bit gamier than I hoped and the saffron risotto was disappointing - tasted like white rice with cream sauce unfortunately. 

This being said, Trattoria is officially my favorite Italian in the city so far! Highly recommended for a night with friends or a romantic evening for two. Enjoy!!!
author: Andrew P.

description:
My friend was visiting from New York and wanted to try Italian. Looked up some places on yelp, found this place. The place itself is cosy and homey. Our waitress was really nice and attentive. 
The bread basket was not that great, the bread was a little hard and tasted old. We each had a couple of drinks, I had grapefruit cocktail, my friends had prosecco, old fashioned and manhattans, which they all enjoyed.
For appetizers we ordered the meatballs, bruschetta and the antipasti. All of it was really good.
 For entree, I had the gnocchi with chicken breast which was really good. My friend had the Fruiti di Mare which he loved, and so did I. Another friend had the calamari steak, which he raved about. And my friend visiting from New York had the Pavarotti without  prosciutto and she did not like her dish very much,  it was pretty bland.

We did end the night with a slice of tiramisu which was amazing, will be back to try other options.
author: Tahima B.

description:
I can't. I just can't deal! I mean... Wow. This is just the place you want to go to when you want the real deal. Period. You want fake or real Italian? If it's real and authentic Italian you want... Look no further. 

I came across this little piece of heaven when I was on the hunt for the best Italian around town. The reviews and pictures really caught my attention. I made reservations for 9 pm. Got there 15 minutes early and were seated within a few minutes. Super small, cute and cozy place that added to the experience. 

What we ordered:

Drinks:
1 bottle of Brunelo Di Montalcino

Appetizers:
Meatballs (3 to 1 order)
Burrata

Main course:
Ravioli assortiti (beef) w/ Alfredo sauce 
Carlesimo

Starting off with the bread. Yum. They bring oil and vinegar and I asked for a side of Parmesan cheese. Duh. I'm obsessed with cheese. I mean. I couldn't stop eating bread! Then the meatballs and burrata came. -_-  just stop it right there. Meatballs: ON POINT! Fluffy and flavorful. Possible? It happened. So good! Flavors were all there. We almost ordered another plate of meatballs but really wanted to leave room for the entree. The burrata.... Ok... How do I explain it... There are no words! It had some kind of sliced meat (prosciutto?) under with the burrata on top and pesto on top of the burrata. That combination was just perfect. It melted in your mouth. There were four pieces. It was just perfect. Can't go wrong with either appetizer!!

I ordered the ravioli and my boyfriend ordered the Carlesimo. Both of those particular pastas are made in house which is exactly what I wanted. Made from scratch pasta. And that's what I got. My ravioli's were great. It had a hint of some sort of sweetness to it which I didn't love because I personally don't like my food sweet unless it's dessert! My boyfriend didn't think it was but his palette is different. His pasta dish was just amazing. All the different ingredients came together to make every bite better than the last. The sun dried tomatoes and mushrooms were my favorite part of the dish. 

Overall: would I recommend? Absolutely. No doubt about that! Would I come back? Yes! I would recommend eating light in the day and planning on going to the gym the best day but certainly worth it. They definitely filled my Italian food fix I was in search of! Our total for the bill was $121 before tip. Not bad. We got a bottle of $55 wine, 2 appetizers and 2 entrees.
author: Ida A.

description: Great Italian food. A little off the beaten trail / up the hill from North Beach. Not a huge selection of traditional Italian cuisine, but still good dishes. I like the Caesar salad with optional anchovies on top.
author: Peter K.

description: Our last night in San Francisco we wanted and nice Italian dinner, and I got it! Charming local little neighborhood restaurant and the food was divine. Service personal and quick. I had a lot of choices, didn't know any of them, choose the right one.
author: Marylee Q.

description:
Awesome pasta off the main strip in North Beach/Russian Hill!
Try the eggplant rigatoni and the broccolini side. Simple and yummy-
We sat at the bar and had a glass of wine with our food. The staff were so nice and they must have asked at least ten times if we were OK or if we wanted anything else. Really attentive and made us feel at home-
author: Kinjal N.

description: I have been here a few times over the years and it is always amazing.  I recently had them cater two different events from at my office. One was a fully catered lunch for 80 and the other was an event with appetizers for 120.  The quality of the food was excellent, the presentation was fantastic and we couldn't have been happier. Everyone raved about and we hope to have them back again soon!
author: John W.

description: Gnocchi  Risotto  Chicken Carbonara Red snapper w/ prawns  Cheesecake  Tiramisu Blackberry Sorbet
author: Duke M.

description:
If you're looking for great food and good service, this is the place. So glad we made a reservation (a MUST on Saturday nights) and we were seated right away. It is a family run business and they take pride in their history. 

We started with the Antipasti platter which quite filling and satisfying. The three pasta dishes that our table ordered were Pesto Genovese, Nocino, and Pavarotti. All of them were flavorful and delicious! We barely had room to share the Tiramasu which was light as air. 

Overall, a real class act.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Most of the Italian restaurants in North Beach are located along the Columbus Avenue corridor.  Located in the outskirts amongst residential buildings at the corner of Union and Mason streets is Trattoria Contadina.  

With 6:00 reservations, we checked in with the hostess were promptly seated at our choice of tables of two near the back of the dining room.  A bar is located near the front and there are some tables in the front with a view of the cable cars going by and there are tables in the middle and back.  They also have a seating area of about four table in a back upper level.  

Our waiter took our drink order before coming back to take our order.  Since we had reservations for a show and short on time, we opted to skip appetizers and just have entrées.  After answering some questions regarding the dishes, we placed our orders, which came piping hot within ten minutes.  

House bread - with extra virgin olive.  Balsamic vinegar was on the table for you to add into the oil. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/trattoria-contadina-san-francisco?select=gLXCZFWIr_lD1-5bMp84-A#gLXCZFWIr_lD1-5bMp84-A)

Vincenzo - fettuccine with Little City sausage, peppers, onions, olives in tomato sauce.  The olives provided a nice balance to the red sauce.  The dish had a good amount of sausage in it.  
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/trattoria-contadina-san-francisco?select=gLXCZFWIr_lD1-5bMp84-A#D_PCLqzpWKYCVqgR9lNoUA)  

Correnti - farfalle with porcini, chicken, peas in a cream sauce.  The chicken was tender in a tasty mushroom sauce.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/trattoria-contadina-san-francisco?select=gLXCZFWIr_lD1-5bMp84-A#U-teRpP7I0kfAPf6AtXy0g)

A nice, small cozy neighborhood restaurant.  We were only able to try the pasta dishes and the two we had were delicious.  Service was friendly and efficient.
author: Al L.

description: Great restaurant owned by a super sweet husband and wife duo. Family restaurant in the family for over 35 years. You can feel the love and passion for this sweet little place! We enjoyed not only the food but the ambiance and company.
author: critsey r.

description:
I came here on a random weekday night at around 5:30pm, and thankfully there was still plenty of seating. It is a cute little restaurant with dim lighting and string lights hanging from the ceiling- perfect for a date night.

I tried the Carlesimo, which is a pasta with "rigatoncelli, pancetta, porcini, peas, sun-dried tomatoes, spicy tomato cream." When I ordered this, the waiter smiled and told me it was their signature dish. I was blown away by this pasta. It was absolutely delicious. The sauce was perfectly creamy, tomato-y, and the pancetta and porcini really gave it a rich meaty flavor. Pasta was fresh and chewy (though I felt it was a tad bit too "al dente" and could've been cooked a bit longer..). Overall, would order this again and again. 

The boyfriend got the Vongole, which is a pasta with white wine, garlic, clams.. etc. This was only meh... and paled in comparison to my dish. We wouldn't order this again. 

We also got the Caprese which was also good. The heirloom tomatoes were really sweet and flavorful, and paired well with the burrata cheese- it all tasted very "fresh". I do wish it had maybe a pinch of salt though, as I feel this would balance the flavors of sweetness from the tomatoes and the sour from the balsamic vinegar. I've tried a caprese salad from another restaurant that had some kind of pesto aioli and I really liked how it made the dish savory, sweet, and tangy.
author: Kathleen Y.

description:
The last time I had dinner here it was with an amazing woman but it was a business dinner and we were in a large group.  Little did I know that she would one day become my wife.  So this place has a special moment in my heart when I look back on it.

I walked in early because I knew I was eating solo and this place is very small.  I was able to grab a table with no reservation.  There is always someone at the door to greet you too, which I love.

I was seated at my table with ex-Bear Ron Rivera...yes there was an autographed picture of him sitting right next to me and being from Chicago I felt like I was at home.  He was not very talkative...I asked him if was picking the 49ers or the Saints and he just kind of hung around there and froze! 

I was delivered some bread which I immediately dipped in some olive oil.  I was very hungry and needed something solid.  I also was feeling pasta and meatballs but did not want to be so basic.  So I got a starter of meatballs and then a half order of Linguine and Clams.

I really enjoyed the meatballs and the best part is that I did not have to share them with anyone.  I had the young lady grate fresh Parmesan cheese all over them.  I also dipped my bread in the sauce and I was in heaven.

Next came my pasta with clams.  The clams were good but I was a little letdown because 3 of the 11 clams were full of sand.  I honestly do not know if that is normal or should I expect that in a restaurant.  We cook with fresh clams at home and we make those suckers spit out ever last piece of sand before we throw them into there boiling death.  So I do not know if I am being unreasonable but a mouth full of sand is not fun!

The pasta with all of the ingredients was very tasty.  I also like that they offer half orders.  I was able to get a nice half order and not feel like I have to eat the whole thing.  It is so hard being Sicilian...we are taught to clean our plate.  So the half order saves me all of those extra calories and carbs!

By the time I left almost every table was taken...so I am glad that I got here early and got my dinner before it was too late.  

Hopefully next time I will have to have dinner with that amazing woman here again!!!
author: Anthony M.

description: Another fabulous meal at the Trat!  our waitress Nicole was the best and of Course Kasey and Vince represented the Correnti Family. Just sorry we missed Kevin and Gina. The roasted pepper appetizer is a must, the bruschetta delicious. We were treated so well by the team, they made it a very special night for us. We recommend this atmosphere and food to all!
author: Marjorie M.

description: Poor poor...poor service ..food was just so average and the duck special was ridiculously small. Our waiter came to our table twice.  His  read persona d water person came the rest.  Sub sub par.
author: Todd A.

description:
Had a great dinner at Trattoria Contadina. As a table of 5, we ordered a wide variety of appetizers (do yourself a favour and try the roasted bell pepper), which everyone enjoyed. Everyone ordered a different main, with no complaints. Good selections of wine. 
Very friendly staff, even though we had a late reservation and stayed well beyond any other table. The staff had almost finished cleaning, and some were enjoying a meal, off to the side, and nobody pressured us to leave. After a long week, this was greatly appreciated. 
Trattoria Contadina was highly recommended to us by a friend, who has been there multiple times.
author: Scott M.

description:
I'm not usually a pasta girl but that Carlesimo got me rethinking. 

Perfect spot for a relaxing 2 hour dinner!
author: Linda X.

description:
Not worth of your money. Nothing is authentic or Italian. The only decent wine is the sangiovese. 
Save your money
The service is nice, hence the two starts
author: Giulia P.

description: Seriously great Italian food with great service. I had veal, which was delicious! My wife had mushroom ravioli. The sauces on both were incredibly rich and flavorful. Highly recommended. We will be back.
author: Shawn H.

description:
Phenomenal pasta. Came here because a friend was visiting from out of town and the four of us split a bunch of dishes. 

Family style is far and away the way to go. The pasta isn't too heavy and is bursting with flavor, I'll definitely be back.

The Carlesimo is a must try.
author: Kevin D.

description: When Italian food is good it's gooood! This place nailed it. The bruschetta was great but the roasted bell pepper with melted cheese and creamy tomato sauce was out of this world. Soaking up the remaining sauce with some sour dough bread was the icing on the cake. I couldn't stop thinking about it and wanted to order another as my main meal. Instead I gave gnochi a try. Once again, awesome flavor and presentation. Home made tiramisu topped things off very nicely for me. This place was packed the entire time I was here so reservations are highly recommended.
author: David S.

description:
Get a reservation cuz this place is small (and packed) We had a nice experience.  The bartender was pleasant while we waited for our guests and our server, Nancy was great.  She even recommended some local bars in the area that are low key.

The four of us split a bottle of red wine, had salads, bruschetta (excellent!) two entrees off the special (risotto was gluten free) menu and two entrees of the menu.

The food was very filling and fantastic!

We also had the sorbet and tiramisu for dessert. Both good and liked the fresh mint.

All and all -- great and would return.
author: Valerie W.

description:
Brunch here was practically perfect in every way. 

A friend of a friend, Silvio, was doing a marketing event for this restaurant and immediately got us going with mimosas and throughout our meal he continued to keep said mimosas bottomless. (He's an awesome.) Silvio also sent us an order of zucchini bread. The bread was moist and delicious and served with a delectable honey butter and an apple/pear spread of some sort. 

I had a difficult time deciding on what to order, because everything sounded incredible, but our server helped out greatly by explaining some of the dishes in detail. I decided to go with the Molto Buono which consists of crispy potatoes topped with bacon, sunny side up eggs, tomato, avocado, and greens. All of that is topped with a balsamic reduction and a bit of pesto. Every component of the dish was cooked perfectly and together...OH. MY. Let me just say that this was one of those dishes that you keep taking bites of, even though you are stuffed, because it is so darn delicious. 

Can I get a bottomless mimosa when we come back for dinner?
author: Emily J.

description:
This is not a very big restaurant but that certainly isn't a bad thing. We were running late for our reservation but they were very accommodating and we were able to be seated immediately despite our 25-minute tardiness. 

Service was very friendly and helpful. We had show tickets around the corner for Brach Blanket Babylon and so by the time we arrived we only had 50-minutes for dinner. Our order was taken promptly and the service was timed accordingly. 

We shared the warm olive appetizer, Burratta special appetizer with duck prosciutto, figs, and arugula, and a Pasta dish of homemade spaghetti, pancetta, broccolini with a cream sauce. Everything was excellent!
author: Greg K.

description:
Cozy and charming corner restaurant in the North Beach area, great for friend-dates or date-dates so basically, great. I'm quite tough on Italian places in the area because many taste exactly like the one next door and I enjoyed this one rather much. It's normally packed downstairs (chair-to-chair action) so try to get seating upstairs, if feasible. I've been here several times and tried the Carlesimo (LOVE), Gnocchi (eh) and the Vincenzo (adequate). Also, I tried some cocktail with ginger beer and champagne (not sure of the name) but it's a must try if you're a cool person.

We also saw a dead bird under a car outside and called the SPCA. FYI.
author: Tania S.

description: Great flavors/quality/food, great service and great atmosphere.  This is one of those places that I learned about via a friend.
author: Mike B.

description:
I called in at 5pm on a Saturday night and was able to get a reservation for 6 people at 9pm. We came exactly at 9pm.  They had valet service which was great because it is extremely congested in this area. Our waiter and I'm guessing food runner were extremely accomdating and fast. The food was great (delicious and fast). I had a wonderful experience and would be happy to come back. 

Upon leaving, I went to their small little bar in front. Again, great and prompt service.


Pros: great service (checked up on our table // drinks always filled // friendly
Cons: Extremely small place
author: Jackie L.

description: Happy hour at 4 pm is amazing!  Meatballs, calamari salad with a cocktail. Restaurant to ourselves with great staff. A great way to enjoy a stellar restaurant without the crowds.
author: Diane C.

description: It's shocking how highly rated this place is. All the dishes we ordered were way too salty. You are better off at the Olive Garden.
author: Melissa M.

description: In May 2017 my sisters and I were in San Fran for a week.  We looked on line for an Italian restaurant & found TC. It was within walking distance of our hotel.  We all had different dishes to try each others.  Everything was "out of this world" delicious. The wine, service, food & atmosphere was well worth the trip alone.  I would fly back from Phoenix, just to eat there. Please try this place, you'll have a great experience.
author: Pamela G.

description: Authentic- that's the word for this cozy little Italian place with delicious food and wonderful service!  We felt like we were in Italy and the wait staff was really helpful with suggestions.  They just all made you feel like they were happy you came to their little corner of the world.  And the food...delicious huge meatballs and perfectly prepared chicken.  We'll be back!
author: Jeri F.

description:
