TC is a quaint spot just outside the North Beach hubbub -- you wouldn't really have found it on a normal walk through the busier (but fun) side near the square. The place seems to get a lot of traffic, and you will in fact not be seated without a reservation (Hooray, Opentable!). Our dining experience affirmed the place as a "must try for anyone wanting Italian in San Francisco" -- it was amazing.

To start, I split an old fashioned (from the very stocked bar) with my wife while we waited for our table. It was super great and used good bourbon. When we were seated, the server brought us some fresh bread and olive oil, as well as freshly grated parm and black pepper at our request. The bread was nice and warm, and the parm was amazing. I'm glad they don't skimp on that either -- some places with fresh cheese tend to not be so generous.

Deciding on what to eat was a hard choice -- every option was amazing. Many have tried the Carlesimo, but I opted for the Gnocchi. I saw on Yelp the ability to order this with pesto and opted for it for the looks... and then I fell in love. This is simply the best gnocchi I've had. It is actually made with ricotta cheese rather than potato, so you are getting a more velvety, creamy texture from the pasta. My wife went with the Carlesimo but subbed the noodles for risotto because of her gluten allergy. They were very accommodating, and the result was also amazing. We kept fawning over our food selection several times, and ultimately opted to save half of our dishes for later (the risotto-fied Carlesimo actually lasted two more meals!). 

I am 100% returning to this place to try all the other dishes ... all around it seemed everyone enjoyed their food and that the kitchen only served fresh stuff. I highly recommend this as a stop if you are in North Beach. Just be sure to reserve your spot in advance.
author: Tarun G.

description: Absolutely amazing food. Great atmosphere and staff. We brought our son and they were so nice by bringing out crayons. Totally accommodating even without reservation.
author: Nadiah G.

description:
They now serve brunch and it's damn good!

It's clear not too many know they are serving brunch because there were only a few tables but we are sure they'll get packed as the words get out.  

What we had:
Mimosa - $8 
Irish coffee - $8 
Italian scramble - $10 - so good and the eggs were perfectly cooked...yum!
Lemon ricotta pancakes - $11 - yummy

Really looking forward to returning...
author: Gloria H.

description: Black Friday, long wait, amazing customer service, delicious bruchetta, really yummy meatballs, small but good beer selection, really good and strong lemon drop, dinner.... Pesto sauce pork sausage and gnocchi also really good.... 5 starts
author: Jason F.

description: Recommended by a friend who lives in the area.  Boy we are glad we went here!!  Great homey atmosphere with awesome food and great wait staff.  Nicole was amazing and very sweet.  We had the lamb, which I highly recommend, it was the favorite of the table.  But everything we had: Burrata salad, calamari salad, wedge salad, ceaser salad, pasta dishes, veal dish, etc... my lamb was the best and thankfully my friends shared it with me because it was huge!  thanks Nicole for being a great server!
author: Tina P.

description: While visiting SF, the four of us ate here last Tue night, with a local guest.  This is a very nice cozy Italian place!  Nice corner location, & very nice feel/ambiance.  Having said all this, I don't exactly enjoy eating dinner SO close to other patrons - you can easily hear their conversation & vice versa - even when they're/we're speaking softly - but I guess this is what you get in most places in SF ("when in Rome...").  As I sat down to order my drink, I scanned the wines-by-the-glass selections.  I noticed right away there were no options for Cab or Merlot, my favorites.  I thought I might be looking at the wrong section of the menu or something.  There WERE bottles of these 2 types...but again, no single glasses.  As my wife & guest were already enjoying their glasses of white wine, I had no one to share a bottle w/ & I certainly didn't need four glasses to myself.  I asked the waiter if I could sample some other red selections - he said the maximum I could try is two (!), so I sampled the Pino Noir & two others (he let me try a third when I didn't like the first two).  Although he did return impressively fast w/ these samples...I didn't like any of them, so I went w/ a Diet Coke.  So this is a ding - how can a SF Italian restaurant (so close to Napa) NOT offer a Cab or Merlot by the glass??  To add insult to injury, I JUST checked the menu on the pictures section here - apparently, there IS a Cab option (Sean Minor, Napa) by the glass - why didn't this waiter offer it to me???  Very strange!  Oh well.  As a group, we ordered Bruschetta - I'll tell you right now, this was probably THE best Bruschetta I've ever had.  The bread was crusted perfectly; the heaping tomatoes were bright red, firm & fresh - every bite was wonderful!  I then ordered the Valdostana as my entree.  Very nice dish - the chicken was moist, but the sauce was fantastic.  My son (14) ordered the Caprese salad & nothing else (he had a BIG lunch), but he loved it.  My daughter had a penne dish & thought it was just OK.  I'm part Italian so my heart wants to rank this a 5...but I have to be honest here.  The lack of wines-by-the-glass is a bit shocking, esp after again, seeing the wine list here.  Also, to be told, RIGHT off the bat, "You can only sample 2 choices" (aka "No soup for you!") is also a bit stern, stoic & surprising.  The five of us were laughing a lot & we definitely enjoyed ourselves, & the staff (bartender, busboy), esp the bartender, was super friendly.  The next time we're in SF, I hope to try this again.
author: Terran S.

description:
Acceptable experience.

Bread wasn't fresh, offered with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.

Wait for entrees was significant - about 40 minutes. Service was otherwise good.

Two entrees (Chicken Parmigiana, and Melanzane with added sausage) were quite good. Two others (Pavarotti and Saltimbocca w/chicken) were average, with the Pavarotti requiring more salt than I've ever seen my wife add to a meal.

Perhaps an off day, but we won't be returning.
author: Nick L.

description: Great wine selection. I ordered the Carlisimo with the spicy tomato sauce and it was delicious! Highly recommended
author: Danielle G.

description:
Pretty decent Italian restaurant, but I feel we get much better in San Diego to be honest. The place is very small, and while it's charming, it's also incredibly cramped. For our starters, we got stuffed peppers, meatballs and gnocchi. Gnocchi was good but could have been softer and more tender. Everything else was below average, especially the meatballs.

My entree was very good. Parmesan Crusted Halibut. It was a lighter dish than a heavy pasta but was very filling and enjoyable. Menu is fairly affordable and the service was good.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Appetizer meat balls and Caesar salad tasted great. Service was not attentive. "Special mushroom ravioli" was "burnt" tasting and under done. Not once was I asked how everything tasted. My mother in laws Gnocchi was the best of the night but I can still taste the under done ravioli. Sad.
author: Aaron M.

description:
One of the best Italian places in North Beach (which says something since it's basically Little Italy). This place feels like a warm, family restaurant and isn't about modern, upscale fare. Instead, it has traditional Italian dishes presented very casually but that tastes very flavorful.

The burrata with arugula, proscuitto and peaches is a good starter. The Carlesimo pasta is hands down the best thing to get here if you're looking for pasta but something a little different (though not too different) from what you're used to.
author: Victor W.

description: Great spot in north beach, packed generally, great ambiance, The roasted pepper appetizer with oozing melted cheese was like pizza without the crust, awesome. I felt the pastas we got were good, traditional Italian fare. The bread was just ok.
author: Tina L.

description: Pasta are just amazing and really generous! I highly recommend the first suggestion: the rigatoni with peas, tomatoes, bacon... it's so tasty ! the burrata also had a perfect creamy and melting texture!  Perfect place for a romantic dinner :)
author: Justine C.

description:
Had a great meal here last night. Service was slow (they brought out one appetizer at a time), but aside from that the service excellent. The restaurant is small and cozy, making for an intimate meal. 

APPETIZERS: 
The burratta was delicious--it had some sort of reduction on it that was so yummy. 

Bruschetta was good--it's two jumbo crostinis piled high with tomatoes and ricotta.  The tomatoes were nice and fresh tasting. 

We had the roasted bell pepper. It was in a cream sauce and stuffed with cheese. Very heavy, but so flavorful. I really enjoyed this app. 

I had the Salvatore pasta--chicken ravioli with rosemary and sundried tomatoes in a cream sauce. The rosemary flavor really came through and was super tasty. 

BF had the Vincenzo pasta. It came with A TON of super tasty sausage--big chunks of it too.  No tiny pieces of sausage here. 

To round out the meal, they gave us a free piece of tiramisu (it was my bday). Can never complain about free, and the tiramisu was delicious! 

I highly recommend this restaurant--it's perfect for an intimate date night!
author: Ashlee C.

description:
Came sunday night for my gf's early birthday dinner. 
It was our first time here..
Wow, I LOVE it! And we loved it!
Very homey, bustling and cute, plus the service was really great. 
I also like the unique location. Off Columbus but not deep in Chinatown yet, so it's pretty clean area, and seeing cable car was very charming.

We had:
3 Meatballs, $10.50, were a bit too tight, but the sauce was good
3 Burrata, $13.00, home-made but, I like tofu better so what can I say?
Gnocchi, $19.00, home-made, was a bit too hard
Veal Saltimbocca, $31.00 was quite AMAZING! comes with 3 baked potato and sautéed spinach with garlic. The sauce was like I wanted to lick the plate so badly. It was really good!
Peroni on tap, $6
Glass of Syrah, $10
Cappuccino, $4

FOOD - 4 stars... Overall, old-fashioned Italian well executed with no frills
AMBIANCE - 5 stars... Cute, classically nondescript with nary a red checkerboard tablecloth in sight
SERVICE - 5 stars... I liked our waiter, he was Nice, easy going and gentle. 
TOTAL - 5 stars... Charming, cozy and comfortable great place. 

Loved it, just loved it.
Everything happened tonight was almost magic!
One of our perfect dinner.
We had a great time there.
author: Nobu K.

description: The caprese  salad was great with the yummy mozzarella and balsamic.  The spaghettini with meatballs and the beef ravioli were okay.
author: Dr. Scott C.

description: I've lived in San Francisco for 20 years and this was the first time here. Boy I didn't know what I was missing! Food was fantastic and one of the best values in town. Service could not be beat because the team was attentive while not being "in your face". I'll definitely be back!
author: Gralen B.

description: This is a neighborhood gem.  Small, intimate, cozy, warm place.  Brothers Kevin and Casey run this fine, traditional Italian cuisine establishment.  Authentic, down-home Italian cooking.  Ample portions, excellent quality, and reasonable prices.  I used to come here "back in the day", in the mid-80s.... same great place.  Hop off the Mason line cable car, it's at the corner of Union and Mason. I look forward to coming here every time I'm in San Francisco (I moved from the Bay Area many years ago).  Two thumbs up!!  A great find.
author: Steven F.

description: We really liked the food. The prosciutto tortellini  and veal plates we so good my wife and I switched half way through so we could both eat off both plates.  We went to Beach Blanket Babylon, and it is a quick walk down to this restaurant if looking for good eats after a show.
author: Mike D.

description:
I've been here twice because my husband really likes it. I wish I could give it a 3.5 stars. 

The food is good. The portions are huge. The price is very reasonable for SF. I got the eggplant pasta dish last time we went, but I don't see it on the menu anymore. I should reiterate, the dish was good. Just not the best dining experience. 

But the service is slow, the space is tiny and cramped. Overall, there are better places to go for flavor and experience. Not sure if we'll be going back.
author: Dimple B.

description:
Great food. Took my boyfriend there for his birthday. It was our first time together and we loved it. 

The food was amazing!
author: Emma Yna B.

description:
As you can tell from our previous (5 star) review, we've been coming to Trattoria Contadina for years now. We make it out here around 3 times a year and we've always have a great meal. I always order my Di mare and my wife always the Carlesimo. This has been our favorite meal that we always look forward to because of 1. the great food and 2. the good memories that we have.

My brother-in-law's family was visiting us for the holidays and we decided to end his trip with dinner here. We ordered the vongole, dimare, carlesimo, w/peppers + mussels appetizers. When we got the appetizer, my brother-in-law took one bite of the mussels and immediately sensed something was wrong. We each took one to try and the pungent smell was overwhelming. The mussels were clearly bad. We sent it back and told our waitress. She was very nice and asked if there was anything we needed to make up for it. She also explained that since it was new years, the seafood was older than normal. She also asked about keeping the dimare since it also had mussels. We thought if they could correct it, we would have it. Maybe just throw out the bad batch and give us fresher ones.

We all were definitely a bit upset at that point. The smell had spread around our table and it reeked. When we got our entrees a bit later, the mussels in the Di Mare were bad again. The server was really nice and understood. She told us that the meal was on the house, but really the damage had been done. We had 2 out of 4 dishes. Even though the Carliesimo and the Vongle were fine, we already had the terrible taste in our mouths and we had to divide the dishes between the 4. The food should not be brought out if quality can't be delivered. The chefs could have just easily cooked up a single mussel to see if was bad or good without putting the customer through the same thing TWICE. Despite the experience, we left tip cause the waitress genuinely felt bad and was accommodating. However, we do feel the ownership should be placed on the kitchen and manager. It's better to be upfront and to deal with bad food than to make your customer the guinea pig.

We came here on new years for good memories and good food. Not a great way to start the year. The free entrees at the end were not what we wanted. Will be hard for us to come back especially since my wife and I were the host and wanted to deliver good experience. It obviously didn't happen.

Update: just changed from 2 stars to 1 star. My brother in law eyes are swollen and his wife threw up after they got home. This is 100 unacceptable. That seafood must have been really old or not properly refrigerated. It also means the clams (which we thought were okay) were also not good.

In Response to the Owners Post: First of all, I have every right to come on to Yelp to give you guys a review. Just like I came on a gave you guys a positive review after the first few times we went (You certainly didn't have a complaint about that). As a owner, you should take 100% ownership when customers get sick to the point that they throw up and have swollen eyes. Simply saying we got a free meal is BS. My family got sick so we lost something out of it. They had to board a flight sick. You only got some scarring from a poor review. If you couldn't get fresh food delivered, then it's also 100% your responsibility. If quality is your top concern than don't serve seafood and/or don't open on days that you can't get it. YOU took the risk of serving the older food. This bad review is peanuts in comparison to what we had to deal with on the days after. Lastly, you weren't even there that night, so don't tell me who-said-this-or-that. Take the bad review and move on.
author: Christopher K.

description: Awesome food and the wine selection is incredible. Make a reservation because the hours of operation are limited and there is a reason. It's worth the limited capacity!
author: Bill B.

description: 3rd generation family owned favorite of mine. I've lived here for 3 years now and have yet to find a better low-key Italian spot in the city. Fresh ingredients never disappoint. We've also started to book the place for work events. GREAT spot that makes you feel like you're at home!
author: Theo J.

description:
The place was bustling for a week night but the hostess seated us promptly. I ordered a Manhattan. Generally, I'm more of a citrusy drink sort of gal (think mojito) but the Manhattan here uses blood orange bitters so I decided to give that a try. The drink was lovely. I can't quite put my finger on it, but the bitters really added an extra level of depth to the drink, definitely endorse it.

For appetizer, the waiter recommended the Pepperoni Arrostiti. It's essentially baked cheesy bell pepper in a spicy tomato cream sauce. The pepper itself was fairly nondescript, but the sauce, oh the sauce!! I could dip bread in a tub of that goodness all day and be a happy girl. My dinner companion seemed to share my opinion and threatened several times to lick the plate. Good thing he didn't because he would have to fight me for the privilege!

For entrees, I had the Melanzane alla Mozzarella -- eggplant covered with cheese. I thought it was tasty, but unspectacular. My date didn't make any orgasmic noises while consuming his Carlesimo (rigatoni in tomato cream sauce) as with the pepper sauce in the appetizer round, but I assume he enjoyed it.

All in all, Contadina has a neighborhood place feel. The tables are a bit cramped together and it get loud, but the ambience is homey/welcoming, staff efficient/friendly. Would recommend it.
author: Alice W.

description:
Carbed up here before the NWM with Christine K & a few of our other friends running the race decided to carb up here. 

I got the fruitti de mar and it was alright.  I'm actually not the biggest fan of pasta/carbs so it was good for what it needed to do and was well priced.  The restaurant itself was a lot smaller than I expected.  Our waiter was great.  Note, CK's husband got the spaghetti & meatballs and wasn't a fan of  the meatballs. Service was excellent and it was a pleasant meal.
author: Lyn C.

description: Amazing food and atmosphere. The service was also fantastic. We will definitely be back next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Chad C.

description: I dined here a year ago when I was in town and could not stop thinking about the meatballs. They are INCREDIBLE. Tonight I had the Spaghetti and Meatballs (which I haven't ordered in a restaurant  since I was a child) and it was delicious! The pasta was perfect. The sauce was superb. The meatballs divine. Do yourself a favor and eat here.
author: Sherri B.

description: I had the caesar salad, carlesimo and the tiramisu.  Generally, things were just okay - the croutons on the salad were pretty salty for my taste, and the tiramisu was pretty strong on the espresso side for me.  The carlesimo was pretty good - I hoped to see something different than rigatoni pasta in it though.  But it had pretty good flavor and was good.
author: Matt E.

description: Great neighborhood spot..my girlfriend and I just spent the weekend in the city.. We wanted to eat in North beach and a friend recommended trattoria... The food was very good.. And the service was EXCELLENT... We will definitely be back!!.. Mike c
author: Mike C.

description: Last sat night we had a wonderful dinner. Because of a slight delay in seating we got free Negroni and Old Fashioned !!!! Wonderful dinner and service. Will be back soon !!
author: Rashid I.

description: After 23 years of living in North Beach, I finally gave this restaurant a chance & was NOT disappointed. The only thing I tried on the menu was the Pesto gnocchi (can NEVER go wrong with pesto) and it was delicious. Came on time for my reservation but was asked to wait at the bar while they got our table ready. Table preparation took a while otherwise service was lovely. The restaurant is tiny and tables are very close to each other so I did feel a little cramped. I could hear our neighbor's conversation a bit TOO clearly. Other than that, I'll definitely be back to try other things on the menu.
author: Som S.

description:
My husband and I came to Trattoria Contadina before heading to the Beach Blanket Babylon show. Highly recommend making a reservation here if you're in the area or heading to the show. 

After looking at the menu and their specials, we decided to start with the caesar salad and their meatballs. Both were wonderful. Everything tasted really fresh. For our entrees, we ordered the Carlesimo pasta (most popular dish on their menu) which contained rigatoncelli pasta with pancetta, procini, peas, sun-dried tomatoes in a spicy tomato sauce and the spaghetti in mushroom sauce (special of the night). Both were outstanding and the pasta was cooked to perfection. Give this place a try!
author: Nancy A.

description:
I was never really a pasta type of girl. My boyfriend's sister was in town for her birthday, so we decided to take her here from a friend's recommendation as this was in the area we chose. I made reservations on OpenTable for a party of 3 on a weekday for 8pm. Generally, the restaurant is small. We waited at the bar for a good 20 minutes until seated in a cozy corner in the back of the restaurant. While I was at the bar, I was recommended a great glass of Beaujolais. Smooth, fulll bodied, and had a hint of oak.  
 
I ordered the ever so popular Carlesimo pasta made rigatoncelli pasta with pancetta, porcini mushrooms, peas, sun-dried tomatoes and a mildly spiced tomato cream sauce. 
 
I usually like pastas that have bold sauce as well how well the other ingredients compliment the pasta. I was in love! I loved the taste of the sun-dried tomatoes in the creamy tomato sauce. The pasta was cooked perfectly, al dente. I thoroughly enjoyed every single bite. Mind you that portions were generous.   
 
The service was excellent, Tentative to our needs for the request for more cheese and water. 
 
I had enough for leftovers and I was looking forward to devouring the rest the following day. Sadly, my boyfriend's sister decided to eat my portion once I cracked open the fridge to realize my pasta already resides in the pit of a stomach. Blasphemy!!! 
 
Until my next visit...
author: Becky Q.

description:
The best pasta I've ever had in my life! This is legit Italian with lots of feel-good favorites. Enticing aromas as soon as we stepped out of our cab. I had the Caccuccio Special with mussels, scallops, halibut and shrimp. Generous serving of fresh seafood with a mildy spiced tomato broth. Bf had the Ravioli special served with a creamy pesto. The taste was unlike any pesto I've had. The pasta was amazing. Great texture.

Real North Beach Italian! Must make reservations! The restaurant was packed with locals! Nothing trendy, just down right authentic. Small intimate place. We were seated against the wall in corner by the bar. I felt cramped and could hear the conversations between the diners next to us but oh well. Service was okay but it didn't matter much. I was there for the food and it was awesome. 

I need to go back to SF to have another bite at this place!
author: Jacqueline G.

description: Cozy and authentic spot in Little Italy. This was not a touristy place, and we enjoyed both the wonderful food and the way we could actually watch and hear the chefs in the kitchen. We tried another Italian restaurant another night, but this one was by far the better of the two. It is a bit cramped inside, and the outside is not the most inviting, but the food surpassed our expectations! I am a spaghetti and meatballs kind of person, and all was homemade and superb!
author: Ellen H.

description:
Cozy Italian with amazing yelp reviews, so I felt like I needed to try it out. Was disappointed. We ordered a bruschetta to start off, which was light and fresh. But the size was minimal for the price. The complimentary sourdough they brought was nothing special. 

I got the clam pasta and my friend ordered a gnocchi with their house made tomato sauce. Clam pasta had excellent infused white wine flavored throughout. The house made sauce was great, but the gnocchi left something to be desired. 

Service was quick but I also felt like I was being rushed. Food would get 3 stars, but I'm giving an extra due to the fact that my friend originally ordered a cream based gnocchi on accident, and the server was happy to exchange it after the dish's arrival.
author: Winnie T.

description:
My wife was having a hankering for fresh ravioli and I wanted one of those "foodie find" Italian experiences that's not on every concierge's list.  Score!

The ravioli in the Salvatore dish is from Molinari's Deli nearby and was superb.  I was leaning towards a red sauce dish but saw the look of a happy woman when our waitress said the Pollo Correnti was her favorite dish.  It's now one of mine, too.  Chicken pounded thin and lightly sautéed, then covered with a handful or two of re-hydrated porcini mushrooms and a cream sauce.  Served with penne and broccolini, both cooked perfectly. This was good eats.

I don't give many five stars, but I'm bumping this one up from a four BECAUSE of the service.  We got in just ahead of a couple of groups and our waitress patiently explained a couple of cocktail drinks to my wife (with samples), and seemed very happy to bring me a couple of red wine samples. I find Italian reds too dry for my personal taste, and the samples she brought did not change my mind, but she was a very good sport as I settled on a cab which went fine with my chicken and cream sauce dish, believe it or not.  The service seemed to be a team effort, and frankly I thought there were more wait staff on duty for a Monday night that I would have expected.

All in all, I loved it.  Thanks, San Francisco.  I had several good meals on my trip and this place makes the list of places I'd return to on my next visit.
author: Roger Y.

description: Cozy, romantic atmosphere. I took my ex here twice. Nothing like sitting near the door on a rainy night, watching the cable cars go by and people stroll in as you enjoy a bottle of wine. Some of the best Italian food in North Beach as well, which is saying something. So glad I discovered it, will definitely return someday.
author: Stephen C.

description: Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of North Beach, this family owned and operated restaurant makes you feel like you're a dinner guest at a large family table. The service was on point (white linens, wine selections, etc.), the food was delicious, and our waiter let us finish our wine after our food was done without feeling hurried or rushed.
author: Katie V.

description: Excelent food.. try the meatball spaghetti. Out of this world!!!. A generous portion. Friendly service... a must come back. Congrats.
author: Alexander P.

description:
Came here with the BF before seeing a comedy show and got seated with no problem even though we were a bit early for our reservation.  We shared the Salumi plate (delicious selection & quality meats), the Eggplant appetizer (flavor was great, I had to scrape some of the cheese off as it was overpowering but it was gobbled up by the BF), and the Fruitti Di Mare (SO SO good, I was searching for ever last piece of seafood in there). 

The meal was a little rushed as we were going to a show, but the food was delicious.  Did not get the chance to sample any wines, but the experience as a whole was great.
author: Raina D.

description: Well, this is so sad and disappointing for me to say, but Tratoria Contadina has really gone down the drain.  For YEARS I said this was my favorite Italian in North Beach.  I went last week and it was terrible.  I had always adored their creamy tomato sauce and their sausage used to be just the perfect amount of spice and flavor.  Not any more!  This was so bland.  Never  going back.  Such a shame.
author: Chloe M.

description: I lived in Italy for 3 months and then moved to San Francisco. This place is my favorite Italian restaurant (that I've been to yet) in the whole Bay Area! I bring my local friends and family who visit here. My favorite dishes are the house made raviolis. I eat meat but my favorite dish is the cheese ravioli in the red sauce. The service is nice. The establishment is a little bit off the beaten track from the Little Italy district which I like. The environment is cozy. Recommended!
author: Angel B.

description:
Came Saturday night with 2 others. Reservations required! The small restaurant was packed even at 5:30. While we did not have to wait, there is not much free space inside for standing, so I highly suggest bringing a coat in case you have to stand outside to wait for your table.

We wanted to order the salumi and cheese appetizers (2 separate, they don't have a combined plate) and our waiter talked us into the pepper with melted cheese instead of the cheese. That was my least favorite thing of the night. The salumi plate was very tasty though and good amount for 3 people.

The wine list is heavily Italian (surprise, surprise) with things like Tuscan, Super Tuscan, Tuscan Blend, and a similarly baffling list of Chianti's. Pricing is varied so we just picked one in a range we felt comfortable with and chose one at random without guidance from our waiter. It was delicious and went very well with our food. 

Although they say family style, the portions were definitely served individually, and it was up to us to exchange plates and bites. I ordered the fruitti de mare which was very good. I was extremely happy with it and hesitant to share ;-)

My boyfriend ordered the pavarotti which was DELICIOUS! Amazing blend of flavors and tastes. The sauce is creamy which makes it very rich so I highly advise sharing this one and getting something lighter to balance it out.

My friend ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. I thought the sauce was the highlight of the dish. The meatballs were flavorful, but so dense. Maybe it's more authentic? I'm used to a lighter meatball. Still really good though.

Service was very attentive. It was a bit loud at our table by the kitchen, but in a weird way it adds to the charm of this place. We had a great dinner mostly made by the amazing pasta. 

Dress is casual. My friend, who is Canadian, was thoroughly enjoying the 60 degree weather and showed up in shorts and flip flops. While I do not recommend this and he did get several odd looks from patrons, the restaurant did not turn us away based on that. Most people were wearing jeans, corduroys, or khakis.
author: Rachel E.

description: Gnocchi and the meatballs were fantastic but the service is less than desirable never checked to see if we needed anything even when my dining partner set his food to the edge of the table took them a food 10 mins to stop by and didn't even ask if everything was ok even after seeing it was a full plate barely touched and when he did finally get a chance to say something it was greeted with a blank stare and no acknowledgement that he said his food was awful ... Very disappointed!!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Top notch Italian restaurant in the Russian Hill/North Beach neighborhood. I had been here once before a long time ago (think I was only 14-15 years old), but I still remembered the place pretty well once we walked in. It is a one room restaurant with maybe enough space for 20 or so tables. There is a small bar near the front door and lots of window space. Even at 7:30 PM in the summertime, there was quite a bit of natural light coming into the restaurant. 

To start, I had a glass of Slovenian white wine which was not quite a pinot gris, but pretty close. Semi-dry and smooth on the palate. My fiance had a Chianti and it tasted pretty great too. Their alcohol prices if you're splitting a bottle are better than what I've seen for similar restaurants in the DC area. We also ordered a side dish of warm olives which went pretty quickly.

I had the spaghetti vongole (clams in a white wine sauce with capers). It was the perfect portion size and the clams were done well. Definitely one of those dishes where I wish there were seconds allowed!

Although I wished their main entrees were a dollar or 2 less than advertised, everything was cooked to order and we had no compliants. This is a great place for both visitors and locals to rub elbows and enjoy some great Italian comfort food.
author: Christina P.

description: I used to love this place. Service is still great but food was way off tonight. Had veal scampi- shrimp were rubbery and veal was tough. Both over cooked.  Too bad...this place used to rock.
author: Joe S.

description: If I were to describe this food as a beautiful woman or sunrise, words would still be inadequate.  I cannot describe  the quality, price, and service. I am speechless. Take the road less travelled and enjoy this 5 stars for 3 star prices place. Made me want to move to San Francisco!
author: Jim M.

description: Very nice, Italian restaurant with friendly and helpful staff. Not too loud. Has the kind of ambiance whee neighboring diners chat with each other.    Really glad I found this place.
author: Peter K.

description: Fabulous food.  A neighborhood joint, where you'll be remembered by Vince, the bartender, and treated well.  Also surprisingly affordable!
author: Ana M.

description:
Four and a half stars for this great spot!

Service: Spot on. Nothing missed, but they didn't blow us away. Four stars. 

Atmosphere: A place to have good, impassioned conversations and dinner with your friends.  Not quiet, but not too loud.  Four stars. 

The Food: Four stars.
The salads and appetizers were very tasty.  The bell peppers are famous and so delicious and rich.  The salad with beets was a healthy portion size. 
The Carlesimo is one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had, and there was a lot.  The pasta is al dente and has a great texture that feels homemade.  The sauce and toppings are fantastic.  I will definitely order it again next time!
The Pavarotti was not my style of flavor for pasta - and the pasta wasn't as nice as the Carlesimo. 
The Veal Saltimbocca was delicious! (poor baby cows...)  The wine sauce was delicious, the spinach was cooked well, and the potatoes were satisfactory.
The best spumoni I've ever had. 
One of the best tiramisu's I've ever had. 

The Drinks: 
The wine list is great, and the cocktails are made well. 

I highly recommend this North Beach / Russian Hill gem.
author: Andrew D.

description: We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Trattoria. We have lived in Italy and eaten a lot of great food, and this place is very authentic. The service was fantastic and everyone was so accommodating and nice! Being from the South, we enjoy hospitality :)
author: Christina B.

description:
I'm a local and this is my favorite spot in North Beach. I've been going for 10 years now. You can never go wrong with the Carlesimo and Burrata to start. 

Stop reading and go to Trattoria Contadina!
author: Lisa T.

description:
Whoa! Put me upstairs, window seat, bring the appetizers.
Meatballs and buratta. Three tasty meatballs in a light and flavorful red sauce. The burrata was served with pancetta and greens. Very good! 
Btw, Trattoria Contadina was exactly what I was looking for. A quaint local Italian restaurant with delicate flavors and a comfortable vibe. Our server was friendly, helpful, and had a a cool attitude. He really seemed like there was nowhere else he would rather be. 
Main courses - picatta red snapper and pavarotti. Both very good. Everyone around us looked really happy with their food. 
KQ... Thanks for the recommendation!
author: Don A.

description:
Excellent atmosphere and staff.

I sat at the bar as it was busy but got a real sense of this being a local place.

Great menu and good variety. The drinks menu is deep and varied and the bar staff know their craft.
author: Gareth B.

description:
We have been coming back for 30+ years  since we lived there and now every time we are in town. Back in the days my husband even had one of his writings hanging in the BR. It is like coming home, warm, comfortable, cozy, great service( hats off to Christobal), with no family arguments and really yummy food.
We shared an eggplant appetizer which was  delicious  . I had the carbonara and the pasta was cooked perfectly. My husband never passes up osso bucco and he was almost licking the plate. 
Kevin or Gina graciously sent over a after dinner drink. We were too full for dessert but the tiramisu at the next table looked wonderful.
Always look forward to coming back.
author: Helen F.

description:
I was in search of an authentic Italian restaurant in Little Italy that wasn't touristy.  Trattoria Contadina ended up being exactly what I was looking for! The restaurant felt so warm and our server was incredibly welcoming. 

At first I was totally overwhelmed by the entrees listed on the menu - I didn't recognize half of the Italian dishes! But our server helped us navigate thru it and made great recommendations. I ended up with the dinner special and my husband ordered Carlesimo. Everything tasted so fresh and comforting. 

The food was wonderful but the cozy atmosphere really made the biggest impact to me. It's the perfect place for an intimate meal with the person you love.
author: Tiffany B.

description: Nice quiet little restaurant away from from the hubbub on Columbus Avennue. Getting a table was a breeze, no long waiting on a Friday night and the food was awesome! Loved the chicken ravioli.
author: Dev N.

description: Outstanding!  Food was great !  Must get the bell pepper appetizer. Drinks very good !! Make reservations and relax for an enjoyable evening of homemade Italian food. Soooo good !
author: Suki G.

description:
Trattoria Contadina was just fine. I've had better Italian food, and better Italian food in the city. 

Their wine selection is awesome, and for those that aren't as into Italian wines (like me), there are other regions to choose from as well. They have by the glass as well as by the bottle.

We had the carpaccio, the cesar salad, frutti di mare, spaghetti and meatballs, and the ravioli. 

I ate the frutti di mare, and it was a lot of food compared to my buddies. The shrimp and calimari were a little overdone, but the mussels and clams were  tasty. 

It was an average experience, but I probably wouldn't go back. 

The good: good selection of food. Primi and secondi.
The bad: limited seating, make a reservation.
author: Amanda B.

description:
A good neighborhood place with a convivial staff. The bar is surprisingly good - had a great Old Fashioned to start off the meal. The appetizers are the best thing on the menu - all of them are fresh and tasty. This would be an excellent place for a happy hour.

The pastas are rich and solid, the cream-based ones are especially good. 

The reason I am not giving four stars is that the saltimbocca, though an ample portion, isn't rolled. It's two scallops of veal with the cheese, ham, and sage sandwiched between them. It isn't the delicate dish that I was expecting. It's good, of course, but the technical short cut was a bit disappointing.
author: L E.

description:
I love learning about the places that warm my heart. I've walked past the establishment a few times up the hill on Mason not really paying much attention to it. Another Italian restaurant in North Beach. There are a lot of those lined up on Columbus street -- very touristy and not really my style. 

Trattoria surprise us at first with their brunch. We walked in on a Sunday many months ago. Delicious with the impressions and flavors of a home cooked meals, the best olive oils, cheese and Italian wine you can find at affordable prices. There's more -- this place has been a North Beach favorite by many of the local Italian residents for over 10 years. It is a family owned business now managed by the second generation and his wife. They met while both working at the restaurant many years ago.

My recommendation: just go!
author: Jessica V.

description:
Wanted to try something new in Little Italy. Loved the past two experiences last time i was in the bay that I figured any place in Little Italy should be just as great as the other  

This restaurant was located slightly higher and a bit more isolated than the other restaurants, but we (friends and I) found it! We walked in slowly into the tiny restaurant. Good thing it wasn't busy yet. Of course, when in Little Italy, one must order pasta!!! I ordered the vongole, which has clams and it wasn't bad. It wasn't the best pasta I've had; I've had better in that area,but it also wasn't awful. The Pavarotti (circa 1984) was good, there were lots of tastes going on, so I enjoyed that one. However, I think my favorite has to be the Salvatore; it was pretty hearty but really delicious as well. The server suggested it to my friend and we all tried his and I really liked it.

I would come back here once I have tried all the restaurants in this area. 
I can't resist pasta!!
author: Jorgess M.

description: Upstairs is way too hot, even in March!  Ordered the pasta special with shrimp. The shrimp were so over cooked they were dry. It use to be our must eat stop in San Francisco. Believe we will look for a new favorite.
author: Missy F.

description:
This was our favorite meal and dining experience while in SF.  Thank you for such an enjoyable meal!

The service is so friendly, and we felt like family while eating dinner here.  We had a delicious pasta, veal scallopini, and carpaccio.  Also, they have a huge bar selection and my husband found a new mezcal drink he is in love with.  

Thank you for such great memories.  We will be back next time we are in the city.
author: M Q.

description: I wanted to take my daughter and her boyfriend to dinner in the neighborhood we stayed during our visit to San Francisco. I found this place on Yelp and walked there in the afternoon to check it out. It was a good idea to make a reservation because it proved to be very busy in the evening. We got a table upstairs. The food and the wine tasted excellent and the service was good. The environment and the atmosphere was nice. It was a little noisy, but the restaurant can't help that some guests talk and laugh very loudly. The overall impression is very positive.
author: Roland P.

description:
Quite mediocre.. I got their seafood risotto and the only taste it had was from capers. Looks like the seafood was boiled and put on the risotto, with no flavor.
My friend got the meatball spaghetti and it was alright. Nothing to remember.
author: Siddhartha G.

description: Fantastic, and this is coming from a person from Philly, which has some of the best Italian in the country. Gnocchi was great, setting was good, desserts were awesome. And they don't rush you. Great spot!
author: Michael B.

description: I can't say enough good things about this place. I've been here a few times and will definitely be back. Italian food is my favorite, and this is my fav Italian joint in the Bay!  You have to get the Carlesimo pasta! It's the BEST!!! The service is always amazing too. You can tell management does a great job. Everyone is always in a good mood, and the vibe is just right :)
author: Trey M.

description: My husband and I can't make a trip to San Francisco without eating at Trattoria Contadina. It's our favorite Italian restaurant hands down. The restaurant itself feels cozy and authentic; the staff is friendly and efficient. The red pepper appetizer alone is enough to keep us coming back. Looking forward to eating here many more times in the future and would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone else spending time in SF.
author: Keara D.

description:
Barbabietola. Arugula, radicchio, beets, goat cheese pistachios vinaigrette ($9). This was the best dish. 

Risotto. Arborio rice, chicken, arugula Parmesan creamy sun-dried tomato pesto ($18). Nothing spectacular here. 

Caccuicco. Seafood stew of clams mussels calamari red snapper prawn scallop spicy tomato oregano broth ($31). Nice stew on a cold evening. 

Service. Attentive and recommended a good fruity glass of wine to go with my Caccuicco. Also recommended blackberry lemonade for my wife.
author: Tim N.

description: Decent Italian. I was expecting better gnocchi after a recommendation from a friend. I probably wouldn't come here if you are looking for something more from the north of Italy.
author: Nora B.

description: Gnocchi was fantastic, basically a dessert. Melanzane was an eggplant dish that was also terrific. We had no wait at 5 on a Saturday, service was super fast. Solid all around
author: Marcus A.

description:
Nothing but love for this restaurant and those working there.  I spent my 50th birthday evening with them and by the end of the night it was like we were old friends.  We started the evening with a drink from Casey at the bar.  Drinks were all good.  Then were seated upstairs in a very cozy / quaint table.  There were 4 of us - myself, husband and 2 older daughters.  We started with the carpaccio and that was fabulous.  Then we had 4 pasta dishes all served family style and all were great.  Our favorites though were the gnocchi and the salvatore dishes.  We also shared the meatballs and they were great.  Also thought they had a great wine selection.
By the end of the evening, we had made friends with the lovely couple sitting next to us and enjoyed chatting with our waitress, Nicole.  
We finished our red wine at the bar after dinner with Casey (bartender), Nicole (waitress), and Vince (host?).  They were so friendly and fun to talk to.  This is not a pretentious place if that is your style.  Very casual and fun with fabulous food.  
My new favorite SF Italian restaurant by far!!!  Can't recommend it enough.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
With very limited experience with this regions food, I let my date order for us and I was pleasantly surprised. 

The Pros: We started with prosciutto wrapped asparagus and oh my god, it was off the hook, a must have if you like asparagus. It was rich, flavorful and nearly a mean all in itself. Then it was on to the breadcrumb stuffed and fried artichokes. They were alright, but a bit heavy on anchovies. Shortly thereafter, the main dishes were served. I decided on the Vongole. The sauce was perfect, very flavorful but not overpowering. Had the clams been a bit better quality, this dish would have been perfect.  The wine was delicious as well. 

The Cons: The place was packed and pretty small. At first a waitress told us to take a seat upstairs and when we did, another waitress told us she was about to close it for the evening. Once downstairs, we were seated in pretty much the only available table in the place, which was jammed in a corner where the door and window were for all who walk by to see us. The service was not the best for several reasons. We had to ask for our wine twice as well as any water refills, but I'll chalk it up to the place being busy. 

If you want top of the line authentic Italian dishes with a cozy setting, don't miss out on this place. The food was unforgettable.
author: Ashley F.

description: This place never disappoints.  The food is amazing, the service is top notch and the atmosphere is lovely.  This is our favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco.  Eat here!
author: Rachel V.

description:
Gosh...my search for good Italian food continues in North Beach.

1 - Polpettine: linguini pasta with Rocky's homemade meatballs and a fresh tomato sauce. The sauce was delicious, but the meatballs were not good. The meatballs had some odd taste to it. If you want good meatballs, go to Tony's.

2 - Salvatore: chicken ravioli with sun-dried tomatoes, rosemary, garlic and a marscapone cheese sauce. I could barely taste the chicken in the ravioli, which had a strong doughy taste and texture. 

The service is great here though. The waiter was very sweet.
author: Margaret R.

description: Their well-known Carlismo is good.  I asked for no pancetta, & it would probably taste better with it.  What was a pleasant surprise was Roasted Bell Pepper.  I'm not particularly fond of cheese, but this appetizer, because of cheese or in spite of it, tastes great.   Hubby thought the Risotto was good, as was Garlic Spinach.  Tiramisu was a bit too berry-like for me.  The server was stretched a bit too thin, but service was decent.
author: Ross W.

description: The Carlesimo pasta was great with the spicy tomato cream sauce! We had the Burrata which was not bad, but not amazing. The Dragoncello chicken breast was ok, the cream sauce was a little bland, but I liked the fresh Gnocchi in it. The Pavarotti pasta cream sauce also didn't have flavor. Ok, but not super great. I probably would not eat here again because SF has so much more to offer!
author: Cara H.

description: I don't go anywhere else in North Beach. Kevin, Gina and co. are always a delight. The food is always outstanding. Do yourself a big favor and make a reservation, especially on a weekend. They get packed. Love this place.
author: Jake B.

description: Small and intimate without being dark or cramped. Excellent food and service, great wine.
author: Emma W.

description:
We were guests of our daughter and son-in-law and this was an excellent choice. Please make a reservation. We did and got right in. The service was excellent. The food was brought out at the right pace and the quality, taste and presentation were all great.
The Spinali was excellent with the right amount of garlic. Enjoy!
author: Joe P.

description: I had the mushroom appetizer and gnocchi. Both were great. Small, intimate place. Great service.
author: Nancy K.

description:
This is the quintessential cozy North Beach restaurant.  It's definitely a locals place located just a block off Columbus.  Get a table near one of the picture windows on the first floor and see people walking their dogs or watch the cable cars roll by.

Everything I've tried here is delicious.  The standouts apps are the polenta with mushrooms, the roasted red pepper with cheese, & of course, the brushetta.  My fave  pasta dishes are the gnocchi (so soft & pillowy in a delicious tomato cream sauce) & the Carlesimo, rigatoni with pancetta, peas, & porcinis in a spicy tomato sauce.  The raviloi are also spot on.  They do pasta right!  Don't forget the generous side of sauteed spinach & garlic...only $5!  You just might order 2.

Impress your friends, coworkers, or out of town guests & take them to Trattoria Contadina.  It will become your new fave spot in North Beach!
author: Erin S.

description:
Excellent food and service. Although I had to wait a while for my table, I had a reservation but had to wait anyway. Wasn't that bad but I was not expecting for it. They have excellent wines and the food is really well done. 

For a date, though, I would not recommend. Because is a small place and the kitchen is open the food's smell will be on your clothes for the rest of the night.
author: Artur S.

description:
I had high hopes for this place.  I am tired of the generic, touristy Italian places in North Beach; so when this place was recommended by a co-worker, I thought that this could be our "go-to" spot for all things Italian.   Sadly, that wasn't the case for me. 

To me, spaghetti and meatballs is the ultimate comfort food. When I saw it on their menu, I had to try it.  Sadly, it was a major let down. The meatballs were so dry, I couldn't eat the rest of it.  My boyfriend had the Valdostana (chicken dish), which he said was pretty good.  We  both had a Caesar salad, which was good but certainly forgettable. 

If an Italian restaurant can't even make decent meatballs, what's there to say about their other dishes?  It's possible that I had a bad batch of meatballs, so I'm willing to give it another try at some point.
author: Khristine A.

description:
First time here. Very impressed. 

Pros-
Great Italian food, really authentic to what I'm use to (from Italian family on east coast)
Good size portions
Old school Italian restaurant atmosphere
The bread and olive oil was amazing

Cons-
Small menu and not a lot of entrees

I would highly recommend the veal scallopini, it does not disappoint.
author: Nico C.

description: Wow! Not only a night filled with amazing food but service as well (Nancy is the best)! Plan to come back whenever we are in town.
author: Jen P.

description: I went here with my girlfriend and it was pretty solid. The drinks are well made, (the Tom Collins was spot on!), the food was great (we got: the Caprese salad, Bruschetta, Gnocchi, & Fruti di Mare), the staff was friendly & attentive, and the atmosphere is cozy. Prices aren't too bad either.
author: Josh S.

description: The lamb it was really good also the veal it was really good but a little empty just 2 tables so it was a little disappoint also he got charge for a whole bottle of Cabernet when we only ask and got 2 glasses but the food that we ask it was just fine also the price it was a little much for the quality of the food
author: Lara L.

description:
I have an affinity for cute little Italian places. I mean, they're just adorable places that warm your heart as soon as you step into the little doors and are escorted to your little table by the little corner.

So right off the bat I was sold on the location and atmosphere. "Solid choice," I said to myself as we got seated. You'll find that I compliment myself a lot....

Onto the food:

Barbabietola Salad: One of the most flavorful salads I've had in a while. The vinaigrette was nothing but sheer perfection. The beets and goat cheese were just cherries on top at this point.

Burrata: That was listed on the specials menu... and what a special delight it was. Soft burrata cheese on prosciutto made for a great combination. But the best part was the carrot jam on top... I was blown away.

Valdostana: My main course was a chicken breast with smoked mozzarella and prosciutto. The smokiness of the mozzarella smothers the chicken and bring the flavor to a whole new level. I enjoyed every bite. Not a fan of the potatoes on the side though.

The wine selection, while limited, was impressive. We had the Pinot Grigio and it was crisp and light. Perfect with the food we ordered.

I will definitely come here again. This makes for a phenomenal date or an intimate dining experience with reasonable prices and fantastic fare.

-----

Distinguishing factor: Quaint little Italian place serving delightful food that pairs well with the warm ambiance of the interior.
author: Nick A.

description: Great little old school Italian restaurant. I would highly recommend reservations. Very small restaurant. Also, it was quite warm inside, so keep that in mind when figuring out what to wear. I liked that the wine list was reasonable. We had a reservation for two but our friends joined us last minute and they accommodated us. I had the gnocchi and if was very good. I would definitely eat here again.
author: Kara R.

description: This place is a San Francisco staple. I remember riding the bus past it daily to get to school every day. I'm glad I was able to try it out this holiday break. The place is reallllllly small so not good if you're claustrophobic. They have an amazing full bar and some seating upstairs. It's really cute, the service is also really great. We ordered two different pasta dishes, one which was Melanzane with eggplant. Wonderful. The other was, Carlesimo. Both were awesome. Pasta cooked al dente and perfect amount of sauce. Good sized portions for the price, especially in SF.
author: Sia P.

description:
We just wanted to go In for an appetizer and a drink because my boyfriend lives a block away and we've never been! We got the mushrooms and the polenta. It would have been great to know that mushrooms come on top of the polenta already, but whatever. The polenta was creamy with a Marsala sauce, it was pretty good. The mushrooms were buttery and blah... The kind of meal that you feel you could make at home. 

It felt like we spend a good amount of time discussing the inefficiency of the layout and antiquated decor. 

Clearly this place stays busy, which is probably largely due to its touristy north beach address. Never the less, the chefs clearly know how to cook and the service staff was on point, I just think maybe management could stand to upgrade a few things.
author: Jillian D.

description:
We have eaten here several times and it has never disappointed
I recommend the bruschetta appetizer, it is amazing!
All of the pasta dishes are excellent, 
I wanted chicken parmesan, but it was not on the menu, so they made me a chicken scallopini (instead of the veal that was on the menu) that was wonderful
The portions are very generous
The prices are quite reasonable
We arrived in time for happy hour which was great because the beers are 4 dollars a glass, wine is 5 dollars a glass
For dessert we shared  a coffee ice cream pie with an oreo chocolate crust that was a perfect ending to a perfect meal
This restaurant is a hidden gem a little off the beaten track, but well worth it!
author: Mark S.

description: Great food!! Veal saltimbocca was excellent. Tight quarters, and very loud.. Service was poor.  We sat next to what must have been our servers friends, who came in after us they had great attention. We not so much!!
author: Lindsay A.

description:
Had dinner here, decent food, ok service, really nothing that stood out or made me think I will be back.
Had the veal, and the caprese salad, and both were decent, A-OK
author: I B.

description: The service was lovely but  the food was quite forgettable, except for the caprese salad appetizer, which was quite good. Spaghetti vongole had no flavor. The red snapper was drowned in butter. Would not recommend going here based on our experience.
author: George A.

description:
I'll keep this one short, but hit the main points.

WHAT A DELIGHT.

Quality bread, high-end olive oil, and aged balsamic hit the table and were devoured.

Comprehensive wine list, and a skilled bartender making mixed drinks.

A beautiful antipasti plate with salami, sopressata, mortadella, bresaola, pepperoncini, sundried tomatoes, artichokes, olives, pecorino, Humboldt Fog, and... probably a few other things I am forgetting. It's a glorious bounty of goodies.

The roasted and stuffed bell pepper was one of the best cheese delivery systems I've ever seen. Covered in a tomato cream sauce (that is PERFECT for bread dipping), and just oozing with melted three-cheese blend.

The Caccuicco. WOW. A GIANT bowl of seafood in a really nice, almost delicate tomato broth with a little spice. Clams, mussels, calamari, red snapper, prawns, and scallops. It's almost too much. Every time I thought I was done, and took a last dive down into the deep bowl with my spoon I came up with something as if it was being replaced from below by some unseen seafood magician. Delicious.

And the service is top-notch. Gina was a PLEASURE, and made us feel like family. Our experience was warm and cozy and felt familiar. Exactly what an Italian restaurant should be.

Ten points to Trattoria Contadina. Will return again. And again and again and again.
author: kainoa r.

description: Best Italian I have had in North end so far and great service. All their pastas are delicious, wine prices are super reasonable and their to teramisu was amazing!
author: M A.

description:
I was hoping to be wowed by Trattoria Contadina given the positive reviews from Yelpers and friends, but did not find the food to be anything extraordinary. I tried the 
Fruiti di Mare and Salvatore pastas. Both lacked seasoning and the pasta was nothing special, but the fresh ingredients carried the dishes. The Salvatore was the better dish of the two, perhaps because it was fresh instead of dried pasta. My date and I shared the osso bucco, a personal favorite! It was the highlight of the meal, flavorful and tender, and the accompanying risotto was lovely. I've certainly had better versions elsewhere, but it was very tasty. 

I was quite pleased with the house wines and my date enjoyed his martini. You can also supply your own wine and pay the $25 corkage fee, which is a great option if you want to bring a nice bottle. The atmosphere is warm - great for a date - and I really liked the view of the open kitchen. Overall, I'm not sure the meal was worth the price tag, but it was a pleasant date night meal.
author: Shania T.

description:
This place is so good. The food is great and the staff is friendly. They have amazing pastas and risottos, and great chicken and veal dishes. They were very helpful, and even made a substitution for us. 
  The risotto I had was delicious, and the Osso Bucco special was incredible. When we had to wait for our table even after our reservation, they even gave us 2 free desserts. The Spumoni cake was great and their ice creams and sorbets are delicious. 
  Overall, a great restaurant!
author: Andrew S.

description: I could go there and just get seven meatballs and be pumped.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Just went here last night and although the service was great, the food leaves much to be desired. To start off, the olive oil/balsamic they provide with bread in the beginning of the meal is extremely low quality. It's not worth eating at all, butter would have been better. We ordered gnocchi to start with, the sauce was good but the gnocchi was very tough. We had the lamb for the main course and it was HIGHLY under seasoned. Actually, I don't think the cooks used any salt and pepper before preparing it. We had to use table salt and pepper and it was still crappy. I have never had to salt and pepper my own food at a restaurant! This was the worst lambs chops I have ever had in my life. 

I am very surprised to see so many positive reviews for this place, this has got to be the first time ever that I've disagreed with Yelp.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Hummm it was just ok to me.  The service was very good but the food was just so-so, nothing special at all.

Came here on a Wednesday at 9:00pm.  Since it was late, there were plenty ot tables.  But definitely make a reseration when you come here during peak hours.  

My friend and I shared the salad, Barbabietola.  It was arugula greens with beets, goat cheese, radicchio, pistachios, and a balsamic vinaigrette.  The portion of the salad was not small.  All ingredients were fresh and the taste was good but just nothing special.

For pasta, we got Fresco which was the penne pasta with sun-dried tomatoes, white mushrooms, spinach, black olives, chili flakes, and an olive oil garlic sauce.  The pasta was not that good.   It was too salty and oliy.  My friend and I only could eat 1/3 of it.  

Then finally we got the ricotta cheesecake for our dessert.  It was decent cheesecake and you can get it any restaurant.  

Overall Trattoria Contadina is just an OK restaurant to me.
author: Liza T.

description:
This review is for brunch/lunch only. I really had a great experience here. The place is right on the corner with big windows. On a nice sunny day (which we've been having a lot of lately), it's awesome to hang out on those front tables. The service was great, and the food was pretty good! 

The Deviled Eggs and Burrata were really amazing. The highlights of our meal. We ordered the Eggs in Purgatory, and the dish looked amazing. We all thought that the sauce should have been spicier than it was. However, it was still a great dish to dip your bread...really unique. The Meatball appetizer had a great sauce, but the meatballs were a bit dry. I would skip that dish. However, we discovered that the spicy meatball sauce mixed with the Eggs in Purgatory resulted in the perfect flavor. We even ended up taking that home. 

I would definitely recommend this place, and can't wait to come back again.
author: Samir P.

description:
The food here is excellent!  These people know how to make Italian food!

I had the vodka tonic made from homemade tonic and I'm thinking what could be so special in homemade tonic.  This was one delicious cocktail you got to try because it tastes nothing like a vodka tonic you would order at a bar or lounge.  The Carlesimo pasta and the Veal Parmigiana was cooked perfectly and tasted like the food I had in Italy. 

They do get extremely busy so call ahead to get a table.  We tried to get a reservation two weeks ago and they were booked up till the late evening.  The server told us that they will get even busier with the warm months coming up.  

I can't wait to go back to try other dishes at this restaurant!
author: Torbert W.

description: I had dinner here with my work team on Thursday night. We made reservations and I highly recommend that you do. Throughout the evening it seemed to get more and more packed and the wait was longer and longer. Its not very big so it does get full quickly. However, it is worth the wait. Great Italian food. We got the Antipasti appetizer, and it looked so good. I couldn't have any since I am expecting, but if I wasn't I would have dived right into it. I shared the gnocchi and Carlesimo plates, and they were both equally delicious. I love gnocchi and have it wherever its available, so I have tasted lots of different gnocchi, and this gnocchi was definitely in my top three. I would highly recommend!
author: Carina R.

description:
Trattoria Contadina is one of the better examples of the neighborhood italian restaurant in San Francisco that I've been to.  We were there on a double date and we were all very pleased.  The service was very good and very accommodating.  

We had brought a bottle of wine and after looking at their menu, I noticed I couldn't find a corkage fee listed.  We neglected to ask and just see what it was at the end of the meal once we received the bill.  Our dinner was fairly expensive, but nothing surprising.  Because of that, maybe they were content with not charging us a corkage fee?  In any case, it was very well appreciated!

The food was all very good.  It wasn't something that I would rant and rave about, but I was very pleased with my dinner as was the rest of our group.  Good flavors and a wide range of options on the menu.

I would go back again for sure and it's nice to be away from the big touristy Italian places on Columbus and in the heart of the NB neighborhood.
author: Chris W.

description: I'm so confused by the 4 Star average rating for this place.  I've been twice and it's not great.  On my first visit, I gave it a "benefit of the doubt" 3 Star rating, though it wasn't that great.  On my last visit, nothing was well prepared or presented, except the happy hour appetizer.  Service was slow and uninformed.  Our pasta's were tasteless, despite lots of salt (felt it the next day) and cream.  I think the best bet here is to go ultra simple if you get pasta, no cream sauce.  The real kicker - with no alcohol and a shared appetizer, one salad and one pasta each, the total with tax and tip was $46 per person.  Definitely not worth it.
author: Kevin M.

description:
The food was so delicious, the service so good that my girlfriend agreed to marry me after dinner!

And don't forget dessert!
author: Robert M.

description: It's been a few years since my last review of the Trattoria Contadina and I felt it was time for an update. Still my favorite italian spot in the city. It's my go to to take out of town guests. The environment is casual and service is wonderful. The menu has changed a lot over the years, but they always keep it delicious. Make sure to check out the nightly specials. OH! And they used to only have beer and wine, but now they have a full bar and with that comes some wonderfully crafted cocktails. The moscow mules in a copper mug are the way to go. Again, it's North Beach so don't drive, take an Uber.
author: Silvio S.

description:
Din. Food: 3/5
Side of meatballs: 2/5. The giant meatball at Tony's Pizza has ruined all other meatballs for me. 
Eggplant penne. 3/5. Super plain.
Bolognese special. 3/5
Tiramisu. 2/5
$70 post tip for 2
Will not return
author: Olivia Q.

description:
This place sucks. I made a reservation for my birthday for 24 people and the guy put me down for 4 people. No willingness to accommodate me, no constructive suggestions on what I can do about it, not even an apology. Never going there again!

To be honest, the food is pretty good.
author: Matei D.

description: Waitstaff was excellent. Food was really good. Small restaurant so I would recommend a reservation.
author: Archer W.

description: We are visiting and went for dinner with our 5 and 7 year olds. Amazing is all I can say! Food, service, pricing, ambience! We has Burrata salad and meatballs to start with an incredible bottle of wine by Nancy's recommendation. Followed by veal for my husband and I had the spaghetti al'merica(?) I know I said that wrong...it was second choice under pasta; best pasta I've ever had! Go here, you won't regret it! I spent more on lunch at the wharf and the food wasn't good! (Lou's Fish Shack). This place is a gem, go and you'll see why;)
author: Haley W.

description: The food was excellent.  The gnocchi were pillows of heaven. The meatballs were delicious as well.  The courses were served to close together and should have been paced slower.  I would definitely recommend the restaurant.
author: Aimee D.

description:
We had a reservation for a large party for an early dinner. We should have realized that it wasn't going to be great when no one in the group could get a valet...so we parked the cars ourselves. The menus were distributed and it became apparent that we were not valued customers when no one ordered any wine/alcohol. The waitress was rude and did not take orders from everyone on the table in some sort of attempt to make us feel unwelcome. The food it self was pretty good, with small portion sizes. 

A decent meal, but not a decent experience.
author: M S.

description:
Straight up the worst Italian food I have ever had. Not sure how can there be raving reviews.

Their signature dish of meatballs is sooooooo dry!! I've had better ones from the freezer aisle. And their vongole was drenched in lemonjuice - yuck.

Also, please don't delete my review from open table if you don't like what's said :).
author: Gigi G.

description:
I wish it were better. I wanted to leave so happy and so satisfied, but it wasn't quite so.

The piccata (red snapper) in lemon-butter-white wine sauce was flavorful for sure, but the fish was definitely on the over cooked size. The potatoes with the dish was quite good, but only somewhat warm. The spinach cooked down with garlic was somewhat bland.

Ricotta gnocchi met neither of our expectations. More solid than we expected, some how it got a little better as the sauce cooled and thickened. It was somewhat 'meh'.

The restaurant is definitely loud even though there is a decent amount of space between the tables, we didn't enjoy having to speak up to talk to each other. 

The bar was intriguing as was the cocktail list, but this is a place you'd go with food as a priority, drinks second, and with the abundance of fabulous Italian eateries in the city, I can't justify a return trip.
author: Alissa A.

description: Love this hidden gem up the street from bustling north beach chaos. Delicious & classic! Every time I come here, I enjoy the food, wine, dessert, ambiance and old SF feel this restaurant has. The stuffed pepper is amazing, fusilli with chicken is addicting & the mocha fango dessert is like a mocha ice cream-Oreo crusted slice of heaven:-) Can't wait to go back & try other pastas! Cheers to trattoria contadina!
author: Sfgal S.

description:
WOW!!! The service was great, especially since my mom and I had not made a reservation because we didn't know and had literally gotten off the bus tour to find food and warmth since we were freezing. 
I had their lunch special which was a pesto pasta with spicy sausage and my mom had their chicken ravioli. WE both were amazed and happy with what was served. Then we saw the dessert menu...OH HOLY MOLY!!! We weren't going to but the chocolate raspberry dessert we had was amazing!!! Totally worth coming here :)
author: Mayra A.

description:
I love this restaurant so much for many reasons:
The food is unique, and outstanding.
The staff are friendly, very professional and love their jobs. 
The atmosphere is inviting and comfortable. 
On top of that the owners are always present and make you appreciated. 
This place will always be my first choice when I visit North Beach.
author: Brandon G.

description: Just had dinner at the bar.  Bartender Drake on top of his game. Frutti di mare was great.  Used to be a "go-to" and now back in the rotation.  Should have never left.
author: Allan B.

description:
Good place for Sunday brunch! My friends and I were going to do the Ride the Duck tour at 3pm and really wanted to do brunch beforehand but most places around have ridiculously long waits (1-3 hours). I was lucky to find Trattoria Contadina because they took reservations. 

The food was delicious! We were so hungry that we had to order an appetizer (which did come out after our food, my only complaint, though) of deviled eggs. For my meal I ordered the eggs in purgatory which was 2 poached eggs in a spicy sauce; they brought out bread to dip in the yummy sauce! My friend had the veggie scramble and we split the lemon ricotta pancakes that comes with honey butter. 

I would definitely recommend this place, doesn't seem touristy even though it's not far from the Wharf and doesn't have lines out the door to be seated. Great food and really friendly staff.
author: Erin B.

description:
I absolutely must recommend this restaurant as being one of the better spots for Italian in the city. We came on a Friday night and got reservations (a must as this place fills up) for 9pm after our concert got out. We originally had a table for 3, but one of our friends dropped out and the waitress was more than happy to accommodate us at a smaller table.

Service was average, there were times when I felt our food should have been out and I ordered the carlesimo and it was absolutely FANTASTIC. The sauce was great, the pasta was cooked so well, but the mushrooms WERE AMAZING. OH MY GOD GET THAT AND EAT THE MUSHROOMS. They are cooked so tender and well it was like my mouth was in complete ecstasy for the 35 minutes it took me to get through my dish. Yes, my car needed to be towed because it was stuck on the curb later. Yes, I didn't drink as much as I wanted to later that night. But it's OK, because I got the carlesimo here and the mushrooms were THE BOMB. UGH. 4 STARS FOR THE MUSHROOMS!
author: Tony H.

description: Meh, I've had better is the only way to describe this restaurant. It wasn't awful, but it wasn't great. We were referred by friends who love it. We walked up to find the front window boarded up. No clue why but no curbside appeal there!  We were then escorted up a set of tiny steps to the second floor and several "too close for comfort" tables. The waiter we had was nice and attentive. We ordered a caprese salad and a stuffed pepper. The caprese was awesome. However, I expected a stuffed PEPPER, not a few pepper strands. They were not "stuffed" either because you can't stuff a pepper shard. Cheese was lain on top and the few pieces were SMOTHERED and I mean smothered in a pepper cream sauce. It was so overkill that I couldn't bear it. It was like pepper creme  soup on a plate. Next were the entrees. I got the risotto special which was "Meh".I've absolutely had better in the 'burbs.  This was the city so I was expecting at least the same if not a better meal. My guy had the chicken parm, which at $24 was a little steep, even for the city. My two stars are for our waiter and his service. The bathroom, and I mean ONE TINY BATHROOM, was pretty bad. Seemed like an old broom closet, it was so small. I wouldn't return as there are tons betters places closeby. But, I tried it. I didn't like it.
author: Sandra P.

description:
The one thing you could do to really ruin my experience is give me under-cooked pasta.

After a very very long wait, I finally get my pasta, and the noodles are under-cooked and luke-warm. How can you make me wait an hour for pasta and then give it to me as if it were sitting out for 30 minutes and not cooked all the way through? You are an Italian restaurant - know your food and know you can't serve luke-warm food. Especially if the person I'm having dinner with is served hot food. 

That was the first sign that something was wrong: my mom's pasta still had smoke coming from it - notating that it was still hot. My food, no smoke. Then to make matters worse, the noodles were hard.

The reason this isn't a one star is because the ambiance of this restaurant is very nice. It's cozy and warm feeling. If you do decide to come here, make a reservation - this place is tiny and gets busy.

I probably will not be returning. It's just so difficult to go back to a place that serves under-cooked, luke-warm pasta after all this anticipation.
author: Junel S.

description: Lovely wed night dinner w no reservations made- great arugula salad, delish fish and hearty gnocchi with two glasses of Grigio = good times.
author: Sam F.

description:
I made a reservation for 8:30 pm. We were having a drink at a nearby bar. However, she was very hungry.

I suggested that we go early at 8:00 pm and see if they could seat us. When we first arrived, it was full. It is a small place. I did not hold much hope for an early seating. However, the hostess said a table was clearing soon. We went to the bar. I ordered a beer. Within about five minutes, we were seated.

First, the place is charming. It is just one of those little neighborhood restaurants that ooze with character. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.

Our server came over quickly and introduced himself. He provided a lot of information about the menu and told my dining companion his favorites. I actually ordered one of them. A little later he was also very helpful in selecting a wine. And it was a very nice bottle of red. I wish I could remember the name. If it comes back to me, I will edit the review and add it.

Some wonderful bread and some very nice olive oil was also provided.

We always mix up who selects the food and we always share everything.

It tends to work like this. If it is a eastern style restaurant, she does more of the selecting. If it is a western style restaurant, I do.

This is what we ordered:

Starters:
I selected bruschetta (Toasted Italian bread slices topped with fresh diced tomatoes, basil, garlic and ricotta salata cheese).

http://tinyurl.com/4yobct5

I selected meatballs in tomato sauce.

http://tinyurl.com/3kszcu7

Salad:
We selected Caprese Salad (Fresh buffalo mozzarella cheese with slices of fresh tomatoes, basil, pesto and a side of mixed greens).

http://tinyurl.com/3wwaztq

Pasta:
