I selected Melanzane (Rigatoni pasta with sautéed eggplant with Roma tomatoes, onions, olives, melted mozzarella cheese and homemade tomato sauce). This was a half order to be shared.

http://tinyurl.com/3nl5wao

Main:

She selected Agnello (Lamb chops, rosemary, balsamic vinegar, wine, garlic, seasonal vegetables, rosemary roasted potatoes).

http://tinyurl.com/3rw3qrw

I selected Valdostana (Sautéed chicken breast, layered with smoked mozzarella cheese, prosciutto, oregano and sage, served with a Madeira wine sauce, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes).

http://tinyurl.com/3kv396e

I am not going to break each dish down. It was all very good.

I think the highlights were:

Bruschetta - The freshness of the tomatoes really came through.

Caprese Salad - This was simply fresh and delicious.   Mm-mm to creamy mozzarella! 

Lamb - These were very good lamb chops. You could really taste the lamb. It seems like so many places now serve lamb that tastes like beef. This had a real distinct lamb flavor without knocking you out with gaminess.

Prosciutto - It really made the chicken dish pop.

Honestly, there were not really any low points to the meal.

I will also note that the portions were large. Even with a half order of pasta which we shared, there was still a lunch or midnight snack of leftovers to take home.

As usual, we pretty much shared everything.

Service and Ambiance - I will just note once again that the service was superb. Everyone was so friendly. The room is delightful. It almost feels like you are eating in someone's home. The restaurant was full of people who were very glad to be there and everyone was thoroughly enjoying the experience.

Overall - Great food, service, and ambiance. I would not hesitate to return.   Honestly, this is probably closer to a 4.5 star experience.  But, I am giving the round up this evening.
author: Mark D.

description: Great cozy atmosphere. Thoughtful service. Great for ages 7-70! Food was fantastic. Perhaps the best Caesar salad I have ever had. Also a great bourbon list.
author: Christopher F.

description: I came here on a Thursday night with my boyfriend for our 2 year anniversary. It was very simple to make a reservation, and when we arrived the host was friendly and actually gave us more than one table to choose from. Right away we were asked if we wanted water/bread. The menu isn't too big but not so small you feel there's nothing you like. We got the bell pepper appetizer, which was seriously to die for! Service was fast and attentive. Our meals took about 25 mins, but there was a big party ahead of us so I knew they had to make their meals first. Our food was delicious! We got the Pavarotti pasta and vascadona chicken. Everything was delicious! Tasted very fresh. The only bad thing is the two top tables are very close together and we got sat next to on both sides. Its just a little awkward. But as small as the restraunt is, its understandable. I had such a good experience here and would definitely come back!
author: Madelynn M.

description:
Really cute neighborhood spot.  The pasta was very yummy and flavorful.
Would love to go back and check out their other selections.
author: Lyly N.

description:
Another great Italian restaurant to add to my list!  Great food!  

I ordered the Carbanara off of the "specials" menu.....One of the best I've had!  A friend ordered the Carlesimo which was really tasty too.  I'll be ordering that next time I'm there.  Also good off of the "specials" menu is the risotto..... yummy flavor!  My husband ordered the Fruita di Mare, which was your average fresh seafood dish.  We also tried the meatballs and carpaccio.  Both were ok.... Nothing special about them.  

The customer service was great.  Our waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable.  I appreciate his recommendations off of both the food and wine menus.  The only thing I was not so pleased with was the lack of parking.  But thanks to previous reviews, we had a heads up and allowed time to park.  

Great place and I look forward to returning to try more things off of their menu.
author: Angela D.

description:
Very cute little restaurant. Nice vibe. We found the ambiance to be very charming. Waiters were very attentive and provided great service. We had the Burrata (AMAZING) Stuffed pepper with cheese (excellent) spinach (excellent) and the meatballs (poor). I am very disappointed about the meatballs, they were very hard and dry. I  find it really hard to understand how they could fail on such an italian staple. 

Overall it was a great restaurant and would return
author: Ben K.

description: Nice, good food but nothing extraordinary.. the calamari salad was with no flavor, the pasta was good, but nothing in the overall experience was fantastic.
author: Martha C.

description: While on a family vacation in San Francisco, we stumbled upon this place and I have to say it was one of the best meals and experiences we've ever had. The food was fantastic and the service even better. It's always really cool to find a real Diamond in the rough. Not a fancy place, just really good quality. we appreciate their hospitality...
author: Dave P.

description: I stayed at the Wharf during my trip and didn't want to eat dinner with all the tourists. Yelped "Italian" and glad I did. This place has true neighborhood feel. I had dinner at the bar; ordered the Salvatore with a side of rosemary potatoes. Tiramisu to finish the meal. GO TO THIS PLACE; YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!
author: Carlito B.

description: Bottom line: I enjoyed it, but it was very pricey for me, and for what I paid, it should have knocked my socks off. It was B+ food, quite good, but lacked the wow factor I would like to experience when two people are dropping over $100 for dinner.
author: Sean B.

description:
Six of us came for dinner and we were not disappointed.  We were worried that there would be a wait given our party size but we got right in!  

We ordered a bunch of appetizers; the meatballs (yummy), bruschetta (delicious) and the caprese salad (typical).  Our waiter was attentive - even with a packed house.

I had the Carlisiemo for my main and it did not disappoint.  It was delicious and generously sized.  A few of my colleagues had the ravioli and really enjoyed that.  The others had the spaghetti and meatballs.  

I will definitely be coming back on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: Cristine P.

description:
I had a great meal here last week.  I sat at the bar and the bartender and hostess could not have been friendlier.  Everyone that works there seems to get along well which makes a very warm atmosphere.
I had the meatball appetizer - it was very good, the sauce was good and the meatballs had the perfect amount of garlic.
Cesar salad was good, it was a very nice portion.  For the main course I went for the chicken parm.  It was delicious pounded out thin with the right amount of sauce and cheese.  It came with a side of pasta but I didn't need it!
I will definitely go back next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Jim S.

description: On short notice was able to get into this place.  There space can be cramped especially if you are upstairs where I was.  However, the server was very attentive to all the guests up there which was nice.  I started with the caprese salad and it was excellent.  Can't go wrong with that.  For the main I had the carlisemo and it was also authentic and tasty.  The food did take a little longer to get to my table than expected but not out of what was reasonable.  From the look of others plates, seems the reviews are pretty much on target.  Great experience.
author: Mark A.

description:
I liked the burrata with figs and arugula that we had as a starter. The meatballs and sauce were pretty good too. We also shared those as an appetizer.  Service was initially slow. It took 15 minutes to get a cocktail. The bartender was in absolutely no rush- even with a full restaurant!  People sitting at the bar were without drinks too.  It kind of irked me to watch him work.  He wasn't even aware of his own lack of any work ethic or speed. 
The linguine with shellfish, red snapper and prawns wasn't too good. I ate 2 bad mussels.  Very fishy. Yuk. I didn't eat the other 2 and my fingers are crossed that I don't get sick. The linguine was overcooked.  I opted for the red sauce and it eventually became incorporated with the fishiness.  I was unable to dunk my bread as I usually do because the taste of fish was too powerful . It's difficult finding good Italian food in SF.  My favorite is still Lupa in Noe Valley. 
My partner had the veal scallopine and thought it was ok.  The veal should have been pounded down more and less sauce would have been better.  It was swimming in a brown sauce.
Bottom line : great spot, cozy venue, full house, cable cars going by, good service (except for the bartender), but the food was just so- so. Won't be going back.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Maybe one of my new favorite places in Little Italy... ok, maybe it's not truly in North Beach, but it is definitely close by.

It's located right on the corner of Mason and Union, so you can watch the cable cars go by as you enjoy your wine and pasta.  The food was definitely tasty, and the waiter kept on top of everything.

However, it is a little cramped inside (especially the airplane-sized restroom) ... the tables are small and close together, but get there early enough and it's not too much of a problem.  The food, ambiance, and service were all solid, so you can be sure that I'll be coming back!
author: Chris Y.

description:
I just loved this place.

It has just enough energy to feel like you are at a house party for a large Italian family.  And the FOOD...just perfection.  The Carlisemo dish was one of the best pasta dishes of my life. 

Be sure to make a reservation :)
author: Lucy L.

description: We had a very "good" meal here. I had the gnocchi, good not great, and my husband had a chicken pasta dish, much better. Very crowded and small restaurant, service was extremely slow but friendly. I think it took 30 minutes for us to be greeted. The burrata appetizer was excellent. Good Italian but I have had better and definitely better service else where.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Coming from an Italian family I tend to be a harsher critic on Italian cuisine. I have to say that this place was the real deal. The red cream sauce has a robust flavor with a little kick to it. The noodles were cooked perfectly al dente. The roasted bell pepper was a great starter to wake up our taste buds and want some more. The ambiance is cozy, operating out of what looks like an old house. The service was warm and inviting and offered great recommendations. I will return.
author: Faith A.

description: Make a reservation! This place is fantastic! I was in SF this past weekend and was excited to take my mom and sister to enjoy some fabulous Italian food. I had been here before and remembered the food was amazing. I was happy to learn that it had not changed. We ordered bruschetta, tortellini w/ mixed sauce and spaghettini w/meatballs. All three dishes were great. Although the food was 5 stars, the service was 10! We had a 9:00 reservation and because others were enjoying their experience and kept ordering wine and dessert, it took an extra 30 minutes for us to be seated. Normally I would be a bit frustrated because I hate for my family to have a bad experience, but the staff was so attentive. The host apologized multiple times and paid for a round of drinks and an appetizer. This was absolutely not necessary, but because of the outstanding service I will be back on my next trip. Great service always makes me want to return. Thanks to the host and servers for making it a special night!
author: Erica A.

description: One of the best Italian meals I have had in a long time! The atmosphere is warm and welcoming. The staff is efficient and kind. The food is second to none! The caprese salad was the perfect balance of tastes and textures. The gnocchi was light with a delicious sauce. I will recommend this to anyone in San Fran and can not wait to come back again!
author: Vicki S.

description:
When it comes to Italian food reviews go from one to five stars, everyone has it's own idea of good Italian food. I personally was very disappointed with my pasta... overlooked and drowned in it's sauce. If you ever had pasta at Mario Batali's Eataly in NYC you would know what I meat by good pasta.
Our appetizers were good though but I'll never go back to Trattoria Contadina.
author: Ron D.

description:
I have been craving Italian for over a month now and I thought the best place to indulge my craving was Trattoria Contadina. I picked this place because I had no idea how to pronounce the name, so the restaurant stuck out. 

Parking was horrendous and when we finally found parking at the bottom of the hill five blocks away, I almost ran into a spider hanging from a tree. But I digress. Stepped into Trattoria Contadina and was told there was no table until 9:30pm. Luckily my gf and I were seated at the bar immediately, otherwise we would be famished by the time 9:30 rolled around. 

I only wanted to try the Carlesimo but my hunger bested me. We ordered the regular size portion for the Carlesimo, Vongole, and Agnello. I thought I was going to love the Vongole because it has clams, lemon, and white wine sauce. But the Carlesimo's rigatoncelli with pancetta, mushrooms, peas, sun dried tomatoes in a creamy tomato sauce won me over. The lamb chops were also very good, cooked nicely and very flavorful. Definitely over-ordered but managed to finish almost everything. 

What I recommend:

-- Carlesimo
author: Andrew W.

description: The best Italian restaurant I've ever been to! I love the atmosphere and the service was great. If you love to eat this is your place! Amazing!!!!
author: briana R.

description:
We ate upstairs. The atmosphere was cozy, and felt prominently Italian. Tasteful portraits decorated the wall. My favorite of which was a replete Italian man, hand over hand with humongous fork and spoon, face down stuffing himself with pasta. This is my kind of place, I think to myself.

I ordered the Spinali (olives, garlic, sausage, more garlic). My dining partners ordered the cheese gnocchi (parmesan cheese on top, of course) and the house special. 

On a scale from 1-10, the food was ridiculously rich. The dishes tasted like: 1. garlic 2. cheese 3. ham. Actually most of our meal ultimately ended up being bread and none of us finished more than half of our meal.

Fooooood coma'd so hard. My brain became a small anchovie, swimming in a big vat of cheese. My poor gills!
author: Marty H.

description:
Make sure you make a reservation! But if your party is small, they'll let you sit at the full-service bar (which is fun because the bartenders are great). I think this is one of the better Italian restaurants in North Beach, unlike most pastas, I left feeling really contently full instead of stuffed. Also, if you're a cheese person, the burrata is amazing. 

The restaurant is conveniently located and the pasta dishes are perfect for sharing family style. My favorite is probably the chicken ravioli.
author: Alice W.

description:
It's been awhile since I've walked out of a place that tasted this good and was completely stuffed! But I better be stuffed after I spent $53 by myself...

You start the adventure of Trattoria Contadina by riding your car up and down the steep streets trying to find parking. It was similar to a rollercoaster ride but with the annoyance of having to look for a place to stop and not just enjoying the drops. After 30+ minutes of doing that you start the next phase of trekking blocks and blocks to the restaurant. If you're coming here on a weekend you better make reservations otherwise you'll walk away pissed off that they can't accommodate you. 

Now comes the good part: the food was great! I started off with an aperitif of Aperol Citrus and the Zuppa special which was a butternut squash soup. My main course was the Cacciucco special which was a seafood stew that had halibut, mussels, clams, in a rosemary tomato broth. The serving was so big that I couldn't finish it and I'm a fairly big eater. The meal was topped off with a latte that perked me right up. 

Our party of 11 sat upstairs and that created a cozy and intimate setting that felt like we were at home. The place was fairly small but was a completely enjoyable experience.  I'll be back...
author: Don D.

description:
Gina and Kevin are wonderful people and both incredibly gracious.   After eating at Gary Danko's, I ate here the following night and really truly enjoyed the food here so much more.

This is one of my favorites!
author: Mark K.

description:
I came here with Miss. Randi N. and two other gals to enjoy a fine Italian meal before we jet off to Italy in a few months to study abroad. Originally, we made plans to eat at another restaurant but it was closed on a Tuesday (Weird? or do I not know something about Italian restaurants?) My trusty yelp app led us to this place, and we were seated right away.

We ordered and split the following:
1 bottle of white wine
4 pieces of bruschetta (priced at $3 a pop)
1 large bowl of rigatoncelli (the first pasta listed on the menu) ($17)
1 large bowl of chicken ravioli ($17)
1 order of the picatta ($27)

I would definitely avoid the bruschetta. They provide ample amounts of free bread, and so you're basically paying $3 for some tomatoes, a bit of cheese, and seasoning.  I would've been happier with a meatball (priced at $2.5)

The rigatoncelli was the standout of the night. Mmmm tomato cream sauce. It was delicious, and it made me really excited about our upcoming trip.  The picatta was also good, but the menu said that it was served with "seasonal vegetables" and we just got broccoli.  I'm not even sure if it's in season. I was thinking we would get asparagus or artichokes. Broccoli is nothing special.

I had a few bites of the ravioli before my friend complained about the undercooked ravioli. I replied, "Really? I haven't had a problem with it. It's good!" JINX. The next two bites were SO HARD. I didn't touch it after that. I probably should've sent it back but at that point we had divided everything by four. 

After all of that, we each chipped in $30 to cover the bill, which wasn't bad considering the alcohol. We were also pretty full, even though it didn't seem like we ordered a lot. Pasta and cream sauce is heavy. (It also didn't help that I ate four slices of the free bread. Please don't judge me.)

I agree that the tables are close together, but the place itself is not the biggest so I wasn't surprised. The servers were knowledgeable and attentive. No qualms about the service!

One of my dates pointed out a signed poster of Bill Cosby on the wall. If it's good for Bill, it's good for me!
author: Jenn C.

description:
Definitely a fan of Trattoria, been coming here for almost 20 years when I am in the city. It seems like it is a little less amazing than it used to be but still very good. I have never had a bad meal here and the prices aren't crazy.

Can't come here without having the stuffed pepper appetizer, absolutely amazing, worth the price of admission.

Both the Carlisimo and Pavarotti were very good

The Valdostana was outstanding, great taste on the chicken, the broccolini was made perfect.
author: DJ D.

description:
A friend and I had looked forward to dining here for a long time... nearly every time we planned to go to dinner, this place came up but we'd end up somewhere else for whatever reason.  FINALLY we made reservations and got there - after years!  

That's the buildup.  Now, the let-down.  After literally years of planning to go here, and finally reserving a table - they shoved us into the smallest most cramped corner of the place, a table you might save for the busboys to eat on their break.  It was uncomfortable and unpleasant.  This took the wind out of our sails. And then, the food was just mediocre and the service - again, we were treated like the busboys who had over-stayed our break time.  

Too bad.  After all those years, what a waste of time.
author: k a b.

description:
Cute little place. We came here for a huge team dinner and took up half the restaurant, but the staff was very gracious and nice as well as efficient and attentive. 

Wine and cocktails were quickly served up, as was the bread (but it was cold -- as a personal preference I prefer the bread warm). 

Let's see, appetizers: the caprese was exactly what you would've expected; the Caesar salad was good but just OK -- the dressing was kind of clumped together at various areas of the salad; and I didn't have any of the persimmon prosciutto thing, but it looked fancy! 

I got the frutti de mare for my entree. Liked it, but didn't love it -- some of the seafood was a little undercooked to my taste...

But let's skip to dessert. Someone ordered a chocolate torte, which was really good but also a bit rich. Pretty much had to take itsy bitsy bites to not die of a sugar/cream/chocolate overdose instantly. But still, delicious. And then there was the blackberry swirl cheesecake, which was absolutely divine -- perfect way to finish dinner.
author: Rowena L.

description:
On a recommendation for something new we brought some out of town guests for dinner here the other night. Made reservations on open table for 6pm on a Thursday, arrived about 15 minutes early and we seated right away. The restaurant is small with most seating down below and has a bi-level will just a few tables, we were seated in the upper level near a window....nice (since we had just walked from Fisherman's wharf and were warm and the breeze felt great)
The service was on the spot and everyone super courteous. Our party ordered wine and started with salads and one person ordered the soup special: carrot with ginger....looked amazing. She said it was fantastic.

We all went with different pasta dishes I did the Salvatore ravioli's and opted for the small size(for me wise choice being they are rich) just enough with that salad and all the bread I ate...:-).

Plus I had an ulterior motive to save room for dessert to share with my husband...Tiramisu......Yummmm ....Wonderful.....
So excellent meal, great service and reasonable price...I would definitely go back.
author: Susan D.

description:
Great food, service was a little bit subpar.
We came in on an 8:30 reservation and ended up waiting 20 minutes for a seat (not the restaurant's fault at all in this case). However, as we ordered food, we noticed the tables next to us order after and manage to get food before. It was about 30 minutes before we asked where it was. The server apologized and managed to get us our dishes in a prompt manner after.

The gnocchi was AMAZING. Really soft and pillowy and the tomato cream sauce compliments it perfectly.
The eggplant pasta was pretty good overall. The olives did make the dish a little pungent and there was quite a bit of cheese, but can't complain overall.

All said, they did apologize profusely and comped part of our meal, which I really appreciate. Definitely will be coming back here for more food in the future!
author: Bharath S.

description:
this place was in the cutest spot in North Beach.

We sat in the upstairs.

The food was so great!  You have have have to try the stuffed peppers!  They are the best and I will never taste anything like them again.

I defiantly recommend going here, but the food is rich so be careful if you are not use to it.
author: Carry B.

description:
this one has been on my list forever. i live in NB and have had to cancel reservations a few times but finally it worked out and i was able to take my mom here for her birthday. it was perfect! i made a reservation but we ended up getting there 30 minutes early and were seated immediately (granted 630p is pretty early for dinner).

we ordered two entrees to spilt - the carlesimo and the veal picatta. both were out of the world amazing but i don't think i'll ever be able to stray from the carlesimo from here on out. it made for extra delicious leftovers too! i should also mention that i'm usually not much of an Italian food fan.

service was on point as well. they kindly brought my mom a birthday tiramisu which she loved. i'm so happy i finally made it to this neighborhood gem!
author: Emily C.

description: Another great dinner at Trattoria Contadina.  What can I say.  They continue to impress.  We brought friends to celebrate an anniversary.  7 of us seated upstairs.  Service was crisp.  Meatball appetizer was delicious.  So were the sauteed mushrooms.  All the various pasta dishes we ordered were beautifully prepared.  We even grabbed an order of Spaghetti Polpettine to bring back for our son who could not make it.  Bravo.
author: Lewis C.

description:
I really loved this place.  I couldn't believe that a date who doesn't live in the city suggested an italian place i didn't know.  so  immediately, because i am that narcissistic i figured it wouldn't be that good. I was wrong.  

it is in north beach, but on a residential block that has no other restaurants...so of course, because i am that quick to judge i thought, great he doesn't' even know where he is taking me.  wrong again.  

it was a weekend night and it wasn't that crowded.  in fact we got a last minute reservation, no problem and then called to delay it...and still no problem.  The place seems tiny, cozy, great ambiance and wonderful service.  

The wine list is small and not pretentious and we found something we really liked.  We had the buratta that was pretty yummy and split an entree. The portions are pretty big.  The bread was amazing.  But I could seriously eat italian bread for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  

it was a perfect way to start an evening in north beach.  I would totally be back.
author: Kierstan G.

description: Big fan! We visited from out of town and trusted the 800+ reviews on Yelp! Loved the stuffed peppers and sauce, loved the risotto on special, great bread and cheese...we are very particular about our Italian and felt right at home at this little spot. Great service!!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Love love love...I pass by this restaurant everyday and finally tried it a few months ago and have been coming back since. I have tried almost everything on the menu and loved it. A few call outs are:
1. chicken ravioli: very unique (I have never had ravioli with chicken) and rich. The flavors are interesting, but good interesting. It was deep and captured all the wonderful fall flavors
2. spagetti and homemade meatballs: very rustic and you can definitely tell their meatballs were homemade and fresh
3. frutti de mare: this is by far my favorite frutti de mare. You get giant whole pieces of seafood...clams, mussels, shrimp, scallops, fish...yums

By the way, impeccable service (yup...restaurants always get me with this).

Tip: reserve...early.
author: Tif L.

description:
Just spent 10 days in Hawaii and San Francisco and felt like this was our best meal on the trip!

Terrific little Italian place on Mason Street, just up the hill from Fisherman's Wharf.  Parking is a bear - took us 30 minutes to find a street spot - but that's San Francisco.

Food was terrific.  Flavorful sauces, good sized portions and delicious, fresh-baked bread.  Lots of great memorabilia on the walls - hey, Steve Young hangs out here - and no complaints about service.

Make a reservation or you won't get in.  We showed up (with a reservation) when they opened at 5, and by 5:15 the place was full and new customers were being told to come back at 9 p.m.

Worth the time and trouble to eat here.
author: Dale B.

description:
Would highly recommend it. I am East Coast Italian  so grew up eating lots of excellent Italian food. The food here was up there with the best. We started off with a salad of arugula, beets and goat cheese which was very good. Nicely dressed with very fresh ingredients. We also had the burrata cheese with strawberries which was so smooth and creamy. For dinner I had the risotto which was perfectly cooked. My 3 friends all wanted the gnocchi but unfortunately there was only one serving left at 7:15pm. That was a bit  disappointing. The gnocchi were excellent..soft and flavorful.
The other 2 pasta dishes chosen were both really good. They have a nice wine list that is moderately priced. The location has a a comfortable neighborhood feel.
author: Bert S.

description: Great service. Food lacked in flavor - - this included a pasta dish and two apps. Eggplant parmigiana was good.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Didn't know that they served brunch on Sundays. But it was a pleasant surprise. They were accommodating to our requests and even made our fav appetizer that wasn't on the menu. Also took care of our kids. 

The bloody Mary's were great and Service as always was great.
author: Ashish M.

description:
Place is small, hard to move around. Once seated, wait staff is attentive, knowledgeable.
Food is amazing! I had the chicken on special, served with roasted potatoes, and a divine light cream sauce. I could have taken a bucket of that stuff home!
My husband had fruta de mare filed with fresh seafood. He loved it! It came with spaghetti noodles/tomato as a base.
Their wine selection is well balanced. The waiter knew wine pairings well.
This is a great, off the beaten path, type of place.
It's on a corner, at the top of a steep hill, so if walking, leave the heels at home.
author: Valerie S.

description: Was there last night had the scallopini and prawns one of my favorite restaurants in the North Beach area
author: S D.

description: I had the honor of going to The 30th anniversary dinner and had a great time! Service Is thee best! Everyone is so welcoming and friendly. The food makes this one of, if not the best, italian restaurants ive been to. The bartender, kevin makes the best moscow mules this side of the mississippi. I continue to eat here and am always satisfied with food AND service!
author: The I.

description: Three of us had a great Saturday brunch here. Our three appetizers were incredible. I can't say enough good things about the deviled eggs or the Walnut bread, each of which was worth a special visit to the restaurant. The burrata appetizer was also a nice surprise (mixed with peaches and prosciutto). The standout entrees were "eggs in purgatory" and a pasta dish from the dinner menu (not the one I ordered, so I can't recall which one - but I had a bite and immediately wanted more).
author: Morris R.

description:
The first time we visited about three years ago, my husband and I agreed it was a four to five-star place.  Our second visit, however, was pretty disappointing.  We made reservations using OpenTable and were about five minutes late.  The host made us feel pretty bad about that (although there was a long line waiting for tables).  The host sat us at a table about a foot and a half from the door and about three inches from the next couple.  It was a horrible table.  That probably tainted the entire night. 

The food was just ok and was barely worth sitting next to the cold door.  We ordered roasted peppers for the appetizer.  It was just mouthfuls of cheese.  The cheese also did not melt well and clumped together. Overall, heavy, greasy and boring. 

For entrees, I ordered gnocchi  in a tomato cream with which was absolutely perfect.  The gnocchi was soft and pillowy and the sauce was sweet and delicious.  The gnocchi  is the only reason I gave this three instead of two stars. My husband ordered spaghetti and meatballs.  He liked it ok, but it was nothing special.  

We cannot remember if we ordered dessert (and ate there a week ago), so I think that speaks for itself. 

I hope this was an off night. We will probably return, but make sure to ask for an interior table and steer clear of the pepper.
author: Mary N.

description:
I had high expectations from recommendations and reviews of this place, however,  I was severely disappointed in the quality of the food and service. 

I ordered the pasta special on New Year's Eve. There was nothing special about it. Pene in a standard pesto sauce. Garlic sausage that could have been purchased at Safeway and wasn't worth eating. The whole dish could have been whipped up with store bought ingredients in 5min and taste just the same. I gave up on the main dish and hoped their tiramisu would save my experience. Nope. The quality of the desert was no better. I tried one more time to enjoy something before I left and ordered an Irish coffee to go, because I needed to get to a show and wanted the coffee to stand in line with. No take-out cups. 

The service was matter-of-fact and businesslike, but not personable. My fiancé ordered gluten free pasta, but the waiter didn't know what it was and said they didn't have it. Many reviews, however, claim this restaurant was one of the few that serves GF pasta in SF. 

Perhaps I just ordered the only things on the menu that were low quality, but it was my first experience and I was deeply disappointed to spend my time and $$$ on a meal that was only mediocre at best and service that was barely utilitarian.
author: Mike M.

description:
Sunday brunch, Sunday Brunch, Sunday Brunch, Sunday Brunch,Sunday Brunch, Sunday Brunch, Sunday Brunch, Sunday Brunch, Sunday Brunch, Sunday Brunch.

Are you standing in line at Mama's? You are at the wrong place. Walk up the hill and dine where the locals dine. Kevin and Gina are awesome. We loved Dirk (Kevin's Dad) but if he's not here, then we love Kevin. Pop in for a drink. He always has an interesting whiskey that he's found in his travels. Scratch cooking, warm environs and family run, 700 Yelp reviewers cant be wrong, get in here.
author: michael e.

description:
This was my first time here and I've been waiting to go for a while. Maybe it was just the dish that I ordered, but my pasta was so incredibly salty, I couldn't finish the dish. My fiance's fish was the same. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE salty food (I'm Korean...we salt everything), but this was too much.

I'll give it another shot in the future. I love the location and the cozy atmosphere. But for my go-to Italian joint, I'll stick with Pane e Vino.
author: Susan P.

description: We had a great meal at Trattoria Contadina! It's a nice little restaurant that would be great for a casual date or dinner with a friend. The Burratta was tasty, the meatballs were good, and the gnocchi was great. You can't compare it to the fine fine fine Italian dining places, but it's also not trying to be (priced fairly, more casual). We really enjoyed our meal.
author: Michael H.

description: To me, a highly rated restaurant is based on a combination of food, service and ambience and this place did not disappoint. Trattoria Contadina came highly recommended by a relative who lives in Switzerland of all places! His Italian friend told him he eats here every time he visits SF because the food reminds him of his grandmother's cooking and he can't find food like this in Italy any more. Ummm, this is as good as a compliment gets so I HAD to get myself there pronto! My husband and I decided to go here for our anniversary and it was the perfect way to end a long day in SF.  The owner greeted us as we walked in and and made us feel like we were guests of honor. Not only was the food authentic but the restaurant was homey and comfy. We didn't want to leave! Our server was also super cool and took great care of us. I don't think you could go wrong with any of the dishes but the roasted pepper stuffed with cheese and topped with a smooth and spicy tomato sauce is a great appetizer to start with. We plan to visit this place again with family and friends soon!
author: Ana G.

description: Arrive randomly at Trattoria thanks to Yelp and had a great meal with my family. The burrata and pasta with meatballs were awesome!
author: Ivan R.

description: Some of the best Italian food in the city with a great local neighborhood vibe. Tutto era buonissimo.
author: Doug K.

description:
Really nice Italian restaurant that's away from the chaos of Columbus St in North Beach. Enjoyed some burrata and meatballs as an appetizer. Both were great. The meatballs were dense, but not tough, nice flavor and the homemade sauce was done well.  

I went with the popular Carlesimo which features house-made rigatoncelli, pancetta, porcini, peas, sun-dried tomatoes, spicy tomato cream. It was tasty and I was not disappointed. 

My girlfriend got their pasta special of the night which also had house-made pasta, shrimp, and a lemon wine sauce. She enjoyed it but noted that the shrimp were overcooked. Not egregiously so, but definitely noticeable. 

While my heart likes this place more than 3 stars, I could only logically provide 3 considering the more-than-lengthy wait in between appetizer and entree, overcooked shrimp, and the simple fact that I wasn't blown away by my entree as I anticipated.

A great experience for sure and a place worth checking out.
author: Steve B.

description:
My fiance and I went before a concert.  Street parking was findable, the location was great and a little out of the way from the usual touristy area in a neighborhood.  I got the feeling from the conversation around us that this is a locals and transplants spot far more than a tourist spot which I think is a great indication of quality and sometimes value.  I would suggest a reservation on a fri or sat night for sure unless you want to wait at the tiny bar.  We walked in at 6pm on a Sunday and were offered the last 2 top that wasn't reserved.  The service was excellent.  Our server made wonderful wine suggestions that we took advantage of an enjoyed.  Their wine list was a bit steep but everything was so delicious and perfect I don't think this should detract you if you really enjoy good wine with great Italian cuisine and feel like you have a little extra to spend at the moment.
THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS!  I ordered the Carlesimo pasta dish.  Everything in it was fresh and perfect.  The consistency and flavor of the sauce could not have been any better.  I kid you not, and I can cook well so I really get that stuff.  My fiance ordered the Fruitti di Mare.  He was also very happy and ate every bite. It had nearly equal pasta to fresh seafood.  All the pasta had the taste and consistancy of being fresh, if not homemade.  We also split a side of broccolini prepared in olive oil, chili flakes, and lemon.  We sprinkled it with the balsamic on our table and it was the perfect compliment.
Try this place!
author: Amanda L.

description:
Really fantastic! I absolutely love this place! Came here with some friends and found it special enough to bring my hubby back for our anniversary.

The first time I came we had the antipasto platter. It was amazing. Every single morsel. We also had the cheese stuffed bell peppers...delicious! My dish that night was the Salvatore (chicken ravioli). SO GOOD! 

When we returned for our anniversary dinner, hubby and I shared the soup from the specials menu..lobster and corn chowder. It was so flavorful! Hubby ordered the tomato cream risotto from the specials menu and I had the Pavorotti. Fusilli pasta with chicken, prosciutto  and sundried tomatoes in a cream sauce. Yum!

For dessert, we split some sort of mocha mousse cake with an oreo crust. 

Service, food, and beer all get 5 stars. I love this place!!
author: Michelle A.

description:
Use to live a block up, one of my favorite places in the city. Great food and atmosphere. Dont get suckered in by the tourist traps in North Beach and come here. Place is legit. Service is awesome.

Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Personal favorites are the spicy cream sauce, contadina sauce, and the eggplant.
author: Chris C.

description: Being a North Beach local I've passed this place a couple times. I haven't been around as much since I went off to University because its a little more of a journey now. What really brought me back is the Happy Hour which was really good. I started following this place on Voo (https://tryvoo.com) so now I know when theyre happy hour is because the commute isnt that far but still I want to be sure I know where I'm going and what I'm doing. on top of the fact that their Moscow mule comes in the actual cups and not just a glass! definitely coming back here
author: Peter B.

description: Great food! Great service, the owners are very friendly! I had the swordfish and it was amazing!
author: Heather E.

description: Great old italian restaurant ambiance.  The food is old style too.
author: Jeff S.

description: The first time we ate there, it was because we stayed nearby during a week-long vacation. The second, third and fourth time was because it was that good!
author: Molly I.

description: Found through yelp, as a tourist. Lived up to reviews and could not have been more pleased. Right around the corner from Beach Blanket Babylon if you are headed there. Adorable little restaurant, right in little Italy. Made a last minute reservation and an even more last minute change, and they accommodated us for a small party. Amazing eggplant and wedge salad to start. Gnocchi and Pavarotti (fusili with chicken, sundried tomatoes) for dinner. Great wine choice for affordable bottle prices. Overall, fantastic value, adorable ambience, wonderful food and service.
author: Reena H.

description:
Been here to dinner twice and both times I felt overwhelmed by the amount of food on the table. You'll definitely have leftovers - which if you're like me and thinking "Hmm. So I'm basically getting two meals for a $14 plate? Cool." However, note that the seafood pasta dish does not refrigerate well. 

Good what-you-expect Italian food and fairly simple to make the reservation on Open Table, though the hostess did have to rifle through a few files to find my name.
author: Krystha B.

description: Hopes started high with the caprese salad.  The chicken parmesan was bland and soggy with the tomato sauce lacking flavor and depth.  Typical Italian American spot...
author: Stephanie J.

description: Love coming here for the gnocchi! They took the Gorgonzola gnocchi off the menu.  But when the waiter saw how disappointed I was he had the chef make it for me anyway!!!!!! Love the food here, love the service!
author: Robyn W.

description:
My best friend lives right across the street from Trattoria Contadina and every time I come to visit him this place is kicking with business! The locals and the tourists seem to really love this place... and now I know why! 

It's a small quaint Italian restaurant on a corner where the cable cars pass by. You can even take the bus there because it stop right out front! Parking is street only for 2 hours because it's permit parking for the residents. Sundays you can park for an unlimited time, but good luck! This place is right off the main strip in the heart of "Little Italy" so on the weekends it is difficult to find parking. 

We called ahead of time to see if we could get a dinner reservation (which is recommended) the earliest we could get in was 5:30 with 9:00 being the next open reservation. Since we were out and about in the city that day, we found 5:30 to be too soon. We unloaded our car after a good day of shopping and thought "let's stop on by Trattoria to just SEE if we can a seat. It was pure luck because a bunch of people were leaving and the hostess was able to fit us in!. It was around 6:15 PM which is still early for San Francisco diners. We felt lucky! 

They have 2 portion sizes that they offer so that was nice. The wait staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes. The food was tasty and refreshing! I always love it when they put lemon wedges in the water glasses. The tables are set with linens but this is still a kid/family friendly restaurant. I noticed they had a supply of color crayons for the kiddies. However I tend to think that this is a nice place for a date and small groups. It's a small establishment and not meant for huge gatherings. Even the co-ed restroom is very small. Be sure not to open the door abruptly or else hit someone coming out of the kitchen! 

I would definitely go here again when I am in the mood for Italian food at a reasonable price!
author: Christine D.

description:
So after a very long day of exploring the city, while my boyfriend and I were visiting my little sister in the city, my boyfriend was insistent that we have Italian food. But myself, being somewhat of a foodie, and not wanting to eat at some dumb Italian tourist trap found this place on yelp. At first I was worried because the pictures of the plates made me think, it was cheap and touristy. But the reviews were so solid we went. 

We got there early, because we were starving. When we walked in the waiter asked if we had reservation... Reservations? ok this was no tourist trap. We said no but he quickly found us a table. They had a decent wine selection but none of us were in the mood for a drink. We started with the meatballs, which put my homemade creations to shame, they were delicious!! The sauce was creamy and robust, and the fresh shaved Parmesan made it that much better. Needless to say they didn't last long. The bread they give you worked perfect to sop the excess sauce left over by the meatballs and tasted wonderful.

For dinner my Boyfriend got stuffed chicken with broccoli and mashed potatoes, which was delicious. The best thing on his plate was the combination of those garlic mashed potatoes and the creamy white sauce on his plate. Half way though his meal though the sauce broke, but delicious none the less. My little sister got the summer carbonara, which was also very yummy. The corn, peas, and shallots were perfect together. I got the pasta special, which was also delicious. Everything was made fresh and the kitchen is open but not loud or chaotic. 

To top off our night the three of us shared a piece of tiramisu. which was so yummy. 

All and all it was amazing but I have had better in So Cal!!! I might go again, but trying something new is more tempting
author: Diana L.

description: Tiny, fun Italian family place right on the Hyde & Mason Cable Car line (Union and Mason corner). Excellent menu and you can ask for something special. We had 4 gkids under 12 and they had a fun time ordering from the menu and sharing good food. We will go again. Busy place with lots of time to talk and enjoy a glass of good vino over bread and laughter. Meals came soon after we ordered. Dessert was excellent.
author: Willis K.

description: So we are on a quest to find the best tiramisu in the bay area.   This place was suggested by a friend so we had to try it.   Here is what we found.  The presentation was ver nice.  Tiramisu looked great - it came on a small plate, dusted with chocolate and mint leaves.  It was also had lines of chocolate syrup running accross it and the plate.  Texture was also very good.   Not too moist or watery but firm and fairly creamy.   If anything it was just a bit on the runny side.  Flavor was a bit bland except for the cohocolate syrup which was very good.  It lacked coffee or any kind of liquoer flavor.  Occasional bites had an interesting fruity flavor to it. Buttom line, it was good but not fantastic.
author: Marcus K.

description: Was at the bottom of our recommendation list from our hotel. It was the only place we were able to get last minute dinner reservations. It's cute, cozy and small. It looked like they had a full bar area as well. Ok service, food was alright. Traditional Italian dishes. Be ready to get to know your neighbor fairly well since the tables are very close together.
author: Karina T.

description: Great location for dinner before Beach Blanket Babylon!  The friendly staff helped us navigate the wine list and menu.  The bread, bruschetta appetizer and caesar salad were my favorites.  The 1984 pasta is surprisingly good.
author: Tracy A.

description: My son and I stopped in on a recent Friday night as we were touring the city.   We were seated upstairs right away.  Cozy atmosphere and everybody was very friendly and prompt.  Our server, Jesus, was quick, very friendly and professional.  The place was busy but we were not rushed or overlooked at all.   I had the Pavorotti 1984, vegetables and cream sauce. My sons gnocchi was probably the best we've had.  Same family owners for 30 years- they are definitely doing everything right!  Prices were moderate too.  We would certainly visit again when in town!
author: Joe K.

description: One of the best Italian meals I've had in SF, the gnocchi is absolutely amazing, simple and rustic
author: Minal P.

description: Small cozy place while waiting for table the bar tender was very nice and made us some great Martinis food and service was great. We will be back
author: Dennis C.

description: The service was amazing. The waitress was great attentive. The environment was adorable so cozy like you were over at someone's house rather than a restaurant. Wine was great, the tortellini was amazing and rich in the best way. We also got the signature big macaroni which I felt like we could have skipped for the meatballs or gnocchi. I probably wouldn't go back just because of the multitude of Italian options in the city to compare to.
author: Christina P.

description:
Utterly first-rate. This is the sort of restaurant that cements the area as an Italian food mecca, and it's some of the best Italian I've ever had, anywhere. Over several visits, my wife and I have tried the mushroom and formaggio starters, the Carlesimo and Gnocchi pastas, and a pan-seared chicken special with lemon butter sauce, artichoke hearts, truffled spinach, and roasted potatoes. 

Everything has been first-rate, with their specialty pasta, the Carlesimo, being utterly delicious. The thickness and freshness of the pastas, combined with the sauces and fresh ingredients, really sets the place apart from everyday Italian. The cheese plate is also a particularly good value, as it comes with four large - and tasty - pieces of cheese, a variety of olives, and a great pepper jelly spread. Fresh bread is included with every meal, as well.

Honestly, the decor is very standard and the servers are kind but don't really go above-and-beyond, but you won't care - the food is what's truly important, and they get it completely correct. If you're looking for a great Italian meal and you happen to be in North Beach - or you want to impress friends with insider knowledge - this place is absolutely perfect. You really won't be disappointed.
author: Matthew L.

description:
This was my 2nd visit here for dinner, and I'm definitely a fan.  I believe (but not sure) that it's a family owned place, in business for about 30 years.  Located about a block off Columbus, it's a 2 story building with 2 levels of seating, and a small bar up front.  Very cozy feel.

Went here on Thur night with 3 coworkers.  Everyone had a great meal.  It's nice to see that when you order a caprese salad in California, the tomatoes are actually ripe, and they use buffalo mozzarella!  It's shocking to see what passes for caprese in other states (such as my own, I'm sad to say).  The meatballs are to die for.  Two of us had the Frutti di mare, which was full of fresh seafood, in a nice red sauce.  The others had veal saltimbocca and gnocchi, and both loved them.

The prices are reasonable, and the service is great.  Would highly recommend this place.  Make a reservation.
author: Gil W.

description:
OK----I was really torn as to how to rate this great local place. Fact is the food is really good----hands down good--no complaints.

Service---hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm not so good. Drinks are priced super high which is odd because their food is priced perfectly. Super small bathroom. Biggest complaint----no privacy--tables are on top of each other. I easily heard the entire conversations of all tables around us. I wonder if the owner is open to change? Bottom line----go for the food because it is awesome---but know its a tight fit..................
author: Chris O.

description:
Food is fresh, pasta cooked just perfect and good quality ingredients used in the making of this delicious food.

I look forward to going back!
author: David C.

description:
What a great find! we walked in just after 7 (4 of us) on a Sunday night we were asked if we had reservations, when we said no the host just smiled and sat us down promptly near a window. Their sauces were ahmazing! so so good. The spaghetti and meatballs, their gnocchi, their signature dish Carlesimo and their Pavarotti all very very tasty. Their champagne cocktail was not my favorite but  i did finish it ;)

Service was good food was excellent!
author: Sea K.

description:
Stopped in here late one night after spending too much time at a wine bar along the waterfront. The restaurant is set a bit back from Columbus, which means that you likely won't have to deal with any of the tourist crowds (excellent feature in a North Beach restaurant). The service was very good considering we showed up so late.

In terms of food, this is solid North Beach Italian. There's nothing spectacular or exciting on the menu, but it's a good mix of feel-good Italian favorites. This combination of good service and feel-good food makes this restaurant a very welcoming one, and a good choice for a meal.
author: Katie R.

description:
Trattoria Contadina is one of my favorite Italian Restaurants in the city. After spending the better half of the last 20 years living and working in the neighborhood, I don't know why it took me so long to find it. 

We've been here a handful of times over the past couple of months and everything we've had has been delicious. Bonus for those who are looking for an early dinner. They open up and 5pm and at that hour it's pretty easy to grab street parking nearby.
author: Brad C.

description: What an absolute gem in Little Italy.  Fantastic prices and authentic pasta.
author: Robert P.

description:
I had previously enjoyed a lovely evening meal with my business partner at Trattoria Contadina and, after reading their Sunday brunch menu, booked in for breakfast today with my lovely wife and business colleague.  

I enjoyed every single thing - food, atmosphere, wait staff, company - about our brunch.

My lovely wife ordered eggs purgatory whilst my colleague and I ordered the special scramble.  All was done to perfection and I really want to give a shout out to the purgatory sauce.  I should also point out the bloody mary mix that was created on premise; not brought in by can.  They use proper ingredients albeit freshly grated horseradish, tabasco, salt, celery salt, pepper, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce; all measured and mixed to spicy perfection!

The staff were very warm, friendly and accommodating and perfectly attentive:  not too much in your business; not remote and distant leaving you with the feeling that you'd been abandoned.

We arrived for 10:15 and finally went our separate ways at about 12:30, leisurely chatting away over wonderful food and drink.

If you're looking for a warm and casual spot to chat with friends on a Sunday morning over well-prepared food, you could do a lot worse than Trattoria Contadina.
author: Jay D.

description:
I always feel a little uncomfortable going against the grain, but I think this place is overrated, at least the food aspect of it. Let's get all the positives out of the way- VERY  cute. Smells AMAZING when you walk through the door. Wonderful location, wonderful setting, very very good service. 

HOWEVER... initially ordered the carbonara, and it wasn't what I expected. Nothing about the dish indicated carbonara.  They use fettuciine noodles, which is fine. They have corn and peas. Okay, sure, whatever. I just couldn't enjoy it without the egg and parmesan, and because the dish came out barely warm. I apologetically asked for a new dish, the Pavarotti pasta, which was fusili served with sun-dried tomatoes, red peppers, zucchini and chicken in a creamy pesto sauce. While the sauce was amazing, the chicken was dry and the noodles (both the linguine and fusili) tasted minimally different from any noodles out of the box I can boil up at home. Considering the raving reviews of this place, I was underwhelmed.

Prices are on par with Italian food/North Beach (approx. 25 for meat entree dishes and 15-18 for pasta dishes) but again, I imagine there are much better Italian places in North Beach.
author: Jan C.

description: Why go through all the hustle and bustle right on Columbus? This place is a knockout. Great atmosphere, cozy, and authentic. Enjoy!
author: Kevin R.

description: Hands down, the best meatballs I've ever had in my life! I love the staff as well. Everyone is so friendly. This is my definite go to place when I have out of town guests.  You can always count on good service and excellent food!
author: Marqus B.

description:
North Beach is known for Italian restaurants, but for the most part the vast majority of places in this neighborhood are a complete letdown. But there is one that has never disappointed. 

For the past several years this has become my "go to" restaurant for out of town guests who are looking for that quintessential North Beach San Francisco experience. But even for us locals there may be no better choice than TC.

The star here are the pasta dishes. Fresh, al dente and perfectly prepared sauces make any menu selection here a winner. If you're thirsty? They offer a full bar and complete wine list that includes selections in all price points.

Parking as you would expect is a pain the royal ass. Over the years I have spent hours looking a spot within a 1 mile radius and I don't even want to think about the amount of gasoline I've burned. But there are a lots just down the street which helps take the stress out of eating here. 

Trattoria Contadina is that one special place just off the main street and hidden away in on a corner. The menu is simple, but the food is amazing. The service outstanding and the atmosphere unlike no other. This all adds up to one hell of a great night out.
author: Rene C.

description:
The smell as you walk in smells delicious of garlic and butter!  

The staff is extremely friendly and wiling to accommodate.

However, when we received our order, the food was a bit on the bland side and lack to pair with the wonderful aroma of the cooking.

for our Antipasti, we ordered the following:

Carpaccio di Manzo - the filet mignon lacked flavor.  Even with the parmesan cheese, EVOO and capers, did not have a good beefy flavor to it.

Insalata:

Caprese - the tomatoes lacked flavor.  They were big meaty portions of a variety of tomatoes, but did not taste like tomatoes

Special Salad of the day was some argula and asparagus salad - no wow factor

Pasta:  All lacked flavor - even with the parmesan cheese and fresh ground peppered offered.  The only plus side was our meal came to our tables piping hot.

Melanzane - sauteed eggplant with tomatoes
Carlesimo - pancetta, porcini mushrooms, peas, and sundried tomatoes
Pasta of the day - some pancetta based pasta with cream sauce - close to a carbonara
Vongole - clams with the tomato based sauce (they give you options of garlic, butter, wine, or tomato sauce)

Main dishes 

The veal chop of the day - was okay

Glad we tried them, but was not overly impressed when there are so many other Italian restaurants to try in San Francisco.  Hopefully, the chef was having an off day because I see that lots of over reviews say that it was good here.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
03.05.10

This is Italian food exactly how I would expect an Italian grandmother to make.  It's my coworker's favorite SF restaurant and she never misses a stop here whenever she visits.  This time a few of us got to join her.

The atmosphere is cozy yet lively.  Our table was already set up by the time we arrived.  We ordered a bottle of an old world red and got to the menu.

I started with the the small radicchio salad: radicchio, arugula and watercress greens with walnuts, sun-dried tomatoes, goat cheese and a red wine balsamic vinaigrette.  $6.00.  Nothing special, but pretty delicious.

For the pasta, I had the small carlesimo: rigatoncelli pasta with pancetta, porcini mushrooms, peas, sun-dried tomatoes and a mildly spiced tomato cream sauce.  $12.00.  I LOVED this dish.  The spiced sauce definitely hit the spot.

I like the fact that you can choose your portion size, so you can try more things in one setting.

For dessert, we had the blackberry cabernet sorbet.  It's multiple scoops served in a chalet.  More than enough for the five of us to share!
author: Jenny L.

description: Lovely restaurant and the service was good. May have been an off night but we ordered the spaghetti and meatballs which were dry and flavorless.  Worst meatball in Little Italy.  We also ordered the Carlesimo which was very interesting but not worth returning for.
author: Alana G.

description: This has been our go to small Italian neighborhood place for a number of years. Not sure that will continue after last night. The most disappointing aspect was the red sauce with the fruita de mar entree. It was incredibly bland. I almost asked the waiter if the chef forgot to add some spices. I tried my wife's risotto and it was fine. My dish had absolutely no flavor. What bummer. The waiter was not very good. He spent alot of time with guests having very long fun conversations and getting more backed up by the minute. We have been here many times and enjoy the small hustle and bustle atmosphere with good food and attentive service. The only thing we got this time was the bustle. I hope they put some more love into their red sauce in the future.
author: Roy K.

description:
This place is delicious and so adorable. I was a big big fan! After almost two years of living practically next door we decided it was time to try it! 

We shared a bottle of the Durati (I think?) cab sav and it was so good. I was very pleased with our selection and would absolutely order it again.

For dinner we had:
Eggplant - the sauce was so good. reminded me of my dad's tomato sauce...the kind you want to just eat out of a spoon
Carlesimo - really rich and yummy. I wanted to finish it, but just couldn't because the portion was so generous! The flavors were really great and the pasta was cooked al dente, to perfection
Pavarotti - I'm not a big fan of chicken in my pasta, but it was good. Again, the flavors are great

The service was excellent and I really loved the atmosphere and feeling of the restaurant. I'll be back for sure.
author: Francesca F.

description: Yum.  Great service, nice wine suggestions, involved and happy owners, hardworking as well.  Make a reservation during power hours.  Cable Car stop right outside, One of my favorites, which says a lot in this town for Italiano.
author: R W.

description:
I've been wanting to try this neighborhood place for a while.  Really cute place.  Small. Has an up stairs, but downstairs is so nice with the Huge windows.  You can watch the cable cars!  It's a cozy restaurant & the service was great.

We ordered for starters a Cesar salad.  Too much dressing.  We also ordered the Bruschetta.  It was okay.  Not great.

We ordered the Vongole.  It wad good.  Had lots of fresh Manila clams in it.
My son had the Sea food pasta, which he liked.

The food was just fine.  It wasn't great.
author: Marie E.

description: My favorite Italian place in the city!  Really quaint and cozy.  Everything we've ever had on this menu is delicious.  My standby is always the Carlesimo.  I don't eat meat so I get it without the pancetta.  My husband and friends have ordered the meat ravioli, spaghetti/meatballs and the chicken cacciatore.  ALL have been amazing.  You can't go wrong here.
author: K N.

description:
Would probably come back to this classic Italian North Beach hideaway.
Good food at good prices, good atmosphere, good crowd.
Notice the absence of the word "great", but still-Good is good!

Highlights:

-Beef Ravioli 
-Spaghetti with sausage in creamy pesto
-full bar/well made drinks
-atmosphere

Lowlights:

-Bread (everything your reading here about their bread is true, cheap, bland, cold - Safeway bakery has a better offering, where are they finding this kitchen sponge they call bread??!
-Service was okay (not bad, just okay)
-parking (but hey, it's North Beach that's a given)
author: Andrew P.

description:
YUUUUM! I cannot emphasize how superb the pasta is here! I shared the chicken ravioli (half order) and a full order of the dungeness crab special of the day fusilli pasta. The mushrooms and fresh parmesan were excellent and the dishes were so good I INSISTED on taking the leftovers for my lunch and I was ready to get into an argument over it if necessary. Ummm my lunch tomorrow is soo gonna rock!

We called in advance on a Sat night and they said they had no reservations but we found some 9:30PM reservations online. Also,  if you walk in on a Saturday night after 9PM they should have some tables open. We found a few available while we were seated.

The bathroom is nasty and the soap dispenser didn't work (won't affect my rating but still.. kinda gross)

The bread is meh but I don't go to Italian restaurants to eat free bread so again doesn't affect my rating. 

Great location as it's off the main strip!
author: Kathy S.

description: Pretty delicious. The burrata appetizer wasn't so great -- rather oily. The clam and wine-butter pasta was fantastic. Elegant, understated interior made for an enjoyable and relaxed meal. Definitely coming back.
author: Aaron G.

description:
Went there on a Friday night with two girlfriends. The service was super slow, we waited over an hour for the food. And then they messed up our order and brought risotto instead of pasta. In addition, the pasta I ordered was supposed to be with tomato sauce but came with pesto sauce! Seems like everything went wrong. The food was just okay, definitely overpriced. 
The two stars only deserved for the fabulous, divine Tiramisu!
author: Tanja D.

description:
Italian food done simply and done well!  

Honestly I had a hard time choosing what to eat because everything on the menu looked really simple.  The simplest dishes are the easiest to mess up and I hoped to minimize that risk.  Luckily I had nothing to worry about because they made my favorite Italian dish perfectly! I love linguini with clams theirs was very flavorful.  Lots of lemon, butter, garlic, but very complimentary and in a light, broth-like white wine sauce.

I also had the sampler of pickled appetizers as well as the barbabietola salad, both of which were very delicious!

Here are the names of the dishes I had:

Barbabietola - arugula salad with beets and a balsamic vinaigrette.

Vongole - Linguini with sauteed clams, lemon, butter and lots of garlic.

My friend had the linguini pasta with homemade meatballs in red sauce, which the waiter recommended as his favorite.  I'll probably be trying this when I return.

All in all, a very enjoyable Italian dinner!
author: Erica D.

description: The place is not fancy but charming, and the food is outstanding.  The food is old school / authentic Italian.  The meatballs are to die for. Plan on making a reservation a few days in advance for dinner as it's hard to get in as a walk-in. Last seating is at 900pm but you can stay in until midnight.  Their Sunday brunch is easier to get into last minute and the food is also fantastic.  Highly recommended.
author: Michael W.

description: This place is just the best. Feels like you're part of the family. Positively delicious menu.  Fair prices. Service is spot on.
author: Kris C.

description:
I was in the city meeting a good friend of mine that was vising from Nevada.  The party we were with took us to this restaurant.  It was very nice, small, cozy.  The caesar salad was VERY good.. I could have eaten it all just for my dinner.  We had appetizers, carpaccio and bruscetta.  They raved about them, I tried the carpaccio and I guess its an acquired taste!  

I think we all ordered pasta and we all were pleased.  Cappellini is probably one of my favorite italian dishes.. but this one was a little on the dry side.  I like a little more 'juice' or 'sauce' with my pasta!  Service was very good and if I'm ever around there again I'd definitely go back.
author: Christine V.

description: My foody friends recommended this place to me and it was as good as they said.  The best Italian restaurant I have been to for a long time.  We shared a plate of spaghetti with meatballs as an appetizer which was excellent.  I had the seafood stew which was excellent, first time that I ate the broth like it was pho or a nice soup.  Long lines to get in so make a reservation.  The veal was fabulous and was pleasantly surprised to find shrimp on top.
author: Steve T.

description:
Decent food.

The charcuterie was pretty good, some interesting meats, but nothing mind blowing.

The spaghetti and meatballs was pretty terrible actually. The meatballs were totally dry. Tasted like they had been microwaved, and had been prepared much earlier.

The carbonara was alright. Again, the ingredients didn't taste super fresh. The corn seemed like it was from a can. It didn't have that just-tossed-with-an-egg feeling.

That said the service is really nice, the place itself is cute and they have SUPER YUMMY moscow mules. So it's an OK choice.
author: Shanee B.

description: The quality of the pasta here is so amazing and fresh. The one i had was the first one in the menu which they recommend. It has a creamy tomato sauce that makes me salivate at just the thought of it and the pancetta in it is so guiltily delicious. Tossed in with mushrooms and chickpeas, the al dente pasta was easily cleared off my plate.  The chicken breast plate is also extremely flavorful and juicy (sorry forgot all the names of the food, too busy eating as usu). It's funny because looking back i realized the whole time I was eating with my mom, our conversation consisted only of "mmm" and "so good" and other noises of immense satisfaction back and forth. Definitely a must try if you're around the area. Service is good, ambiance is cutesy, and i had no wait for an early sunday dinner. Only cons: very small space for seating and pricey but you get what you pay for!
author: Lyn Y.

description: The service was ok and food was just like any other italian venue in sf within this range. they did have a great wine selection and were able to accomodate a large group!
author: Kiran J.

description: A truly "cantina Italiana" where you can taste a good Italian wine or beer and eat nice Italian food. A "small" place with real Italian spirit! Highly recommended! Also, beautiful view of Mason Street. Certainly a place to come back!
author: Rodrigo M.

description: Everything was so SALTY...usually family owned restaurants in North Beach turn out pretty good (even the ones with fewer reviews and lower rating) but this place is just MEH. No comparison to Tommaso's.
author: Anji S.

description: Service was a 5+. Food was outstanding 5+. Loved the roasted pepper, it will be one of our favorite dishes that we try to replicate at home. We also enjoyed the olives, gnocchi and the Carliesimo pasta. Great experience for our 15 year wedding anniversary!!!
author: Steve H.

description:
I'm in love!!! I love pasta and this place does it right! 

I like how they offer two sizes to their pasta dishes since pasta can be so filling.  My friends and I originally wanted to come here for a sit down dinner but we were planning to go out later on that night so we ended up getting take-out.  I ordered the Carlesimo along with one of my other friend.  I got mines without peas.  It was really good and creamy.  My friend who had it with the peas said it was kind of weird for him.  Our other friend had the Fresco, which was a nice healthy tasting dish.

I would say if you want to come here for dinner, you should make reservation in advance, trying to do it the same night will get you no reservations.
author: Mimi P.

description: Consistently one of my favorite spots in the city along with great service, fantastic food!  I don't live in town but always seek it out when in town.  Highly recommended especially the stuffed peppers
author: M S.

description:
I came here Sunday night for dinner with my husband and my parents. I made a reservation and I was seated right away. 

We brought our own wine and the corkage fee was $20. We ordered the stuffed bell pepper and mushroom appetizers. It took them a very long time to serve the food, but it was delicious! The food was fresh, simply, with lots of flavors. I highly recommend ordering anything with the tomato cream sauce, it has slightly spicy and I loved it! 

I would definitely come back!

The restaurant itself is tucked away into a small two story old house, it is romantic and great for special occasions.  Do not come here if you are looking for a quick bite to eat. This place is all about the experience and ambiance.
author: Julie J.

description: I love the ambience here!  Also, the food is really fantastic.  My only minor complaint would be that the tables are very close together because the restaurant is small.  I think the prices are very reasonable for the quality of the food and portion size.  I also absolutely love the pasta dishes here and will go back again and again.
author: Adina H.

description: We wanted to love this place. The reservation was easy to make, but when we showed up, our table wasn't ready. We ordered antipasti, pasta, and secondi, and our waitress was thoughtful enough to recommend 1/2 portions of the pasta since it was a lot of food. We ordered drinks, but then they were out of raspberry syrup. We ordered coca cola, but then it was flat. We ordered the saltimbocca, but then they ran out of potatoes. The saltimbocca also had a bit too much rosemary (maybe another spice?) so it overpowered the entire dish. Probably just an off night.
author: Brianne P.

description:
I had heard of the legend of Trattoria Contadina for many years, but I was very comfortable with the rotation of my North Beach spots and hadn't gotten around to getting there.  My super-Italian friend, Vince R, told me that I had to try it.  And when a genuine Italian gives you advice on a must eat spot - you listen. 

We got an early reservation this busy Valentine's weekend, and totally lucked out by catching a parking spot half a block away.  The restaurant is TINY, maybe 12-15 tables in the L-shaped dining room.  We sat under a wall of autographed photos from various celebs and athletes that had been there.  We enjoyed some Pinot...

Being it was our Valentine's Dinner - we decided to splurge and order 4-courses.  We ordered the Bruchetta and a small order of Gnocchi to start us off.  The bruchetta arrived first, and I was disappointed to see it was only two pieces.  While it was ok, it was easily the most underwhelming portion of our meal.  Immediately after, the gnocchi made its way to the table.  It was solid, served in a great creamy tomato sauce and topped with fresh grated parm.  The dumplings could have been softer, but overall it was rock solid.

For the main course I ordered the Chicken Santi (chicken breast, pancetta, white mushrooms, sun dried tomatoes, garlic, penne pasta in a vodka cream sauce)... and the wifey ordered the Pavoratti (chicken, pancetta, sun dried tomatoes, zucchini, fusilli pasta in cream sauce).  Those too arrived in a flash - my wife immediately had remorse when she saw my Santi.  While she liked hers, she really loved mine.  I let her pick away at it, but if it weren't Valentine's - she would have lost a hand!!  It was perfection!  Even the lady at the table next to ours actually asked what it was that I had because it looked so good.  The Santi was the highlight of the meal.

Finally, we enjoyed a little White Chocolate Covered Ice-Cream Heart, with a Strawberry Sorbet filling for dessert.  It too hit the spot.

Overall, like many other North Beach spots - 5 stars.  It is my wife's new favorite spot, however Firenze By Night remains my #1 spot.  I should also mention that their service was flawless.  We'll be back!!
author: Joel V.

description:
This place is always super packed and after tonight's dinner, I now know why.  The service is attentive and the server is very nice and takes care of you.

Everything is super fresh.  The pasta is cooked el dente.  My friend and I had two dishes:
1) Spaghetti with Garlic Sausage (they didn't make meat balls today because of the meat loaf).  The red sauce was very rich and fresh
2) Carlsemo: The cream sauce was rich and the pasta was chewy and yummy.  They used a lot of pancetta and there was a good balance of meat and pasta

Dessert here was fantastic also. 

The place is rustic and you are seated close to other people.  A very romantic / low key place. 

Would definitely come back here when I am craving Italian food. cannot wait to come back!!
author: Wendy K.

description:
Quite possibly the best pasta experience of my life.  I came here last night with 4 friends.  We made reservations on Open Table, and when one friend was stuck in traffic and I needed to change the time of the reservations, they were incredibly understanding.

We were seated upstairs and our server, Marqus, told us all about the specials and what his favorite dishes were.  Between the 5 of us there were two orders of the Carlesimo, two orders of a pesto dish that was one of the specials, and an order of gnocchi.  Everyone was OVERJOYED with their meals, and we were all excited to taste the others that we didn't personally order.

Take-away:  This place is the shit and I am making my parents take me here for my birthday.  I'm probably going to order the Carlesimo again because it was so incredible- I was actually upset that it was not my dinner again tonight.  Marqus is also the BEST.  Everyone else that we encountered at the restaurant was also fantastic, but Marqus is a STAR.
author: Nora S.

description: They started a Sunday brunch in the last year and it has blown my mind every time. From the lemon ricotta pancakes to the breakfast risotto - you will not be disappointed. And the coffee and bloody marys make it even that much better. Sadly, it hasn't quite taken off like they planned and they might only continue it through October 2014. Please go and try for yourself! It is a decadent, fantastic brunch.
author: Ferol G.

description: Ordered Clams and Mussels and the sauce was way too salty and sour. Pumpkin cheesecake was ok. Ended up spending $20 on one appetizer which was far from exceptional
author: Eva D.

description:
Delicious! Friendly! Fun!

Cute little corner restaurant with delicious food!

Corkage fee was not worth it but I had a great night.
author: Melissa T.

description: Came here for my post courthouse wedding dinner with my family.  They were able to accomodate for our party comfortably.  The wait staff was very attentive and patient with our party of 10.  Everyone enjoyed their authentic Italian dinner.  I was in love with my pesto pasta with green beans and my husband got the veal dinner which he loved a lot.  Overall I would come back to this place for a good Italian meal.  It was a little pricey but that was expected for the area and meal.
author: Bianca G.

description: great casual home-y italian restaurant. authentic homemade italian food! the gnocchi and the pavarotti were amazing! for appetizers we got the cheese plate and the meatballs, all delicious.
author: Kelli L.

description:
