Only reason I am giving a 4 rather than a 5 star is that I was freezing all through dinner.  We sat near the door (ask for another table in towards the back you make reservations) .  It was a colder winter night and I wore my coat all through dinner.

Beyond that, the food was so delish and the service was right on par.   I ordered a seafood with spaghetti dish.  That is my usual choice at an Italian restaurant, so I can be picky.  Their dish was great - seafood was cooked properly and their sauce complemented it well.  My boyfriend ordered a pasta & sausage dish, which he loved  (he cleaned the entire large sized plate).    Based off a Yelp review we ordered the Peppers appetizer and it  did not fail to meet expectations.  It's a relatively simple app.  It's pepper sliced in half and laid on its side (you only get one half) and then filled with several cheeses.  While it would be tough to match it's level of deliciousness, I'm inspired to recreate it at home.  

I would recommend making reservations as the restaurant itself is pretty small.  We saw a larger party go through a door, so I'm guessing there is a back room, but I never saw it.   

Oh! And also watch  out for the parking situation if your driving.  We went super early with plans to walk the area for 20-30 min before dinner. That def didnt happen because we were circling for parking that long.  In the end we ended up parking in a lot that was $10 for 2 hours.  Next time we'll be skipping the search and will just parking in the lot right away.

Happy eating :)
author: Kalah A.

description: Enjoyed this family run restaurant. We went on a Saturday night so a reservation was a must as it is a small place. Loved the in house made gnocchi, meatballs and red sauce!  Service was exceptional    We ordered a couple of dishes with smoked cheeses and found it a prominent taste so be aware when ordering.
author: Susan S.

description: Small place which was a little too warm for but food and service were excellent. My son and I shared the eggplant appetizer which was outstanding!!  I had the carlesimio rigatoncelli which was excellent. My son had the Salvatore (chicken ravioli ) which he thought was excellent as well. More of a pasta place Although they had a fish and veal on the me menu as well. Highly recommend.
author: Clayton A.

description: This place is pretty good.. we came because we thought they had beef carpaccio and they did not, and that was a bit of a disappointment. The antipasti appetizer with the meats/cheese/olives is great, and quite large! The meatballs were very good also. Beer list was decent, especially for an Italian restaurant.  Hope to come back for dinner next time, but we left in search of carpaccio!
author: James L.

description:
I dislike tourist traps and I dislike heavy/fatty Italian-American cuisine.  While cutting through the middle of North Beach, my biggest fear occurred when my companion whined "I'm hungry, I want to eat now!"  I quickly pulled out my Yelp for the Android and looked for a highly rated restaurant with 100s of reviews.  BINGO!  No tourists, no [obese] family sized portions, no manicotti and no lasagna!  This place serves homey food without the North Beach clichés.  It's no Quince, but great casual food if stranded in that neighborhood. 

Pepperoni Arrostiti: Roasted yellow pepper with three cheeses and some tomato sauce.  Simple, yet very tasty.  A much more exciting way to get your cheese fix than through a typical mozzarella and tomato salad.  Around the same price as many of the pasta entrées, so definitely an indulgent anitpasto.

Carlesimo: If meatballs are too commonplace for you, this is your dish!  Thick pancetta bits, porcini, peas and sun dried tomatoes offer a complexity of textures and flavors to this dish.  I especially enjoyed how the peas added a fresh pasty contrast.  The creamy tomato sauce added extra indulgence, almost like eating liquefied cheese.  The rigatoncelli seemed like it was freshly made rather than from a box, always a plus in my book.

Gnocchi: These gnocchi were little squares of ricotta that were chewy and hearty.  I don't think there was any potato in them since I never sensed a overly starchy center.  It was simple and I liked it.  Same nice sauce as with the Carlesimo.
author: Adam B.

description: A legend, and rightfully so.  Nobody leaves this place unhappy.  The best italian food in North Beach, loved by locals for generations.
author: Kaveh A.

description:
A great family restaurant in North Beach, worth walking off the beaten path and up the hill. I was in the mood for Italian food and with a group of four I thought this was the perfect place. A nice warm homey atmosphere, I was impressed by the posters of the best Italian boxers, football and baseball players. To start off..nice warm french bread accompanied with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.

For appetizers, ordered the antipasto plate ($16), a platter full of flavorful cured meats, cheeses, sun dried tomatoes, roasted peppers and warm olives. Yes, warm olives. The chianti was a nice addition to the appetizers. 
Main entree ordered was the Vongole large dish ($18), linguni pasta with sauteed clams in shells with linguini noodles cooked in al dente. The sauce was a lemon, butter, garlic and wine sauce. I like garlic but the garlic was a little too much because it shadowed the taste of the clams. 
It was kinda nice because the waiter had made a mistake with one of the dishes and he left the dish of Carlesimo, an entree of rigatoncelli pasta with pancetta, porcini mushrooms and a flavorful cream sauce.
I like the fact that their are two sizes on the pasta dishes-small & large.Very good service, worth coming back to.
author: Jim D.

description: Trattoria Contadina has become one of my very favorite spots in the city.  There is a total cozy San Francisco vibe to this little North Beach gem, right along the cable car track.  Each time we have visited, the service has been warm, friendly and completely attentive.  And the food is fab!  Killer pastas, beautiful entrees, and delicious apps and deserts, and the prices are total do-able!
author: Amy A.

description: Brilliant food, amazing wait staff, tables are close together to inspire some friendly back and forth between diners. Great pastas!
author: Alex O.

description:
Had the Gnocchi with Asiago sauce - rich and creamy but not too much (which happens often in other restaurants in my experience ). Great setting nested between Russian Hill and North Beach (away from all the traffic and lack of parking in the heart of NB). 

Service was prompt and friendly. We were even seated half an hour before our reservation, which was nice.
author: Robert K.

description: I pass by this place all the time and have been meaning to try. Finally tried it last week and I am so happy I did! Great comfort Italian food, the weather has been freezing lately and we wanted something warm for dinner, this really hit the spot. The staff is super nice and accommodating and all three dishes we ordered were awesome. Definitely worth going to if you're craving Italian!
author: Lizzy U.

description: Great little Italian spot. The mushroom risotto was delicious and the staff was super friendly.
author: Asia F.

description:
It use to be my favorite place ( third generation ownership) when the parents ran it....I really want to say that the food was really good....I use to be able to say that....I had two others with me that agree with my rating...I'm bummed that I have to say that one of my favorite places wasn't that good today.....ahhhhhhhh.

Many years ago I would visit this vibrate restaurant and order the wonderful Pavarotti Fusilli....It was so good that I would try to reproduce this sensation at home.   But those days have long gone....I ordered this today, and the pasta lacked taste, it was over sauced, and service was average at best.   I been wanting to return here for years.....What happened to my place!!!!  I think they may have lost me for another bunch of years....at least until this memory goes away....I want that good taste back...


..Cant recommend it.
author: Ron B.

description:
Solid 4 stars. Had the bruschetta, spaghetti and meatballs (for the kid), Picatta and the Summer Pavoratti. All very good. Loved my veal and prawn picatta.
Tiramisu was very good.
Small, intimate place. Cozy.
Would return.
author: Tom A.

description:
So incredibly disappointed with my experience at this restaurant. I had been looking forward to going to this restaurant for weeks. I planned a special night for my husband and myself. Unfortunately, our schedules are crazy so I wasn't sure what time we'd get there. Therefore, we were not able to make a reservation.

As we walked up to the restaurant we saw that it was very busy and were anticipating a long wait. I was totally fine with waiting, until the front door seater (who I think was also the manager) made me feel like we should leave. First of all, he told us we were looking at an hour and a half wait. This seemed a little exaggerated since there were very few people actually standing around waiting for a table. But it was the way he said it that bothered me. He really made us feel like there was no point in us waiting. We decided to wait nonetheless. We walked up to one side of the bar and he told us we were in the way and could not stand there. So I found a seat and my husband stood behind me. But no more than 5 min later another couple stood where we had just been and he offered them free drinks because they had a reservation and it wasn't ready on time. I asked him why we weren't allowed to stand there but they were and he was tongue-tied for a good reason. Naturally, I am pretty upset at this point. During this whole thing we had been waiting for one stinking cocktail from the bartender for at least 15 minutes.

So we've already wasted 30 minutes at this restaurant and we're seriously considering leaving, but we decided to stay because we have heard such good things about the food and I didn't feel like searching for a new restaurant at this point. We ended up being seated after only 40 minutes, which I knew was more likely than an hour and a half. To top off the experience, the food was utterly disappointing. We had the Gamberoni and the Carlesimo. Both were just not up to my standards of great Italian food. The wine was good but I was honestly just drinking it to numb the pain of a terrible restaurant experience. 

We still tipped generously because I know it was the front door guy who really made this a 1 star experience, but needless to say, I will never come back to this restaurant.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: I picked Trattoria Contadina because of its family owned and home like atmosphere, and I am happy to say that feeling transmits to the dining experience as well. The Correnti family was incredibly supportive and went the extra mile when I asked for impromptu support to deliver a suprise to the table. The service was spot on and the food was delicious. The Osso Buco fell off the bone and I had to fight to keep it to myself. The bell pepper appetizer was outstanding as well. I don't know what the sauce was but it made me want much more. Everybody had something different and all dishes were delectable. The wine list has a nice array of italian favorites( the soave was outstanding) Cocktails were spot on and dessert was equally tasty. We will be sure to return soon for many more occasions. Thank you so much, all of you, for a wonderful evening and an unforgettable experience!
author: Rick S.

description:
Took a friend there for birthday. Had reservations.  Man at door kept seating everyone but us.  Two cars drove up and were seated without reservations. I ask them and they were kind enough to tell me they we're walk ins.
Man at door said he didn't see us 5 feet away from him and was very flip about the whole matter. Came by to offer two glass wine but refused one as I was driving.
People came in after us and were served and had dessert and left b4 we did

Chicken way over cooked, they did not offer to get anything else but brought a cake and slid it on the table for birthday.it was getting worse.  Word had gotten out and we were now the enemy.  Very petty.  We have been coming for years and sent all our friends too.  You can now look forward to our friends telling their friends.

Was better when family present And running things.  Man at reception needs to go be successful ay McDonalds.  Not worthy of your reputation

Fun evening turned ugly by your staff.  Really too bad   We used to send everyone there
author: Dean B.

description:
I lived in North Beach for 10 months and this is the one and only Italian restaurant I'm even going to bother recommending. The atmosphere is not 'trendy' but it's welcoming and genuine. I wouldn't get excited about the space... but I WILL get excited about the food! So good! 

We are talking legit Italian - giant plates of pasta. They offer a nice selection of varied dishes ranging from light vegetarian pastas to heavy, rich meat pastas with perfectly blended ingredients. I really love how you can order full or half plates of pasta. A half plate is more than enough to consider a meal and you can do a salad or other app to start. I've always had pasta and apps here so I can't vouch for the main courses. Very good value for the prices. You'll walk out full and smiling!
author: Amber C.

description:
Very romantic and quaint restaurant on a corner. It's quiet and meek - as we walked up you could hardly recognize or realize it was a restaurant from a distance. 

Service was great - some things were strangely proportioned. Bruschetta was $7 and they gave us one each. Bread with olive oil was good. They weren't very big pieces, either. Boyfriend had risotto and raved about it the rest of the trip. Mine was pasta with zucchini - lots of zucchini so this made me very happy.

The next morning we ran into the host on the street and he remembered us, so we talked for a long time and he was very informative about the city and friendly.

I think the food is pleasant and the atmosphere is just as nice. I definitely preferred this to the places lining up Columbus Ave.
author: Allyson D.

description:
I just had dinner here with my folks and it was a real treat!  We lucked out with the corner table even though I made the reservation 1 hour beforehand.  At TC, some privacy is good because the restaurant is laid out as one big open room.  Needless to say, if there are any slightly drunk patrons the place can be a little loud.

The food was exceptional.  We started with bruschetta, which was moist, but not soggy.  The tomatoes were incredibly fresh and delicious.  For dinner I ordered Saltimbocca, or veal parmesan.  Delicious would be an understatement.  The food was exceptional.  It was the kind of meal that you have to eat slowly or you'll otherwise miss out on the subtleties of the dish.  I left feeling very satisfied.  

My only gripe was the slower service.  I liked it toward the end of the meal because we weren't rushed, but at the start it took 20 minutes before the wine we ordered was served.  I don't mind waiting, I do mind waiting for my vino.  :)
author: John M.

description: I went here on my birthday and it was fantastic. Gina was very pleasant and the entire staff are very welcoming, professional and on the ball. The food was amazing all of my guests had a fantastic dining experience. -Wonderful! Thank You all so much =) I will be back great food!
author: The Thinker M.

description:
Really nice cozy restaurant in a somewhat hidden corner of north beach.. its not right on columbus, so I am guessing a lot fewer tourists show up here.
The food is really awesome.. awesome selection of vegetarian pastas and appetizers.. I especially love the cheese ravioli and gnocchi.
The desserts were pretty good too.. we tried their tiramisu and some kind of mousse pastry.. pretty good!
The waitstaff and the owner are super-nice. The place is small, full of people, but not too noisy.. great place for a conversation alongside some really good italian food!
author: Aditya M.

description: The best meal I had during my stay in San Francisco.  The same chef from when my parents went on their honeymoon 26 years ago is still there! The ravioli was amazing! The waitstaff was very attentive.
author: Paige G.

description:
One of the office assistants in my GF's office recommended this, and I was told this is the BEST home made italian food in the city. I came here with high expectations, and I really wanted to like it but it wasn't anything special on my list. 

like always especially when trying a new restaurant we wanted to try everything. So between 4 people we had a lot of food.

Bruschetta x4 (fresh tomatoes and great crispy bread)
These stuffed Peppers (very cheesy, but i love cheese so it didn't bother me but it bothered peopel i was eating with)
Capreses (nothing special about this, small pieces of mozzarella, not enough basil)
Mussels (cracked mussels, semi-fresh
Carlesimo (supposedly their signature dish, i didn't think there was anything special)
Correnti (veal was dry, pasta was a bit flavorless)
Pesce Marsala (probably the best dish, i liked this dish the best)
the Lamb dish (Gamey, but when i eat at french restaurants not as gamey as this...)
and one more pasta dish with sausage a pesto sauce and shell pasta. (my pasta was a bit bland, i needed more parmigiano reggiano and some chili flakes, to boost the flavor  
Tiramisu (dry)

All in all the most important part for my meal is the main course because that is where all the food is, and especially at an italian restaurant you need good pasta. This place only had alright pasta. Overall my experience warranted a 3 stars, i will be back in the future sometime, just don't know when.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
Great food and great service!

Our dinner reservation for 11 was ready upon arrival.  We were the ones who were a little late because of having a hard time with parking.  I peered through the windows right before we walked in and wondered... where will we sit?  Our server lead us toward the back of the restaurant and up a narrow staircase... onto this hidden loft-like area.  How cozy!  I loved how our tables didn't receive much foot traffic.  

Food:
I ordered the Carlesimo, per our server's strong recommendation.  Rigatoncelli pasta with pancetta, porcini mushrooms, peas, sun-dried tomatoes and a mildly spiced tomato cream sauce.  I loved how the flavor of the sun-dried tomatoes, porcini mushrooms, and spiced cream sauce played with/against each other.  Topped with freshly grated parmesan cheese, it was perfect.

Service:
Our servers were very patient with us.  You could tell they loved working there.  They actually fooled me, as I thought they were Italian based on the way they were pronouncing all the menu items.  I have to say, also, that they were very patient with us, as our table of 11 definitely had a lot of questions to ask about what was on that menu.

To sum up:
I will wholeheartedly recommend this place to friends and will visit again.
author: Krystal Nina L.

description:
I've been living in North Beach for 3 years and this is one of the few places I frequent and will recommend to friends.  Most of the Italian restaurants in North Beach are heavily catered towards tourists and can get away with mediocre food, since most diners are out of towners and won't be back again.  Trattoria Contadina definitely stands out from the rest.

PROS
- Fresh pasta, made daily, always al dente (they have a couple pastas made fresh in-house and the rest are delivered each morning from a local pasta shop)
- Excellent sauces (very well balanced, tasty)
- Pasta orders available in half size or full size, depending on your appetite or for those who like variety (I've gone with friends and ordered a variety of different pastas for sharing)
- My favorites: For pasta, Carlesimo and Salvatore; For appetizers, you can't go wrong with the roasted stuffed peppers--they were grilled so the natural sweetness came out, with savory soft cheeses, and a very tasty spicy tomato sauce that complimented the combination quite nice
- Close to bars and gellato, if you want some after dinner activity

CONS
- Parking is a bit ridunkulous in this area
- Kind of small and need reservations

HIGHLIGHT
- Fresh pasta! It's amazing!
author: Miyuki I.

description:
Very neighborhood-y, close to North Beach but so much better than anything you'll find there. Its a few blocks (downhill!) from my house and one of my favorite places in SF!
I most recently tried:
Mussels: yum. some clams were added too. white wine sauce.
Caprese: so fresh! add a little salt & pepper and you're good to go!
Fresca: penne with spinach, sun dried tomatoes and mushrooms. simple yet delicious. a half portion was big enough for me!
author: Sara P.

description: Lovely little restaurant. Food was  okay but pricey. Don't think I would go back. My wife liked her vongole, my clams had some sand in them.
author: Greg C.

description: The friendliest owners / staff / bartenders I have encountered in a long time.  Perfect neighborhood GEM that I will return to again and again.  Everything on the menu is A++.
author: Ryan M.

description:
We tried their Pavarotti, Vongole, and rissotto. I ordered Pavarotti because someone here said that it's good, but I think it's very bland... The vongole is very mediocre as well. The rissotto however tastes really good. Granted I never eat any rissotto before, but it's definitely the highlight of our meal.

Service went downhill when we told the waitress that we weren't ordering any drinks. Other than having water refilled by the water guy, the waitress didn't ask us if everything is ok during the meal, while asking everyone else around us. Rude?
author: Novalina N.

description: Amazing, traditional Italian joint. Best in SF I've had. Cute, cozy and definitely need to make a reservation any night of the week. Meatballs are outstanding!
author: Katie A.

description: This is a local family business, which is in the heart of the neighborhood.  Off the main strip of Columbus, but well,worth it.  We were a party of five and we shared everyone's dish, plus a couple of appetizers.  The food was excellent, and the sauces all yum! We will definitely go back on our next visit.  The waitress and service was very good as well.  The place was tight and loud, but it made for great ambience!!!
author: Ronald P.

description:
Italian food in North Beach is ironically and unfortunately hit or miss.  Most places are taking advantage of the foot traffic and the fact that you are unlikely to be a repeat customer.  If you do find yourself looking for Italian in North Beach, take a step off of Columbus and come get some great food at Trattoria Contadina.

The bruschetta is fantastic.  The pepperoni arrostiti (roasted sweet peppers in a cream sauce) is one of the best combinations of flavor available - you will find yourself asking for extra bread to soak up the residual sauce after the peppers are gone...

All of the pastas and secondi plates I've had are great.  I am particularly fond of pasta carlesimo (with pancetta and a spicy, creamy tomato sauce) and the valdostana (basically a cheese and prosciutto stuffed chicken breast).   Exactly what you'd expect in a amily run Italian trattoria.

The sign that says "we're not for sale" is amusing...
author: Mark F.

description: This is my favorite Italian place I've been to in San Francisco.  I've gone about three times now.  Every dish I've had is good, with my favorite being their Cesar salad with anchovies.  The Carlesimo is amazing as well, but any pasta plate you order you really can't go wrong
author: Brian K.

description: Really great place. The meatballs as an appetizer were the best I ever had (sorry mom). The bruschetta was excellent. We shared the Fruitta de mare, which was also excellent and fresh. The price was unbelievably inexpensive. Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgable. The best Italian restaurant I have been to.
author: David H.

description:
One random day, the wifey and I decided to dine here. This is what I've gathered:

1. Parking is a bitch. Take a taxi or better yet take the cable car. It'll drop you off right in front.

2. Make reservations. It's small, and they put the seats together pretty close. Italian hospitality.

3. DO order the Bruschetta, the Conchiglie, or the Risotto. Hell, their house meatballs are awesome too.

4. DO NOT order the gniocchi. The sauce came out a neon orange. Reminded me of a famous dish from Signore James Kraft. Turned me off. Then I ordered the Conchiglie with fennel sausage: AWESOME.

5. Wait staff was quick and responsive. People had their A-game that night.

6. THIS IS NOT A TOURIST TRAP. So all you idiots who say "I know italian, my family is italian" but really you're from New York "italian", save it and eat here. It's a good place.
author: Arturo F.

description: We absolutely enjoyed celebrating our 7 year anniversary today! My wife was overwhelming surprised with the gift but our favorite dishes are Carlesimo & Salvatore!! We flew from Dallas, TX to just eat at this restaurant just to celebrate!! The best Italian food!
author: Paul P.

description:
Good not very good. Overall, 3.5 stars!  Here's the rundown on what my buddy and I ordered tonight: 
* mushroom appetizer: 3.5 out of 5 stars. Good "Marsala like sauce." 
* stuffed half pepper,with 3 cheeses appetizer: 4 of 5 stars. Tasty and good,sauce. Good for mopping up,with bread. 
* Paparadelle (spelling?) with lamb and pork ragu: 3.5 out of  5 stars. Pasta had good consistency. Sauce was meaty. Good portion. Ragu had a strange flavor. 
* Frutti di Mare: 3.5 stars out of 5. Lots of,seafood,but the white wine sauce lacked flavor and complexity.
* Bottle of Nero D'Avola: 3.5 stars out of 5. 
* Free bread with olive oil. 4 of 5 stars. 
* Service: 4 out of 5 stars. Fun and friendly! 
Yes, overall I would return and would recommend to friends.
author: H E.

description:
For a casual Italian meal that is simple and delicious, you cannot go wrong with Trattoria Contadina.  I love this place.

The salads are great and the meatball starter is yum!

My favorite pasta entree is not on the menu (yep, they let you order off menu!).  I love their tomato cream sauce and ask for it with rigatoni.  Oy, it's good stuff!

Service is always friendly and accommodating.  The restaurant has an intimate neighborhood feel and can get pretty busy, so I would suggest making a reservation (especially if you have a group of 4 or more).
author: Jen Y.

description: Although the restaurant seems a bit dark downstairs, I was surprise there was a upstairs. The food was delicious and filling. Fantastic Italian food.
author: Karen J.

description: What a special meal we had, my daughter and I had just seen Beach Blanket Babylon and wanted a neighborhood Italian restaurant. Trattoria Contadina did not disappoint - a neighborhood feel - we sat in a window table looking out at the street. The service was nice but the food was delicious! Presented in a simple enjoyable fashion (not at all pretentious) We started with bruschetta - loved the tastiness of the tomatoes, wonderful olive oil seved with the bread. My daughter had gnocchi and I had clam pasta - we had no problem getting to the bottom of the bowl!! Yum. Big recommend and we would love to return on another trip to San Francisco.
author: Cynthia F.

description: My husband and I were craving Italian so Yelp guided us to this wonderful little place on a Sunday afternoon. This is not a high-end restaurant, but it doesn't matter because the customer service and food make up for the lack of tablecloth and fancy waiters. For example, they were serving Sunday brunch, but the chef was kind enough to make a dish from the dinner menu that we really wanted to try. Tiny bar, but the Bloody Mary blew me away - and I don't even like Bloody Marys! My favorite thing was the 3-Meatball appetizer; we practically licked the plate clean of the sauce. We're really happy that we listened to other Yelpers and tried this place... Will definitely be coming back.
author: Convict T.

description:
I a bit late in writing this, but I must say, really not that impressed, considering the hype and wait time to get a seat if you don't have a reservation.

My boyfriend lives right around the corner and we decided to finally check out what Trattoria Contadina has to offer. From the start we did have relatively easy service and managed to snag a no-show reserved table. As usual, I was a bit disappointed with the wine selection that seems to be an ever present problem in North Beach - freakin' Italian food left and right and yet try to find a decent wine outside of Iluna Basque? Forget it! I went for a St. Germaine based cocktail instead that was so-so.

Dinner was quick, although our bread, drinks and parmesan service was not. Zach got this cheesy sauced gnocci dish that literally tasted like Better Cheddar crackers in liquid form. I opted for the tortellini in creamy red sauce, substituting fresh tomatoes instead of sun-dried that was pleasing, but nothing short of what I could have prepared at home.

Verdict?
Half-block from Zach's +1
St. Germaine +1
Menu substitution +1
Wine selection -1
Waiting for my parmesan -1
Squished in corner table -1
Food -neutral-

Given that I give all business a 3 to start when walking in the door, I think it's safe to say that I will be sticking to other restaurants for the remaining time Zach lives in North Beach.
author: Alita M.

description:
I'm ambivalent.  It's a sweet, comfortable, cramped atmospheric neighborhood Italian restaurant loved by the locals in North Beach, the staff ranges from old hands to fresh out of grad school but they're all informal and friendly, and everyone leaves with a smile.  Food is pretty decent and some is actually quite good.  The homemade pasta tubes they call "Carlesimo" with pancetta, sundried tomatoes and all, which our waitress was cheerfully explaining to every table was "by far the most popular" was in fact very tasty and I would return just for that.  

I just can't get past the fact that they seem to be cutting lots of corners with their food and preparation.  The seafood in the frutte di mare was uneventful and the spaghetti seemed to have been twice-cooked instead of made to order - an old mass prep food technique.  They're obviously not going for top tier dining, but as long as they've been in business and with the prices what they are, I think they can step up their game.  The tiramisu too, it was pretty good and unusually sour in a good way, but not fabulous and the plating looked like a bomb went off in the flour pantry.

Nothing I can say will dissuade the die hard fans, the place is a mini-institution, and if you're a tourist or just want the real North Beach experience you could do worse.  For sure the place has heart.
author: Gil S.

description:
This place was phenomenal.  It was off the beaten path in the North Beach neighborhood, but well worth the slightly uphill walk.  They have an impressive wine list, and tons of things on the menu.

There was the most amazing bruchetta, many of the pastas are made in house or around the corner, and I highly recommend the Nebiolo wine.  Definitely ask for recommendations from your server.  We tried the chicken ravioli and a delicious chicken dish with the most flavorful broccolini.  Cheers!
author: Katie M.

description: We've had dinner here before and it was delicious. Today we had the brunch and it was amazing! The deviled eggs are perfection, zucchini bread and BLT were all so good. They had someone there doing wine tasting, the mimosas were bottomless and the staff super friendly. We would definitely go back.
author: Kelli D.

description: We have been here twice now with out of town family and haven't been disappointed at all.  The people are really nice, there is a nice variety of great Italian dishes to choose from and they are all served good, hot and plentiful!  My only complaint would be that the food is a tad on the bland side, but still enjoyable.   If you like olives, you have to try the hot olives as appetizer.  And all though we had a dessert smorgasbord (tried 4 different desserts) my favorite was the blackberry-merlot granita.  Yum!
author: Brooke B.

description: Amazing food and great service, add it to your short list of places to try.
author: Michael R.

description: Great service, great food! Only down side was the noise! Tiny little place with no acoustics! Everyone loved their dishes.
author: paula m.

description:
By far, Trattoria Contadina is my new favorite restaurant in SF. It's very small so a reservation is almost necessary if you're going to eat around peak dinner hours. We had a reservation for two at 7:30pm on a Monday but ended up waiting about 20 minutes until a table was ready. This wasn't an issue since we just ordered a bottle of wine and enjoyed some of that while talking near the bar prior to being seated. 

After being seated our waitress apologized for the wait and told us that we would receive a free order of bruschetta (which was delicious btw) since it took a little while to be seated. The food came out about 20 minutes after we ordered and looked/smelled as good as we both hoped.

The. Food. Was. Amazing.

My date ordered the Carlesimo and I the Salvatore. It was one of the most flavorful dinners I've ever experienced and after we each took one bite we decided that we would be returning to Trattoria Contadina again. While both dishes were surprisingly delicious, I enjoyed the Salvatore the most.

This is a great spot for a date but don't tell too many people or else it will get too busy !
author: Jeff D.

description: While looking for a place to have dinner with one of my girlfriends, this quaint little Italian restaurant caught my eye.  The restaurant served amazing handmade ricotta gnocchi.  Their bruschetta was to die for, and the service was impeccable.  I would definitely return to Trattoria Contadina!
author: Andra E.

description:
My boyfriend and I had the antipasto and two glasses of pinot noir to start with. This was perhaps, the highlight of the meal. I can always go for some cured meats and cheeses with wine.

The main pasta dishes themselves were very heavy. After 4 bites, we were both done for the night. We went over to E Tutto Qua for dessert afterwards.

A bit of an unmemorable meal, if you can't tell from my review.
author: Patricia Q.

description:
************************** 521 ****************************

          Small little charming neighborhood spot in North Beach, super friendly service, simply great Italian food. Trattoria Contadina serves organic produce, sustainable-raised meats, and wild fish as they stated. That's really awesome for a small resto this size. I took my BFF here years ago, and still 1 of her FAV Italian retos in SF.

- Bruschetta - Toasted Italian bread slices topped with fresh diced tomatoes, basil, garlic and ricotta salata cheese, you can order by each piece, so good here.

- Carpaccio di Manzo - Thinly sliced raw Filet Mignon with fresh arugula, parmesan cheese, extra virgin olive oil and capers - can't go wrong.

- Meatballs - big, full of flavor, so good that I didn't want to share with my friends.

PASTA - anything pasta is great here and they do serve smaller size per your request.

- Melanzane - Rigatoni pasta with sautéed eggplant with Roma tomatoes, onions, olives, melted mozzarella cheese and homemade tomato sauce - love anything red sauce here.

- Guglielmo - Linguine with prawns, mushrooms, onion, prosciutto, roasted peppers, cream - My friend loved it.

- Saltimbocca  - Veal scaloppini layered with prosciutto, mozzarella cheese and sage, served with a marsala wine and tomato sauce, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes - so much flavor and tasty.

- Dessert: Tiramisu, of course! 

             I can't eat much lately, but being here, the aroma from the kitchen and the tasty food, I drooled the moment I walked in! Reasonable price, a good spot all around for comfort food night out with your loved ones. Trattoria Contadina also makes a good date spot!
author: Manda Bear B.

description: Food was excellent.  Wine was sub-par.  Ambiance was cozy but a bit too cramped (you will hear your neighbors' conversations all night).  Service was un-attentive and our waitress was running on fumes.  Not sure if I would come back again or recommend to a friend.
author: Justin L.

description:
I had the carlesimo. It was pretty good, but I would want to try something else next time. The pasta was okay. I really liked the mushrooms and peas. 

The tiramisu was awesome!

I sat at the bar. The bartender (Taylor??) was super friendly. The host was fun to talk to also. This place is cool. I'd come again and recommend it to others. I'm so full, but I wanted to eat everything in front of me so I did. I accidentally ate a lot of bread because I was so hungry and was afraid I wouldn't be able to finish my food. Somehow, I did. Probably because I was slowly eating it and not entirely paying attention since I was caught up in conversation with the bartender and the regular next to me.
author: Joolie T.

description:
Its a 3 star no way around it.  
Very basic flavors, a little overcooked pasta, a little mushy ravoli.  Wont be rushing back anytime soon but it wasnt an evening killer if you know what I mean.
author: C W.

description:
One of those places you are bound to miss if you haven't already been. It's a tiny door on a quiet corner on a street with a line of glittering restaurants just a few yards down. Open the door though, and it's a bustling little place with small Italian people carrying enormous pasta dishes very hastily.

The chicken ravioli was some of the best I've had in a really long time. The wine was inexpensive, and it's just a nice loud place to get Italian dinner.
author: Rahul J.

description:
It's like 3.5 stars but I couldn't get myself to round up...yet.

A girlfriend of mine and I came to Trattoria Contadina for dinner before heading out to a New Year's Eve party. Unfortunately, my friend was somehow 45 minute late for our reservation.  I sat at their little bar and sipped a drink while I waited....and waited...

The hostess was super friendly and, despite being a very busy evening, they accommodated us as soon as my friend arrived.  I was very thankful for their patience.

We started with an order of carpaccio, which was pretty good.  The shavings of parmesan were pretty awesome.

She ordered the guglielmo (linguine with prawns, mushrooms, prosciutto, etc.) and I ordered the vongole  (linguini with clams).  I thought the vongole would have a bit more of a richer buttery white wine sauce, but it was actually very strong in the lemon/acid content.  It wasn't bad, just not what I had expected.  I think overall the dish could have used a little more seasoning.  My friend said her dish was good.

For dessert, we ordered the chocolate cappuccino mousse cake, which was amazing.  I have heard good things about this place so I would definitely come back to try another dish.  The friendly staff and dessert really made this place.
author: Naoko M.

description:
Excellent food and service, got the gnocchi which was excellent, and 2 of the pastas the carlismo, and another.  Ordered a seafood dish as well.  

Atmosphere was amazing as well.

Very good Italian food in North Beach but make a reservation and bring your checkbook.
author: Michael K.

description: Great spot for an Italian dinner in North Beach! My husband and I really enjoyed our experience here.  We had Jesus as our server who was very attentive and recommended an excellent red wine. Our favorite dish was the gnocchi with a tomato cream sauce.
author: Allie C.

description: Small place with great service and great food. The meatballs are simply amazing! Plan on coming here again!
author: Cindy A.

description: Prior to an evening of Beach Blanket Babylon laughter, my wife and I made a reservation at this wonderful restaurant through a Google and Yelp search. My wife selected this gem and the two of us, just wishing for a an evening of delicious Italian food, found our mecca. The service was sweet, the food was impeccable, the libations tasty, and the ambiance was like I was sitting in my own living room with many guests. The atmosphere was very relaxing. I had the spaghetti special with homemade egg noodles, shrimp, and scallops, in a white sauce. It was very tasty and so delightful. I highly recommend this little gem in North Beach. I could have sat there all night, eating Italian food, sipping wine, having conversation with my bride, and watching the cable car whisk by!
author: Jim E.

description:
Another value restaurant (tasty at a reasonable price).

Pepperoni Arrostiti and Caprese are good starters.

Agnello and bottle of Caigliano are simply solid.
author: Francis M.

description:
Food was good, but not great. What really knocked down my rating was the poor service. Our waiter could not understand our orders; the appetizer never came; cocktails took 20 minutes to arrive.  

There are plenty of places to eat in San Francisco.  Just skip this one.
author: Richard O.

description: I feel like a place like this doesn't need more reviews form me.. but here I am.. giving it 5 stars. Reinforcing what you already know. If you are trying to decide if you should go or not, just go. Food was amazing, service was great. Restaurants like this make me wish I lived in the city.
author: Angie H.

description:
Came here with a few lady friends to celebrate our impending study abroad trip to Italy - woohoo! We were seated right away although we came without a reservation even though the restaurant was pretty packed. One minus: the tables were pretty close together and I felt like I was sitting in the lap of the dude next to me. You're welcome, dude.

We ordered bruschetta as well as two pasta dishes and a meat dish. I can't remember the names of the pasta, but one was some sort of chicken ravioli and the other was rigatoni with peas and other tasty things. The meat dish was veal with prawns, and was served with veggies and potatoes.

I liked both pastas, but the rigatoni was the standout. Unfortunately, a couple of my dining partners bit into hard ravioli (I'm not talking al dente here, people). I didn't have that problem, but still found the ravioli less exciting. The veal and prawn dish was nice, although not thrilling by any means. 

Contadina really deserves 3.5 stars but I'm rounding up to 4 because the service was on point. Our server was quick and attentive. Plus, the price was pretty reasonable for what we got. Next time I would skip the bruschetta, since they're pricey (around $3 per piece?) and you get tons of tasty free bread anyway. 

Grazie!
author: Miranda N.

description: Shocked to have a terrible experience here after reading the good reviews on open table and yelp. The food here was awful. The meatballs were dry and tasted old...like they simply reheat them day after day in the same marinara. The Vincenzo pasta was flavorless and the sausage in it was disgusting. I am not one to write yelp reviews but the food was so bad I felt it was necessary to warn other people. We spent 90 bucks for our dinner and left so disappointed and hungry. It seems like a place trying to cut costs by using sub par ingredients. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
author: Alexa S.

description: So very disappointed with this restaurant. Usually you can't miss with  any traditional italian style restaurant in North Beach, but miss this one did!   just because a place is busy doesn't necessarily mean the food lives up to it. People walk by and see oh wow its busy, must be good, NOT!! Don't be fooled!  I ordered the seafood pasta but I swear they used canned tomato sauce, no better than Olive Garden. Also you'll pay $10 for 1/4 small glass of white wine. Everything is covered in heavy oily gravy like sauces. From the meats to the pastas. No thank you! Pass! I give 2 stars for the cozy quality of the restaurant only. ) :
author: suz p.

description:
WOW!  This was the best meal we had in San Francisco.  Walked in on a Thrusday night and had about a 15 min wait.  The aroma of the food drifted down the street and seductively brought you to the resturant.  Service was very good and attentive.  My wife ordered the house salad and I order the Ceaser.  Both were excellenct (but would have been perfect if you didn't have to pay extra for anchovies).  My son order the olives for an appetizer and had more than he could eat of different types (and he can put away olives).  

My wife and son both ordered the Paravotti, my daughter ordered the Gnocchi and I had the Fresco.  Each was excellent in it's own way.  The food was extremely flavorful and well presented.

It's a small, cramped resturant, but the food is out of this world.
author: Clark E.

description: Quant little place that's out of the way of the main street madness of italian restaurants in North Beach. The other reviews are en pointe about their cream sauce! Definitely anything with that sauce is drool worthy. My hubby got the steak and it was cooked nicely. Decent wine selection. Romantic and great location.
author: Maria G.

description:
I tried to get into some North Beach Italian places but found that they were full up on a Friday night at 8pm, so hit up Yelp, looking for nearby places with a good rating that could take a last minute reservation. Luckily, Trattoria Contadina was able to accommodate my girlfriend and I at the last minute. And I am glad they did! We started with delicious drinks (featuring some of my favorite spirits from St. George's), such as their Martinez. My girlfriend, the expert on such matters, said it was better than any other she'd had. We also started with a couple of delicious appetizers, the Mushrooms and the Pepper. The Mushrooms were good, but the Pepper stole the show - as you may have read in other reviews, the spicy tomato cream sauce is amazing, and it paired very well with the roasted bell pepper and delicious cheeses. For our main dishes, we had the Carbonara and the Gnocchi (with the prosciutto, peas and Point Reyes blue sauce). Wow! We'd had some Italian a couple of days before, and it just did not compare to this pasta. The blue sauce was very tasty, and the gnocchi were very well executed. Similarly, the Carbonara hit the spot. We finished off with some Fig gelato. I should also point out that our server made recommendations throughout the meal that were spot on. Thanks!

As we left that night, we noticed that the restaurant got busier after we arrived, so I'm not worried about this place sticking around. But don't tell too many people about it - I still want to be able to drop in and feast at a moment's notice!
author: Joshua R.

description:
My mother and I had lovely evening here on a busy-BUSY Saturday night.

My shrimp linguine dish was creamy and savory, I was surprised at how good the sauteed red peppers were. However, they were a little cheap with the shrimp... My mother loved her chicken parmigiana. The salad before the meal was good, and the bread was stubbornly Italian despite the foodie influences around.

The servers did not dote, but were also quick to get us what we needed.
I wished I had room for dessert, but the portions were so big there was no way. 

All in all, a lovely Italian dining experience in North Beach, but not the end all be all.
author: Natalie J.

description:
We have been patronizing this restaurant over 20 years now. Most recently, we had a fantastic experience with a large family gathering for our daughter's 16th Birthday party. It made me realize again, what a amazing gem this place is.

We had originally planned to meet at Capo's.  I was seduced by all the buzz and couldn't wait to try it. But, between their cash only policy, largest available table for 10, and then a draining experience of trying to navigate their ridiculous reservation policy (or lack thereof), a final conversation with their manager made me realize this place was just not interested in accommodating their customers for larger parties or special occasions. But, I digress a rant for another forum.

When I finally capitulated on Capo's, after banging my head against the wall trying way too hard to make it work, I was all the more impressed with Trattoria Contadina. They called me right back, and were just amazing in collaborating with me to make our experience wonderful all around. They willingly set aside their upstairs section for my party, they agreed to let all the guests in 10 minutes early, before they were scheduled to open, and they were amazing in staging the guests in the area and then escorting us up to the party keeping the surprise perfectly intact.  Where I couldn't even get Capos to take any interest in helping me whatsoever, Trattoria Contadina went way above my expectations to set up a wonderful surprise family gathering. The night unfolded with everyone thoroughly enjoying themselves.

The service was top notch.  In addition to the arrival accommodations, without even asking, the restaurant had offered parking tips for my guests and offered us in advance our choice of a fixed price menu or diner's choice. They arranged for a dedicated server for water, dish removal service and other misc. requests. And, our waiter (Jesus) was professional, friendly, responsive and insightful with respect to the menu. 

Across the board, all the dishes were fantastic. My family spent nearly four weeks traveling all over Italy in 2012, and I can assure you the food at Trattoria Contadina was authentic and as good as what we experience while in Italy. With the large party, we sampled many items from the menu. Just to touch on a few: 1) my brother couldn't stop talking about how tender and tasty his veal was (he said he can't wait to come back and order the exact same thing); 2) my daughter said her Gnocchi was cooked perfectly and the sauce was the best she had ever had (including her time in Italy); 3) the pesto risotto was to die for;  and, 4) the Caprese and Bruschetta brought me right back to my summer last year in Italy. Desserts were equally enjoyable with a particularly light and nice Tiramisu and, for the chocolate lovers, a Torta di Cioccolato that was rich and amazingly smooth and creamy to satisfy any chocoholic palate.

Everyone left in good spirits and completely satisfied. And, as we were leaving, the manager (owner?) even passed on fond wishes and blessings on our daughter's special occasion. After having such consistently great experiences at this restaurant over the years and experiencing such wonderful and attentive service more recently for our special occasion, I can see why this restaurant remains so highly rated and has been such a great asset to San Francisco for so many years now. Capo's may have the buzz now; but, if they are to endure the test of time, they could take some lessons from Trattoria Contadina in the kind of customer care and authentic Italian hospitality that makes for a successful, enduring  establishment through the years in a highly competitive market. I may still try Capo's some day; but, after tonight, my true loyalty will always be with Trattoria Contadina.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I walked in saying: "I know this is going to be my next favorite restaurant". And I was right. 

Not to far down the street is a quaint Trattoria that is packed every night of the week. I think we went on Tuesday and didn't have to wait long. 

Service was great . I ended up splitting a small caprese salad $8 and a large dish of their most popular pasta. A penne with a spicy cream tomato sauce with peas, tomatoes, mushrooms and chicken. It was delicious. $13 sm, $18 large. 

They also had a moderately priced wine list with several wine from Italy that I am excited to try. All and all it was very nice and I can't wait to go back to try more! 

My recommendation: Eat family style. Its worth it.
author: Heather H.

description: Delicious handmade cocktails - I had an amazing negroni - which are a great start to their awesome old-school fare - I had fettuccine with sausage onions and peppers - sublime!
author: Bee G.

description: Such a gem! I walked in and smelled the wonderful aroma of garlic. I ordered the burrata which was the best I ever had with figs, mint, arugala and balsamic glaze. then for my meal, I had the stuffed pepper....a roasted yellow pepper with Asiago and Mozz cheese in a tomato cream sauce. The food was spectacular and it was very busy. The tables are close together and I shared my app with my neighbors at the next table. Took the cable car back down the hill. A lovely evening.
author: Lori B.

description: Excellent Italian restaurant - reasonably priced dishes with good wine. Small place, so make a reservation ahead of time.
author: John L.

description:
Everyone is right about this place. It's simply amazing. Nestled in some residential buildings, this corner space definately is intimate and romantic. I like the fact that its not on a busy and loud street where Italians are harassing you to come and taste their food. 

They have a small bar in which you may find all different tasty wines. Reservations were hard to get the day of, but we went there early and were seated relatively soon after. We were seating at a table close to the windows, which was very nice. Too bad it wasn't a first date =). 

Their portions were VERY generous. My friend and I opted to share an appetizer, a main dish and dessert. We got the Cesar salad, which was AMAZING. The tiramisu was different from most I've tasted, but was very good. I suggest getting the wine! =) They have a signature wine which made the entire experience. 

Take a cab. Parking will be super tough unless you find a garage in NB and walk from there.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Loved this place.  We were meeting a friend there and randomnly chose this place based on the Yelp reviews and the fact that I wanted Italian.

Made a reservation with OpenTable.  Got there, and had to wait about 5 minutes to be seated.  Service was perfect and my meal, which was a shrimp risotto, was awesome.  Bread was great that they brought to the table as well.  Place was super small and intimate and kinda congested, but great ambiance just the same.

Only one restroom in the entire place, and they closed kinda early, but other than that, perfect experience.
author: Lori H.

description:
My sis finally took me and the boy here last night, after 4 years of mentioning that this place rocks!

It's small so you're literally elbow to elbow with the servers and the other patrons. 

Food: good stuff! Really fresh and so tasty! We had the clams and the cheese/meat platter for starters. Then I had the pavarotti pasta (chicken, prosciutto) half order and the boy had the tilapia, the sis had the ravioli and the fruti de mare. 

Then for dessert, we had the chocolate cake/torte and the tiramisu. Both we good and yummy!

Overall, it's pricey but really worth it.
author: Cath M.

description: If you are after some authentic Italian Pasta this is the place! Great ambiance, wonderful team and food Blesimo!
author: Bita H.

description:
Tiny Italian place. 

Caesar salad- great. 

Gnocchi- great. 

Definitely recommend this place.
author: Josh H.

description:
I truly loveTrattoria Contadina. The wonderful people, charm and cozy atmosphere along with deeeelicious food really make it a special place. I have brought my friends here, my mother and even hosted a work team dinner here (with a group of 25!) Everyone leaves with a smile! 

I have a tendency to sit at the bar - because it is fun and I enjoy the energy. For the work dinner, I reserved on a Wednesday night and we got the whole upstairs for ourselves. They have 2 set menus to work off of - and I received rave reviews from my team for several days after the event. The service is always fantastic - those dudes are ON IT. 

Also, they are absolutely on top of accommodating my dietary needs. As I am gluten-free, I always order an entree - (the lamb is delish) and they take great care in preparing a safe meal. It is also refreshing I don't have to explain what it means when I say gluten free. That can be a real bummer sometimes. Everything is fresh, the portions are quite generous - and I LOVE those darn roasted potatoes. :) Great wine selection too.

I absolutely recommend this place. Great for a fun date, to bring family, or even host a large group! (Fairly certain parties larger than 8 must be reserved M-Th, since it is a smaller space. Need to be fair to all those wanting to come in on the weekend!) You won't be disappointed.
author: Giorgia H.

description:
This quaint, warm neighborhood restaurant immediately stands out to the passerby...so much so, that at first site, makes you want to return. In my case, the same evening.  I was promptly welcomed as I took an open seat at the bar.  My Boston accent was immediately recognized by one of the waiters when I ordered a glass of wine, who also happened to be from Boston.  From there, I spent the next couple hours talking & laughing with the bartender, hostess and wait staff - while enjoying the Melanzane - made with fresh tomatoes, eggplant, onion, calamata olives topped with fresh mozzarella...not to mention the homemade marinara! To die for! I commented on how fresh the vegetables tasted, and was told that they are delivered daily.

The staff is very tenured and knowledgeable about the cuisine.  They also have daily food specials and daily drink specials...a nice touch.  You also have the option to order full or half orders of the entrees...and all are reasonably priced.

I couldn't pass up the urge to revisit the Trattoria before my return trip home after a one-week stay in San Francisco.  This time I ordered the Melazane with meatballs, which was a great addition to this plate.

My only regret is that I didn't find it earlier in the week.  Highly recommend with 5 stars!
author: Rachel C.

description: Loved the food and wine. Had to wait inspite of reservations on a weeknight. Place is small but the service is attentive. Would probably not go again as I want to try other Italian places in and around North beach.
author: Rutuja K.

description: Excellent italian restaurant one block off Columbus Ave in North Beach.  Service was great.  The meatballs are amazing and the atmosphere is cozy.  We hadn't been for awhile and were pleasantly reminded to put it in our rotation of restaurants!
author: Leslie V.

description:
We have been here 4 or 5 times now and each time we try something different. Their daily specials are always interesting and well prepared. It is all good but I agree with fellow yelpers, they really do the simple dishes very well. I had a Corkscrew Pasta with clams in a spicy tomato sauce that was sensational, even a great leftover the next day.

The wait staff if knowledgeable and friendly and there is also a large, varied wine list to choose from.

About my only complaint is the noise level. This is not a location for a quiet, intimate romantic dinner. It loud, busy and fun!
author: Suzy S.

description:
By far Shatangi's favorite restaurant in the city. They make you feel welcome and the food is off da shizzle!!! good for groups, great for a date or anniversary / b-day etc. The only place I'll get my veal on (only  once a year I feel so bad for them. They're soo cute (and delicious)).

It must mean something that their lowest review is a 4 star!!

Shatangi told you...

P.S. If TC ever want's to invite me for whatever. You know me as Njon.
author: Njon W.

description: Overall the food tasted good.   Seven people dined and everyone, for the most part, enjoyed their dishes.  One pasta dish was a little too spicy even though a request was made to go mild on the spices.  On that same dish, the pasta was a little under cooked.  There were no complaints on any of the other dishes.   We were seated on time and all the dishes were delivered hot and together.  The atmosphere and vibe from all the employees was warm, welcoming, and friendly.  Our waiter  offered a nice smile and excellent service throughout.  The restaurant is very well run.  I would recommend this restaurant.
author: Barbara K.

description: Good place to take a date. I ordered the Polpettine which was good. The noodles were perfect but the meatballs were average .
author: Austin H.

description:
There wasn't anything spectacular other than the lamb here that stood out at me.  The wait-staff was nice, but it was a bit cramped.  The bruschetta was pretty good but nothing you couldn't make at home with really good tomatoes.  The bread was decent.  

The lamb however was spectacular.  Agnello was the special they had.
author: Chaz N.

description: Your cookie cutter Italian run-of-the-mill place in North Beach.  Nothing memorable at all, though it certainly wasn't bad.
author: Kristen S.

description: So great.  Welcomed us as a party with three kids no problem.  Fresh pasta, great wine, and a homey atmosphere.  Great option for a date night in North Beach.
author: Rich L.

description: Absolute BEST Italian food!! Amazing, finger licking good!!! Completely recommend this place!! The place is really small and you're almost sitting with the people next to you but the food completely makes up for it. Great service and great food!
author: Monica G.

description:
Delicious Italian food!!!  Everything tastes home made and the place has a nice comforting feel to it.  Waiters are very nice and knowledgeable. Wine list is nice and compliments the flavor of the food.

Would recommend anybody in SF to visit this nice restaurant.  Its hidden on a small st away from the main strip.
author: Mark M.

description:
TC prepares simple, rustic Italian fare that tastes great and is very well proportioned.  Was very impressed with the meal...you can tell they have been cranking out quality for many years.

The decor and vibe was cool about 25 years ago.  Along the walls are the obligatory head shots of 1980s celebs and SF sports figures who ate there.  I spent much of my dinner with Dick Vitale, Rob Nen and Mike Fratello staring down at me.  The flooring looks like something you'd find in your weird uncle's 70s bungalow.

Service was decent.  Nothing special.  Kind of rushed.
author: Jon M.

description:
I like this place. It feels like a small real italian place. Food was good. I probably did not order the best dish to my taste (tried to go healthy...)
The restaurant is a little too dark. 

The desert was excellent !!! Some cake with ice cream, muliple layers of deliciousness (Fango I believe it was!)
author: cyril l.

description:
Trattoria Contadina is still consistently good Italian food. Pretty much every night of the week I would suggest calling for a reservation if you don't want to wait (because the inside is small waiting usually means outside in the cold!). The service here is always really nice and professional.

The bread at the beginning of the meal is not warm, but fresh and good with a glass (who I am kidding...) or bottle of wine. The grilled lamb chop is amazing and has a nice hint of rosemary. The Carlesimo pasta is still my favorite and I will keep coming back for that tomato cream sauce which says spicy, but is not. 

I was very unhappy with the carmel dessert. It was incredibly sweet in an over the top way. That was my only mistake in the ordering, and I wouldn't get it again. Other than that I love Trattoria Contadina!
author: Natalie N.

description: The restaurant was full and we didn't have a reservation, but the hostess kindly offered my husband and I a seat at the bar. The bartender was friendly and attentive. My husband had the Carlesimo and I had the gnocchi with a glass of moscato. My gnocchi was pillowy and the sauce was rich and flavorful. I didn't speak through dinner, as I indulged in such an amazingly delicious dish. My wine was not too sweet and was refreshing for an unusually warm night in San Francisco. We were very impressed and will definitely stop by again.
author: Crystal O.

description: Was recommended to us by a local and we are REALLY glad we went.  Its small and cozy so make a reservation.  It smelled amazing when we went in and tasted just as good.  Good service, great menu and really nice atmospher.  Cant wait to go back.
author: Ryan O.

description:
So many choices for italian dining in North Beach, but we made the right choice for dinner after BBB..close proximity to Club Fugazi.  We started out with the antipasto plate...nice selection of calamata olives, peppers, mortadella and salami. I had the Ravioli Assortiti (cheese ravioli in creamy pesto sauce).  Goodness...the ravioli melted in my mouth!  My husband had the Vincenzo (fettucine with italian sausage).  Sausage was tender and just the right amount of spiciness.  Dessert?  If you don't get their tiramisu you certainly will regret it.  So very light and the flavors are devine.  Tiramisu is not one of my husband's favorite desserts, but he raved about this one.  Our waitress was pleasant and attentive.  Service all around was commendable. 

Restaurant is small and intimate so reservations may be a good thing.  Window seating is great for people watching..it is located on a residential corner.  We really wanted to take the cable car (runs right there on Mason) back to Union Square.  The car was full, so we decided to walk the mile.  From Mason looking east...great views of the new span of the Bay Bridge. Perfect way to end a day in North Beach.
author: J F.

description:
Wow!!! Love this place. 
Make sure that you have a reservation before heading there. We did not have one but we were early and lucky. 
My wife had the Salvatore and really enjoyed it. She ordered a half portion which turned out not to be enough. 
I had the Carlesimo which is a dish with their famous creamy tomato sauce. Loved every bit of it. 

We will come back here next time we visit San Francisco.
author: Per J.

description: Quaint little place with excellent Italian food. It's small yet somehow manages to feel spacious enough that you don't feel like you're eating with the table next to you. The service is just attentive enough - they kept the wine and food coming frequently enough and let us enjoy a very long dinner without much interruption.
author: Brett B.

description:
Trattoria Contadina is a cute little restaurant on the top of the hill, right at the corner of the cable car stop on Mason and Union. Although the general rating of this place is 4 stars right now, it just doesn't do it for me. 

Environment: tables are tightly packed together with barely and room to push your chair out. There is a small bar and upstairs about seating for 20 more. It actually seems like an illegal fire hazard to have seats so close and a staircase so narrow used to get upstairs. Oh and by the way, you pass an outside bathroom sink on the way. Overall clean though. 

Food: 
-small spinaci salad - was enough for 2, but nothing special 
- Carlesimo - indicated as a house specialty on menu. Tasty, creamy tomato sauce with mushrooms. Better of the two pastas ordered. 
-Salvatore - homemade chicken ravioli. Ravioli itself had good flavor, but the sauce was lacking flavor and depth. Made a pretty good sauce for myself by dipping these raviolis in the Carlismo sauce! 

Drinks: Pretty pricy and on the high side considering the prices of the food. House cab by the glass - $9. 

Parking: Harder than normal since the cable car is nearby as well as the hilly areas surrounding the location. 

Overall: Not really worth it for the prices. Not bad, but not great. Not likely to return. There are many other Italian restaurants in the area that will give this place a run for its money.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
In town and thinking about Italian food.  Decided to give Trattoria Contadina a try after reading the reviews here.  The restaurant is small.  We had reservations and arrived early.  We were told "have a seat at the bar".  In fact every couple that arrived was told the same thing even though there were several open tables.  Whatever.  Bread fresh.  Meatball appetizer rocked.  Great sauce.  Caesar salad had wonderful dressing.  This review only gets 3 stars because our main entrees were "just OK".  Chicken Marsala and veal.  For the price, there should have been more on the plates.  My veal wasn't tender (had to cut it with a steak knife ) and the brocollini was cold.  I so wanted to like this place but $120 later for two dinners, one appetizer, one salad and wine I don't think I'll be back.  And $12 for a small glass of red wine?  Really?
PS - Later that night we got a message on our cell saying we were a no-show.  The guy at the door never even asked our name when we said we had reservations and were a little early.  Have a seat at the bar.
author: Karen B.

description:
Really wasn't impressed.

The special was spinach soup - now that was delicious.

However, we had two staples of the menu - Carlesimo and Gnocchi - really average. I was not wowed whatsoever.

I guess it's a 3-star, but I want to give it 2 just because I was so let down!
author: Sam A.

description:
When we arrived the hostess sat us right away. It was really busy on a Saturday night, but the service was never lacking. I don't think my water glass ever dipped below a quarter full, and I drink a lot of water.
The food was awesome. I would have been happy with just the bread and wine, but the pasta was delicious! We ordered a small gnocchi and a small carlesimo. I'd hate to see the large size plates because I was pretty full after just bread and pasta. The carlesimo had a spicy cream tomato sauce that wasn't very spicy. To me the highlight was the gnocchi, the cream tomato sauce was rich and earthy, and the gnocchi were tender and delicious. We also split a chicken entree that we couldn't finish, because we were too full, it too was excellent.

The only downside is that the tables are tightly spaced, and on a crowded Saturday night it was pretty loud, but of course a reasonably priced restaurant with great food and excellent service will be crowded. So don't go there expecting to have a quiet conversation.
author: Olen R.

description: Cute, crowded spot. We ordered lots. Everything was good - the highlights were mussels and clams (very tender and delicate and classic preparation), veal saltimboca (very tasty), gnocci (in a tomato cream sauce - pillowy like they're supposed to be), and the salad with arugula and beets -- real good, especially b/c it's organic. Except for the meatball -which was far too dense, everything was solid+. Even the olive oil was yummy. The service was excellent. Wouldn't say it was the best meal of my life.
author: Andrew K.

description: Came here with my girls for dinner. It was so good. Walked right in the server gave us "the best seat in the house" right next to the window so we could people watch. They were very helpful in describing the dishes so that we could order exactly what we wanted. The portions were huge and delish. Highly recommend.
author: Muriel M.

description: Underwhelmed by pasta and my first bottle of wine was spoiled...
author: Katherine L.

description:
Trattoria Contadina.   #1 on our dining to-do list!

This charming small corner restaurant is along the trolley route & on our visit last year, we noticed how busy it was every time we rode by.  The yelp reviews were all 4 & 5 stars, so we made it a point to dine here.  .

We showed up right at 5:30 when they opened for dinner.  The staff were very welcoming & made us feel right at home.  Obviously, this is a real neighborhood spot as evidenced by the familiarity with other diners upon their arrival.  I really should have gotten the name of our server to give him due credit.  He was perfect in his manner & had such a pleasing personality.
We decided to share our entrees & ordered:
Bruschetta  $7  Two large slices heaped with beautifully seasoned tomatoes.
Beef ravioli  $15  Ordered with the tomato sauce.  Very good.
Calamari risotto with spinach & arugula  $18  First time dish for my hubby.  He loved it!  The squid was plentiful & very tender.  
My husband has a hearty appetite & pretty much ate every last crumb.  Even the entire mini-loaf of sourdough that came along with the meal.  
Turned out the portions were just right to fill us both up.  

The Trattoria Contadina really lived up to our expectations.  All the times we passed by on the trolleys, looking longingly in the windows.  Watching diners who seemed to truly be enjoying their food & the close-knit atmosphere, we wanted to be those people!  Now that we've done it, we feel special.

For hubby & I, this is going to be our San Francisco spot for future visits.
author: Lynette T.

description: Great italian food, best one I had in San Francisco so far. Very good and intimate ambient, good for a romantic dinner :)
author: Felipe L.

description:
Ok, so maybe I haven't written too many reviews on here but this definitely deserves my first 5 Star rating. We decided to try something off of the main strip to stay away from the crowds. Turns out we weren't the first to hear of this place. We didn't have reservations and had to wait but it was well worth it. 

The place is small and has a very home-style type of a feel to it. The service was friendly and prompt. We were offered something to drink while we waited to be seated and were tended to soon after we sat down. 

I ordered one of the two or three dishes they recommend off the menu. The 'Carlisimo' ended up being one of the best plates of pasta I've had anywhere stateside. The penne pasta was firm and generously covered in their tomato cream sauce along with peas and sun dried tomatoes. The Parmesan I had sprinkled added the finishing touch. 

Definitely an excellent place to go for homemade Italian food. And if you're in the mood for a delicious pasta dish, the Carlisimo will not let you down.
author: Rafael D.

description:
This is my "go to" for nights when I simply want to count on good food.  I always order the same thing, which is the beef ravioli with pesto.  The pesto is magnifique (insert correct spelling, cheesy accent, and kiss ur finger tips)  Service is great, ambiance is cozy (more like snug), and if you don't mind practically cuddling with the patrons sitting beside you, then the setting is quite charming.  I quite enjoy ease dropping on other people's first dates, drama, and topics of convo, so this suites me just fine.

I live about three blocks away, so not only is it incredibly convenient, but in my opinion, the best Italian I've had in SF.  Perfect date spot.  I once heard a friend refer to this place as the "closer".  So guys, if you want to make a charming first impression, take a date to this place and you will be recognized as a man with good taste, romantic style, and intriguingly  humble in his selected surroundings.

The only reason I didn't go with a 5 star, is because the bread sucks.  In my opinion, the bread bowl at Italian restaurants is a staple that makes a tasty impression, which should give the diner a promising feeling for the upcoming entree.  Just like chips and salsa at a Mexican spot.  But the bread at Trattoria Contadina has that rock hard crust that doesn't exactly melt in your mouth, no matter how much oil you douse it in!  Otherwise, this place rox~

Enjoy!!
author: Michael H.

description:
I've been to Trattoria Contadina twice now, and was thoroughly pleased both times! The staff was very welcoming and attentive. For appetizers, I recommend the Antipasto (cheese and meat platter) and the Zafferano (clams and mussels). You can't go wrong with any of their pastas, as most of them are drenched in their delicous tomato cream sause.

A plus to dining here is their small & large portions they offer for their salads and pastas. This is perfect for parties who want to order individual dishes, or order family-style.

Reservations are definitely needed on the weekends. And if you can, try to sit on the top floor. Its less crowded, and just as charming :)
author: Michelle C.

description:
A real solid Italian place off the main strip. The staff was really friendly and accommodated our slightly rushed schedule. The food was great -- and there was plenty of it. I had the risotto and it was very good, though it could have been cooked just a touch longer. My girlfriend had the saltimocca which she loved. The waiter kept the bread coming with some very good olive oil and vinegar, which was a great plus. We had bruschetta, too, which had some cheese on it, which is uncommon but tasted great.

The building feels a little unfinished. They could put some work into cleaning up / covering up the unused upstairs balconies.

I recommend this place if you're going to see Beach Blanket Babylon and want to get off Columbus, which is just a couple blocks away.
author: Andrew T.

description:
The days when I rode the 45 home from work I would pass by Trattoria Contadina almost daily and always wondered how the food was. My grandma and some other relatives were in town and said they wanted Italian food for dinner (a typical Midwest response), perfect time to try Trattoria Contadina.

Nice little restaurant with typical Italian restaurant atmosphere, nothing special and not too run down. We had a party of 8 and I was very surprised they were able to accommodate us especially since I made the reservation that same day.

I hadn't eaten at a traditional Italian restaurant in a while and after dining at Trattoria Contadina it made me realize that unless you are in Italy, most traditional Italian restaurants are the same; nothing special. It also made me realize that unless you are a tourist, why would you eat at a traditional Italian restaurant in SF, when there are SO many other great restaurants? Everything I ordered came EXACTLY how I expected and everything was good, but nothing was mind blowing. 

I ordered the gnocchi with tomato sauce and a beet /arugula/pistachio/goat cheese salad. The gnocchi tasted fresh and was very traditional (no new American spin on gnocchi) and the sauce was good, but nothing great. The salad was pretty good, but after all, it's just a salad.

Overall I think Trattoria Contadina is WAY better than most of the Italian Restaurants in North Beach (most of which are not very good and very touristy) and if you are looking for traditional Italian food in North Beach, I would recommend this place. BTW my relatives (from the Midwest) loved it.
author: Elaine S.

description:
I've been coming to Trattoria Contadina for 25 years and its always consistantly good.  The staff is friendly, the prices are reasonable & the food is always excellent.  Their take on Veal Piccata is excellent.  The risotto is always a good bet.  Its not fancy, it's decor is the same as your Grandparent's basement, 1970's era.

The location is great (Mason & Union) and you can take the cable car to the front door which eliminates the parking worries.  I hope they continue in business for another 30 years.
author: Gary C.

description:
Yum.... I've come here twice now and loved all of my food. Note: it is rich and comes in huge portions, so come when you're ready to throw all calories and diets out the door and you are truly craving some heartwarming Italian cuisine.

At 7:45pm, I was able to get an 8:30 reservation for 4 no problem. However, the best part of it was walking in at 8pm with my full party and the host was able to accommodate us at 8:00! It was lovely not having to wait a long time for dinner.
