I had the penne pasta, and it had a touch of spiciness to it which was delicious, and cheesy. I had a ton for leftover and ate it for lunch the next day.

SO GOOD!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Teeny tiny restaurant, but excellent food. Like we were crammed into our table for 4, it was almost uncomfortable (and we are all normal sized people). 

Service was slow and we were disappointed that most wine was sold only by the bottle. 

The food was excellent, though and made up for the slow service and food cooking time. I'd go back. Very romantic restaurant, would be great for dates. I was there with co-workers for dinner while we were attending a conference.
author: Desi D.

description: So very yum!! First, I would like to say after reading  Jazmin C's post and then eating at the restaurant, Yelp should remove her negative comments and ban her from the app all together due to poor form as a patron at a family owned restaurant. After realizing that this restaurant barely seats 30 guests, it is apparent that it would be detrimental to fail to bring your reserved party of 7 on a busy night as Valentines Day; shame on you! But I digress... This place is wonderfully charming with many friendly staff. We had the pleasure of having Stephen as our waiter and he did an excellent job of acquainting us with the menu along with a friendly smile and prompt attentiveness. We had the meatballs for the appetizer, gnocchi, carlesimo, and stracciatella for dessert. Everything was flavorful and filling! Make sure to come hungry and leave with leftovers. It was a great experience and we would definitely visit again. Thank you for a delicious night Trattoria Contadina!
author: Dana A.

description: Great food, great service. Unpretentious italian dining in an intimate family atmosphere, but the portions don't come in colossal boat-plates, so you can enjoy dinner without fear of becoming an overnight diabetic. Try the chicken ravioli with a nice glass of wine
author: Tony R.

description:
We were a large group and they were very accommodating.  Half of our group arrived very early, and they made room for us at the bar so we could have a drink while we waited.  We were the last people in the restaurant, and we did not feel as though they were trying to hurry us out.

The tomato cream sauce is amazing.  I am a sort of ravioli snob.  I love beef ravioli and I order it often.  This was the best I have ever had and I think it was because of the sauce.  Don't get me wrong.  The ravioli itself was great.  Mine was cooked well, but the sauce elevated the dish to another level.

I can't comment on the noise level as I was paying more attention to my company than other tables.  I am sure we contributed to whatever noise there was in the place that night.

I am not from the area, but if I should return I will certainly go back.  Mostly for the sauce.
author: Laurie T.

description:
This place is solid: good portions, wonderful flavors and fairly priced! I made a reservation for 8. We were seated promptly and well taken care of. I really enjoyed our dinner tonight. It's just good italian food, no pretention. 

Worth noting dishes:

- Carlesimo pasta
- Fresco pasta
- great wine menu within an affordable range

It's true, the bread isn't that specia and comes cold,l but the olive oil that comes with it makes up for it. We were too full to try any desserts but I plan on coming back will save room for dessert next time.
author: Inna L.

description: Came saturday night for my mom's birthday. It was my first time here..Wow, I LOVE it! Very homey, bustling and cute, plus service was great. I felt like I was in Italy! The Pavorotti- a creamy pesto sun dried tomato pasta was my favorite. SOOoo delicious.  Just go :)
author: Rosieposie Y.

description: I really enjoyed the marinated olives - best I've ever! The entree was a little less spectacular (although still very good) and it was a bit noisy. I'm definitely coming back here.
author: William T.

description: Chose this restaurant based on the reviews on yelp, but was somewhat disappointed. We were seated in the back which is a strange room that was hot and dark. The waitress was rushed and down to business which just made us feel like an annoyance to her. The food was decent but nothing special. The buratta appetizer was good quality burratta, but I found the combination of adding strawberries to be strange, it felt more like a dessert. I ordered the beef ravioli with tomato cream sauce for a main course. The dish was pretty bland and uninspiring. I tasted a few of the other dishes at the table and while the pasta is fresh and good quality, the sauces lack flavor.
author: doug B.

description:
You know, I used to like this place.  The good news was that we were hanging out in North Beach taking a walk on a sunny day with the kids, and it was rolling on dinner time.  Kids wanted Pasta and I thought, Hey let's go to Contadina.  It's been a while, but it's a little off the tourist track and been pretty good over the years.  

Well - unfortunately the tourists have found the place.  You can tell by the way the waiters treat you.  Cattle call mentality.  Had some shrimp pasta dish - Meh..... Not made with care.  Spaghetti and meatballs - Meh... sauce tasted old and like it had been sitting all night on the steam table and then reheated again.  Meatballs tasted like the refrigerator.  Simple salad to start was fine.  Ravioli were mediocre at best too.  

Hostess was nice and professional which was a plus.
Now we're in need of a decent place to eat Italian food in NB.
author: Aaron N.

description:
A few weeks ago, I made reservations here for my parents' 40th anniversary, which was last night.  They wanted to go to this place because we all really enjoyed it last time we were here. 

When we arrived at Trattoria  Contadina,  there was a private party going on, taking up the entire restaurant.  The hostess told us that someone should have informed us when we made the reservation that there was a party going on (they didn't) and that they were bussing our table and it would be ready momentarily.  15 minutes later,  they were apparently still bussing our table, my parents and I were standing outside (we couldn't go inside because the private party was inside) waiting for our table, and the hostess was making absolutely no attempt to help us in any way.  In fact, she was busy talking on her cell phone trying to secure a private tour of the Whitehouse for her mom.  

So now we've been waiting for almost 30 minutes,  it's my parents' anniversary, and we are standing outside waiting for a table that never materialized, and no one is trying to help us at all. We couldn't even go inside and sit at the bar.  So we left. And then we walked around North Beach on a Monday night, in the rain, trying to find a restaurant that was even open (since many restaurants take Mondays off) for a celebratory dinner.  I was trying to do something nice for my parents and the was night completely ruined.  Thanks Trattoria Contadina. I have never been so appalled by such awful service, and I do not recommend this place to anyone.

Not to worry, I believe the hostess managed to secure that private Whitehouse tour for her mom.
author: Nicole G.

description: A very nice evening.  The bartender and the drinks were great, hostess was very nice, waiter and server were spot on.  The food was very good.  Nothing was spectacular or outstanding.  But an overall good experience.
author: Michael N.

description: Loved it! Small, charming place. Had the meatballs but substituted the penne pasta. Delicious! I would recommended reservations. We were seated without, but the place did get busy very fast. Had the warm olives as an appetizer with a glass of wine and slices of nice bread. My meal tasted very "homemade" and I would certainly eat there again. Attentive wait staff. We had a lovely dinner.
author: Darlene C.

description: Oh my goodness! I chose this place for a special date night with my husband while visiting San Fran.  We had a great experience.  The staff was very attentive with bread and water, it took a little longer to see our server but once we did he was great.  I ordered the Chicken Correnti, and it was one of the most flavorful dishes I have gotten in a long time.  The chicken was cooked perfect and the sauce was so rich and delicious I could eat it on anything.  My husband got the special and raved about his as well!  Great little place with ambiance and great food.
author: Bethie H.

description:
This place gets all of its good marks from me based on the atmosphere, good character, and solid service. When you walk in, you immediately realize that this classic american-italian eatery is snugly tucked into a room the size of  a neighborhood corner bar. It's small, tables are close together, and it's pretty warm in there. That being said, it's effectively charming rather than unpleasant. The service paces the meal well, and is attentive and friendly.

The food is ok. They have all of the heavily sauced and cheesed items that you'd expect. (quick up-front tip: don't take anybody here who's shy about veal; there are like nine veal dishes on the menu and veal stock is prominently featured in the sauces for several others) 

The pasta doesn't taste freshly made, especially the ravioli which had a nice nutty cream sauce, but a little bit of a gluey chew to it. Penne with tomato sauce was weak. Veal scallopini was good, but came out drowning in a deep rich sauce. 

Overall: The atmosphere is charming, the wait staff is attentive, the flavors are predictably okay, but nothing mind-blowing, and "fresh" won't be the word foremost in your mind on your way out the door.
author: Bo J.

description: Loved that place. Small restaurant, friendly service and great food. Used to go quite often until we moved. Gonna go again when we'll back for vacation. Hope everything will be as it used to be.
author: .C H O C O L A T E L O V E R.

description: This is one of my favorite local spots to eat.  You have to have one of their manhattans if you go!  Their staff has always been really friendly and attentive.  I've been here a bunch and all the food I have tried is consistent and amazing.
author: Norman M.

description: I love this place.  Not fancy, but not a dive.  Just good food and good ambiance.
author: Leah M.

description:
Service was excellent and prompt. Menu selections were good - not extensive, but covered the basics.  The main courses  were generous,  well prepared and presented nicely. The food was tasty - a bit more on the herbs would have suited my taste.  The bread did not appear to be fresh baked which I would have expected at this type of restaurant.   Wine list could have been a little broader in selections by adding  a few choices below $40.00. 
Worth the experience,  but with 2600 restaurants in the city,  it will be awhile before we return.
author: tom m.

description:
Having walked by this neighborhood joint for years and often times wondered out loud about it- finally got a chance to experience this neighborhood gem.

The home-infused olive oil with crusty bread is an absolutely lethal welcoming to a starving stomach, a more appropriate way to quell the belly was with a few glasses from our bottle of Primitivo- presto! Drunk within 3 sips! 

Motto bene pasta options- half portions were more than enough for me and the big guy- Melanzane pasta was out of this world delicious- a solid alternative to my go-to parimigiana melanzane (which is not on the menu here). 

I would recommend skipping tiramisu- Advertised as "rum soaked" without a trace of rum in the taste or dried consistency of the lady fingers was a let down as I had saved my "dessert stomach" for some of this goodness.

All in all- highly recommended locals Italian restaurant in North Beach- skip the beaten track and trek your way up the hill to experience Trattoria goodness!
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Love this place. Consistently great. Fabulous sort-of locals only place. Tad hard to find but worth it. Go early for a table. We eat there every time we travel to the city.
author: Dale D.

description:
I came here with the parents (who are the foodies of my family) and it was great food, great service, and good old fashioned old school Italian atmosphere. The walls are filled with all the famous people who have visited this North Beach landmark.

The place is small so not great for big groups, but the food is fantastic and the price is right. I got the veal - amazing and the pasta is delicious. I can't remember the apps we got, but I know I scarfed them down.

Great for a friday night dinner, then hit North Beach bars.
author: Nate E.

description:
Followed Yelpers' advice and took out-of-town guests here for a real Italian meal. I was disappointed. I had one of the specials _ a mushroom risotto _ and it was bland, bland, bland. 

On the upside, the location is great, the ambience is great and the service is great. 

I'm not sure I'd try it again.
author: Kim C.

description:
A solid 3.5. Just not good enough to give it four...Staff is really awesome and very accommodating and friendly. Restaurant ambiance is fair but nothing great. The bar in the middle is just sort of awkwardly planted with 4 chairs. 

The food was a solid 3 to 3.5. The caprese tasted like middle to lower quality mozzarella for the quality and price we paid. It was passable. The pasta dishes were decent. Meatballs were much to dense and a bit hard to cut into but had a pretty good flavor. Sauce is decent without being memorable.  The homemade pasta that's served with the pancetta and cream sauce dish is served al dente and is quite good. 

There's no doubt that if someone suggested coming back I would. But if I was in town and was in the area again, I'd definitely try somewhere else if I was able to make the choice. I'd say they are a tad high on the price for the quality. However the quality is relatively respectable.
author: Matt W.

description:
Dining at Trattoria Contadina was like eating at home with my family surrounding one table, great conversations, bottles of wine on the table, and wonderful food that we all shared.  

Yes, it is a small place, but I embraced and enjoyed the cozyness and itimacy -reminded me of Italy.  This visit, I ordered the Gnocchi, which was just wonderful. Plus, of course, I had a bite of everyone else's dish.

It helps to go with a good group of friends or family because the relaxing atmosphere just makes the experience more enjoyable.
author: T S.

description: Can't go wrong here.  Very old-school Italian restaurant. Felt like being in Boston to me. Recommend gnocchi. Chicken Marsala. Lasagne.
author: Brian W.

description:
Unfortunately, Trattoria Contadina is just another typical Italian red sauce joint kept alive by travel books and concierges that counsel tourists seeking an authentic North Beach experience.

While the service was excellent, the food was uninspired and lazy. The bar tender down the street suggested that we start with the pepperoni arrostiti, a bell pepper cut in half, filled with cheese and drenched in the house specialty, a tomato cream sauce. The dish, while reasonably tasty, was sloppy, unimaginative and not memorable.

After a couple of salads, our server promptly delivered our main courses. We order a seafood soup that ended up being almost  inedible.   An unbalanced broth without even a hint  of white wine, garlic or lemon was topped with overcooked bi-valves and tasteless, rubbery squid.  The dish was a huge miss.  I ordered the polpettine, linguini in tomato sauce (I'm not much for cream sauce) with  "Rocky's" homemade meatballs.  It was fine.  The meatballs, dry and bland, had been previously frozen.
author: Sam S.

description:
Two words usually make me salivate at any Italian restaurant and these are, "warm bread", unfortunately this place does NOT serve warm bread which is why I can't dip into the 4 star mark.  The good news is that by not eating a bunch of bread I had room for my yummy main course.

The Gnocchi with tomato cream sauce was simple and delicious.  The wine was good but overly pricey for the conservative pour.  Next time I'll definitely get a bottle instead of ordering by the glass.  Silly ME!

The salad I ordered was mediocre.  I don't really consider sprinkling a few dried cranberries and under-toasted pecans to be fine dining but the balsamic dressing and baby spinach were flavorful.

Impressive atmosphere although I recommend they do some "leveling" on their tables.   No need to spill my red wine on my white dress so early in the evening.  Oh, and the waiter brought me the wrong wine at first, but no biggie.  I just knew I wasn't drinking what I ordered.

I would revisit this joint although I hope they will add a few elements, namely:  warm bread, level tables and a few "off-menu" seasonal specials.
author: A H.

description: Fabulous Italian. Generous portions, big flavor, friendly staff, intimate environment. I really enjoyed it, but more importantly, my wife did.
author: Ron M.

description:
If you're ok with what you see on the menu, you'll like it.

I gave it 3 stars because the menu selection felt like it was missing a few things (I was hoping for lasagna or ziti). Ended up with the gnocchi and ravioli. Good enough but not particularly special. Also a bit overpriced.
author: Donovan B.

description: Good food at reasonable prices. Not crowded...surprisingly for SF. Great environment. People were nice. Portions were on the bigger I'd say. Not amazing, but pretty solid for dinner. I would come back.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Came here to celebrate mothers day and made a reservation day of on open table with no problem! We arrived a couple minutes early and the table was ready for my mom, sister and I immediately. Bread was given to temporarily satisfy our hunger. I love soft, freshly cut bread with olive oil and vinegar. Yum! Anyways, they have a very good sized menu and everything sounds and smells delicious. I got the Melazane - rigatoni with egg plant, olives, tomatoes, fresh parmesean. It was delicious! It was even a little spicy. I helped pick my sisters plate out, the Pavaratti - prosciutto, chicken, zucchini in a cream sauce. Also very delicious and light. The pastas come in half or full dishes which was a nice touch because I hate being defeated by large plates of food. My mom got the halibut which tasted wonderful! The whole experience was great especially because the restaurant is so loving and well taken care of. It's a family run restaurant with a bunch of family photos. Today we were taken care by the son Casey who pronounced all the dishes beautifully in what I think is Italian... Haha. I hope it was at least. Anyways, what's dinner without dessert? I got the cuore which was a chocolate ganache with a raspberry sorbet center. It was to die for! I definitely recommend getting dessert not only because it tastes great but there's a great selection and they're all $7! 

I can't wait to come back again :)
author: Jackie M.

description: Was kind of a mixed bag.  Guess they have new ownership.  I liked my chicken Marsala dish and my wife did not like her pasta.  The Mozzarella Bufala was good.  Guess the disappointing part was the presentation of the food or lack of creativity.  The very small intimate atmosphere was nice, but a little too cozy.  Did like the history that we saw around us on the walls.
author: Joshua D.

description: i had the cheese ravioli and it was out of this world with freshness.  we finished off with the tiramisu which was one of the best that I've ever had so far.  this is a quaint place so a reservation is highly suggested.  by the time we were leaving, there was a huge line out of the door.  i will be back to try the other dishes soon.  thanks for your hospitality and see ya soon!
author: Brixton P.

description: Second time coming here and better than I remember! We ordered 2 burrata and 1 antipasto to start, plenty for the 8 of us and absolutely delicious. I ordered chicken piccata but tasted everyone's pasta, each one amazing. The pasta is fresh and made in house. We brought 2 bottles of wine and were only charged corkage for 1. Will be coming back!
author: Kelsey G.

description:
I had been here a bunch of times over the last few years when I lived in SF, but it had been a while. Went back with friends a couple of weeks ago when I was in town and remembered why I loved it so much. The food is so outstanding. Between the three of us, we had Saltimbocca (thin veal with prosciutto and cheese), Pavarotti (fusilli with all kinds of stuff in a cream sauce) and Polpettine (linguine with meatballs). The last dish was officially mine but I can't decide which one I loved the best. The meatballs, though, are so delicious.

And I have always loved the vibe in there. Everyone is so friendly - we chatted with the GM Gina and our waiter Milo made us feel as if we were his main concern for the night. He suggested a great wine in our price range and was so friendly. And I love that it's a locals place - as close to Columbus Ave as it is, it speaks more to the neighborhood crowd. Absolutely recommended!
author: Karen H.

description:
delicious italian food for very reasonable prices!
went with my boyfriend for dinner on a sunday night and we were glad that we had 7pm reservations because the restaurant was packed. it's a cozy, family owned place with good service and yummy food. also the bread and olive oil before the meal was good too but save room for the menu courses

what we ordered:
app: meatballs in house red sauce
entrees: beef ravioli and pavarotti

would we order it again? absolutely =)
author: Mary N.

description: I may be biased because this is two blocks from my house, but it's my favorite restaurant. It's a small place and you usually need reservations, but it's the city and that's nothing new. Food is delicious! Great wine list and the ambiance is really sweet. Amazing Italian spot that isn't such a tourist trap like the rest of North Beach.
author: Chelsea B.

description: My wife and I have been coming here for four years.  Which is why we just came back for our one year anniversary.  It is our favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco.  We drove up from Orange County and one of the first things we did is get our reservation at Trattoria Contadina.  I would really encourage this because the restaurant is cozy and quaint with limited sitting.  However, in my humble opinion, this is a plus.  It is owned and operated by a husband and wife (Gena and Kevin, I believe).  They truly make you feel like family.  We always get (religiously) the caprese with burrata and the roasted bell pepper for appetizers.  Entrees are fair game because I have not had a single negative experience.  I do recommend the ravioli in tomato cream sauce.  It is freshly made by a "little elderly women."  She is a saint. Ask for either Cristobal or Steven and you will be in phenomenal hands.  My wife and I only stay in SF for about four-day stints.  Sometimes we even eat here twice during that duration.
author: Clayton V.

description: The food was four out of five, but the service was above and beyond. As an example, my 5-yr old daughter had brought with her a cool rock that she had picked up on a recent hike at Marin Headlands. She left it on the table and we didn't know until after we left. My wife went back to ask about the rock and our server offered to dig through the trash!! which we really didn't expect him to do. We went back the next day and he had found it (by digging in the trash). He was very happy to give it back to her. We left him an extra large tip!
author: Curtis H.

description:
I've heard a lot about this being a "quintessential" San Francisco restaurant.  And it did not dissapoint!  I would recommend this to anyone.

The staff was very attentive and friendly.  We went for a late dinner and they fit us in right away in the upstairs dining room, which was small but necessary to fit the crowds that flock to this place.

The "carlesimo" (pasta with zesty tomato, pancetta and mushroom sauce) was delicious and full of flavor!  My friend's risotto de jour was alright, but nothing compaired to my dish.  Our wine was fantastic (Pinot Noir of some sort - recommended by the bartender).  Another friend had the gnocci and it was alright - I've had better (see: Nob Hill Cafe).

Needless to say I would recommend this place to friends and will take my family here the next time they're in town.
author: Holly D.

description: Service was lacking-- second bar drink was offered and we sat waiting at the end of our meal for about 10 minutes before we got our check-- even though it wasn't busy. Meat balls were too compact right but the entrees were delicious: red snapper and spaghetti with scallops, shrimp, peas, mushrooms in a tomato cream sauce.
author: Liza F.

description: Wonderful Italian food, small place with good service, highly recommend.
author: Neil R.

description: Love this place.  It is the quintessential neighborhood spot where the staff is friendly, the food well prepared and the room welcoming and warm.  Tonight I had the caesar and vongole and both were excellent.  If I was visiting San Francisco, I can't imagine a better place to jump off a cable car and stumble into.  If I lived in the city, what a treat to have Trattoria Contadina just down the block  from your home.  I live in Marin so I'll happily drive into the city to enjoy this gem of a resturant.  This is what North Beach is about.
author: Jim H.

description:
Very good Italian Restaurant in North Beach.
Excellent Service, Great authentic Italian food, and an inspired wine list.

I have been here twice and really enjoyed it both times.
author: Johm H.

description:
My wife and i dined at the restaurant for the first time in 1998. 

The restaurant is located at the corner of mason and union, which is a trolly stop. The dinner was excellent back then as it was this year. The kitchen is consistent and the quality spot on.  Our server recommend the eggplant appetizer that is not on the normal menu. My wife ordered the scallops, I had the veal. 

 I do recommend using yelp reservations Friday - Sunday nights.
author: Jay H.

description: This place is a great place to go if you want delicious Italian food. It is a hidden gem. It is located off Columbus and from all the other restaurants in North Beach. There is slightly a trek up a hill but totally worth the yumminess and it gives you a slight head start on calorie burning. Just a note, the pasta may be a more on the al dente side for some. Still really great place to share with the company of good friends and indulge in some calories that's worth every one.
author: Eve C.

description: Inside the restaurant, there is a newspaper article from 1986 posted on one of the walls that describes Trattoria Contadina as the best and most romantic new italian restaurant in the area. The restaurant still holds that status today. The Carlesimo pasta is incredibly rich and has a fantastic texture that cannot be beat. Other items on the menu are predictably solid with well-balanced flavors and fresh ingredients. I'll keep returning just for the Carlesimo and the atmosphere!
author: Elena M.

description: Good place! Good food. LARGE PORTIONS for a nice Italian place. The pasta dishes were good, not the best I've ever had, but reasonably priced.
author: Elliott S.

description:
Trattoria Contadina is in my neighborhood and is often recommended as an Italian favorite in North Beach.  I finally took everyone's advice and wandered in on a Sunday night with a friend visiting from out of state.  It was BUSY.  So busy we made a reservation for the first available time slot they had (and hour and a half later) and went on to entertain ourselves at neighborhood bars.  The wait was well worth it.  When we returned we were seated upstairs in a quiet corner and our server was delightful.  We came in ready to order big and try as much as we could.  I highly HIGHLY recommend the yellow bell peppers, smothered in delicious asiago and mozzarella cheeses in tomato cream sauce.  That is just the beginning.  Order some meatballs as well - delicious appetizers.  

We decided we wanted to try as much on the menu as possible so after savoring our delicious appetizers we ordered pasta AND an entree to share.  We also threw in a bottle of wine and then a dessert (like I said, we wanted to try everything).  The kitchen was closing as we finished our entrees and our server actually came to our table and introduced us to the server who would be relieving him for the evening since it was time for him to leave.  I was impressed that he took the time to bring our new server over and make sure we were taken care of before he left for the evening.  Our new server was equally as pleasant and had lots of dessert recommendations - which we took (try the torta di cioccolato - it's delicious). 

The food was delicious and the wait staff was great - making sure we enjoyed our food while being insistent upon us taking our time to finish our wine and dessert despite the fact that everyone else was gone and they were closing.  I would definitely go back again!
author: Lauren M.

description:
The restaurant is small, cozy and quaint for couples on a date, but no so great for groups/parties for 6 or more.  The menu looks great too, but the the reality of the food is that the portions are small for the price and not that flavorful if not boring.

Figuring that I needed to give them a fair shake, I eaten there several times and tried the following with corresponding results:
Fruitta di Mare with red or white sause was over cooked
Gnocchi was mushy
Rigatonicelli is glorified macironi and starchy
Ravioli were falling apart and mainly empty.

Really felt as if I were eating a Lean Cuisine meal which would of probably would of been better and 1/4th the price

Caio,
caferio
author: Caferio Y.

description:
This restaurant should have five stars but I'm giving it four stars for the experience. The parking experience, that is. I'd give it 4 1/2 stars if I could since parking is not their fault but since it directly affected our experience, I feel I have to address it. We had reservations at 7:30 and after circling the area numerous times, I called to let them know we would be late. They were not able to accommodate our tardiness and pushed our reservation back to 9:00. It left me with a not so great feeling but whatever. We ended up having to drive back to our hotel since there was no parking ANYWHERE (even the garages were full, we were willing to pay extra to make this reservation!). My husband and I had a few drinks at the hotel bar and then cabbed it back to make the 9:00 reservation. 

As soon as we walked in, we completely understood why they couldn't seat us. I had no idea it was that small! People seemed to be crowded in as tightly as they could and I was immediately excited -- couldn't wait to taste the food that would cause people to cram into each other so! We were promptly seated and as the hostess took us back, I discovered she was taking us upstairs to an even tinier room where we were sat in the corner. The ambiance was so lively and animated that I didn't mind being in the corner one bit. 

We quickly ordered a bottle of their house Sangiovese and celebrated that we had finally made it and were about to start our meal. I ordered a Caesar salad to start and my husband ordered a stuffed pepper. The Caesar salad was very good, I could definitely tell the dressing was made in house. It was not the best I've ever had but I would order again. My husband's pepper was stuffed with A LOT of cheese but he loved it and the tomato cream sauce was outstanding. For our main courses, we asked the waiter what pastas, if any, they made in house. He mentioned the raviolis, gnocchi and meatballs were all made fresh in the kitchen. So my husband ordered the gnocchi and I ordered the meat ravioli with tomato sauce. The gnocchi was very tasty but as with any gnocchi dish, became somewhat boring of the same taste & texture over and over again. He finished about half and I think if we come again we might order the small and split that dish. The meat ravioli with tomato sauce was the clear winner. The sauce was light and fresh and clearly had wine in it. I fell in love instantly. In my head, I quickly tried to figure out how to tweak my own tomato sauce recipe to mimic theirs, that's how good it was. The meat ravioli itself was prepared well and seemed to be cooked and seasoned perfectly. You could definitely tell it was fresh pasta. For dessert we were so stuffed that we ordered cups of coffee and were quite satisfied with that as well.

I will definitely come here again and know to plan ahead of time in terms of getting to this restaurant!!
author: Jennifer F.

description: The service was ok, nothing special but not horrible. I ordered spaghetti and meatballs, and the meatballs were terribly bland with a lack of seasoning and no real flavor other than "meat." The spaghetti sauce wasn't bad, but nothing to go back for.
author: Barbara F.

description: un-be-lievable. the roasted bell pepper appetizer was out of this world.
author: Jeff F.

description:
Dined here last night with a group of friends and my partner and had a good time (3.5 stars). 

Drinks were good and the bartender, with his tattoos, was SEXY! Definitely personalized service and made sure we enjoyed our drinks- he was great!

The service was also good and friendly, although a slight language barriers with some servers. My food was ok.. it tasted good, but within 5 minutes of it being laid out in front of me, it was cold, which was a huge bummer. 

Our salad was ok and other folks plates ranged from very good to okay. I loved the neighborhood feel, the attentive service (specially at bar), and the friendliness. I think other folks (other yelpers) typically have  had a better culinary experience than we did.
author: Art A.

description:
carpaccio, pesto, carlesimo

'nuff said
author: Andrew W.

description:
Came here on a first time visit  to San Francisco.  My wife and I are both from Philly and have not been back for real Italian in some years and decided to try the Italian in SF.  We took other yelp suggestions and tried this place and could not have been happier.  It is a small hole in the wall type place and the food was excellent.

The quarters are a bit tight, but that is how real Italian places usually are.  The food was great and they allow you to pick your size plate so you don't have a huge amount of food wasted.  We did a Caprese salad for an appetizer and it was great.  The pasta dishes have great selection and if you like Veal Scalapini you have tons of choices.

Desert we did a sorbet and tiramisu...very good dessert.

Overall we recommend this place. The staff is very nice and could not be more personnable.

For a bottle of wine, three entrees, two desserts, coffee and one appetizer the total came to about 145 before tax and tip.  Not bad not great but overall the food and experience was wonderful.  The bar is expensive if you plan on having a drink before you eat.
author: Chris M.

description: Great Place, Great Price, Great Service and FANTASTIC FOOD!  What more can you ask for?  If you are in SF you must try it.
author: Lorraine W.

description:
I haven't been to all the Italian restaurants in the city, but that's because this place makes me not want to go anywhere else!!!
  Food, wine and service is incredible... love the intimate atmosphere .. and the upstairs dining area. Yum! Try this place!!!
author: Brittany M.

description: Great food and service.  I ate there with my daughter, her friend, and my husband.  My husband is 100% Italian and very particular about Italian food.  We all agreed it was outstanding and authentic.  They use produce from local sustainable farms.  Perhaps that makes the difference.  Great place to go.
author: Patricia B.

description: This is our favorite Italian restaurant.  Every time we're in town we have at least one dinner here.  Make a reservation if it's a weekend night.  The staff is very helpful and attentive.  Its like eating at someone's house, very hospitable.  The quality of the food is always good.  The drinks are strong.  Even the other patrons are friendly.  I guess that's what happens when you're sitting so close to each other.
author: t d.

description:
Pretty small place, but it has that home feeling to it. The service staff was very friendly and helpful. There were so many good looking dishes, it was hard to choose. One of my favorites is eggplant parmesana. Every time I order this at any other restaurant it is breaded pieces of eggplant with some type of marinara sauce and pasta. I thought their melanzane was going to be perfect, but it turned out to be nothing more than pasta with little chunks of eggplant. Pretty disappointing. However, I will not give up on this place and probably just need to order something else next time.

Great fresh bread!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: An excellent no-frills italian restaurant with good service, great food, but a bit of a cramped atmosphere (one of the bus boys elbowed me in the back of the head because the passage between tables was so narrow).  Their housemade ravioli was excellent and like nothing else i've had before.
author: Dan S.

description:
3.5 stars

4.5 stars for the food and most of the service. They were a little slow coming to give us bread and take our order initially, but the food came up quickly once we ordered. Everything, from the bread to the pasta itself, was delicious. I had the salvatore and thought the larger size was perfect - but then I was hungry. Less hungry people were happy with their smaller portions. I'd brought cupcakes to share afterward, and we weren't sure we'd be allowed to eat them in the restaurant. They were in fact very accommodating and even offered us plates for them! Hence the 4.5 stars.

Unfortunately they lose a star for asking us if we were done because people were waiting for our table. We'd paid the bill, but we were still finishing up our conversation, and it was a bit jolting to be asked if we were "just about finished." I don't know if they felt like we should leave since we'd eaten an outside dessert, but if so they should have just told us we couldn't eat the cupcakes inside. That said, I would definitely go back as the rest of the experience was good.

PS. I called beforehand to ask about parking, and they recommended a lot on Vallejo and Powell...it's $3/hr, cheaper than most.
author: Emily W.

description: PERFECT birthday dinner. We took the suggestions of our waiter and were very happy with everything we ordered. Will definitely return. Its a very quaint, romantic place for delicious Italian.
author: Kari D.

description:
A place so nice we ate here twice. When we were planning our most recent trip to SF, one of the first calls was to make reservations here. The tomato cream sauce is the bomb. And the pesto is equally good (tastes like a summer garden). 
Small drawback in that I had to chase down our waiter to get bread and table service. Otherwise, an awesome place and not right on the main drag.
author: Alan T.

description:
Recently returned for dinner right before they closed one night. We arrived without a reservation, but the hostess welcomed us in & allowed me to park in front in their loading zone, rather than try to circle the area to find a spot. Very thoughtful.

We wanted to try a variety of pastas & sauces and our server gave us great recommendations on 3 different 1/2 orders.

The service was thoughtful, timely and professional. 

Can't wait to go back!
author: John Eric S.

description: Let's face it. LA just doesn't have good Italian. I flew out to SF to visit one of my old college roommates and she took me for a fun, foodie adventure. This place was probably some of the BEST Italian food I've had EVER. The gnocci practically fell apart in my mouth and the meatballs to the spaghetti was flavorful! I can't wait to visit again.
author: Celia C.

description:
The Food was good 
The service was good 
The place was small, and crowded.
But the price was resonable, and i had a good time.
author: Steve M.

description:
I was in San Francisco on a business trip and after shopping on Market Square, I ventured north to Trattoria Contadina.  I found this small restaurant courtesy of yelp and it was a big hit for me. I walked in without a reservation and was promptly seated. The owner greeted me and gave me some meal suggestions.

I ended up getting the half order of caprese salad which was tasty. It wasn't the best I have ever had, but it was fresh. Your meal comes with fresh baked bread with butter, olive oil and balsamic vinegar. I chose Carlesimo as my entree. It was delicious. The dish had a lot of pancetta, peas and sun-dried tomatoes in it. It wasn't just pasta.  The spiced tomato cream sauce is what makes this dish. 

I opted out of getting dessert even though the selection looked amazing. However, the owner and I got to talking about work and traveling and I was given a delicious dessert drink. It is a must. It was a warm tiramisu cocktail. If I could, I would have licked the glass clean. It was that good.

The service and staff here is amazing. They are super friendly and accommodating.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Planned a dinner for 6 on a Saturday night, St. Patricks Day nonetheless.
Hostess called me about three hours before to confirm reservation. I liked how she gave me the friendly reminder about parking and how crazy it would probably be to get there.
Dave and I were well prepared and arrived well before our friends. We sat at the bar and enjoyed conversation and a Peroni will the bartender. He was in the middle of mixing a Fernet cocktail when I had asked him about it. With Dave being a big Fernet drinker we became very interested in other mixologies. 
We sat down quickly when our party had arrived. Service was very attentive and pleasant. 
More importantly, what we ordered:
To start, stuffed pepper (1 per order), awesome stuffed cheesy goodness with a tomato creamy sauce, the kind where you sop up all the bread in.
Pulled burrata with arugula and proscuitto, very fresh and tasty
I had the frutta di mare 1/2 order, super delicious
Dave had the fresh gnocchi, other orders were salmon risotto, chicken francese, and lamb.
Everyone loved the food!
Definitely will be back....
author: DayDay D.

description: This place was amazing.  Nice small intimate setting, and the food was great.  Tried several appetizers, and I got the cheese raviolis with the marinara cream sauce. Go there, you won't be dissapointed.
author: Tony O.

description: This place is amazing.  Super tasty food, and a great wait staff.  Marcos served us and he was really good.  The hazelnut gelato was incredible.  The place is small so reservations are a must.  It's definitely a great experience in SF.
author: Laura J.

description:
We found this promising looking spot on a long walkabout. It was our first meal in SF. Prior to dinner, we enjoyed a martini at Capp's Corner (major old school Italian character) and should have stayed there for dinner. Here it goes...

The special salad of Burrata & Speck was lovely (pretty sure the main components are not made in-house). The Antipasti Meatballs were under seasoned with a texture of boiled meat. The sauce was watery. A plate of sin that had us debating on canceling the next two courses. The beautiful Brunello kept us in a hopeful mood. The Carlesimo Pasta was not in a spicy creamy sauce as stated on the menu. It was loaded fatty pancetta. The pasta itself was perfectly al dente but NOT made in-house. The grand finale had my Italian boyfriend envisioning a roman rolling over in the grave. The Veal Saltimbocca was overcooked and topped with partially melted mozzarella. It floated in a pool of marsala water. Simply awful. The broccolini was barely cooked and the garlic was raw. We ate one bite and started chugging our vino so we could leave. I did mention that the Saltimbocca was "not good" and the waiter was too busy to apologize. We paid for that dish. Our bill was over $350.00 bones and we are still seething a week later. 

Thankfully, the rest of the trip was filled with amazing eats. Sadly, we did not eat another Italian meal.
author: Staci W.

description: I've eaten at Trattoria three or four times now and have NEVER been disappointed. Their pasta dishes are delicious, excellent wine, appetizers (Bruschetta, Eggplant, Meatballs) are all fantastic. The ambiance is very nice, small / intimate mom and pap Italian resteraunt. A good place for a date.
author: David L.

description:
My favorite restaurant in San Francisco.

a bit of of a hole in the wall type of place off the beaten path.  just a few blocks from Columbus Ave., it's a bit underwhelming from the outside but don't let that sway you.  GREAT food and friendly service.  I travel to SF a couple times per year for work and I try to eat here as much as I can.  I have a friend who named his dog "Gnocchi" after the Gnocchi here.  That should close the deal for you.  I'm not a big gnocchi fan but everything else I've had is great.   I'd suggest reservations just to make things easier (it's not a very big place).    Great for romantic dinners or even groups as they'll place tables together for you.  Friendly staff as well.  But seriously, go for the food -- it's fantastic.
author: Mark S.

description: Made dinner reservations for our first culinary experience in SFO via Open Table.  Reservations highly recommended.  Seated near the window to partake in people watching & street drama.  The ambiance is small, somewhat rustic & very intimate with intense aromas wafting throughout.  The menu was impressive & tempting with a flurry of fantastic sounding selections.  Our party ordered all pasta dishes:  Veal picotta in a creamy mushroom sauce w/ penne pasta; Lamb risotto; Chicken Marsala; & penne pasta in olive oil w/ sundried tomatoes, spinach, black olives & chilis. Everything was perfectly prepared & enjoyed.  A cozy corner easily accessed via cable car.  A gem off the beaten path.  Service attentive and accomodating.
author: Kalani C.

description: It is really funny how two people can gave such different opinions about a restaurant experience. I usually go to Yelp as a rule when visiting a new city. For the most part star ratings are fairly accurate. Trattoria Contadina was very good overall. I ordered the bruschetta, peppers with creamy tomato sauce and the pesto dish with chicken and zucchini. The bruschetta and peppers with creamy tomato sauce were both outstanding. The pesto dish was good. My wife thought her dish with the eggplant was OK....We both thought the prices were in the high side. Also, their online menu shows half portion prices as well as full. That turns out to be old and outdated. There is only one set price for each dish.  The prices on the online menu are less than what the actual menu prices are as well. Overall a good experience. Definitely make reservations because the place is tiny and fills up fast.
author: Jonathan H.

description:
This place is so adorable.  It's super tiny and crowded, but that makes it seem even more authentically Italian for some reason.  Everyone was so nice, including the man who seated us and the two men who waited on us.  I like that they offer small and large portions.  The small was just the right amount.  The cappellini with fresh tomatoes was great and my friend had the spaghetti and meatballs, which she also loved.

We split the Caramel Pecan Sorpresa for dessert and it was amazing.  Caramel ice cream with caramel sauce and a crunchy glazed pecan topping.  So good.  They also have a limoncello tiramisu that I was dying to try, but didn't get a chance.
author: Marjie T.

description:
- food: basic, good Italian
- atmosphere: neighborhood casual
- staff: perfunctory 
- price: average

additional info:
- not a strong urge to back...
author: J. B.

description: Though we reached the restaurant just at their closing time, they let us in, and we were served well. Food was good, options for wine were diverse and plenty.
author: venu p.

description:
I live in Chicago and whenever I get to San Francisco, I hop on the cable car and head here for dinner.  Just love the food, the location and the atmosphere.  The beef ravioli is my favorite.  

Ask for a table by the front window if you can.
author: Ray L.

description:
We went here with some friend visiting from London. After some pre-dinner drinks @ Vesuvio on Columbus, we were happy to see that this restaurant is a bit off the beaten path of the rest of the cat calling restaurants on Columbus as you enter North Beach (beyond Stinkin' Rose). 

The place probably seats about 40 max, so reservations are definitely recommended. We arrived for reservations at 8pm, the place was packed, but we got seated immediately.

My wife had called ahead to say that she was vegan, and had asked whether they could accommodate her. Although Contadina is not a vegan restaurant, it is definitely vegan friendly, and the owner was adamant that we should come, and they would assign a "vegan-aware" server to our table.

The service was impeccable. They indeed took care of us, and our quirks, and were super nice and friendly as well as accommodating. 

The bread they serve is absolutely divine. Some sort of amazing home baked sourdough bread which isn't too sour. Absolutely delicious (with some garlic infused olive oil... yum!).

We ordered the anti-pasti (which was meh, btw. The cheese is pretty blah, and the meats, well... I'm very peculiar and have very high standards when it comes to cold cuts, having had the privilege of indulging on some of the best hams (bellota) in the world). This is where I take off a star.

The mains however, were fantastic: the veal saltimbocca was very rich, but also very good ! The asparagus it came with were perfectly cooked, and the veal was soft and tender. The other veal dish was the Correnti, which consists of pan sautéed veal scaloppini topped with a porcini mushroom cream sauce and served with sautéed Swiss chard penne pasta, it was absolutely divine.

The fresco is an awesome option for vegans/vegetarians. It was explosive w/ flavor, but mind you, you gotta like the garlic, and accept the fact that there will be a 3 meter radius of empty space surrounding you for the next few days.

The one additional sore mark in the dishes we ordered are specific to the Linguini Vongole, which consists of linguini pasta with sautéed clams and a lemon, butter, garlic and white wine sauce. This dish was far to acidic and bitter, and we left it untouched. Thankfully, the service here is so good that they did not charge this dish to our bill.

All in all, a fantastic meal with some minor sore points, impeccable service, and a really warm, exciting atmosphere. Would definitely come back.
author: Shayan S.

description:
Walked in with 3 adults and a 2 year old.  Got lucky and was sat immediately.  Food was fantastic.  Had a butternut squash soup and risotto that was amazing.  Everyone enjoyed the meal and the service was friendly and attentive.  Great, neighborhood atmosphere.

Definitely going back if I'm in the area.
author: D D.

description:
Overall: B 
Old school. Definition of a southern trattoria 

Decor: C 
Rustic. Close seating which results in a loud and hot dining experience. 

Food: B 
Just like Nonna used to make. Good Bresola, but cut too thick. The costolette is crucial. Hands down the best dish on the menu. 

Service: B 
A little slow which is fine by me, just don't go in there expecting a fast meal. Milo made up for the slow plating of the food with humor and witty banter. 

Value: A 
Big boy portions. Every dish can be easily shared by two people.
author: Roger H.

description:
If you love pasta in delicious sauces, this is the spot for you. 

I went with a group of friends last night and everything we ordered was delicious. They start off by serving you bread and olive oil. I'm not usually one to eat much bread but the olive oil was DELICIOUS! So, I had a few pieces. 

For dinner I had the Salvatore which is Chicken tortellini in a tomato cream sauce. Holy yum! The tomato cream sauce was so tasty. I also stole bites of my friends gnocci in pesto which was awesome and a bite of the pasta with clams. All were well prepared and flavorful. 

The restaurant is a bit small so I would recommend making reservations.
author: Jeanette L.

description:
Nice cozy place in North Beach!  One of those good ole Italian places.  The price is reasonable but suggest you make reservations as it can get pretty packed at times.

The food was great.  Not perfect but it was great.  I had tried the Vongole and if you are into seafood and white sauce, this is a must try.  The portions are also pretty generous so if your meal comes in 1/2 size, go for that.

Our group tried the chocolate mousse and the lemon tiramisu, our group was divided in what we liked but I liked both.   The chocolate mousse with the raspberry and coupled with the chianti we had was perfect for my palate.  

Definitely will come back here and try more.
author: Fe R.

description: Love this restaurant. We go there everytime we are in SF. Food is excellent and it is a fun atmosphere.
author: Elaine J.

description:
My #1 place for Italian comfort food.

I came here for the first time several years ago but I still distinctly remember loving their Carlesimo pasta.

The space is charming and cozy, and the food is affordable.  Great for a casual date night, a small celebration, or really any reason for eating some great Italian food.
author: S L.

description:
Husband and I ate here based on Yelp reviews and LOVED it. The food was great, but it was the experience as a whole that merits the five stars. 

Arrived around 7:30 on a crowded Sunday night w/o a reservation. The two couples who arrived right before us both had reservations, so I thought we'd be looking at a long wait. Nope! The hostess was nice as can be when we said we didn't have a reservation (sometimes they look at you with derision when you dare to show up without one), and got us seated within about 5 minutes. 

The atmosphere at the restaurant was very cozy and warm, but clearly in an urban setting. The front room was somewhat small, but we were seated in a hidden little room upstairs, which was wonderful -- out of the way and not cramped. Patrons were a wide mix of ages and types -- there was a group of 8 in their early 20s in jeans, alongside tables with very nicely-dressed couples in their 50s, and everything in between. The staff seemed equally nice to everyone.

The food was delicious. First, the bread -- yum! Served with olive oil, and there is balsamic on the table, which my husband thought was much tastier than normal balsamic. 

We started by sharing the large size of the Caprese salad. (Note: they have multiple sizes of a number of their dishes, which is a really nice feature). There were three slices of tomato, a mix of greens, and the most delicious mozzarella I have ever tasted. We devoured it. My husband ordered the linguine with meatballs. The meatballs were delicious -- moist, perfectly seasoned. Mmmm...

Overall, we were very happy we found this place and will definitely come back in the future. Thanks Yelp!
author: Kristin P.

description: Unfortunately I remember this place being truly great Italian food, but I think it has outgrown itself now.  What used to be intimate place with incredibly tasty and high quality food has dipped into more of a generic churn - who knows, probably yelp helped to do this - the volume has brought down the quality for sure.  It's not bad, but it's not great (anymore).  For the price, it should be great.  And our server clearly had better places to be.
author: Rob J.

description: Was blown away by the taste in each bite of food we had tonight at Trattoria Contadina.  Glad to see that the restaurant is staying in the family.  The owners and staff were warm and welcoming.  They really took the time to make us feel special.  You could taste the love in each dish that was prepared for us.  If you are looking for a romantic cozy spot to have a delicious meal then this is the place to go. Will definitely be returning.
author: Katrina B.

description:
Wonderful.

This is our go-to place for a nice meal. We have ordered various items and we've always been happy with our choice.

We love the gnocchi and the risotto. I've had steak, they've cooked and seasoned  it well. 

We make reservations each time we go, the place seems to fill up quickly. 
Restaurant is clean, full bar, they are always helpful when we ask about wines.

Staff are friendly and attentive. I'd recommend it to anyone who is looking to have a great Italian meal in an intimate setting.
author: Marisa E.

description:
Didn't realize they serve BRUNCH.....we happened to be walking by....
FABULOUS lemon ricotta pancakes (light, airy, and delicious), fantastic
patty sausage and crisp, non fatty bacon.  What a treat and right in our neighborhood!
Go soon, before everyone finds out that they are open for brunch!
author: Roberta I.

description:
This lovely, friendly, cozy little Italian-American restaurant on Russian Hill is always a sure bet.  The food is simple, of high quality, great value and very nicely prepared and presented.  The staff is attentive and pleasant.

Warm Marinated Olives - Great little antipasti to enjoy with fresh bread, olive oil and balsamic.
Casare - Well balanced house-made dressing with, if you like, excellent alici marinate.
Caprese - Nice fresh Mozzarella.  The quality of the tomato could have been better.
Mista - Nice
Frutti de Mare - Spaghetti brimming with fresh clams, mussels and shrimp, with tender calamari and a light, fresh tomato sauce.  Very good.
Pavarotti - Excellent pesto cream sauce.
Bistecca - Beautiful, flavorful flat iron steak with an impossibly good red wine reduction.  The hint of (I think) capers was a great surprise.

Thank you to Trattoria Contadina for another wonderful experience!
author: Jclnmd J.

description: Delicious real Italian food! Definitely must try the cheese-filled peppers!
author: Shea S.

description: Good Italian food on the Hyde street cable car route in North Beach.
author: J.D. B.

description: Excellent beet salad!  I liked that they had small sized dinner serving portions or full sized, got to try 2 different menu items that way without overeating or having to waste anything.  I had the duck pasta, great flavor!  We walked here from the Hilton where we were staying at in Fishermans Wharf.
author: Megan S.

description: This has been our go to place in North Beach area for at least 15 years! Of course we always make a reservation since it can get busy - we want to ensure we can dine there. This place is definitely not one of those hyped-up North Beach restaurants - this is a warm and inviting family-owned restaurant. You will usually be greeted by one of the owners - Gina at the door or Kevin behind the bar!! The service and food is always consistently great!! Make sure you try the stuffed pepper appetizer - it will truly create a wonderful start to your dining experience. Also the wine list is quite diverse; however, not complicated and at reasonable prices. Love this place and you will too!!
author: Jan H.

description:
As I told mrs crash, "mama at Grappino's would be impressed"! Yes it's traditional, yes it's cosy but it's also fun, and full of flavor and robust and yes, large serves.

The other reviews are right, there is nothing 'new' or 'adventurous' on the menu, just solid rustic italian cooked with fresh ingredients and care.

Booking seems to be  essential.

For my review of "rue saint Jacques" I said I could be talked into becoming a regular: for contadina, I wish I could be a regular!
author: Captain C.

description:
I feel like I'm cheating on my first love, Tommassos.  But I LOVE this place. I've been here about 10 times over the past 5 years and every time I fall in love with the quaint neighborhood feel and the amazing and unique food.  Its not just some other north beach italian place, you can tell this place has been around forever and the locals really love it.

I went there last night with 2 friends who had never been.  It was great, the hostess was super cute and accommodating.  We were still waiting for our 3rd and she seated us anyways in the table of our choice (even though the place was packed).  The bartender was great even though he forgot to give us our wine, but when he did...he topped us off with a little something extra.  Totally made up for it!

The food was great as always and I left stumbling the block home to my house feeling great.  I won't get into specific dishes since I've had pretty much everything on the menu.  So I guess that speaks for itself.
author: jessica b.

description: Got a recommendation from the front desk clerk on this one.  We wanted good italian at a non tourist trap in little Italy, and this place delivered.  Though the bathroom and overall place is small, the ambience is great for a nice family dinner.  Everyone I was with enjoyed the food and we all got the smaller portions, which was plenty.  The service was outstanding.  Highly recommend if your in the area as it could be the best italian you have ever had.
author: David C.

description: This place is an institution, and they take that reputation very seriously.  The walls are lined with pics from celebrities who have dined there over the years.  It's got a nice mix of locals and tourists, which makes for great people watching.  It's also right on the cable car line so it has a fantastic San Francisco feel.  I've ordered many of the pastas during my visits and always come away impressed.  The stuffed pepper appetizer is particularly impressive.  The wait staff is very good at their job and the owners are visible and friendly.  It's a real family run operation.  Bonus:  has a tiny bar inside, perfect for a pre-dinner cocktail.
author: Paul W.

description: My favorite place in North Beach!  Great Food, vino and cocktails!  Service in excellent!  can'y miss!!
author: Rikki Y.

description: One of my favorites and used to live across from here, my GF intro'd me to this spot and I've loved it ever since.  Get the Peppers for an app and the Carlesimo for dinner.  You will love it!
author: Rich S.

description:
My fiance and I were out in San Francisco for a visit and needed a place for supper. We found this on yelp and all the great reviews were not wrong.  Great Italian food, great atmosphere and wonderful service.  It reminded me what I like about the little home-owned places.  Bring your appetite when you go here and a half is probably enough for most people.  Do save some room for dessert.  We had the Lemon-cello tiaramusu.

Seatting is close, but comfy is about the only downside.
author: Craig M.

description:
So funny thing about this place... I went because a friend that use to live in San Francisco that is OBSESSED with this place.  Both her and I went to Terrior that after and got into an debate with a guy there who thought this other Italian place was better... but he did say the gnocchi was outstanding.

So I have to agree with this guy.. the salad and such were just average.. I got mussels and clams which were great but not as amazing as the homemade gnocchi.. it is seriously out of this world!  Cute spot.. the staff was extremely nice and accommodating.  Now.. I have to remember the name of the other spot and compare.
author: Patty T.

description: A solid choice for classic Italian meals in North Beach, they serve up pasta classics in hearty portions.  They also have meat and fish plates.  Their salads are a high note, with good interpretations of the tried and true caprese and caeser salads.  The ambiance, however, is what bumps this place up to 4 stars.  It is set on the corner of Mason Street, so you get the dinging and rumbling of cable cars just outside the windows.  The requisite celebrity photos and cozy decor make this neighborhood place a good bet for an unpretentious dinner with folks you aren't trying to impress.
author: Aaron S.

description: Went for lunch on Mother's day with the family.  Everyone was so friendly.  The owner (I think) was so nice and when I mentioned I was a vegetarian, she even showed me the dinner menu and said they could make anything off of it for me!  I always appreciate that.  I got a bellini which was perfect to drink.  I started with the asparagus and egg salad, very yummy and unique.  I did get the Carlesimo and they subbed spinach for the meat.  It was very good.  The kids shared a half portion of a pasta they made just for them.  Parking was rough but everything else great!
author: Manisha S.

description:
If this had been a 3 or 4 star experience, I probably wouldn't be writing this review.  However....

The food really wasn't very good.  And I hate to say it, but the bus girl needs to be retrained.  She filled a bowl with olive oil to the rim, so when we dipped the unremarkable bread in it, the oil spilled out.  She also insisted on refilling my glass of water after only a couple sips.  Normally, I might appreciate such attentiveness, but the table was cramped, so unnecessary intrusions of elbows were unwelcome.  

And why do I have to tell both the bus girl AND the waitress that I don't want any pepper on my salad?  Damnit, I said "no" already!  Stop interrupting me!

Maybe I am nitpicking, but I left feeling unsatisfied, and that's the bottom line.
author: Tom K.

description: Been here a few times, once for brunch and a couple times for dinner. Really like the ambiance of the place. The food is good - only item that let me down so far was the Frutti di Mare, which was a little bland. Overall, great experience dining here!
author: Daniel W.

description: It is a decent restaurant. I've been there a few times. Nothing is too memorable but I do remember it's better than a lots of restaurants in North Beach especially Mona Lisa and stinky rose
author: Ricki H.

description: Anyone that would rate this place anything but 5 stars is coo coo. We know this place is small, we know this place has dim lighting (have you ever heard of a romantic atmosphere?) Bottom line is the food is delicious and the service is amazing every time! Even if I came here at the very last minute and I had to sit at the bar, the bartender is charming, sociable, and honest. First time I came here was for my bday and I wasn't in the best mood (due to a disagreement with the bf), my server and even the bus boy cheered me up! you also get a special dessert on your bday. The Carlesimo pasta dish is spectacular..but everything else I've tried is pretty amazing.
author: Natasha A.

description: Excellent experience. Brunch and dinner are great. Classic Italian. Favorite Italian restaurant in north beach. Recommend the meatballs among other items.
author: Thomas S.

description:
Off the beaten path, in a neighborhood, and was a wonderful surprise.  Everything about it was terrific: Food, ambiance, service and price!  Loved it.
- One small issue... we were one of the last reservations of the evening and felt a bit rushed at first.  Appetizer came before we had a chance to even order our wine.  Things settled down a bit and it was all good.
author: John P.

description:
Great little place in north beach!

We had reservations and one other place and they were closed tonight so we got reservations here.

Just one of those places that is small and just cool. Not like a cheesy Italian place.

Apps we had were

Mista
Spring mixed greens with tomatoes, calamata olives, onions, parmesan cheese and a balsamic vinaigrette 

Nice salad, i got the small and it was still big......

Person i was with had the

Prosciutto 
Thinly sliced Prosciutto di Parma, served with fresh seasonal fruit and extra virgin olive oil

it was huge, the seasonal fruit was ..... cantaloupe


Now for the entrees

Saltimbocca 
Veal scaloppini layered with prosciutto, mozzarella cheese and sage, served with a marsala wine and tomato sauce, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes

looked good

i had the special

A risotto with lamb. 

it was some good eatin. nice big portion and atleast 8 slices of lamb. mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm

i was stuffed but  we decided to get desert

got the
Blackberry Cabernet Sorbet 

it was ok.

overall the meal was great, 

it was just tough to feel like you are on the next table because you are so close to all the tables. This place is small.

Worth going back!
author: Roy K.

description: I agree with the taxi driver.  "Best Italian food in town!"
author: Susie A.

description: The best Italian food in North Beach and all of San Francisco.  I've been here numerous times and tried a variety of dishes.  Everything is delicious.  Some favorites that come to mind are; the Carpaccio, Caprese, Valdostana, Gnocchi, and their impeccable Bar and Wine list.  If you find yourself in the neighborhood, do yourself a favor and stop in at the Trat.  You'll be thanking yourself later.
author: Brian D.

description: Excuse my language but this place is shit. First of all, how are only two of the pastas made from scratch? The gnocchi with bleu cheese was good but the compliments end there. Everything else was bland and not great italian food. To top it off, almost everyone in my party had stomach problems for the next 24 hours. The only thing we all shared (the gnocchi - i.e. the only thing we enjoyed) seems to have been not so good after all.
author: Amy F.

description: If I could give 4.5 stars that's what I would give it.  I've been twice and both times the food was very good, but this last time the service was a little weak.  Another waiter stepped in and picked up the slack which helped a lot.  I had a pasta with spicy tomato cream sauce, sun dried tomatoes, peas, and some kind of ham/bacon.  The antipasto plate was good too.  Definitely recommended.
author: Jason A.

description:
Perhaps because I am from the same motherland, I expected"Farmer Trattoria" to be as such, hearty, friendly, cheap, rustic and authentic. Ah! friendly, a hit! but hearty, rustic and cheap like a TRATTORIA should be...well, not a hit, not close. Thus, it missed out on authenticity.

Lo so che nn siamo in Italia, pero', miseria, alla faccia che prezzi aio'! Avrete contadini che cagano oro dalle vostre parti magari, ma nn da noi a San Francisco!
author: Paolo D.

description: This place is great, but you will need a reservation.  It gets busy FAST!  We went around 6pm and had a great experience.  We ordered an appetizer of burrata, speck and a pepper jam that was really good.  For our main course, I had the saltimboca which had a lovely sage thing going on.  My boyfriend has the steak.  I would say for the price, we got a lot of food.  And the service was excellent.  Next time we go, we are going to try the pastas.
author: Tapedeck B.

description: Treated a friend out to dinner, restaurant was way smaller/cozier than the pics showed, parking was pretty crazy, parked in a lot around the corner for $20. Bruschetta was ok, I have had better but it wasn't bad. My friend got the Caprese salad and that was really delicious! For an entrée I got the chicken with gnocchi and mushrooms, really really good. For dessert we both got the stratiacella gewhich was divine. Service was quick and atmosphere was lively, kind of loud actually but fun. Would for sure go back for another special occasion. Prices were a little steep but I felt the quality of the food was also up there.
author: Jeanna M.

description: Came here for a friends birthday and was completely unimpressed. First thought, it looked quaint and smelled good. We sat down after barely managing to squish through the tables, hallway and stairs; bumping into purses and knocking jackets off of chairs, receiving annoyed looks from the wait staff (like your not already aware that its narrow and you have to wait to pass). Sat down, ordered drinks and was then told that they were out of meatballs, gnocchi and half the rest of the menu. Friend's pasta was cold and by the time it came out again the rest of the table had already finished.
author: alamogirl h.

description:
As I grow up I'm beginning to enjoy the finer things in life, like raw oysters and red wine. But I'm also beginning to appreciate the simplicity of homemade mac and cheese and a hearty beef stew much more. That's why this old restaurant has become my new favorite in North Beach--it's Italian comfort food in a comfortable, homey setting.
 
My friend and I began with the Impepata di Vongole e Cozze (steamed clams and mussels in broth), which would've been better if the shellfish were larger and there was more of them. For $15, I don't believe we even got 15 clams. I'll bypass this next time and try the Polenta e Funghi instead.

Next we split the Gnocchi alla Napolentana ($16) and the Linguini con Polpettine alla Santucci ($17). These dishes were classic but squisita! Although the ricotta gnocchi was a little chewy, the tomato and cheese sauce was creamy good. The meatballs in the linguini were beautifully seasoned and the tomato sauce simply delicious. This restaurant does classic food right.

Service was nothing short of wonderful. If I lived in North Beach, I'd come here often. It's a great experience at a great value. Get off of that tourist trap known as Columbus Avenue!
author: Liz T.

description:
I was in SF for a tech conference and a local that I met at a baseball game recommended that my co-worker and I try this place.  I'm glad we took his advice.  The seating is limited, so I'm also glad we made a reservation.  It's also tight, so be prepared to hear other peoples conversations(or them hear yours).  When we walked in, our table wasn't free yet, so we ordered a drink at the bar and waited for our table.  I ordered a Drakes Hefewiezen.  This was my first time drinking it, so I didn't know what to expect.  I wasn't a big fan of it at first, but continued to sip it as we waited for our table.  When we got to our table, the guy tending the bar, who I think was the owner, came over with a new beer from a fresh keg and notified me that the next Drakes he pulled was the last of the keg, so mine was probably flat.  The new beer was much better, and I'm glad he made the effort as I probably would have just finished my first (and last) Drakes. As we looked over the menu and eventually ordered, all of the staff was friendly and helpful with any questions that we had.  This place truly has that family owned feel.  On to the food...  We ordered the meatball appetizer and bruschetta (antipasti).  The meatballs were possibly the best Italian meatballs I have ever had, and the sauce that came with them was amazing.  The brushetta was also very good.  Then onto the main course, I had the Salvatore(chicken ravioli), which was awesome, and my co-worker had the gnocchi with asiago tomato cream sauce, which I tried and almost wished I had ordered that instead...Until I took another bite of mine.  The sauces were all wonderful.  After we finished our meals, we ordered desert.  I had the hazelnut gelato.  It arrived in a dish with much more than I was expecting.  I quickly noticed that some of it was very crystallized as if it was melted and re-froze.  Thankfully, the top two scoops were not this way.  They were rich and creamy as I had hoped for, and two scoops was probably all I needed.
Overall, the food was great, the service was great, the atmosphere was OK.  The only negatives were the flat beer, which was corrected without me saying anything, and my desert, which I'm sure they would have corrected had I said something.  The next time I am in SF, I will likely try this place again (even with all of the other options)
Great Job Trattoria Contadina and thank you to the guy at the Giants game, who recommended this place.
author: Josh G.

description: WOW!!!  This restaurant is AMAZING!   It is by far the best meal we have had in San Francisco on our 5 day stay in the city.   We were looking for a local place - one with charm and authenticity.   Our concierge at the Clift Hotel suggested this restaurant and we are so glad he did.   I had the Chicken Parmesan - gave half of it to my boyfriend and still had leftovers.   It was the kind of meal where I felt annoyed that I was full because it was so delicious I wanted to eat it all.   My Boyfriend ordered the Pavorotti Pasta dish - fuscilli with sundried tomatoes, chicken,zucchini in a tomato cream sauce.   It was incredible.  For apps we split a ceasar salad and meatballs.  They also served us a dish of crushed garlic in olive oil that was out of this world.   I love that they have an open kitchen.  All the food that was placed on the counter was piping hot and served right away.   I can't say enough good things about this place.  On the way out we met the owners - a really cute couple who were so friendly.   RUN - DON'T WALK to this restaurant.
author: Michele A.

description: Excellent service and excellent food. We were in San Fran for Dreamforce last week so we ventured out of the hotel/conference area and found this place.  Looking forward to returning some day soon I hope!
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Worst Italian I've ever had!

Went here for the first time tonight after several aborted attempts. I expected to have a nice meal. Instead I sat on my toilet for 15 mins afterward, seriously.

I had the Valdostana. It was dry and tasted awful. It was swimming in butter and covered with dry, tasteless prosciutto. AND it had a thick layer of cheese. The waiter asked if I wanted parmesan cheese on it. Cheese on top of cheese! I opted no.

The bread was no better than Safeway bread. The oil was tasteless and cheap. The meatballs were ok and the hazelnut gelato (which I can probably get anywhere) was the best part.

Service was fine. The restaurant made my clothes stink.

Stay away!! This place is terrible!
author: Jeff M.

description:
I just moved into the neighborhood, and went to check this place out. I can say hands-down that I will be frequenting it!!

We had to wait, even at 9:30pm, but I didn't have a reservation, so I expected that!

"It was good, and the people were nice" says the person who came with me! That about sums it up. The food was some of the best Italian food that I've had, and it is a great place for getting large plates and sharing them family style.

I appreciated that the bartender took the time to let us sample each wine before we picked what bottle we wanted.  The service, from the host to the server to the bus boy was just great, so nice and considerate. We were there very late, after they were closing, but even as we finished, nobody rushed us out.

I had the gnocchi, and it was delicious.
author: Carina E.

description: It was everything we heard it'd be and then some! Intimate, friendly but with just enough buzz to give any visitor that "city" feel.  Food was outstanding and the portions appropriate.  They give the option on pasta dishes for small or large portions which is great, allowed us to enjoy a couple of appetizers.  We brought our own wine so not sure what the wine list is like.  Cappuccino was great with dessert, this place had everything we needed.
author: Kevin R.

description: This place has been around for a long time.  I decided to go back when I was in town (it used to be my father's favorite restaurant about 15 years ago).
