I remember it being much better than it actually was the other night.  The service was great, the food was just okay (heavy sauces overpowered the rest of the dishes), but the place is just so worn.  The original linoleum floor and tiny dirty bathroom justifies that this place needs a little update!  And parking is horrible.  Staff is still incredibly friendly and brought back good memories.  However, not sure I'll return.  There are much better Italian restaurants in the city now.
author: Hillary B.

description:
Chicken with Marsala, provolone, prosciutto (nice)
Bruschetta (delicious)
Chianti (cheap and tasty)
Good vibe
No pizza???
author: Geoff G.

description: Trattoria Contadina is a small neighborhood restaurant; reservations highly recommended so you don't have to wait too long. The restaurant is loud with the many customers talking over each other but the energy is fantastic. I dine here at least once a month, the food is awesome and the service is always great. The host/manager knows me and my sister and usually takes care of us when dine here. I've never had a bad meal here and always recommend friends of friends or people visiting the area if they want great Italian food at a local spot to definitely check out Trattoria Contadina. In my opinion it is by far one of the BEST Italian restaurants in San Francisco. Salute,
author: Liz D.

description: I am baffled by the long line of strong reviews.  Bland food, inferior ingredients, skimpy bits of premium items like prosciutto in the salad or lamb in the ragu.  Forgettable.
author: Kirk B.

description:
Could it be?  Is this it?  Is this perfect Italian food in San Francisco?

By george, I think it is!

Came here the other night to celebrate my best friend quitting her job.  (A move that, in my opinion was at least 6 months in coming - definitely worth celebrating.)  We didn't have reservations as we ambled up at 7:15 on a Friday night.  (Yes, we were that bold, believing in our universe driven right - no - NEED to celebrate.)  The hostess politely told us that it would be a 2 1/2 hour wait.  Even seating at the bar wasn't available.  Well, we stood outside to talk it over.  (Really, I think we were incapable of moving any farther away from the maddeningly delicious scents wafting out the doorway.)  All of a sudden, the universe (having driven us here in the first place), in the form of the hostess, said to us, "Come in.  I think those people with the reservations aren't coming."  And the next thing we knew, we were seated at a cozy little table near a window.  

The rest of a the evening is a delightful swirl of rich and flavorful food, wine and conversation.  We had the clams & mussels appetizer, with lots of bread to soak up the white wine sauce.  I had an enormous plate of pasta with chicken, sundried tomatoes, zucchini, peas and cream sauce (1/2 for lunch the next day, it was so large).  Best friend had pasta as well, with chicken, pancetta, and an amazing red sauce.  For dessert we split something we'd never seen before (but certainly plan to devour again at our earliest convenience): limoncella tiramisu.  

And with that, our meal was complete.  Everything we had was incredibly flavorful (but not the same flavors, as can sometimes happen at lesser Italian restaurants).  The total bill, before tax was around $90.  Very reasonable for the amount and quality of the food.  Service was excellent.  Ambience was warm and cozy.

I'd go back in a heartbeat.  But I'd probably make reservations.  Cause I can't always just expect the universe to lay rose petals at my feet.
author: Ravena F.

description:
Overall while I love Italian food, I don't honestly love it here in SF.....kinda sucks in my opinion but that's just me.  Or maybe I'm not hitting the right spots. 

This place however is perfect. Small local spot and not on Columbus (thank god) that sports a decent wine list and amazing food. Once inside you will feel the charm and smell the aromas that you would experience in a trattoria in Italy. Almost anyway. 

Last time I came here with my "BFF" (why they use this term is beyond me) to grab a late night dinner and just catch up. I ordered the Ravioli Correnti - Fresh ravioli filled with beef, pork, egg, spinach, herbs and cheese, served with a porcini mushroom cream sauce. This may be one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. I tried to lick the plate but I'm pretty sure I would have been slapped (she likes hitting me in the head). Don't think I still didn't think about it anyway. 

She had the Frutti di Mare alla Fiore--
Fresh sauted Manila clams, Prince Edward Island mussels, salmon, calamari, and prawns with a garlic and pomodoro sauce, served over linguini pasta. Overall this dish was good, but not stellar.  Noodles were definitely fresh but I've had better items here over the years. 

Wine list here is reasonable and not too expensive. Try it and you won't be disappointed. I think I even saw a Michelin recommended sticker in the window. Score.

Morgan approves...
author: Morgan H.

description:
I love this place.  It's really nice to eat in a family run restauran in this corporate world!  I first visited here in about 1994 and have been a regular every time I return to SF.  I've even gone as far as to get food to go to eat on the plane on the trip back to Portland.  I believe that the service was better prior to having a full bar.  Now more time is spent by the wait staff worrying about everyones drinks than just getting another bottle of wine.

I have never had food that was anything less than wonderful.  My favorite is Pasta Pavarotti.  A close runner up is the chicken ravioli.  I rather like sun dried tomatoes and both of these have them so perhaps I'm bias.

Their bread is to die for as far as restaurant bread is concerned.  I'm a butter on my bread person and there is never a shortage.
author: Parker J.

description: Searched for months to find a sweet spot with a tasty menu for my husband's 50th birthday. We wanted an intimate gathering for about 20 people. When it came down to scheduling and planning the menu, I realized that with the diet dilemmas of our group the fixed menu options weren't going to work for us. Vegans, celiac sufferers, finicky kids, diabetics, we were a chef's nightmare. Gina was amazing, she allowed me to create my own menu and when we arrived, everything was perfect, she even printed special menus with my husband's name and 50th birthday at the top. The service was great and the food was incredible. I'm so grateful.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
After forty years of living one and a half blocks from this place, my sister finally gets to eat here and I am lucky enough to be there with her!! wow!! Where we gonna hold the celebrating party? At Trattoria Contadina of course!! I am told by my sister that this place existed here even when I roamed the streets as a lad here, but I don't remember too much....  it's nice seeing the cable cars go by - big spacious windows - and of course SF Muni stops here also and noticed each and every passenger and those getting off at the corner bus stop look to the restaurant windows....  When I initially walked in, my senses were pleasantly overcome by the strong aroma of olive oil and garlic - lots of it! I thought I was in Spain or Italia again...  (no such luck). I ordered the swordfish with raisins and almonds in a light gravy, served with asparagus. Except for the usual obvious lack of salt a la americana, the swordfish was sooo delicious ~ I was not disappointed! I had a very nice slightly dry white house wine, and it went great with the fish. I noticed that unlike other restaurants I've been to since arriving in the states two years ago, this place was cooking with REAL garlic and not that bottled crap that's diced...  I saw and ate real garlic!! The asparagus was firm yet tasty and not hard. It was totally a very delicious experience and to make it more interesting, the couple who sat next to us had some time in a location when I was there at the very same time, plus knows of my little seaside town in Spain! wow!! The place was packed as we walked in, and quickly filled up after we sat. The unisex bathroom waaay in the back and to the left was tiny, homey and reminded me right away of Spain and/or Italia! Braaaavo!! If you turn around - or TRY to turn around - you may end up stuck or outside!   :-D  The only downside I can see of this tiny corner location were the tables were waaay too close for comfort to each other ~ BUT thar's an UPside to that: you can practically taste and smell your table-neighbors' entrees and perhaps what you'll be ordering on your next visit here!! I did notice the swordfish was not on their online version of the menu...  so forewarning the online menu isn't updated.

I finished the evening with a Bailey's coffee that was excellent - how can you miss? I fondly remembered the last time I wanted to try a Bailey's in SF I was still under-age!! hahahahaaa  The service is outstanding!! I'll return in a heartbeat!!! ooooh, after living in Spain for over a decade, I now consider a restaurant that's "noisy" to be full of happy diners...  this place was noisy!!!  :-)

NOTE: I forgot to add stuff....  important stuff!! We ordered after a few minutes and expressed my surprise that I should find swordfish anywhere, as I love to cook/eat swordfish with real olive oil hand-carried with me from Spain (liter bottle didn't cost me $4). Not only was I SHOCKED to find swordfish here BUT in just a few minutes, it was served!! That's amazing, and the restaurant was packed!!!
author: Tony L.

description:
In the past week I revisited three restaurants that I've really enjoyed in the past...both Bocadillos and Bar Crudo were as good as I remembered but I gotta admit, I was a bit disappointed with Contadina this time around.  

First off, the restaurant was really hot and really LOUD.  Food was good but $13 for a caprese salad?  The tomatoes were really cold and not very ripe, the dish overall not seasoned well.  Maybe I'm being a bit harsh because I just had a $13 lobster/burrata/heirloom tomato salad at Bar Crudo two nights prior but I felt a bit ripped off.
Pastas were both tasty and large portions, but again, $17 for linguine with sausage?  

All in all, good food at inflated prices...I love the neighborhood feel to the place (our hostess and waiter were both great) but doubt I'll be returning anytime soon...there are too many other good options for the price.
author: phil h.

description:
Everyone has a "go to" place.  Whether it's for dates, out of towners, or gathering with friends.  For most of the past 6 years, Trattoria Contadina has been my go to spot.  Why?  Because it's damn good Italian food without pretensions.  You can have your A 16's, your Delfinas, and your SPQR's.  My grandmother would not set foot in those places.  Ever!  Why?  Because they're not even run by Italians!!!!  My personal list of most hated Bay Area thingies goes: Delfina, A 16, and then the tree sitters.  See the connection?  They're all posers!!

On to Contadina.  I went there for the first time in a long time a few weeks with my girlfriend.  (If you LOVE this place so much, why have we never gone there?)  As usual, the meal did not disappoint.  If you are looking for specific advice on what to order, I'll narrow it down for you: EVERYTHING!  Oops.  That probably did not help.  I say everything because I mean everything is awesome.  If you have to pick just a few, I would go with the Rigatoni Melazane, the Gnocchi, and the Capellini.  The Polenta Funghi is a awesome starter.  How good are the desserts?  I wouldn't know because I have never had enough room after dinner.

So if I love this place so much, why not 5 stars?  Because it's crowded and often a little too hot inside.  I have never left there without a nice lather.  More than you needed to know about my sweat glands, but something you need to know if you sweat a lot.  Your first date might think you're a freak.  That's ok, because she will be impressed that you took her here for some real Italian food and not some pretentious low grade dog food at Delfina.
author: Chris I.

description:
allow me to start off by saying that I am not the romantic type by any means...im willing to give you my girlfriends email address to prove that point ha. 

with that said, Trattoria Contadina is a beautiful establishment in the perfect spot of north beach. most restaurants in north beach are set on the main side of tourists and eating dinner consists of being looked at as if you were a fish in an aquarium, i swear i hate when im eating and tourists are pointing at my food through the window...call me a hater, and ill call you correct. 

anywho...back to the review. my girlfriend and I have gone here for valentines day for the past two years and it has always been a wonderful experience that makes me wish I had more reasons to return here. I dont know why people complain about the service, because for me the service has always been top notch, they are always attentive and welcoming. The atmosphere is set just outside the tourist walk but close enough to go for a nice walk after your meal. I simply love the location and the feel of the restaurant. 

The food is rich and man oh man, coming from a japanese boy...this is authentic italian food ha. the food is always soooo good and the wine is on point as well. the bar is super awesome and so are the tenders. 

i approve of this establishment because they serve veal and they serve it well. god i love me some perfectly cooked baby animal...
author: Patrick K.

description:
Ciao no bella...no me likey...
Wasn't impressed whatsoever...
Cute, non-pretentious, Italian joint.   We ordered the bruschetta and Caesar salad, which was good.  My marsala chicken was disappointingly dry and flavorless.  I do give them props for the homemade Tiramisu!!!  Service took a lonnnggg time, but he was apologetic and kind.

 We sat upstairs and I couldn't help but overhear...

(couple on my left)  "we best git back thee otell, fer we fall asleep riott here."..."we got dat toor ta thee i-land wer dat prison was"...

(two couples behind us, with one obnoxious redneck)...."YEH!!!...COLUMBUS DAY IS COMIN' SOON...IT'S AN EXTRA DAY OFF.  GOOD THING THEM INJUNS DIED OF CHICKEN POX!!!   (I had to turn around and give him the "you're an ignorant redneck" look)....(him)..."WHAT?...I WUS JIST KIDDIN'...YA'LL CALIFORNIANS DON'T HAVE NO SENSE OF HUMOR"

I'll just have to retry again...
author: Gemma P.

description:
Love, love, love.  I work in North Beach, and was wondering when I would find "my" Italian restaurant, one that I could go to incognito and never mention to the tourists I talk to all day.  This is that restaurant.

I wanted to treat myself and a friend to an indulgent Italian meal one night.  I was poking around on Yelp when I co-worker told me about this place.  She said, "This is one of my magical spots in the city.  This is where I take my mom when she's in town. This is where my boyfriend and I go when we want a romantic meal.  This is where my best friend and I go when we want to go out together and be girly and eat amazing food and talk girl talk over a bottle of wine."  Needless to say, I had to try it out.

So, my friend and I wandered over there, taking a welcome turn off Columbus and into the quiet side streets of North Beach.  There was a 40-minute wait when we got there, which we used to start with wine and appetizers at the bar.  The wine was divine, and the cantaloupe/prosciutto appetizer was an unexpectedly amazing combination.  I don't know if we actually spent 40 minutes at the bar, joking around with the friendly bartender, but it seemed like very little time went by before we had a table.

I had the rigatoni with eggplant and tomatoes; she had the chicken tortellini in heart-attack-inducing cream sauce.  We got drunk on wine and shot the shit about work and boys and life in general.  We laughed, we cried, we came nowhere near to finishing our pasta dishes.  We left with take-out tiramisu for the co-worker who had made it all possible, plus visions of delectable leftovers for our lunches the next day.

Sometimes restaurants are okay.  Sometimes they are amazing.  And sometimes you have a meal that you would happily repeat every second of from start to finish, from the company to the food to the warm, garlic-and-wine-induced vibe in the room.  Trattoria Contadina gave me that meal, and I keep wondering how soon I'll be able to make it back.
author: Martha T.

description:
Came here to get off the beaten path on Columbus.  Restaurant packed, and they said it was booked solid, but they could take us as long as we were out of there by 7.  That gave us an hour--and it was well worth-it.  I had clam linguini and I don't think I've had better. Also, the caesar salad was one of the most authentic I've had.  Bread was crusty, olive oil was great quality.  Brother had gnocchi which looked rich and creamy.  

Mark it as a good spot for a nice city dinner.
author: Carrie P.

description: Appetizers were good, though the meatballs were only room temp when served. My Fettuccine with Italian sausage was not very tasty with sausage tasting a bit gamey but my wife's Pesce Milanese was very good. I think there are far better Italian restaurants in North Beach and other neighborhoods in the city.
author: Hari J.

description: Good spot.  excellent location just a block off the action.  good service.  The meatballs were fantastic.   intimate and delicious.  also the lamb chops were perfect!
author: Bucky W.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood Italian restaurant. The food is always fresh and delicious and the service is fantastic. Trattoria Contandina is the perfect restaurant for a romantic dinner or to take out of town guests. I love the salad that has figs, arugula and asparagus. My favorite dish is the Pavorotti or the Spinali. YUM!
author: CE R.

description:
I've been coming here for quite a few years now, and have never been disappointed. This is great Italian food in a cozy neighborhood environment. The only negative is that the place being cozy, can be a little tight quarters with the table next to you, esp. if you are in tables for two.  Other than that, no complaints. The food is always great and the appetizer of Pepperoni Arrostiti con Formaggio, is worth the trip alone!
Pasta tastes freshly made, sauces are terrific, and moderately priced. This has been my go to restaurant for visitors and locals alike. I have always enjoyed great food and service, and highly recommend it to anyone who will listen.
author: Kathy K.

description: What a disappointment!  Actually, I have now had too many disappointments from Yelp, so this is probably my last review.  This restaurant is NOT Italian.  If I had closed my eyes while eating their stuffed peppers, I would have thought I was in a Mexican establishment.  I ordered the Spaghetti Carbonara, and was served a pasta with a heavy sauce full of onions.  Onions!  Not in carbonara.  Sorry folks.  I learned to cook in my mother's Italian restaurant, and I know Italian food.  This is not it.
author: Vicki T.

description:
The food was pretty good (bruschetta and cappellini pomodoro) but not fabulous and the service GREAT! The menu has a nice array of vegetarian (or vegetarian-able) choices, and the wine list looked good (although we didn't imbibe).  The bread with olive oil was ok.

We came in early, when it seems the place is popular with families with young kids - the place was LOUD. The family next to us popped open a DVD player and put in Sesame Street and pumped up the volume and I began to wonder if I would be continuing my rude parents rant from Duck's Nest . If I had wanted to watch TV I would have stayed home, where I have a choice of what I'm watching (and hearing).  However, in this case, the business cares - we were promptly moved to a table where we could hear the music and not Grover and were treated with respect and understanding of our desire to move. 

Also on the theme of the owners caring, staff was busy putting up covers on the air conditioning. I suspect they have heard about the overheated problem, so then installed air conditioning. However, the cold air blasts on the tables below, so now they are putting redirection covers on the vents. I get the feeling the temperature in there is going to be perfect by the time they are done messing with it!

If I am in the neighborhood again, and the hour is later, I might go back. This is more of a 3.5 stars.
author: Lise L.

description:
Trattoria Contadina salvaged what had been a horrible evening in North Beach. After spending over 45 minutes waiting at a different restaurant, despite constant assurances that the table would be ready in 5 min (!!!!), the wife and I decided to go home. We walked by Trattoria Contadina (both in extremely bad moods and hungry) and decided to give it a try.

We were seated immediately, in a funky little room upstairs in the back. The servers and busboys were absolutely friendly and polite. I was really impressed by the service, and considering the mood that I was in, that is saying something. We both ordered the Frutti di Mare which was excellent. I can't wait to go back to this place. I recommended it to a couple of European friends a few weeks ago and they both loved it as well.
author: Ryan S.

description: Really disappointed by this place.  Really cozy, has a great vibe.  I had heard so much about it, but food was just mediocre.  This is the kind of stuff that is good for tourists, but much better Italian can be found in the city.
author: Denise C.

description: Great food ! Good wine list. Wine prices were very reasonable. Would definatley eat there again.
author: Charlie G.

description: Good food, friendly service. cocktails are decent, not great.
author: H K.

description:
I had a very romantic and tasty dinner at Trattoria Contadina the other night. The place is small and you do sit very close to others, but the food and vibe make it worth it. Our waitress was very friendly and offered us great suggestions. She also let us know that all of  the pasta dishes are available as half orders. We went with the gnocchi (average), the meatballs (very good), and the beef ravioli (outstanding). 
I thought  the prices were very fair and they also had a nice wine list. I would recommend getting a reservation, as there is really no bar area and the place always seems to be packed. I can't wait to come back!
author: Lisa A.

description:
Bellisimo!!!! My girlfriend an I were talking all day about how much we love our family's Italian food (la cuccina de la mama) and decided on a Saturday evening to just head to North Beach.

No reservations and the Cable Car just brought us to La Contadina, without even having headr about this place ever.
We absolutely loved it. The food was great and the people who work there are open for any sugestion. We talked about our passion for food and they are open to all comments (I thought the meatballs should be made from 100% veal), we discussed a new possible Italian dessert to be put on the menu, and as a good Italian family does, we loved to see the crew at the end of the evening having family style dinner all together.
author: Tom V.

description: It's tough to review this restaurant because I had an A-OK spaghetti with sausage and garlic sauce but had little flavor and then a to-die-for steak with marsala sauce and polenta on the side. I was seriously about to lick the plate it was so good. I also overheard the ladies next to us say that their seafood pasta was good but had little flavor. They doctored theirs up with lots of cheese and red pepper flakes. Maybe just don't get the pasta? Service was excellent though.
author: Karin Z.

description:
excellent food.  Very authentic, has a pretty good wine selection as well.  The bill is always less than you'd expect it to be for what you get!  Havent had a bad dish here yet.  

This place has an awesome location as well, where people watching through the huge windows cant be helped.....which is pretty fun, especially in SF.
author: Jeff W.

description:
I've lived here for 11 years now, so I'm way past shiny bars and fireplaces to attract me to a restaurant. I'd dive into the darkest hovels of Chinatown if it served mind-bendingly great food. So for me, a place is all about the food - ambience takes second. Fortunately for Trattoria Contadina, they're getting rated on their food and not their decor, otherwise I'd bust them down to 2 out of 5 stars.

The pasta I ordered at first looked like a small portion, but that was deceptive. In the end, the portion was more than enough to stuff me. The problem was that the food really wasn't that good, and for a restaurant that's allegedly a 'go to' place, I'm failing to see how this place gets such good ratings. The pasta itself tended to be chewy and unevenly cooked and the ravioli tasted bland. The one saving grace was that the sauce was decent, although nothing I'd come back for. My girlfriend had a similar experience, so we ended up tasting one another's dishes to keep from getting too bored with our own.

Service: here Trattoria Contadina gets a meager 2/5. The restaurant was less than half full, and the hostesses were camping out at the bar chatting, yet nary a waitress was to be seen. I had to flag down a bus-boy to get my parmasean grated for me. Lame. The waitress also didn't even bother to offer me a pepper grind, but when the people next to us were seated, they got it. Pathetic. Just pathetic. I was also pretty hacked off that the bartender took a good five minutes to pour me a glass of $6 wine while he yacked away with some guy and casually took his time to make 2 martinis. Sigh. So much for customer service... I guess their work ethic is that they'll take care of me when they get around to it.

Hot tip to wait staff: if you want a tip of any kind, you have to give service... I work for my money and I don't give it away to random people I don't know unless they give me something in value in return, so you have to work for it too.

Pricing: There are two measures of prices for me: 1) what seems reasonable based on volume, and 2) what seems reasonable based on quality. For the volume of food, the prices were maybe a couple bucks above reasonable. But for quality, fah-getta-bout it! It's overpriced for what you get. And as for the wine... sheez... they offer up vinos in the multi-hundred dollar range and can't make a good pasta? My slow glass of Berenger White Zin cost $6... the entire bottle costs maybe $4.50 at Safeway. If the food was good, maybe I wouldn't care so much about that, but sheez. Any why a white zin? Because all the other wine by the glass is way overpriced... $8 and $9 for what they were serving? Ridiculous.

Decor: unfortunately this is where I go into full-on ream mode. Trattoria Contadina looks like it got stuck in the early '80s and never bothered to look forward. Local charm for a neighborhood classic is one thing, but neglect and nasty-ass '70s wood paneling are something completely different. Given I have 8 bazillion choices for Italian food in North Beach, I can find a place with bad decor with better food, so if Trattoria Contadina can't compete on its food alone, I'm more likely to take my business somewhere else.

On the wall are fading photos of athletes long retired and disco stars like Donna Summer. Seriously, Donna Summer. I don't think I saw a single personality on the wall newer than Robb Nen when he played for the Giants. The wood paneled walls look like the living room from That '70s Show, and the sink in the hallway --- which ALL customers have have to squeeze by to get upstairs to eat --- is a really tacky touch. 

What I'm getting at is that if you're looking for a place to impress with somebody with your culinary tastes or preference for nice decore, Trattoria Contadina strikes out on both counts, in big ways.

We both left very disappointed. We'll definitely be back exploring North Beach again - it's been years since I stomped around there. But Trattoria Contadina will not be on my list of places to return to unless Gordon Ramsay sweeps through and gives the kitchen and decor an enema. 

Sorry, it's just not worth the ratings it's getting. It just isn't.
author: Gregg G.

description: I come from traditional Italian cooking and so going to "Little Italy" to try their restaurants was very exciting for me.  This place is clean, the atmosphere is is welcoming and the food is excellent.  The brushetta is amazing and some of the best I've had.  I had spinach ravioli's which were cooked perfectly and tiramisu for dessert which I give 4 out of 5 stars.  Not the best I've had but good and same with their cannoli's.  Definitely great, but not the best your going to have, but worth the buy.  This is a wonderful resturant to go to while in the city.
author: Carly C.

description: The carlisimo. don't worry about reading the menu... It was fantastic. We went here for a birthday party and everything was spectacular. The meatballs were delicious and the peppers were filled cheese, sauce, and smiles.  Expensive, but that's what you pay for. Will definitely be returning.
author: Tami G.

description:
I went here for a friend's birthday with a group of 7 girls, and we had a blast. The waiter was very helpful, giving us tips on wines that would go best with our food, and giving us opinions on what food to order. 

I ordered a small portion of the chicken ravioli plate with white sauce, and it was enough to fill me up comfortably. It was delicious -- not over the top with flavor, but not lacking either. I had tastes of my friend's dishes as well, and those were also very good (risotto, eggplant pasta, garlic chicken pasta). 

We told our waiter that it was our friend's birthday, and they came out with a tiramisu with a lit candle, singing happy birthday. The tiramisu was great, and they didn't charge us for it (i know some places will put it on the bill).

It was a very homey place, and it was crowded on a Saturday night. The only problem I had with the ambiance was that people kept coming in and out of the restaurant, and cold air would blow through it -- I ended up eating my dinner with my jacket on! Other than that, the food and ambiance were great.
author: Song-My T.

description: Excellent service and food! This place has a really cozy feel, it's tiny and they really pack the tables in so it feels like you're on a date with whoever sits next to you as well since you're practically bumping elbows. The food was pretty good. We shared filet mignon carpaccio, the alaskan halibut special, veal scallopini entree and a half portion of the pesto pasta. The food all tasted really good and wasn't overly rich. I really liked our hostess and server a lot. It's a couple of blocks away from Cobb's Comedy Club, which is why we ate here, otherwise I wouldn't have known about this place. Definitely make reservations, without one, you might not get a table for the night.
author: Thao T.

description:
It is truly a remarkable sensation when one re discovers something that they didn't know they were without.

Last night I rediscovered this little gem of an Italian restaurant.  The last time I had been here was 4 years ago before I moved back to London for the 3rd time.  I loved it then, and now having gone back all these years later I still love this place.  This place is about good authentic food, good wine, good service, and a friendly neighborhood feel inside.  No pretention, no hassle, just all around fan friggin tastic.  One may even use the word quaint.  Tables are close together, so there is a very intimate feel to the place.

We started with the Antipasto, then I had the Barlotta (veal scaloppini with shrimp) and my friend had the Saltimbocca.  While my meal was absolutely delicious, I was a tad envious of my friend's dinner, her veal scaloppini was wrapped in prosciutto and mozzarella.  I mean come on that just sounds like a sexy dish.  This was all washed down with a bottle of Taj 2006 Syrah.  The meal was perfect.  I can't figure out another way to describe it.  I was a happy, full, and smiling man by the time dinner was over, nothing could bother me and all was well with the world.

My hat is off to everyone who works there and my apologies to the couple at the table next to us for being so loud and talkative, it seemed you wanted a quiet meal together and you had to deal with my rather humorous if not inappropriate stories.

I am looking forward to moving into the city next month so I can enjoy the splendor that is Trattoria Contadina on a more regular basis.
author: Carter H.

description:
Very yummy indeed but not too many you know, veggie options. But after desperately scouring the menu, I landed on the rigatoni melenzane. I swear to god this shit was enough to feed me twice! And I mean it too. But I probably burned it all off walking up five hills to get to the car. I swear, I never appreciated living in Oakland before I found out how absolutely terrible parking is in San Francisco. But anyhoo, this is a great place to recommend to friends or even keep as a secret. 

5 huge stars if they had more veggie friendly fare :)
author: Emahlee H.

description:
Great place to take the visiting parents.  Casual but nice.  Great service.  The food was fantastic.  I ordered the Lamb Chop special.  Very tender and prepared in a stew style with carrots, celery and onions.  Tried a couple other dishes.  All the pastas were wonderful and fresh!

This is exactly what I want out of an Italian spot in North Beach!
author: Peter H.

description:
I was with friend and we were seeing a show on 12/2 at Bimbo's.  She said she's been there like 10 years ago and liked it and I definitely was in the mood for some Italian food.

We didn't have a reservation (Sunday night) but we were seated within 10-15 minutes.  They seated us upstairs and it was actually quite cozy being away from the bar and the entry way.

We shared a spinach salad with dried cranberries and spiced/toasted walnuts.  One of the best salads I've had.  Just delicious.  The walnuts and the fruit just went perfectly together especially with the pre-dinner bread and olive oil.

I had the meat tortellini with the cream sauce with peas and prosciutto.  Yum!!!  Just fantastic.  I usually eat half my meal and take the other half home but tonight I went to town.

My friend had the spirally macaroni pasta (sorry, don't know my pasta types all that well) with the tomato-cream sauce and veal medallions.  Also fantastic.  We always share our dinners and we both agreed that hers was the better of the two, but I'm not saying anything bad about my tortellini, it WAS great.  She had enough to fill up on and have lunch for the next day.

Great atmosphere and the wait staff was very friendly.  Some of the best Italian food I've had in North Beach and definitely one of my favorite places now.  I will definitely come back.
author: Josh L.

description:
Good Italian food.  Warm, inviting with attentive service(however, it was like nails going down a chalkboard when the server said 'Bon Apetit' and 'fromage'.  My Italian bro-in-law would blow his top if he heard that in an Italian restaurant!)

Agree with other Yelpers, good place to bring out-of-towners.
author: michelle s.

description:
You have to be in the know to know, and when someone is in the know it's good for them to show. Well that's the case with residents of San Francisco who've had 10+ years of experiencing the local flavor. Luckily, one of these fine individuals was kind enough to introduce me to the Trattoria Contadina. In the heart of North Beach, this restaurant truly possesses the Italian image. Small, Italian family style, I felt like there might have been a secret operation going on in the back room. As the fine wine we were drinking was starting to go to our heads, the bawdy comments we were making were undoubtedly distressing the rest of the patrons who sit not more but inches away from you. 
ANYWAY... I'm not usually a fan of Caesar salad, but man this one was tasty. The Carpaccio was AWESOME and the Frutti de mare was full of frutti... the way I like it, nice and fishy!
author: Rada I.

description: Very good. Small, cute place. Loved it's authentic-ness. Cheap wine, really good Italian food, big portions. Would go back and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a not-so-touristy place in North Beach.
author: christine c.

description: Each time we visit San Francisco we make it a point to eat here, a neighborhood restaurant away from awful tourist traps; we have never been disappointed. The staff is great, the warm olives are a great way to start. This time we had the veal with risotto... And the house made raviolis with spicy tomato creme sauce... Scrumptious!
author: Candace B.

description:
I find myself in North Beach wanting a great pasta dish for dinner.  This lady, I think she said her name was Sebastian, saw me searching around the touristy area.  She recommended this spot, and I am very glad she did.  What a charming little spot.  We arrived around 5:45 pm.  The place was empty.  By the time we left, at 7:00, the place was mobbed.  
I had the bell pepper appetizer, and was blown away.  The ravioli was just what I was looking for, and left me looking forward to eating here again.
The deserts were mediocre at best, but not the reason to go here.
This really is a cute "date place."  Eat here soon.  You'll probably become a regular.
author: Mike W.

description:
Charming spot in North Beach with good ol' fashioned Italian food. 

I had the linguini with meatballs and it was exactly what I was looking for. I didn't pay attention to what my friend ordered but something with sausage in it which was also excellent. 

Service was timely and right on the money with everything. 

You have to deal with parking in North Beach of course but I'd come back again anytime.
author: keith h.

description:
I have lived in N. Beach for six months and have been sampling the restaurants during that time.  I live a few doors from the Trattoria, but was waiting for a special occasion to try it. 

Well, my roomy and I trekked all over n. beach in search of an ideal meal and atmosphere, but were coming up short with each menu and restaurants we surveyed.  Finally, we decided to go to the place on the corner.  

It was fantastic! The service, ambiance and of course the food were all generous and delectable.  The prices are reasonable enough, especially when you consider that you will likely be taking home tomorrow's lunch.  I'd give this place another star, but while it's all-around great, the food is not  a mind-blowing gastronomical feast.

I have reservations again for Friday night and hope to have an even better experience now that I am more knowledgeable about this perfectly fine neighborhood joint.
author: Charlie B.

description: Love this restaurant! Owned by 100% Italian family!  The atmosphere makes you feel like you are in Italy! The food was delicious!  I had the gnocchi and it was awesome! Highly recommend making a reservation otherwise you will have to wait for a bit!
author: Caterina M.

description:
Man what a great restaurant!  We had reservations for a Wednesday night.  We took the cable car and it let us off right at the corner.  Even though we were 15 minutes early, they seated us immediately.  The seating was really tight because we had a big group near us and another big group that hadn't arrived yet.  

We just went straight for the entre course because the meals we saw were huge!  My wife had pasta with a vodka sauce (I forget what meat and veggies were on it because I was way too into my own plate.)  Mine was sliced Italian sausage, sundried tomatoes, mushrooms, and ear shaped pasta tossed with olive oil.  Luscious, fattening, and probably the best Italian meal I ever had.  We both had a nice Chianti with it that was under $10/glass.  My wife and I had to each take half home. Poor people on the cable car had to smell my garlic.  

The only downer was the big group was celebrating some business success and were very drunk, loud and annoying.  Everyone kept toasting and I got bumped a few times.  It was a bunch of 30 something yuppie looking people that didn't give a damn about anyone else in the restaurant.  I guess I can't blame the restaurant for them.  It did kind of ruin it towards the end.  Our server was fantastic though!
author: Brian B.

description:
Really good Italian food in North Beach, at a pretty little cozy corner restaurant, up the hill a bit at where the Mason St. cable car passes Union St, and  where you don't have to feel too much like a tourist.  (In North Beach, that's hard, especially for Italian.)

I lLOVED my risotto and the polenta funghi.  Spinach salad was very nice, with great carmelized pecans on it.  a certain soon to be ex 's gnocci was pretty decent.  So was the wine.  Prices not bad, either, and the portions were filling, plus the menu has offers daily specials.  

The only thing that bothered me was something I've never really encountered, and which surprised me by my disaffection - the food came to us faster than you could say "another glass of wine, please?", and the appetizer made it out sooner than the bread and olive oil!  Plus, my risotto came out so piping hot that it took the entire meal (and lung-fulls of air and breath) to cool down.  Still, a nice place.
author: Today Y.

description: Went here yesterday for dinner and loved this place! Great service and a very cozy ambiance. We tried the cheese ravioli (which I felt had extra nutmeg) and chicken pasta. The tiramisu is definitely worth trying as well.
author: Al K.

description:
I came here during the holidays with family from out of town, and some local SF family.  We had a FABULOUS time.  My mom is a spaghetti & meatballs freak, and she looooved the S&MB at Trattoria Contadina.  

I felt like a hero bringing them here.  Everyone was extremely pleased with their dishes!  The bread just keeps on coming, which makes it an automatic hit in my family.  Wine was great, antipasti platter was great, service was great...

I'm looking for an excuse to come here again soon!
author: Alice H.

description: We  tried a number of italian places  and all were booked. Finally found this one.  We were not disappointed.  Great food, great service.
author: Denise M.

description: Best meal we had while staying in San Francisco! This small little restaurant serves absolutely delicious food. I had the risotto (which was a special) and it was absolutely to die for. If you are in San Fran and like Italian cuisine you must stop in. Don't forget to make a reservation!
author: Kate E.

description:
I came here around 7pm on a Saturday.  They said there were no available tables until 9:30pm.  Wow that's discouraging.  However, there was room at the small bar.  This turned out to be a blessing in disguise since the bartender was so cool.  
My friend and I shared an order of bruschetta (2 pieces).  It was delicious.
I had ricotta ravioli with pesto sauce.  It... was... amazing.  My friend had gnocchi.  Also amazing (I had several tastes haha).  
At one point the bartender was making a drink with Absolut Raspberry and 7-Up.  I commented by saying it sounded good.  He made me a smaller version on the house!
I highly recommend this restaurant, but you better make a reservation if you want a table.
author: David K.

description:
Their clam pasta seemed to be very salty?  Surprising!  I wished someone else could try it to make sure it wasn't my problem.   I had been worrying what I should say so the chef wouldn't be embrassed if the waitress asked me about the food. Thank God, when she picked up the still full plate at the end of the dinner, she didn't say a single word. 

However we liked the flavor of their olive oil, with a little bit garlic and pepper for bread dipping.
author: Ile F.

description: How do they get their bruschetta that good?  If I knew I would be making it everyday.  The pasta I got was great though the cream sauce was not spicy as advertised yet perfect in every way.  Little crowded but very nice wait staff.
author: Emily O.

description: What a fun date spot!  My boyfriend and I wanted a date night out, and we found the perfect place.  Not only did they seat us before our reservation time when we wandered in early, but they gave us a great table upstairs by the corner window.  It was very cute and romantic, and we loved all the food.  To top it off, our waiter brought us dessert drinks on the house!  It really made a great impression, and we've been back since and loved it just as much :)
author: Erin B.

description: The seafood in the Fruitti Di Mare was very fresh, with the sweetest and most tender mussels in generous portions.  The services was precise and super friendly.  There is a lovely homely feel to the restaurant - away from the tourists on Columbus Avenue.  Bruschetta was on the house while we waited for our entrees.  The owners are good Samaritans and very nice people.
author: Victoria L.

description: food was good, typical italian restaurant but it won't blow your mind.
author: Terrence M.

description: I had dinner here with my husband and our newly engaged friends. We were out on our only double date night on the town during our trip to the bay area. My friend C went on Yelp to find us a nice and quaint italian place to try. Contadina did not disappoint!! We had such a beautiful evening of wine and food. My favorites of the night were the antipasto plate, and my entree of beef ravioli with a porcini mushroom cream sauce (not on the menu). The server was so nice and he really helped to make the night memorable. I'll be back!
author: Betty Y.

description:
This restaurant fed a vegetarian family meat for the first time in spite of our repeated requests to not have meat in our meal. My wife, my visiting parents and I, all 4 of us staunch vegetarians due to our religious beliefs went to this place looking at the great reviews on yelp for a eventful dinner. We made sure we ordered vegetarian pastas and repeatedly reminded our waiter that we would not like any meat in any of our dishes. The meal arrived and after we had eaten half of it, I realized to my horror that there were chicken pieces in our basil pesto penne pasta. My wife and I decided not to put up a show since that would break my parents. We discretely arranged for the meal to be taken away and asked for the check. Once again I was annoyed to see a gratuity of 15% added to a party of 4 and one of the wines priced higher than marked on the menu. I just wanted to have enough of it and simply paid the bill not wanting to spoil a pleasant day for my family. 
I am wondering how it would be if someone was allergic to a particular dish and this place serves them without caring for their health requirements. Stay away from this place that does not respect people's values.
author: Pranava S.

description: as the night gets darker, the atmosphere is better - food is good but some other italian restaurants in the neighborhood have it beat
author: David D.

description:
I know, I know, I make the effort to go to a semi-fancy Italian restaurant and then go and order spaghetti and meatballs....it's so "boring".  What can I tell you the spaghetti and meatballs here are great. There is definitely a good ambiance here and the only downside is that it does get a little cozy having all the tables so close together.

I'd recommend going on a week night so that you may get as lucky as a friend and I did and get seated at a table that is really intended for four. Having that extra space made all the difference.

If you want to risk going here on a weekend when it's super busy here are a few survival tips:

1. Don't bring a jacket unless it's f**king freezing outside as it's pretty warm in this restaurant.
2. Don't bring a bag unless it's filled with whatever the guys in Pulp Fiction were carrying around since you won't have space to store it while you eat.
3. Try the spaghetti and meatballs.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Been here a few times and enjoyed each meal.  The servers are friendly and welcoming, as is the bartender.  The wine list is excellent, very comprehensive and a range of options as far as price.  The food is an excellent mix of classic Italian dishes with some creative twists.  Desserts are also very good and are light enough to fit in your belly after all the delicious food.  
Only problem is parking....damn it sucks over there.
author: Jessica L.

description:
The decor is as laughably predictable as the menu.

The gnocchi, though, were absolutely fantastic.

I'd go back for the food, but not for anything else.
author: Brad L.

description:
Currently my highly coveted, even further highly researched, distinguished award of Best Italian Food In San Francisco goes to Trattoria. 3 words - MUST...HAVE...RAVIOLI. 

I get takeout here, have fun romantic neighborhood dinners here, it doesn't matter, just partake however you can. It's really stellar and definitely worth it.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
This place is too over rated.  There are far more better restaurants in the Little Italy area that provides much better service and food.

Perhaps when it comes to eating out, I've become a complete service snob.  I did not like that my waitress, Robin, did not offer my bf and I fresh ground pepper for our salads, or parmesan cheese for our pastas, and did not come by frequent enough to refill our water.  

It my seem like I'm making a huge stink over something that small, but when I'm sitting an arms length away from another couple who got fresh ground pepper, freshly grated cheese, and water without asking ever once asking,  something seemed very wrong with the picture.

Food was alright.  Service was terrible. Won't be going here again.
author: SuperDeeDuper S.

description: I think this place is slightly overrated. I have found the service and food much better at Trattoria Pinnochio. But, most of the people I went with raved about their food. Maybe mine was just a fluke.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Summary: a good (not great) LOCAL Italian restaurant. 

Food:
Salvatore.  Chicken ravioli with sun-dried tomatoes, rosemary, garlic and a marscapone cheese sauce. Pretty tasty, but nothing to knock your socks off.  8/10

Carlesimo. Rigatoncelli pasta with pancetta, porcini mushrooms, peas, sun-dried tomatoes and a mildly spiced tomato cream sauce. The orange tomato sauce was flavorful and the porcini mushrooms added  good flavor to the dish. 7/10.

They serve small and large portions. The small would be probably be enough for most people.  

Service. Excellent attention by the small staff.

Atmosphere.  It is a SMALL restaurant off the main strip of little Italy. It holds about 35 guests comfortably. It is loud inside so it is a little hard to hear a conversation. 

Location.  Easy to get to via mason-Powell line or 45 bus, if you are in union square. I have heard that parking is incredibly difficult.  

PS.  Don't forget to walk a few blocks for gelato.
author: Russell S.

description:
I am not a fan of North Beach at all, but by someone's request and another's recommendation, I ended up here. 

They were almost all booked up when I called at 3, which is a good sign, means the place is in good demand. It is a nice small place off the main streets, facing the houses, which helps me forget that I am in North Beach and just spent half an hour finding parking. The hostess asked us if we would prefer the window or the "tapestry", which I thought was a rather silly question (yes, the window thank you).

Insalata caprese with sliced tomatoes and buffalo mozzarella was very refreshing, carpaccio was sliced very thinly indeed (can you pick it up cleanly? I sure can't). 

But what struck my attention and what earned the stars it did was one of the "special entrees", a bistecca di calamari, a nice big hunk of squid dipped in egg and pan sauteed in butter and lemon and garlic. A quarter of a lemon if you can't get enough of that. Something I have never seen in an Italian restaurant in California, and something that suits my tastes very well. The squid was very tender and it certainly was the softest squid I have ever eaten, but not without losing its elasticity. The egg coating was evenly cooked all around, which shows that the kitchen staff has good skills. Did I eat the vegetables that came with it? I don't think so.

Ravioli with pink tomato cream sauce was also a very nice entree, but my squid was better. I don't usually go out to eat pasta, since it's sort of an annoying concept that it costs so little yet they charge you just like another entree. That and very rarely have I thought that I just had godly pasta in a restaurant. 

In the end an absolute MUST is to eat their tiramisu. It is made in the house, and it is THE best tiramisu I have encountered. Do not try to be polite, do not make excuses, eat the damn thing. 

It ended up being a very worthy place to know for such out of town guests as I had to entertain that evening. Got to drive over the hills, let them walk around silly North Beach, watch the cable cars, with a restaurant that keeps letting you know you're in San Francisco. A tourist's place that a tour guide wouldn't mind too much going to, which was exactly what I was that evening.
author: Daria J.

description:
Italian food is so important. Why's that? (you may ask). It is about true love, culture, and bringing people together. Every time I am with family and friends enjoying an Italian meal you can hardly help but become engulfed in the food. Whether it is a simple fresh baked loaf of bread with the tangiest olive oil or a perfectly made quattro formaggi gnocchi, Italians love food and sharing there wonderful culinary skills with others. Trattoria Contadina is refreshingly authentic. I could have easily ordered three antipasti, a pasta dish and 2 entrees from their ridiculously excellent menu! 

I started with a radicchio and arugula goat cheese salad. It was perfect and the candied walnuts added the perfect crunch. I was able to steal a bite of my Dad's bruschetta which was very great. The tomatoes were diced and loaded with garlic and basil and finally coated with olive oil. The crunchy loaves of bread were a hit and kept coming to the table!  

Veal Scallopini, Filet of Sole, Alaskan Halibut and a Veal Chop describe the composition of our entree course. Be sure and try one of the many wonderful pasta options they offer and go with the large portion to share with the entire table. The wine (both bottles) were excellent and so was the HOMEMADE Tiramisu and cappuccinos.

Excellent Italian food. Authentic. Delicious. I may be eating here again tonight!
author: Theresa T.

description:
Best Italian food in north beach...how do I know- I used to live there. 

In fact if you ever find yourself at Trattoria Contadina look across the street at the grocery- I lived in the apt above. My roommate and I made a pact that we would never go there until the last day we lived there. And so we didn't go until the last days. By this time we had eaten at all the places in north beach several times over- which for the most part is pretty crappy.  But Contadina  was incredible and very well priced. Cheers cheers- why the hell didn't we go there earlier?
author: Martin S.

description:
Finally!  A decent Italian place!  The place itself is packed kind of tight.  There is an upstairs but all the tables in general seem to be squashed together.  The decor isn't that great, but the food makes up for it.

I'm not saying the food is to die for, but come on, good Italian food in SF is hard to come by and this place is the only one that has satisified my craving so far.  I had the linguini with clams (but substituted a red sauce).  It was pretty tasty.  Decent amount of clams.  The spinach salad was nice too. 

They are only open for dinner so make sure to check their hours and I'd recommend making reservations as they were packed when we went.  I will def be back to get the linguini again.
author: C A.

description:
Eh.

Average service, average food.  The antipasto plate was a huge disappointment, and that's pretty hard to screw up.

There's better Italian to be had in the city!
author: Alyssa W.

description: The best Italian food, outside of Italy. The pasta is amazing, the stuffed peppers are insanely good, and the dessert was so scrumptious.
author: Jacqueline G.

description:
One of my least favorite things is when you come into a restaurant and they give you 6 noodles topped with 2 shrimp, and break you off with an expensive bill. This was not the case at Trattoria Contadina (I still can't pronounce it!). They hook you up with a lot of food to say the least. 

Service was attentive without being annoying. Atmosphere was great probably because they had a Warriors jersey framed by the bathroom (come on you've seen my profile picture). They have an open kitchen so when we left my shirt and face smelled like garlic which made me hungry again a few hours later because i started sniffing myself. 

I recommend the clam linguine and salmon on the bed of linguine. Both were excellent dishes. Oh yeah, their house merlot is good as well so I recommend that as well. Overall great experience all the way around. Yeah!!
author: B.J. K.

description:
We had a great meal and a great time at Trattoria Contadina!  My girlfriends and I just returned from a weekend in Napa and were staying overnight in SF and wanted Italian food.  We picked this place primarily for the great reviews found here and elsewhere online.  We weren't disappointed.

We had to change our reservation from 5 to 6 at the last minute and they couldn't have been more accommodating.  We did have to wait a few minutes for our table, but it was very crowded and a small restaurant, so it was not a problem.  

We started with wine and bruschetta, which was very garlicky, but in a good way.  The tomatoes were fresh and the seasonings just right.  Between all of us we got soups, salads and small plates of pasta, and everyone at our table raved about everything we had.  I had the large plate of Ravioli Correnti, which was beef/veal stuffed ravioli with a porcini mushroom sauce.  All the pasta is homemade and it was incredible.  My only complaint is that it was very rich and I should have ordered the half plate instead so I could finish it!  

One of my friends ordered the Fettucine con Salsiccia alla Vincenzo (sausage and peppers over linguine) and it was delicious, as I had a few bites.  Also, another friend wanted one of the pastas in a half order with no sun dried tomatoes, and even though it said on the menu 'no substitutions please" they made the change for her with no problems.

We also had dessert, after dinner drinks and coffee - and the entire bill for 6 people was only $300 - $100 less than we had paid for the night before with two less people, no apps, no coffee and no after dinner drinks.  

I highly recommend this gem and wouldn't hesitate to go back next time I am in San Fran.  Everything was really good and the service, albeit a little slow sometimes, was friendly and accommodating.  Go here - you won't be sorry!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Sorry to disagree yelpers, but I found this place to be mediocre.  
The bruschetta was two pieces of dry toast with not-very-tasty tomatoes.  For nine dollars.  The salad was decent.
My husband's pasta was actually good, but mine was a watery mess, literally swimming in watery tomatoes.  And did I mention it was watery?  
One star for being pretty affordable (except the bruschetta), and one star for good service.
author: Michelle A.

description:
This is my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco...and I've tried all of them (in North Beach, at least!). Three things about The Trat (as I call it, because I can't say Contadina for some reason)

--You MUST make a reservation, so it doesn't work for last-minute marinara cravings.

--It's off the beaten path of screaming Italian hosts and hostesses, so it has a bit more quaint feel, family owned and operated.

--Everything on the menu is great. I've been several times, and have done neighbor-plate-sampling each time. The best thing I've had has been the delicious bell peppers on the appetizer menu. They are indescribably decadent. You must get them. After raving to the owner, he sat down at our table and described how to make them at home. I still haven't attempted, as I know they wouldn't meet up to my now high standards for bell pepper apps.
author: Sharon H.

description: Just had an excellent Italian meal!!!!!  The food was served hot and the seasoning was perfect.  You couldn't ask for better service, from the friendly host to the cheery smile of the girl who fills your water glass.  I will definitely be back again.....thank you for a pleasant evening.
author: Margaret C.

description:
This is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. I first came here a few years ago for a friend's birthday dinner. She rented out the top floor of the restaurant. It was cozy and intimate and most importantly, the wine was flowing and the food was GREAT.

I came here again recently. We sat upstairs and being more sober this time around, I realized how charming this restaurant is. It looks like they converted a home into a corner restaurant so when you look out the windows, you see other homes and forget that you are eating out at a restaurant. If you want guaranteed satisfaction, order the Tortellini alla Panna (fresh tortellini filled with beef, pork, egg, spinach, and cheese, with prosciutto and cream sauce ).

The service is great. The food came out faster than a bat outta hell. It's popular and not a huge place, so play it on the safe side and make reservations. Salute!
author: Jackie M.

description: Went here with a group of 6 near closing time on a Thursday night.  Two of our group were late from the airport but they were great about saving our table.  Everyone enjoyed their meals and the prices weren't bad for San Fran.  Gnocchi were my favorite.
author: Darren R.

description: absolutely a wonderful dining experience.  from the staff to the menu, our experience was first rate.  and, for san francisco, the prices were very reasonable.
author: joe s.

description:
We're still raving about Trattoria Contadina.  The manager of a hotel we were staying at clear across town recommended the restaurant to us, even called and made us a reservation.  We were thrilled to eat in fabulous North Beach, and my taste buds couldn't have been happier.  The food was superb, but the waiter was missing in action much of the time (thus only 4-stars). 

We sent a group of friends there - and we weren't embarrassed.  

Make reservations - it is popular, and can be crowded.  I'd recommend an early week night if you want to relax with good wine and fabulous food.
author: deb h.

description:
My favorite Italian restaurant in the city, no doubt. If you've been disappointed there before and you find yourself there again, order the following:
Bell pepper appetizer
Ravioli contadina. 
psssssrrrrrr, thats the stuff right there.
author: Garrett M.

description: Really cute and quaint restaurant. My friend got the risotto and it was delicious. I had the spaghetti and meatballs..the meatballs were good. I would go here again.
author: Tammy N.

description:
I feel intimidated by all the 4- and 5-star reviews but I just can't go that high... maybe that's what led me to expect greatness that I just didn't find there.
The appetizer of olive poached eggplant with tomato sauce, olives, mozzarella, etc. was indeed wonderful. Eggplant cooked just right, sauce so flavorful and tangy with the olive, luscious stringy cheese. Had my mouth watering for the main course!
I had the nightly special of red snapper with artichokes in a red sauce, unfortunately it fell completely flat. The fish was clearly not fresh, with a very "fishy" smell, and way overcooked almost to the point of being gelatinous. The artichokes were straight from a can, tough and flavorless, the sauce was completely bland, probably so as not to mask the delicate flavor the fish was supposed to have, but it needed more to hide the fishiness. Served with roasted potatoes that were, well, roasted potatoes with no seasoning. The highlight was the spinach sauteed with garlic, which was very tasty, I wished I had more!
Based on all the other reviews I think it's worth another try, just maybe stick with one of the everyday dishes they may have had a chance to perfect.
author: Mark C.

description:
I'd totally go back here any time. The wait staff was knowledgeable and pleasant, though not terribly speedy. One thing Contadina nails is the simple stuff. This isn't going to be the most elegant place you've ever been, but Contadina should rank in the upper echelons of Italian eateries in North Beach (and that's saying something).

Food: 4 stars
Wait Staff: 4 stars
Atmosphere: 4 stars
Price: 4 stars
author: Thomas K.

description:
Best restaurant Italian food I've had in a very long time. I've been to Italian restaurants in NYC's Little Italy and Boston's North End, but nothing in recent memory has come close. For starters, I really like their menu. It's a good mix between comfort food and challenging dishes you wouldn't try making at home. The price range is extremely reasonable for Italian food and they have an extensive drink menu (didn't see any beer though).

We ordered the special of the day which was a pasta with many types of seafood along with spaghetti and meatballs and chicken marsala. The seafood pasta was hands-down the favorite of the table. The spaghetti and seafood pasta both had red sauces, but they both had their own unique flavors which was really nice. The chicken marsala was decent, but the chicken breasts were thick and therefore a little dry.  All in all, it was a really well-rounded meal. The waitress was really accommodating too. My parents are not big fans of cheese and they were able to make the appropriate accommodations. They didn't give us the look when we wanted to share dishes between us either.
author: Sutee D.

description:
I wasn't impressed and actually a bit disappointed. 

The service was great, the staff was super friendly and nice with good suggestions, but the food did not par up. 

We ordered the Pepperoni Arrostiti con Formaggio for the appetizer. It's roasted bell pepper layered with bel paese, asiago and mozzarella cheeses, served with a spicy tomatoes cream sauce. This was probably the best of all the dishes we ordered. The spicy cream sauce was super tasty. 

My Linguine Vongole was SUPER BLAND. I could only taste the butter in the pasta. No garlic to be found and it's super sad when I have to dress my own dish with salt and crushed red peppers for flavor. The clams were also very fishy tasting. 

My friends Tortellini alla Panna was NOT FRESH. The 'fresh pasta' was actually rubbery. 

I won't be back.
author: Gladys C.

description:
I loved this place so much that I went there two times this week!

The place is a small space, so make sure that you get reservations--even in the non peak hours. 

The menu is authentically italian with delicious handmade pastas. Yum. The gnocci napolene is delish. The portions are pretty hefty (more american sized than italian) but they have half portions of pasta. 

Also, it is on the very border of north beach/russian hill so doesn't feel too touristy.
author: lindsey l.

description: cute, classy italian place, datey and great pasta
author: Niket B.

description:
The Fiancee and I really like this place.  We have had several meals here and have enjoyed every one of them.

The cheese stuffed roasted pepper IS that good - you'll go through a loaf of bread mopping up the red sauce!  The food, service, and ambiance all get solid recommendations.  

However, there was one time that they completely exceeded my expectations.  My mother, 3 sisters and fiancee were having a girls weekend in the City and I made a reservation here for them.  While speaking with the manager making the reso, I happened to mention the occasion and semi-jokingly mentioned to take extra good care of them, not really expecting anything more than their normal attentive and courteous service.  

Well, they were fortunate enough to sit by Joe "the chocolate guy" - who was entertaining several guests at the next table... this guy must have had 2 cases of incredible wines stashed under his table because not 2 minutes after being seated he passed the first of FIVE really high end bottles of wine over to the ladies.  

Where the staff came through was at the end of the meal when the manager came over with Irish coffees for the entire table, compliments of the house telling them, "the guy who made the reservation wanted us to take really good care of you" -  REALLY cool move - above and beyond.  Needless to say this capped off a very memorable evening.
author: matt p.

description:
My half-italian husband and i have been on the constant search for "our favorite" italian food in SF. Well, I think we're still on the quest...BUT this place was pretty tasty.

Nice that it was a bit off the beaten path from the rest of the North Beach restaurants. Nice and cozy interior. Both of our entrees were very good, and the service very efficient. I had the rigatoni with eggplant which was just right, and the hubby had the pesce e pomodori - which included some potatoes on the side that were to die for. 

Overall, very good experience. A little pricey. I reserve 5 stars for "amazing" ...
author: Anne Y.

description:
This is a great place that's nice and out of the way (most of the best Italian seems to be NOT on Columbus), it's small and quaint without feeling crowded and a great ambiance.

Food was great, great portions, very friendly service. Eventually they had to ask us to leave to make room for another party coming in, but they felt bad and offered us free drinks at the bar.
author: Mark A.

description:
The first time my girlfriend and I attempted to dine here, we arrived a little late and were turned away.  We took no chances on our second attempt as I made a reservation on opentable.  It's safe to say that it was worth the wait.

As a previous reviewer stated, this Trattoria is about two blocks removed from Columbus, which is nice because it gives the restaurant a "locals only" feel.  It is nice to avoid the gaudy decorations and gimmicks at some of the other restaurants in North Beach.  I had the linguini and meatballs, which was delicious.  Most places give you one or maybe two large meatballs, but you receive three big ones here (insert joke here).  My GF got the Gnocchi, which came with a very rich, but delectable sauce.  It is very tight seating inside, which makes it quite loud when full, but other than that, this is definitely one of my favorite Italian restaurants in SF.
author: Cody M.

description:
This is certainly in my top five Italian restaurants I have eaten at in the City and the prices are really great too.  I went with a large group and we had reservations at 8:00, we were finally seated at 8:15 -- but after the minor delay in being seated our waiter was incredibly attentive and timely.  Let's just say he kept the wine flowing like water which I imagine, with a group of eight, keeps you on your toes.  

Some of our fave dishes:  Ravioli alla Salvatore (AMAZING, very rich but absolutely delicious - this was THE favorite), spaghetti alla calamari e scampi (a daily special), & the salmon.  Unfortunately we were all too full for dessert but the slices of cheesecake coming out of the kitchen looked fantastic.
author: Katie P.

description:
I can't say enough good things about Trattoria Contadina. The pastas are delicious and always cooked to perfection. The wait staff are friendly, very knowledgeable and always make you feel comfortable even if the quarters are somewhat cramped. Wine list is nice and thorough with a great selection of vino to compliment whatever you choose off the menu. 

For starters you really can't go wrong with the carpaccio although the prosciutto is also pure bliss.  As far as entrees I've tried a variety of dishes here and not been disappointed once. From veal saltimbocca to gnocchi napolentana to frutti di mare (seafood mixture over linguine with garlic and pomodoro sauce, delicious) to the delectable little ravioli salvatore, you really can't miss with this place. 

Trattoria Contadina easily gets my nod for best Italian in the city.
author: Tommy P.

description:
Went here for a date night w/ my boyfriend and we ordered the beef carpaccio which came out room temp...never had it like that before. Just made me nervous due to it being raw and warm at the same time. 
-Wine was fabulous
-Service was pretty slow (tho they were busy) 
-I was pretty much touching elbows with the two tables beside me (which doesn't totally bother me cuz some of the best restaurants are small, what can ya do?)
-My gnocchi was pretty good, just tasted like macaroni and cheese tho. Still, it was good.
-The after dinner cappuccino was nicely prepared
author: Kimberly P.

description: The bell pepper app is to die for. Service is always great. Small tight seating with local appeal. Cheers
author: Sarah P.

description:
North beach...its a place that I don't visit too often...like South Carolina. It's like...there's probably good stuff there, but there's probably also a lot of tourists there...so the signal (good spots) to noise (shitty spots) could be a but lower than in some other neighborhoods. Plus, I live a ways away.

Anyways, I felt like taking a safari. I jump on a cable car, pose for some photos, reluctantly sniff some ass that is shoved carefully in front of my face since people need to stand outside cuz its just that rad (ok ok...I like standing outside too...). And see this place. Right on the corner of the cable car line, and not on Broadway...SCORE!

The restaurant is full, but there are only maybe 10-15 tables. So, if you want to go on a weekend...plan ahead (I went on a Monday)! I plop down at the 4 seat bar right away...one seat is left available.

The food is solid. Its not legendary, but its solid, and its pretty cheap. The best part was everything blended together nicely instead of one thing overpowering something else. Nice specialty drink menu too. None of that girly shit...they bring the classic liquor. Bonus points there.

Honestly, what I liked most about this place, and what earned it the 4th star was the feel of the joint. It was super comfortable, but not divey. Its like being an invited guest in someone's house. The wait staff loves to talk to you, but they are ultra-attentive in their service without looking over your shoulder way too much. 

I'll be back because its a solid spot in a neighborhood that I need to know more about. Its the right blend of wait staff/food/and price (BTW, with 1 hefty drink, an app, and a pasta dish, I skated out of there for $35!) Just go already.
author: Sean C.

description:
In town for business and got recommended this place by the hotel concierge. 

Small, local (not divey) restaurant in North Beach. On a Tuesday night it was young adults and business attired people. Good vibe and was definitely quiet enough so the table could hold a normal conversation without shouting or having to say "huh" a bunch of times. 

The service was slow. It took 15 minutes to take a drink order (waters and an iced tea since half of the party was pregnant) and then once the drinks arrived along with some bread it took another 20 minutes to take the dinner order even though we were sitting there with our menus closed. However once the order was in the food arrived in a prompt time. 

Caesar salad and ravioli with ricotta cheese filling with tomato cream sauce for me and an Insalade Misto and spaghetti and meatballs for my business associate. 

Food overall was yummy and the salad plus the small pasta portion was good for the tow of us. There are small and large portions, depending on if you would also want to order a meat selection. 

We did not try wine or cocktails even though there is a full bar that you can sit at and an extensive drink menu. 

5 stars for food and ambiance but 3 stars for the service. I would come back here again.
author: Debbie E.

description:
Came with a Milanese friend for supper. We arrived on time and they immediately sat us in the back against the wall. Looking out gave us the impression of the place being old and uninviting. Not old as Rustic but just old as in I need Ramsey to come in and revamp it. 

What can I say? The food is blah. My friend had the Saltimbocca - literal translation is "Jump in your mouth". In was not the case at Contadina. It was an overly sweet cheesy mess with an extremely thin strip of veal. I had a pasta plate that was a complete blur for me. I remember that there was too much cheese and parsley. Or something. It was such a bad experience that we couldn't muster the enthusiasm for dessert.
author: Veritas V.

description:
Had a 7pm reservation- we were seated at maybe 7:10-7:15...fair enough.  We had to ask for bread after a while which is a no-no to me at an Italian restaurant. Come on people, bread and olive oil are always expected- stat...lol.

After a reasonable amount of time the waiter delivered 3 out of 4 meals correctly- my dad's veal dish came out with the wrong sauce so they took an extra 5 minutes or so to re-prepare it and offered a glass of the wine he was drinking on the house. 

I had the Cavatappi special which had veal, sundried tomatoes, capers, onions and a tomato cream sauce- yum-o! And there are leftovers which is always great. My friend had a cavatappi with scallops and both my parents had veal dishes. Everyone enjoyed their food but they lost a star for the service. We noticed that the table next to us had one of their orders prepared in error as well.

The star may come back if I go again and have a seamless experience.
author: Diane S.

description:
I went here with a group of 6, and it was great! It was a little hard to get the server's attention sometimes, but the food was great. And I mean it -- save room for dessert. The tiramisu was great, but the Limoncello tiramisu was incredible. If you have to choose, go for the lemon. 

The tables are close together, but I think we got a little lucky because of the size of our group -- we were upstairs in a nook by the window, so it wasn't so bad. 

Overall, a great restaurant and we'd totally go back.
author: Kellie P.

description:
There are plenty of good Italian places in the area, but what makes this place cool is that it's a little out of the way from the standard touristy places on Columbus. 

It's got a cool neighborhood feel and solid dishes. Tight-ass food critics may not put it atop their lists, but locals love this joint.
author: Justin C.

description:
After running somewhere between 15 and 20 miles each, the three of us knew we needed to carb reload.  After looking around on Yelp, found this place with the awesome reviews.  It says it opens at 5:30 on Saturday, but we got up there around 5:15.  There were already people seated inside.  We didn't have a reservation, but the hostess easily accommodated us, with fair warning that she needed the table by 6:45.  

On the menu, there were two prices.  The waitress said there are two sizes, one that is more of an antipasti size and the other is entree sized.  We decided to start off with the Antipasti Contadina, and ordered the smaller Rigatoncelli alla Carlesimo, a smaller Fettucine con Salsiccia alla Vincenzo  and a dinner Fettucine con Salsiccia alla Vincenzo.
