description: Italian in this city usually sucks!  Get me back to NYC, South Philly or Jersey any day.  HOWEVER, this is some of the best italian I've had in SF, no joke.  Pretty authentic and not overly touristy.
author: Kim N.

description: The local italian hot spot. Simply the most amazing italian food in San Francisco. Tratorria Contadina never fails to deliver consistantly friendly service, and amazing food. Off the beaten path on Union/Mason, the Columbus Street crowds are avoided and you are treated to an atmosphere filled with some of the most well-known San Francisco faces. Treat yourself to the Fusilli Pavoratti, you won't be dissappointed.
author: Dave M.

description: "The Tratt"--I have been going here for years and I LOVE this place. Not only is it cozy and sports spectacular service, the food is excellent. Don't be shy when you're there--and hold off on your diet. Go there with the intention of eating delicious Italian food. Order the stuffed peppers as an appetizer, the bruchetta is good as well. I always opt for the Ceasar salad, though the spinach one is good as well. One of my all time favorite dishes is the gnocchi, which is actually made from cheese and covered in a delicious tomato cream sauce--to die for--but VERY rich, so be careful ;). Needless to say, I like to go here as often as possible.
author: michaela w.

description: After three years of living here, I finally got around to trying this place! Very friendly service, with a reservation we were seated promptly. We sat upstairs, which I really enjoyed because it wasn't quite as loud and gave a more intimate feel. I had the pork chop and my sister had the veal. Both were very tasty, but I think the pasta's are the way to go here. We had a great bottle of wine and everything was reasonably priced. I will certainly be back to try more!
author: Lisa K.

description: The food seemed mediocre.  I was hoping for much better considering the reviews but won't be going back.  Atmosphere was nothing special and the tables were very close together.
author: S. C.

description: The bf and I came here about a month ago.  The pasta is fantastic!  Plus, it turns out the manager is a high school classmate of the bf's sister.  Nice!  Definitely recommended as a neighborhood joint.
author: Sheila W.

description:
4 stars for the food:  Fabulous as usual.

-1 for the service.

Here's why:  
1. Our waiter took quite awhile to take both our drink order and our food order.
2. He brought our bottle of wine over (after waiting 10 minutes from the time of ordering it).  Place the bottle of wine on the table and then excused himself.  We waited another 5 minutes till he came back to actually open it.  
3. He also looked really scattered.  I saw him take our food over to another table.  Note: We were sitting upstairs where there's about 5 tables.
3. He made somewhat of a off-kilter joke at the end of our meal.  Normally it would've been funny.  But he didn't really build a rapport with me and my girl friends before joking that he "doesn't mind 3 ways".  
AND number 4. . .I'm pretty sure he called my friends "bitches" as we walked out.  They walked ahead of me and I think he believed I had walked out before them.  The look on his face was priceless as I turned the corner and the words were leaving his mouth.   haaaa!

So, guess it's Take Out for us now.
author: Amanda U.

description: Average and really cramped. I was starving when I went, so that made it more decent, but the chicken marsala didn't impress me and my dates pasta with vegables seemed bland.
author: michelle k.

description: Trattoria Contadina -- that's amore. Love everything I've tried here, especially the halibut. I think my favorite part about this restaurant, though, is how small and homey it is. Feels like you're dining in Mama Celeste's kitchen, only the food is waaaay better.
author: Heather L.

description: I've been here twice and both times I've had a good meal.  The place is very small and reservations are a must unless you can go when they open.  We had a party of six and everyone was very satisfied with their meal. The brushetta which was excellent, and the Frutti di Mare alla Fiore is great if you like lots of seafood.  We had a great server Robin and they gave us a yummy dessert wine on the house.  I'd go here more but can only deal with North Beach parking about twice a year.  If you have a party with over four people I'd ask for a table in the upstairs dining room.
author: kacey h.

description:
I love inappropriate conversations.  I especially love inappropriate conversations in small places surrounded by a bunch of stiffs.  And I really-super-duper love inappropriate conversations surounded by a bunch of stiffs when the conversation is about pooping or farting.  
So last night after Clams and I had finished our 3-cheese bell pepper dish in a cream sauce and our gnocchi with cream sauce (but before the salmon and before the tiramisu),  she informs me she recently became lactose intolerant.  Oh yeah!, let the fart talk begin!  
With two power-brokers on one side of us, a foursome of elderly folks on the other side, Clams launches into the horrible gas she gets after eating cheese and other dairy products, how bloated her stomach gets etc. It's great!  Then she tells me a story about how she was in a bar recently and there were these two Mastiff's there that kept farting...apparently some of the worst farting she's ever experienced.  
This has nothing to do with Trattoria Contadina.  But, great food, GREAT waitstaff, small room,  friendly atmosphere, all rolled into a great medium-priced package....*that* describes Trattoria Contadina!  
But if anybody else likes going out and talking about inappropriate things, I'm your man!  :)
author: Zev K.

description: Hands down the best Italian food in North Beach.  They are known for their Ravioli, although everything on the menu is superb.  Great place to take your out of town guests and  your parents!  I would eat here every night if I lived in that area.
author: Amy H.

description: SHORT & SWEET: Some of the best - if not THE best - Italian in SF; small and intimate; a taste of San Fran in North Beach with cable cars rumbling by; excellent hosts who make you feel like a celeb, but expect to wait 10-15 min for your table; impeccable service; STICK WITH PASTA; the perfect meal: Melanzane alla Mozzarella to start and the Tortellini alla Panna - you'll be back with your whole crew; first dates will end well if you choose Contadina.
author: Corey S.

description: Oooh, busy place!  Came here on a school night and it was hoppin'.  Food was delicious, a bit heavy, but delicious.  I ordered ravioli.  I like that this place is so quaint, and has a lot of character.  There were four of us, and we shared a bottle of red wine (or two, I can't remember).  Good times, good energy.  I look forward to coming back here.  Mamma Mia!
author: Sarah F.

description: Amazing, Amazing, Amazing!  That's all i really need to say.  Everything we had here was fantastic.  I had the Chicken Santi which was served in a white sauce that was melt in your mouth delicious.  We split the Gnocchi as an anti-pasta and though it was not melt in your mouth, the sauce they serve it in was so good you didn't even notice.  The fiancee had the halibut which was served in a tomato sauce with capers and that pleased her tremendously.  Would definitely go back here in a heartbeat.  make reservations as the place is small but well worth it.
author: Vincent R.

description: Our family went here at the recommendation of Zagat's Guide and the Four Seasons Hotel. It's known as a landmark North Beach traditional Italian restaurant just off the beaten path. The atmosphere was festive, but cramped and noisy. We found the food mediocre and the house wine surprisingly weak.For starters, the bread was bland. Our caesar salad was below par. There was not a hint of garlic (which one would expect in a caesar). The best of our four meals was by far the lamb chops. They were great. The gnocchi was ok. The rigatoni w/eggplant was nice but not great. The spaghetti w/meatballs was nothing special. Our waiter, who was handling a lot of tables, was attentive. However, he did forget one of our appetizers (then kindly comp'ed it afterwards). For just OK Italian food, Contadina is alright. For amazing Italian food, we would not go back.
author: Jennifer M.

description: I ride by this restaurant everyday to and from work.  Each time I go by, I can see that the patrons are having a great time - they're smiling, laughing, seeming to enjoy the food.  After I read the reviews from fellow yelpers talking about the great food, I decided to take my friends who were visiting from LA to Trattoria Contadina.  I should have taken them somewhere else!  My dish was bland, my bf's dish was salty, and my friends didn't "mmmm" and "aaahhh" like they usually do when we're out to eat.
author: Zaneta C.

description:
I'm a snob. I'll admit it. So naturally, with my snobbiness, you would assume I wouldn't enjoy a restaurant that really is a bit cheesy with the decor. 

However, I've been coming her for, like, ever. I can remember sitting on the little stool by the front window, coloring in my kaleidoscope coloring book while chatting up the maitre d'. I was about five. We have taken pretty much every visiting family member here, and come here every year on Xmas eve after seeing the Nutcracker. The food is superb, and the service divine, though possibly becasue a lot of the waiters seem to know us. So enjoy the food, the cheesy decor, and try the Tiramisu. I love tiramisu.
author: Liv K.

description: This place was AMAZING. It has a small family-owned feel to it. The service was fast, efficient and friendly, and they handled our special request and substitutions with no issue at all. The food was incredible... super tasty, and we all had to sample each other's because the dishes were all sooooooo good. We started with the appetizer order of meatballs; they were big, juicy and very delicious. We also got an order of bruschetta bread; it was loaded with tomatoes, basil and cheese on a crunchy bread. For our mains, I ordered veal scallopini with prosciutto, mushrooms and marsala with pasta and broccolini; my girlfriend ordered beef ravioli in a creamy tomato sauce (great size portion and tasty); and her sister got the "house" specialty: pasta Carlesimo. This last one was probably the best pasta I have ever tasted... very flavourful with a spicy finish, but not too much at all. Super tasty. (Just thought I would mention how good it was again and that I was totally jealous.) We also split an order of carbonara just because we all love it, and it was incredible as well... cheesy with bacon in a cream sauce. At first I thought the peas and corn in it were going to make it taste off, but they were a great addition to this dish. All our dishes came out hot, which was nice. Since we had an extra dinner dish, there was no room for dessert... and there were lots of leftovers! But, we look forward to visiting again before we finish our vacation and fly back to Canada. We will be trying the tiramisu and the Oreo cookie with fudge chocolate chips and gelato mmmmm good. All in all, it was great food, fair price, awesome service... and we will be back for sure when in San Francisco again.
author: Mig A.

description: One of the best Italian meals I have ever had. The charlisimo was so good and our server was beyond helpful with giving us other tips on local food.
author: Jamie R.

description: Not only is the the closest restaurant to my house but I also think that it is one of the best in North Beach.  Make sure to make a reservation and order the cheese stuffed roasted bell pepper as an appetizer.  I promise you won't be disappointed.
author: KRISTIN B.

description: We keep trying other neighborhood places for good authentic Italian as they open up in North Beach but Trattoria continues to remain our favorite.   Not only is the food excellent but the portions are large.  Our favorites are the spicy sausage pasta and the sun dried tomato and cream sauce pasta.  I usually eat very healthy but I can't help it - I get the cream sauce at Trattoria!  Its too good!
author: michelle s.

description: I went here at a friend's recommendation for my birthday and the food was mediocre at best.  My mom had the fruto di mare and the seafood was not fresh and very tough.  For the price we could've eaten at Farina and had a far better experience.  The wine glasses were small and so was the amount of wine poured per glass.  This is definitely not the place to come for a special occasion.
author: Stephanie K.

description: GREAT food.  I had the eggplant & mozzarella appetizer and egg noodle fettucini with spinach and salmon for the main course.  The sauces were all really flavorful, the food was served piping hot, and the portions were generous.  I would definitely go back.
author: Doug A.

description: This is, hands down, one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city.  It's cute, cozy and conveniently located off the cable car line (if that's any importance).  The food is absolutely fantastic.  I typically only order pasta dishes at Italian restaurants but here I venture out.  Their chicken dish layered with smoke mozzarella, prosciutto, oregano and sage in a madeira wine sauce is my personal favorite.  On and don't get me started on their deserts!  I AM the "sweets" connoisseur and I think they are to die for especially their chocolate cake.  This place is sorta noisy but it still works for a date BUT I highly recommend making a reservation beforehand otherwise you'll probably be looking at a 45-1hr wait....Yumm! I'm getting hungry just writing this thing!
author: Danielle V.

description: The food was very good in general (my first visit).  Everyone I was dining with left happy.  Dishes are not cheap but not exorbitantly expensive.  If you want value for money, go for the Rigatoni over the Ravioli.  I had the Rigatoni alla Carlesimo and I loved it.  The bread was not great.
author: Adam M.

description: I love this place. They can accommodate large groups or just a party of two. The food is consistent and the atmosphere is bustling. I always have a good meal and a pleasant evening.
author: Shannon C.

description: This place is great. I went with my gf for her birthday. The food was great, the service was good. They have a decent wine list and the price was right. all in all a great place for dinner. make reservations, its cozy and is always full
author: Chris P.

description: one of my favorite restaurants in north beach that strays away from the touristy columbus route.  solid, comforting italian food.
author: Helen T.

description: The food is just fine, but the veal saltambocca was terrible. It was in a gelatinous sweet malty sauce; probably the worst rendition of the famous Italian dish I've ever had. Also the meat was pretty mediocre grade. I was almost taken aback when I complained about the taste of the dish and the waiter said that I shouldn't worry that they wouldn't charge me. I'm not going to force feed myself a $35 dish which tastes terrible and I'm more offended that they were going to charge me. I'm not going back. I would rather fly to Connecticut for a good Italian meal and back than suffer through that veal again.
author: Tertiary D.

description: from the moment you pass through the doors of this lovely neighborhood gem, the experience begins. warm smiles, appetizing smells, and gentle chatter fills the room from the minute the doors open until the last check is paid. the ambiance here is exactly right for me. i wouldn't change a thing.
author: Coco M.

description:
I don't understand the rave reviews this place got. It's edible, but that's about all I can say. It tastes like every other bland North Beach restaurant. I'm definitely not a food snob, but I was really disappointed. 

The service was great and the atmosphere was nice, but the food is definitely NOT worth it.
author: Melissa M.

description: Spaghetti and meatball plate was ok, nothing spectacular.  But the tortellini dish was delicious.  Waiter was a bit rude and snooty.  Hostess was nice and accommodating.
author: Grace L.

description: I'd give it six stars if I could! Not only is the food always amazing, but the people who work here are really special. This restaurant beats out all those touristy North Beach restaurants by a mile and is always so warm and friendly. Everyone I've ever taken here has loved it and Trattoria Contadina knows how to make regulars feel really special, knowing you by name and appearing with free appetizers and dessert drinks. Speaking of drinks, all the drinks are great too. Yum, I wish I was going there tonight...
author: LT M.

description: Came here a few weekends ago.  The food was excellent and the staff was as well.  we have two small boys and despite this being a smaller neighborhood place, they were totally accommodating.  We each had pastas.  A cheese ravioli in a cream tomato sauce and a penne pasta with sun dried tomatos, mushrooms, and creamy tomato sauce.  Both were excellent.  We had the Arugala salad with balsamic dressing and figs.  This was a little disappointing.  The salty of the balsamic way overpowered the sweet of the figs.  I think they're striving for more balance because they seem quite dedicated to quality and customer service so if you're reading this Trattoria Contadina, try to adjust the salad a little. It has great potential but the balance our evening was a bit off.  They have a solid beer list with the usual suspects and some interesting craft beers.  The house sangiovese we had was solid.  No great.  But solid.  Bottom line, this was a wonderful evening.  Very good food and Excellent staff.  We would go there again when back in town.
author: dave c.

description: amazing. best food in north beach hands down. amazing pasta (homemade) and their cream sauces are the best i have ever tried in my life. the restaurant itself has awesome, authentic italian ambiance and its in north so so much to do after dinner - whether its gelato or drinks or anything. always make a stop here when im in sf!
author: Clare C.

description: 14 years ago when I first moved here, I used to LOVE this place but no longer.  I was here a couple of years ago and it was ok. Fun, good service but nothing special.  Now it is a step down from that.  The prices are pretty high and the food is rather pedestrian. Decent sized portions but no finesse to any of the dishes. We ate at 6:30p and ordered the risotto special.  Possibly the worst risotto I've had in a restaurant. More like a fried rice or a paella.  I was shocked that they could pass this off as risotto. Someone cooking in the kitchen has NO idea what a true risotto should be like (I'm not sure they even used arborio rice).  The tomato cream sauce was tasty but caters to midwestern and teenage tastes (I was with two adolescent boys and they liked it just fine). The red snapper was pan fried in a heavy sauce. Very old school.  Not bad, but not great either.  They also don't have a fryer, so no deep fried calamari.  Wine list had big markups.  In sum, the pastas are decent as long as you stick to the butter/wine/garlic sauce or you like rich cream sauces.  The rest of the main courses are hit or miss.
author: Priscilla C.

description: the classic family owned italian restaurant. a true SF favorite. i grew up a few blocks away and recall the place always looking intriguing but didnt actually try the place till a few years ago. luckily it was everything i thought it would be. the place is a bit on the small side and gets packed very often so reservations are key. the food is VERY GOOD and the wine selection is nice also. i also kind of appreciate that its not on columbus or any other  very commercial street, union and mason give it a much more "neighborhood feel" but the cable car noises in the background of your meal are a nice touch.
author: Andrew D.

description: It's a small restaurant with a pretty mural on the wall and streetcars going by.  It would be a great place to take out of town guests.  Everything I've had there is excellent, particularly the extremely cheesy roasted pepper appetizer.  The portions are huge so order half plates, shared meals, or appetizers if you are interested in walking out of there instead of being rolled.  The servers can be inattentive but the hostesses are great and will help you out if you need to get your waiter's attention.
author: Molly J.

description: Seriously overrated.  Food was good but not fabulous by any means and for the $100 we spent it (for 2 people) we left feeling ripped off.  The signature dish there is anything with a tomato-cream sauce but this turns out to be way too sweet.  The hostesses and bus people were great but our waiter was a flake.  Will not return - too many other great restaurants in the area.
author: Mizu H.

description:
This place hit the spot, homey Italian food.  busy, but not neglectful-- the service was friendly and my tortellini was yummy. the prices were good

The beef carpacio was rocked!  Will definitely return.
author: melissa W.

description: I was a bit disappointed after hearing such good things about this place. The food is OK, definitely better than your average North Beach tourist trap, but it's not that great value, and the wine is positively expensive. The seating is really cramped, although there's not a lot they can do about that - it's a very small, cosy venue. The service is OK - not very memorable. It has a "tucked away" feel, which is nice, but there are better places to go in North Beach - my recommendation would be Piazza Pellegrini.
author: Ellen H.

description: I guess I am going to be the dissenting voice here.  The one time I visited, I was served white rice with parmesano cheese melted over it; such was their version of risotto.  Need I say more.
author: Nigel P.

description:
not "fine" dining - but this is really, really good.  The place is a little cramped.  

I have been back a couple times and never disappointed.  

If you add their wine list, this is a five star.
author: Hal B.

description:
4.5 would be more appropriate.

My favorite place in North Beach by far.   While I feel you can get a lot of very good food in that neighborhood, Contandina is the only place that goes beyond the standard.   Small and cozy, it's also one of the only places that takes reservation, which is helpful.  Had my best experience sitting at the bar and chatting with the great bar and wait staff.

Worth repeat visits!!!
author: Kris E.

description: This place was great for a casual Thursday night out.  The prices are reasonable, the pasta was in fact as good as everyone else has reviewed.  I found the service to be very friendly and plenty prompt enough.  The waitress helped us with some good, honest advice on wine selection which was very much appreciated.  I say if you want traditional Italian with lively but not loud atmosphere, and you don't want to pay too much, you've found a good choice.  (Easily accessible on the muni 41 line too, let's off right in front of the restaurant)
author: Kevin I.

description:
I'd been hearing good things about this restaurant forever and FINALLY went to try it out.
Each time I passed the place by it's always been soooo crowded. I figured it most be one of those little hidden treasures... unpretentious and unfancy but with top-notch, authentic, old-country, tasty food. I guessed wrong. I can only describe the food with one word - blah. 
I went there with my (Italian born and raised) boyrfriend and a friend. We shared an unremarkable bruschetta, and waited eagerly for our main dishes. 
I went for Rigatoncelli alla Carlesimo which sounded delicious in words on the menu.... but sadly, blah. 
Marco had the Spaghetti Bolognese, which is his standard test for a good Italian restaurant... blah. 
And Gene had the Tortellini alla Panna... this one was in fact better than blah. Maybe even getting close to yummy. 

So, all in all, I'm not sure what the fuss is about. I'd say it was okay, definitely not bad, but really not all that good either.
author: Deirdre F.

description: This place is a MUST eat at restaurant in SF!  If you are looking for great italian food, I wouldnt go anywhere else.  I had the best pasta dinner in my whole life at this place!  Go!  You will not be disappointed.
author: James M.

description: The customer service was HORRIBLE! Not only were they rude, they also let our food sit out for a long time before serving it to us. I rarely ever give any place a bad rating, but I am not impressed with this restaurant. The food was ok, nothing great, and overpriced. The dishes we got we could have easily made at home for a lot cheaper. I was disappointed. The search for a great Italian restaurant in SF continues.
author: L. S.

description: Best restaurant in San Francisco! The service is incredibly fast and friendly, and the resturant iteslf makes you feel like you are in Italy. It is very charming. The food is delicious: the pasta and chicken I had was the best I have eaten. Great restaurant!
author: Ryan H.

description: Disappointed!  I searched on Yelp for a nice pasta dinner in North Beach the night before the San Francisco marathon.  Overall the reviews seemed good and I liked the menu so I made a reservation for 2 at 6:00pm on a Saturday.  We arrived on time and the restaurant was about 2/3 full.  It is a small place, but they made the most out of the space.  The staff was friendly and we were seated immediately.  Water (which is important for a marathoner!) was brought quickly and our server explained the specials.  We went with a salad on the menu that had figs which sounded good. My dining companion doesn't like peppers and eliminating this from a chicken pasta dish while substituting a red sauce was easily accepted.  I ordered the seafood pasta.  So far so good.  Bread was brought along with oil & vinegar.  I was happy that the oil & vinegar was separate however the bread was really boring white bread served at room temperature.  If you've ever had the CPK bread it was only 1/2 step better.  Fortunately the salad was delicious!  We waited a bit for our entrees, but not terribly long.  However when they finally arrived they were warm, not hot.  The temperature of my pasta was a little hotter when I started mixing it up, although quite a bit of the seafood was lukewarm.  My partner's chicken pasta was not hot at all.  I have no idea why our food wasn't hot as the place wasn't packed and the servers seemed to be on it.  What was even more disappointing than the temperature was the flavor.  There wasn't a lot of seasonings in either of our dishes.  We were both truly disappointed!  In my opinion it is pretty hard to have boring marinara sauce, if you can't do anything else at least add some garlic, but honestly this was some of the worst I have had at an Italian restaurant.  My dining partner joked that we would have better off going to CPK. There were quite a few old pictures of celebrities on the wall which leads me to believe that this restaurant might have been better in another era. The entrees were around $17, not cheap - not expensive, but NOT worth it!  Fortunately the meal didn't affect my marathon time but we will definitely not be back.
author: Jennifer H.

description: This was the worst meal I've had in years. The ambiance was pleasing upon our arrival and our table was not ready for our 9 PM reservation so we went to the bar for pleasant cocktails made by a great bartender. Then we were showed to our table and asked to order. We ordered the antipasti and the best thing on the plate were the olives. They were out of the wine we ordered - the wine list was limited and overpriced. We were then asked to order. We have now been at our table for about 10 or so minutes. When we said we were not ready and were looking to take our time our waiter informed us that the kitchen was closing. This should have been our sign not to order and find another restaurant to dine at but we went ahead and ordered 3 entrees. Our antipasti arrived and we were about half through when a bus boy came to take our plates. We said we were not ready. He walked downstairs, came back and placed three dishes on a side table. He then came back over and said, "I'm taking your plates now". He did and served our entrees. The veal was rubbery, the pasta was overcooked and the risotto special was miserable. The pork was tough, all the vegetables in the risotto were undercooked but the risotto itself was like glue. We had a good laugh over this meal, but today I went to check my credit card statement and Trattoria Contadina generously charged my card twice for such an exquisite dining experience. Diners beware. Stay Away. p.s. I would give this place zero stars but the 1 star was for the bartender and the finely crafted pre-dinner cocktail.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Friends (native SF'ers both) and I decided to go to North Beach after a day spent looking for San Francisco Noir film sites (see, the Art Deco Building at 160 Montgomery, which was in Dark Passage with Humphrey Bogart).  None of us had been to NB in quite a while, and the touristy aspect of it underwhelmed.  But going first to Cafe Trieste was just as I remembered it from maybe 15 years ago.  And Paul Kantner, of Jefferson Airplane/Starship, was sitting solo in a chair on the street the corner, reading a newspaper and smoking a cigarette, just waiting to be recognized.  But I digress.  Our reservations were for 6:00.  The downstairs was already full, but we were shown to the much cozier upstairs room, with a corner table.  The service was very competent, the bus person (woman) was especially noteworthy for her friendliness and attentiveness (water, etc.)  The food, however, fell short, if you are used to a more updated style of Italian food.  This was old school, indeed, as other posters have mentioned.  We had the prosciutto with melon, which was o.k., but nothing special (is this ever anything special at this point?  Maybe back in 1985 ...)  Also, the mellanzana.  Which was tasty, but that's about all I could say.  I had the polpettine, as I'm a sucker for meatballs, but while they did have some dimension to them, they just sort of sat on the linguini.  Or was it spaghetti?  The "fresh tomato sauce" was amazingly underwhelming, didn't come together with the meatballs, although I have to say it benefitted from sitting around until the next day, when I had the leftovers at lunch.  So maybe they should make these on Monday for Tuesday, etc.  My friends had the valdostanna, and while they didn't rave about it, they pronounced it good on a standby Italian old-school level.  The caramel gelato dessert was also a disappointment, though it sounded wonderful.  We all agreed that Contadina gets good marks for atmospherics (a block above Columbus) and that the food was ok, maybe even good, but old-school Italian.  And the prices!  Tab for sharing two appetizers, and then one pasta, a glass of wine and sharing a dessert was $49 (including tip).
author: Leslie P.

description:
My favorite italian place in SF. Granted, it's near my house so it's convenient, but the food is reliably good. Decor is nothing spectacular, but that makes it the cozy local family place...

The eggplant/mozzerella appetizer is to die for. My go-to dish is the Ravioli alla Salvatore- Luscious!!!
author: Lindsay B.

description: Great dinner!  Small and cozy space with wonderful menu.  I had a hard time deciding what to get.  The pastas and meats were all great.  Wonderful dessert drinks as well.  I read about this place on yelp and tried it.  I would definitely go back.
author: Theresa W.

description:
Not bad at all.  We went for a birthday celebration, and the food was pretty good.  Made a reservation with opentable.com and was seated immediately.  They have a well stocked bar with some original cocktail choices.

The place is tiny and a little crowded, and the bathroom is tiny.  If you're really claustrophobic, this is not the place for you.  It's the biggest factor into giving the place 3 stars over 4.

We had 3 appetizers (bruchetta, carpaccio and prosciutto with melon), and all of them were tasty, especially the bruchetta.  I had the caprese salad and gnochi, and was very happy with both.  Everyone else seemed pretty satisfied with their meals, but I heard the ravioli was almost too rich.

For dessert, we had the spumoni ice cream cake, which as also really good.

I probably won't go out of my way to go back there (parking sucks!), but if I am in the area again, I will definitely be back.
author: Bert W.

description: We had a great time..!  The seating was intimate and the service was perfect.. Delicious fresh bread and a great ceasar salad to start.. Our main courses were the gnocchi and the beef tortellini and both were wonderful..
author: J G.

description: Delicious!  My honey and I were there for dinner on Saturday night and had an amazing meal.  We started at the bar, the bartender just happened to be the grandson of the family that started the restaurant.  He was very responsive to our drunken chattiness and helped us out by talking the hostess into seating us earlier than our reservation.  He also let us try a scotch that we weren't sure about before we ordered it.  The bar only seats four people and the two people next to us were eating their meal there.  We liked that the location is away from the commercial stuff on Columbus. We had the bresola (AWESOME) and the caprese salad - very good.  We had a special of the evening, a  fusilli pasta dish with a spicy tomato sauce, black olives, and shrimp that was perfect.  Even better was a veal dish with a creamy mushroom sauce. It was lick-your-plate-good.  The (free) birthday tiramisu was a nice surprise and devoured by both of us.  Highly recommended!
author: Nina V.

description: What a Carbonara!   Everyone at the table couldn't stop taking bites off my plate.   And, some fantastic Italian wine by the glass.    I'd give it another star but the waiter was a little slow (or english was not good enough) and made mistakes on both of my drink orders, and didn't get my wife's entre correct - causing the table to wait for 10 mins while her's was re-done.   Nonetheless, I'd definitely return.
author: Joseph U.

description: For some reason I've lived in the Bay Area for over 6 years and have never eaten Italian.  Well that was remedied last night with one damn fine eats.    We all have our measuring sticks for different kinds of foods.  Mine for Italian is linguini with a white clam sauce.  Here its called the Linguini Vongole.  I'm not Italian and I didn't care to babblefish that so pardon my lack of knowledge.  Anyhow, we started off noshing on the bread in their super rich and almost butter like olive oil. "You know its fresh when it tastes like buttah" and old Italian friend's father once said.  It was all I could do not to fill up on that alone.  Next we split a great Caesar which came just the way I like it, a bit heavy on the dressing.  Romaine is pretty boring beyond the crisp sweetness so I like every piece with at least a little bit of that Caesar zing and some parm on there.  Perfect in my book.  Next was my aforementioned Linguini Vongole.  I got to pick each clam outta the shell and put it in my perfectly al dente pasta.  The sauce wasn't too wine-y or too oil-y or too garlic-y.  It was the perfect marriage of all three major components until it was all gone.  Here I thought I'd have a meal the next day but it was so delicious I ate it all.  Perfetto!
author: Chard M.

description: Unfortunately, I have to change my review.  I previously said, "Easily the BEST italian food I've ever had," but a second experience proved to not be so top notch.  Unlike the mouth watering dish I first ordered, the chicken with smoked mozzerela and proschutto was average.  Here's what I thought about my first visit:  You know when you start to eat something and all the sudden your caught off-guard by your tounge enjoying itself far more than you expected?  We got the mussels and clams which were pretty standard, but our entres - The Risotto con Pesce Despada (think that's right) - Risotto with Swordfish - was AMAZING, sundried tomatoes, spinach, perfectly creaming tomato cream sauce and exactly right cooking time for the risotto, with a filet of grilled swordfish on top - to die for!  Entres are about $20 - I'll go back for the risotto, but count me out for the new dish trial runs - 5star first visit, 3 star second visit
author: Jared F.

description: Went with my 2 kids (11 and 8) and felt like they could not wait for us to leave.  Waiters hovered and cleared plates that still had food on them, and didn't bother ask if we wanted leftovers boxed. It was clear they wanted us out of there to turn the table.  Food by the way was good, not great. They charged me $3 to substitute chicken for pancetta, which set the tone for my experience. Not going back.
author: Apryl S.

description: We had a big group dinner here of 12 people and they accommodated us very well with prompt service, fantastic food and a great atmosphere without it being too loud at all.  The Gnocchi is unbelievable.  Wine list is a bit on the pricy side and the 2nd cheapest Chianti we ordered was not very good.
author: Rafael D.

description: This is a great Italian place to take out of town guests to who insist on eating Italian food in North Beach, as the food is more authentic and less Olive Garden-ish than most of the restaurants on Columbus.  I've had gnocchi, chicken marsala, and veal scaloppini  and all were delicious.  The polenta appetizer is good too.   I'm only giving it four stars because although this place is slightly off the beaten path, word has gotten out on how good it is and is and it was packed with tourists last time I was there, which gets slightly obnoxious.  Also, it is pricey.  Last time I was there with two other people and we ordered three entrees and no wine, the check came to almost $90.
author: M M.

description: The food was quite mediocre. The faux Italian accent was irritating.  Not worth the trip.
author: Michele L.

description: good italian food.  slightly cramped seating and the main course took a little time to come out but, at least that means it was prepared fresh.  would definitley come back again.
author: Tanvi A.

description: hands down - my favorite place for italian in north beach.  the food is great, and its not as touristy as a lot of the other places in NB.  its a great place to take visitors or family.  and the specials are usually really good.
author: Carolyn B.

description: We called late on a Sun. for dinner that night.  We were able to get an 8pm res., which was fine, considering we would go early and have a drink.  We were tourists and took a cable car part of the way to the restaurant, which was fun, and then walked the rest of the way.  Can I just say how much I love walking?  It is bound to make us as a society more healthy, considering we typically get in our cars to drive one block!  Fresh air, good butt work (love those hills, SF!), and stimulating conversation with the love of my life.  The evening started out perfectly!  We got to the restaurant about 30 min. early, and after ordering a drink, we were told our table was ready!  Woo hoo!  The food was yummy, the wine was delish, and the prices were very reasonable.  The service was wonderful.  We felt the meal flowed nicely and our waiter was helpful.  This was just the type of neighborhood restaurant I would LOVE to have nearby!
author: Robin A.

description: Just took some relatives to Trattoria Contadina before Beach Blanket.  I have to say I was really pleasantly surprised.  Great food, good service, and right on the cable car line.  It had that perfect feel and look for out of town guests.  The food leans towards simple red sauce type mid-west east coast type Italian.  And the prices are pretty reasonable.  Sit in the window if you can and sip a glass of there fairly priced reds.  Enjoy!!
author: Robert A.

description: I just had dinner here last weekend and it was amazing!  I had the Verde pasta, and it was sooo good (I had a half portion and still had some leftover for the next day).  My friends ordered two different raviolis, also very good.  I ordered bruschetta as an appetizer, and our waiter told us they ran out of the crunchy bread that it's usually on....10 minutes later the waiter said he had a surprise for us, and gave us a plate of yummy bruschetta at not charge :)  Amazing service!!  Even though it's a small restaurant, I didn't feel too close to anyone around me.  Also really good wine, and nothing was overpriced or too expensive.
author: Brittney D.

description: When we ate there a few months ago, the food was nice but not outstanding. So we decided to take some out of twon guests there this wekeend and it was probably the worst food i have eaten in San Francisco. The gnocchi was awful, the pasta was dry, stale and rubbery, with the high prices (2 pieces of bruschetta for about 10 dollars !) and the absolutely terrible food , i am definetely not going there again.
author: A B.

description: Service = 4 (kind, but not overly attentive), Food quality = 5 (Alaskian Halibut w/ mint sauce and antipasto where wonderful), Decor = 3 (cramped quarters/loud)
author: Stephen F.

description: after coming here for years i can still say with confidence that this is my go-to italian joint in SF.  everything is prepared nice and fresh and the service is impeccable.  the risotto is spot on every single time and one can't complain too much about their chocolate bombe dessert.  this gem is truly an institution here in SF and i look forward to many more dinners here.
author: Swarup B.

description: major goodness. try the cheese pepper appetizer thing (and get your lactose pill ready!). i've gone here several times in large groups, tried just about every person's dish, and they were all outstanding. that about says it. the salmon is great, the bolognese is the same, great... and the mozarella in the caprese is so fresh i was looking around for a cow... good wine, too. gets crowded... but what are you gonna do: this place is pretty much the bomb (and it won't break your bank either).
author: Eli F.

description: best gelato in town!!!!!!  order the vanilla and hazelnut, and then come back to Yelp and thank me.
author: Kelsey C.

description: Tried this place tonight on a recommendation from a friend. I've tried a few other places around North Beach for pasta, but I think this place is my new favorite! I loved all the dishes I tried! Really great pasta and appetizers. I had the clam linguine, and bits of the ravioli and another pasta I can't remember the name of, and all of them tasted great! For an appetizer I tried the eggplant dish which was really good too. It only had 3 pieces though, but there were only 3 of us so it worked out =) I will most definitely be coming back here! I think reservations are necessary though because I hear this places fills up. It's pretty small so I wouldn't doubt it. (We had reservations, so we were seated immediately). But I recommend this place as one of the "must try"s of North Beach. Located along the cable car (Powell & Mason I think) and bus routes (45 and 41?), so it's convenient to get to if you aren't within walking distance.
author: Nhi T.

description: Absolutely love this family owned restaurant.  The service is great, the space is great, and the food is great!  Triple g(s)!  Sit at the bar..casual and fun.  The carpaccio........um...two kinds?    The best.
author: Allison M.

description: A friend took me to Contadina after Fleet Week.   We got in without reservations, but we were very early so I woudl recommend reservations.  Traditional Italian food was great and service was good (not great), but the food was wonderful.  I recommend highly.  Good wine list with good value.
author: Jimmy W.

description: There's so much bad food in North Beach that it's quite refreshing to find a place like this so close to Columbus Ave. It's small, so make reservations or be prepared to wait, and parking is plain awful, but you can take a cable car to the front door. Only had pasta even though the secondi piatti looked very good as well. Bread was only average, but shared a great mushroom polenta. Prices are reasonable given the quality of the food. Pasta was cooked nicely al dente, but I wasn't wowed enough to give 5 stars, partly because of the sauce which I thought was nothing special. Service is pretty fast. Lastly, might not be the best place for a romantic dinner, despite the atmosphere, because tables are really close together - we spent a long time talking to the people at the table next to us - they were visiting from Boston - by CAR. 6-week trip. I went home and back to work the next morning. And cried a little.
author: Alexander G.

description: this is old school, parents take you out for your first italian meal , decent service, meatballs and spagetti crowd, charming and cute ... could use a new taste bud in the kitchen, but thats why this corner spot hangs with the hoodies!
author: tim y.

description: Best Italian I have had in the city!!  And very reasonably priced.
author: Kim M.

description: Wow this place was terrible.  Yet another awful ripoff reheat joint in north  beach.  We went after all the 4+ star reviews on here... and it was shockingly bad.  We couldn't finish our entrees. Waiters are nice though.
author: yourcousin l.

description: traditional, simple, great service, fresh, yammy, and reasonable.
author: bit b.

description: Let me set this one up.  I was well on my way to one of the worst birthdays on record.  I always forget to take that dang day off work, next year for sure.  I went meet a couple friends for a drink before heading to Trattoria Contadina and SURPRISE a former roommate had flown in to celebrate my birthday.  Things were looking up.  Did I mention that it was one of those really odd SF days  - 80 degrees and sunny?  I should have been amp'ed right?  What got me amp'ed was meeting up with a bunch of my friends and enjoying a really wonderous meal.  Everything was great - wine, apps, main and dessert.  I had a pasta with mushrooms, garlic, peas and sausage in a tomato cream sauce. Woah - sounds simple, it is and it was fantastic.  I need to get back there.  The service was really wonderful, they were kind and very accommodating to our large party.  The space is pretty small so if you have a crowd, all ahead.
author: cristina t.

description: It's surprising how people have such different experiences at the same restaurant. We first went here last year with friends. They found the food great. My wife and I were disappointed compared to other Italian restaurants in the North Beach area. So we tried it again last month and came away with the same results. The food is OK, but not up to par with other offerings in the area. Sorry, as we know this is a popular neighborhood restaurant, but we felt the food left a lot to be desired.
author: Roger M.

description: one of our favorite places in north beach... and good for large groups... but, make reservations (for groups) ahead of time... at least one person @ your table must get the "Contadina" dish... named after the owner, it is definitely a must!
author: matt g.

description:
liked the food (it was okay) and the ambience (very small, family-ish spot).  i ordered a pasta dish (can't remember which one) and shared bruschetta with others.   i didn't think the food was amazing, but portions are huge, so there were tons of leftovers.

because of the small size of the restaurant itself, don't expect to linger after your meal.

not sure i'd return, but i'm glad that i went once.
author: courtney o.

description: This may be one of the best Italian meals I've ever eaten. The salad was teriffic, and the pasta was out of this world. I am pretty picky when it comes to Italian food (thanks dad) but this was a winner. Very authentic food, a relaxing and romantic atmosphere and good wine list.
author: Kristin L.

description: Sorry, I just don't get all the hype.  I've eaten here once and we've gotten take-out a few times.  Nothing wrong, but nothing special either.  With a number of much more delicious (and cheaper) options in the neighborhood, I don't see why people are flocking here.  However, we have gotten various forms of pasta every time -- so maybe it's better for other dishes.
author: S J.

description: We are lucky to have an apartment a few steps away from this restaurant.  Our realtor took us there for dinner before we even closed and it was wonderful.  Very difficult to get into on the weekends.  Very good food. Great servicxe.
author: Judy H.

description:
I am very sorry to make this review, I have sent a ton of people to this cute, very recommended family run restaurant...
Maybe it was the day of the week, maybe the cook was not inspired... but the food was not even close to what you would expect from a place as recommended as this one.
Everything... everything!! was swimming in sauce, that is not Italian!!! Good Italian is all about the simple produce that taste amazing on their own.. if you soak everything win sauce, if you overcook the pasta, if the antipasto only has canned pickles, canned artichoke and some yellow bell pepper and cold cuts, if your top your daily meat suggestion with a ton of unknown sauce.... that means you are not proud of your produce, you are hiding something. ..
Again, maybe the head chef was out for the day, maybe they had some leftovers, maybe...
I will probably go back in a while and give it another try. I would love to be proven wrong...
author: Juli L.

description: This place is a great restaurant that, while in North Beach, is well of the beaten path.  Keeps you clear of the tourists and the bridge and tunnel that infests the area.  No frills, but they have great food, attentive service and a good wine list.
author: Matt A.

description: This is a cozy restaurant. My party was seated upstair. And they are really happy with their choices, Ravoli Salvatore, Ravoli Correnti, Linguine Vongole, Rigatoni something. Will recommend to bring out of town visitors.
author: V G.

description: The food and service was great.  Simple Italian food, no bells or whistles.  Nothing ground breaking, but each dish was was done really well.  The only negative thing was when we got the bill.  When walking into/dining at a place like this you really don't expect $80/head.  Don't get me wrong, the food and service was really good.  Perhaps their wine list should be better matched to the food and ambiance.  Simple Italian food, paper on the table, pictures drilled to the wall, brick laminated floors etc. etc.  Again don't get me wrong, comfy relaxed atmosphere, just a bit of sticker shock.  There are better meals to be had at that price.
author: damien p.

description: This is one of the best Italian restaurants in North Beach.  The restaurant is small and busy, so be sure to get a reservation.
author: Stephanie B.

description: went there for a birthday last night. fresco pasta was delicious! antipasto with the warm olives was delicious. only reason why it's not a 5star-er is because there was nothing incredibly unique about the place. good food, good atmos!
author: Whitnie L.

description: I LOVED this place! I came here to celebrate my 21st birthday. I love Italian food and this place was such a good pick! It is a little on the tiny side, especially if you're seated uspstairs (note to the ladies wearing heels: be very careful going up those stairs, they are steep!) We had a group of 8, so I made a reservation a week before. When we got there, we were immediately seated and waited upon. The bread was really good and tasted fresh. The champagne was yummy. I ordered the Chicken Ravioli (substituted the cream sauce for marinara)...Oh my gosh! It was so good! That is possibly my favorite dish I have ever had! No joke, it was amazing! All the other people I went with loved their food too (One had the Capellini, one had the Halibut..don't remember the rest). We got the Tiramisu for dessert and I am seriously saying this...by far the best Tiramisu I have ever had! And I've had quite a few. It was perfect! I really wish I could have licked both my dinner plate, and the dessert plate. After dinner, the host helped us catch cabs, which was so nice of him since it was freezing and us ladies weren't wearing weather-appropriate clothing. The only negative thing...the bathroom. It is the tiniest bathroom and it is very dirty. But, the food and service definitely makes up for it! I think I will have to eat here every time I go to SF.
author: Nikki L.

description: great place a little bit aways from the rest of the excitement in north beach.  portions are huge! unfortunately I didn't have much of an appetite and just had to settle for a generic salad, but I tried my friends' dishes and thought they were yummy.
author: jozilla w.

description: old skool.  great, fresh pasta.  frutti de mare seafood pasta was ripe.  go.  do it now.  shout out too for all the great pics on the walls, including the Pistons represented - Chuck Daley, Kelly Tripuka, George Blaha a, #50 jersey!  Wow.  Go Stons!  Apparently, Chuck knows the owner and used to drop in when the Stons were in town.
author: Henry F.

description: I was somewhat disappointed with this place after reading pretty good reviews.  The place is small and cramped and there were at least 3 flies roaming the restaurant the entire time we ate there.  Hard to enjoy your meal when you are constantly swatting at pesty little bugs.   The hostess was lovely and seated us right away (despite being early) but our waiter was sub-par.  Drinks came out after the salads.  As for the salad, I ordered the "buffalo" mozzarella which was not all that special.  Thick slices of cheese that barely counted as fresh mozz.  I prefer my caprese to have creamy delicious cheese instead of something sliced right off the log.  Also, the bread they serve is nothing to write home about.  At least they provide olive oil because the bread would be too dry to eat alone.  We all ordered pastas for our main course.  I had the egg fettucini with fennel sausage and peppers which was good but not spectacular.  The pasta was clearly homemade which I love and the serving size was absolutely massive (I would guess three people could have shared this dish).  Overall, I would say mediocre food and ambiance but the price point is decent (particularly in the typically over-priced North Beach neighborhood).
author: Karen L.
